generated_caption: Czech exports of goods to Russia reached nearly 4.3 billion U.S. dollars in 2019, marking an increase compared to the previous year. Over the observed period, the highest figure was recorded at over six billion U.S. dollars in 2012.

This statistic shows the share of households in Sweden with access to fixed broadband connection of 30 Mbit/s or more, from 2017 to 2019. During the survey period, the share of households in Sweden with access to fixed broadband connection of 30 Mbit/s or more increased from 96 percent in 2017 to 98 percent in 2019.

In 2020, the population of China's urban areas reached approximately 941.8 million, while the population of rural areas reached around 322.8 million. The total population in China amounted to approximately 1.4 billion in 2020.

American football is a commonly watched sport both in the United States and worldwide. Some of the biggest stars in the game are household names and often divide opinion based on their public persona and fans'loyalties. During a January 2022 survey in the United States, 11 percent of respondents had a very favorable opinion of quarterback Odell Beckham.

In November 2020, a survey carried out in the UK found that 23 percent of respondents were very worried that the COVID-19 vaccine would not be safe, while a further 29 percent were fairly worried about this. Although 35 percent of those surveyed said they did not worry at all about the safety of the vaccine, nine percent were very worried and a further 31 percent were fairly worried that it could have side effects.

On February 25, 2022, 912 people were hospitalized in the United Kingdom with COVID-19, while a further 1,087 people were waiting to be hospitalized, but in need of a bed. The number of people hospitalized with COVID-19 in the UK has fluctuated since the pandemic began, peaking on January 4, 2021 at 4,536.

On February 27, 2022, 10,229 patients were in hospital with COVID-19 in the United Kingdom ( UK ). Since April 2020, when the highest number of hospital admissions were recorded at 39,453, there has been a significant drop in admissions. The latest number of cases in the UK can be found here.

ESB Group generated a revenue of 3.74 billion euros in 2020. This was the peak in the period of consideration and an increase of 200 million euros compared to the previous year. Revenue figures have been trending upward since 2011. ESB Group is a government-majority owned electricity supplier in Ireland. The utility was established in 1927 and used to hold a market monopoly.
In 2020, nearly 70 percent of cosmetics sold by Counterfeit in Russia were offline. The remaining 30 percent of the company's sales were generated online.

From 2019 to 2020, mascara was the most popular cosmetic product among Russian women, with over 75 percent of survey participants purchasing it. Perfumes and colognes ranked second and third, with 70 and 57 percent of the customers buying them, respectively.

This statistic shows the annual sales volume of whiting in Spain from 2008 to 2020, in thousand kilograms. 2016 ranked as the year with the highest sales volume of this type of products with around 533 thousand kilograms.

In 2019, around 17 percent of non-Hispanic white adults in the United States reported having anxiety in the past two weeks, compared to around 9 percent of non-Hispanic black adults. This statistic illustrates the percentage of adults in the United States who experienced symptoms of anxiety in the past two weeks as of 2019, by ethnicity and severity.

Due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, many cultural events have had to be cancelled or postponed in Germany and around the world. Based on a survey conducted in Germany in November 2020, around 60 percent of respondents agreed that they would be likely to spend the Christmas holidays in 2020 in a different way, for example by watching cultural events online or having a virtual dinner with friends. However, almost 30 percent of respondents disagreed and stated that they would be spending the holidays in the same way as last year.

In 2020, the share of international tourist spending in Morocco stood at around 63 percent, while the share of domestic expenditure reached 37 percent. The share of international tourism expenditure decreased by around 15.5 percent compared to 2019, while the share of domestic tourism expenditure increased by around 15.5 percent.

In the week starting on March 2, 2020, sales of alcohol-based hand sanitizers amounted to 27.16 million Argentine pesos, up from 21.93 million pesos sold in the previous week. This represents an increase of around 23.6 percent. During the same period, sales of hand sanitizers in the United States increased by 12.6 percent.

As of October 2021, the National Center of Internet Education was the most commonly used platform for MOOC courses published by Russian universities, accounting for over 15 percent of such courses. The platform of the Higher School of Economics in Moscow was ranked second, with 13 percent of MOOC courses published on it.

In 2021, the number of pilgrims on the Way of Saint James in Brazil amounted to nearly 90 thousand, out of which more than 86.5 thousand were men and approximately 93.5 thousand were women. In 2020, the number of pilgrims on this religious route had decreased by more than 50 percent compared to the previous year, due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

In 2020, pop songs were the most popular music genre among male and female respondents in Russia. Nearly one half of female survey participants and over one third of male participants named pop songs as their favorite music genre. The second most popular music genre in Russia was folk songs, which were preferred by 22 percent of female and 20 percent of male participants.

Online payment methods have a lot of variations in terms of their implementation and usage by customers. According to the source, the most commonly requested feature by French customers was the security of the payment process, which was mentioned by 64 percent of respondents as being a very useful characteristic of e-commerce websites.

As of 2019, around 81 percent of adults in the United States with depression reported no symptoms in the past two weeks, compared to just around 3 percent of adults with depression who reported severe symptoms. This statistic illustrates the distribution of depression symptoms severity in the past two weeks among adults in the United States as of 2019.

In 2019, around 19 percent of non-Hispanic white adults in the United States reported depression symptoms in the past two weeks, compared to around 12 percent of non-Hispanic black adults. This statistic illustrates the percentage of adults in the United States who experienced symptoms of depression in the past two weeks as of 2019, by ethnicity and severity.

The statistic presents the most common areas in which the first El Nino prize was won in Spain between the years 1908 and 2021. The El Nino Prize, also known as El Nino de la llibertat, is an annual award given to the best Spanish-language book published in Spain between the previous year and the following year. The most common areas in which the first El Nino prize was won were in the provinces of Castile and Leon, with 43 and 37 wins respectively.
In 2019, the value of barley imports in Latin America and the Caribbean amounted to approximately 364 million U.S. dollars, up from nearly 301 million dollars recorded a year earlier.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, gaming company Roblox Corporation had generated over 13.6 billion U.S. dollars in DAU from users in the United States and Canada. This figure is up from the previous quarter's daily active user base in the United States and Canada, which amounted to 11.6 billion.

As of February 2020, the majority of Hungarians believed that elderly people and risk groups would get vaccinated against coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in some time during 2020. Another 16 percent of respondents thought that this would not happen.

As of April 2020, the accommodation and food service industry was the most negative affected by the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in Hungary. Only 15 percent of the enterprises in this sector expected to have a positive turnover in the next six months.

As of November 2020, Amazon.com was the favorite online store of 57 percent of responding consumers in the United States. Walmart was ranked second with a 14 percent consumer preference share, followed closely by Target with eight percent.

A survey from 2020 showed that roughly half of Italians believe that Christmas will be different this year due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Around one in four Italians thought that Christmas will be canceled, whereas another third of respondents thought it will be celebrated in the same way as last year.

According to a survey carried out in November 2020, the majority of respondents in Argentina said that abortion should be legal in any case, because women have the right to decide. When asked about the possible reasons for abortion legalization, more than half of the Argentine respondents interviewed answered that the practice should be legal because it is the woman's choice. The second most common answer was that abortion should be allowed because the pregnancy could be a result of rape.

Approximately one third of Russians planned to purchase New Year's Eve or New Year's day gifts in 2020, according to a survey from December of that year. One quarter of respondents stated they expected to buy or order most of the gifts ahead of the New Year's Eve celebration.

Over the past weeks, as a result of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, the number of search queries on the internet regarding electronic education in Moscow has increased significantly. The most significant growth was recorded on March 16, 2020, when the number of online queries on the topic exceeded 1.2 thousand percent compared to the previous week.

In the third quarter of 2021, Nigeria's GDP increased by 3.9 percent compared to the same period of the previous year. Between 2019 and 2021, the largest GDP growth in the country was registered in the second quarter of 2021, at 5.1 percent.

In the second quarter of 2021, Nigeria's main import partner was China. Between January and June 2021, China accounted for about 30 percent of all imports into Nigeria. India followed, being the second main import partner of Nigeria. In the same period, exports from Nigeria to China increased from 1.3 billion U.S. dollars to over 6.3 billion U.S. dollars.

The majority of respondents believed that the fashion industry would be best defined by the comeback of classic styles such as denim, flapper dresses, and suave tuxedo. At the same time, 41 percent of respondents predicted that the industry would be defined by the rise of digital fashion and the new marketing trends that would come with it.

A survey from April 2020 asked Italian individuals when they expected their country's economy to return to normal after the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. The answers indicated a rather pessimistic outlook. The largest share of respondents ( 27 percent ) believed that Italy's economy would not return to normal until after June 2021. By contrast, only seven percent of interviewees thought that the economy could start recovering already in May 2020. The current situation in Italy, where the number of coronavirus cases is escalating, might influence the economic stability of the country.
The revenue of the automotive industry in Romania was estimated to amount to approximately 25.6 billion euros in 2020. The highest revenue was recorded in 2019 at over 30 billion euros.

The impact of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak on TV news viewers in Norway was significant from March 14 to March 15, 2020. The audience share of NRK1 and NRK2 increased from 0.99 percent on March 14 to 1.04 percent on March 15.

In 2021, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, Poland introduced restrictions on daily life, which have a significant impact on the economy. More than half of Poles believe that the most restrictive rules should apply to hotels and restaurants. Every fifth respondent is of the opinion that the limits should apply only to shopping malls.

The value of imported goods into Denmark fluctuated from 2010 to 2020. The import value of goods was the highest in 2019, amounting to 649.5 billion Danish kroner. The lowest value of imported goods was in 2010, with 623.5 billion Danish kroner.

The majority of respondents were of the opinion that the vaccine against COVID-19 would be very efficient or a large extent efficient. Only three percent of respondents believed that the vaccine would be not at all or not too efficient.

More than 40 percent of respondents believed that the most important priority for the new Romanian Government should be to improve the health system and to fight against corruption. Only three percent of respondents considered the treatment of Roma and other minorities to be the most important priority for the new Government.

In 2021, the construction industry employed the largest number of people in the European Union, at over 32 million people. This was followed by wholesale and retail trade, which employed approximately 27.5 million people.

From 2015 to 2020, the number of deaths in Texas prisons from natural causes, such as illness or injury, increased significantly. In 2015, 174 prisoners died from natural causes in Texas prisons. The number of deaths from natural causes in Texas prisons reached 328 in 2020, an increase of around 55 percent.

In 2020, the most frequently given reason for not wanting to be vaccinated against SARS-CoV-2 coronavirus in Poland was the opinion that the vaccine was not needed, as the individual's immune system was strong enough to fight the disease.

In fiscal year 2020, the import volume of liquid natural gas to India was around 33.8 billion cubic meters. There was a consistent increase in the import volume of LNG to India since fiscal year 2012.

This statistic illustrates the total amount of investments in biotechnology in Spain in 2019, by origin of funds. During that year, the total amount of investments from domestic institutions amounted to 785 million euros.

On May 17, 2020, it was reported that the British government were going to change their official coronavirus slogan to 'Stay alert, Control the outbreak and Save lives.'Although, there is some confusion as to the clarity of the new slogan, as 36 percent of survey respondents in the United Kingdom reported that only the old slogan, 'Stay home, Protect yourself and Others,'makes it clear what they are supposed to do to stay healthy during the coronavirus pandemic.

The Norwegian TV show 'Familie Vogel'( in English : 'Family Guy') had a significant drop in viewership in March 2020 due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. On average, the show attracted 1.8 million viewers per episode in the first four weeks of the year. However, the numbers dropped to roughly 1.2 million in the period from March 27 to April 3, 2020. The numbers for the first four weeks in the period from March 13 to March 15, 2020 were similar to the first four weeks of the previous year, so the coronavirus outbreak did not seem to have had a major impact on viewership during this period.

The timeline shows the per capita consumption of bottled water in the United States from 1999 to 2020. According to the report, the U.S. per capita consumption of bottled water amounted to 45.1 gallons in 2020.

This statistic shows the per capita consumption of flavored milk and drinks in the United States from 2000 to 2019. In 2019, the U.S. consumption of flavored milk and drinks amounted to 13.8 pounds per capita.

Of the 59 nuclear reactors in the United States, 43 were commercial power reactors that had been in operation for 30 to 39 years as of December 2020. Only three commercial U.S. nuclear reactors had been in operation for less than 20 years.

The statistic shows the global market share of smartphone operating systems in 2013, by country. In 2013, the iOS operating system had a global market share of 26 percent. In the same year, the iOS generated 22.7 percent of all smartphone sales worldwide.

This statistic represents the cumulative installed capacity of wind power worldwide in 2019, by leading country. The United States had a cumulative installed wind power capacity of around 103.5 gigawatts in 2019.
The timeline shows the national TV advertising spending during the NCAA men's basketball tournament from 2015 to 2019. In 2019, the TV ad spending amounted to 912 million U.S. dollars.
According to AV-Test, trojans were found to be the most common type of malware affecting Windows systems. In 2019, trojans accounted for 64.5 percent of all malware incidents on Windows systems.

In the fourth quarter of 2019, the subscriber churn rate of Spotify amounted to 4.8 percent, down from 5.2 percent in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Cmulative figures for 2019 are not available, but in the annual churn rate amounted to 19.8 percent, which the source noted was partially due to promotional trials. Whilst such trials draw in new subscribers, many of whom tend to convert, Spotify counts paid trialists in its subscriber numbers, meaning that those who do not convert then become churned subscribers.

As of March 2021, North America had the highest active Facebook usage rate with 71 percent of the population accessing the social network. Facebook penetration was lowest in Africa, where only 19 percent of the population used the social network. The global penetration rate was 45 percent.

The statistic illustrates the contemporary artworks with the highest auction price worldwide between July 2018 and June 2019. As of June 2019, the highest priced contemporary artwork was 'The Physical Geography of Nowhere'by Jacob Kassey and the price was set at 90.7 million U.S. dollars.
In February 2022, CCI's consumer confidence index in Poland was at a level of -31.4 points, which is a decrease of 17.7 percentage points compared to the previous month.

This statistic gives information on the most popular social networks in the United States as of October 2018, based on monthly active users. During that month, over 206 million users accessed Facebook, making it by far the most popular social network in the United States.

In 2019, a total of 26,836 children in the state of California were victims of child abuse, the most out of any state. Texas, Florida, Illinois, and New York rounded out the five leading states for child abuse victims in that year.

This statistic presents the media consumption of children during summer in the United States as of June 2015. During the survey period, 25 percent of responding parents stated that their children consumed somewhat more television during summer than other times of the year.

In 2021, Brazil had approximately 162 million internet users. That year, internet penetration in the South American country amounted to 65 percent of the population. By 2026, the number of users on the Web is expected to reach 187 million.

This statistic shows the percentage of prisoners under the age of 18 who were abused as a child in the United States in 1999, by sex and type of abuse. In 1999, about 36.5 percent of female prisoners under the age of 18 were abused as a child, about 1 in 4 was sexually abused.
The statistic shows the selection criteria for smartphone purchase in China in 2012. In 2012, around 70 percent of the respondents in China selected a smartphone by the design/look/feel of the phone.
The statistic shows the number of active internet-enabled smartphones in India from 2011 to 2016. In 2015, there were around 166 million active internet-enabled smartphones in India.

In 2018, a total of 2,631 children adopted from abroad were living in the United States with a family living here legally. In that same year, a further 1,098 children adopted from abroad were living in the U.S. with no family sponsorship.

As of April 2020, Tumblr had 496.5 million blog accounts, up from 463.5 million in the corresponding period of the previous year. The social networking site is one of the most popular platforms for sharing blog posts and digital content.

This statistic depicts the sales share of the sunglasses market in the United States between 2010 and 2011, by retail channel. In 2011, 38 percent of sunglasses in the United States were sold at sunglass specialty stores.

The chart shows the number of days it has taken for the number of deaths from COVID-19 in select countries worldwide to double as of December 13, 2020. For example, the number of deaths from COVID-19 in the United States as of October 17 was 8.09 thousand. On December 13, the U.S. had a total of 16.25 thousand COVID-19 deaths. So it took 57 days for the number of deaths in the U.S. to double as of December 13.

This statistic shows the net income of Marriott International, Inc. worldwide from 2007 to 2020. Marriott International, Inc. is a U.S.-based hotel company that owns and operates the brands Park Hyatt, Andaz, Grand Hyatt, Hyatt Regency, Hyatt Place, Hyatt House, Hyatt Resorts and Hyatt Vacation Club. In 2020, the company's net income amounted to approximately 72.9 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the weekly mobile e-mail access rate in selected countries as of 2016. During the survey period it was found that 64 percent of respondents from the United States accessed their mobile e-mails on at least one week per month.

As of February 2022, it was found that U.S. mobile users spent an average of 25.8 hours per month on the TikTok social media app. The video-sharing platform was ranked first among the leading social apps in the United States based on monthly user engagement.
The statistic shows the share of digital revenue in 2012, by segment.

The statistic shows the market share of the largest U.S. broadband providers between the years 2006 and 2013. In the most recently reported year, Comcast had a market share of 20.8 percent. The overall number of broadband internet users in the United States has increased dramatically since the beginning of the 21st century.

In 2021, it was calculated that the United States had by far the highest GDP per capita of any country worldwide, at just under 69,000 U.S. dollars. The country with the second highest GDP per capita was Germany, at around 50,700 U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the percentage of teens who reported owning a computer. The statistic allows for comparison of computer ownership amongst teens within different household income brackets in the U.S. as of 2018. The survey showed that 95 percent of respondents from households with an annual income of 75,000 U.S. dollars and more, owned a computer, while only 74 percent of respondents from households with an annual income of less than 30,000 U.S. dollars reported owning a tablet.

This statistic shows the preferred platforms among global app developers as of the first quarter of 2014, sorted by region. According to the industry survey, 47 percent of responding app developers in South Asia were working on apps for the Windows Phone.

This statistic shows the global inflation rate compared to previous year from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the global inflation rate amounted to about 3.15 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic presents the global distribution of mobile app developers as of November 2014, sorted by region. During the survey period it was found that 29 percent of mobile app developers were located in North America. Asia was ranked first with 33 percent of mobile app developers.

As of March 2020, almost half of the Finnish people expected to spend more on personal hygiene products such as hand sanitizer and hand soap because of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Only two percent of the respondents expected to spend less on these items.

This statistic shows the results of a survey asking respondents in the United States which digital media and devices they used on a regular basis in 2012. The survey revealed that 83 percent of U.S. television viewers used this device on a regular basis.
In 2021, U.S. imports of trade goods from China increased by 16.1 percent compared to the previous year. This was a significant increase from the growth rate of -14.8 percent in 2020.

In August 2021, the Purchasing Manager Index ( PMI ) in the industry sector stood at 54.1 points. The figures are seasonally adjusted. The PMI is a measure of the average change over time in the prices received by domestic producers for their output.

This statistic shows the number of Starwood Hotels & Resorts properties worldwide from 2013 to 2015, by region. There were 219 Starwood Hotels & Resorts properties in the Asia Pacific region in 2015. Starwood Hotels & Resorts was founded in 1969 and now has more than 1,200 properties worldwide. In 2014, Starwood Hotels & Resorts was the forth largest hotel group in the world in terms of revenue, followed by the Accor hotel group.

This statistic shows the number of Starwood Hotels & Resorts properties worldwide in 2015, by brand. There were 210 Westin properties within the Starwood Hotels & Resorts portfolio in 2015. Starwood Hotels & Resorts was founded in 1969 and now has more than 1,200 properties worldwide. In 2014, Starwood Hotels & Resorts was the forth largest hotel group in the world in terms of revenue, followed by the Accor hotel group.
This statistic shows the income of Starwood Hotels & Resorts worldwide from 2010 to 2015. Starwood Hotels & Resorts earned an income of approximately 488.1 million U.S. dollars in 2015.

This statistic depicts the per capita consumption of fresh bananas in the United States from 2000 to 2020. According to the report, the U.S. per capita consumption of fresh bananas amounted to approximately 27.2 pounds in 2020.

This statistic shows the economic value of meetings and exhibitions to host destinations in the United States in 2019. The meetings industry contributed a total of 42.5 billion U.S. dollars to the U.S. economy in 2019.

This statistic depicts the per capita consumption of fresh fruit in the United States in 2020, by single fruit type. Bananas and apples were the leading fruit types in the U.S. in 2020, based on per capita consumption. The per capita consumption of fresh apples amounted to about 16.4 pounds that year.

This statistic shows the number of exhibitors at largest trade shows in the United States in 2019. According to the source, there were 15 exhibitors with a booth at a trade show with a budget of 50 thousand U.S. dollars or less in 2019.

Between the first week of January and the first week of March 2020, the number of users of online pharmacies in Poland increased due to the outbreak of coronavirus. The most significant increase was recorded in the number of users of Doz.pl, the second highest in the number of real users, i.e., those who placed an order in the last 30 days.

As of March 2021, the Facebook page of the Hong Kong Tourism Board was the most popular Facebook brand in Hong Kong with about 1.75 million fans. The Facebook page of the Hong Kong Airways was the second most popular Facebook brand in Hong Kong with about 956 thousand fans.

The graph shows the planned change in shows attended in the United States in 2014, by type of show. The results show that 30 percent of respondents reported that they were planning to increase the number of international shows, and 51 percent of respondents reported that they were planning to maintain the number of national shows.

This statistic depicts the per capita consumption of fresh sweet potatoes in the United States from 2000 to 2020. According to the report, the U.S. per capita consumption of fresh sweet potatoes amounted to approximately seven pounds in 2020.

The timeline shows the per capita consumption of fresh romaine and leaf lettuce in the United States from 2000 to 2020. According to the report, the U.S. per capita consumption of fresh romaine and leaf lettuce amounted to approximately 14.4 pounds in 2020.

This statistic depicts the per capita consumption of fresh sweet corn in the United States from 2000 to 2020. According to the report, the U.S. per capita consumption of fresh sweet corn amounted to approximately 4.86 pounds in 2020.

This statistic presents the share of adults in the United States who feel it is acceptable to use social media for personal reasons at work as of February 2017, sorted by generation. During the survey period, 36 percent of respondents aged between 18 and 30 years stated that they felt it was acceptable to use social media for personal reasons at work.

This statistic shows the net income of MGM Resorts International worldwide from 2008 to 2020. MGM Resorts, a gaming and hospitality company based in Nevada, had a net income of approximately -1.31 billion U.S. dollars in 2020, down from 2.23 billion the previous year.

The statistic shows the results of a survey concerned with the fear of terrorist attacks in the United States. The survey was conducted from 2003 to 2013. In March 2013, 29 percent of the respondents stated they were very afraid of a terrorist attack happening in the United States.

This statistic shows the total assets of Wyndham Resorts worldwide from 2008 to 2020. The total assets of Wyndham Resorts amounted to approximately 13.9 billion U.S. dollars in 2020, up from 13.8 billion the previous year.

This statistic shows the leading trade show promotion methods ranked by their importance to attendees in the United States in 2013. According to the survey, 48 percent of respondents ranked emails and eNewsletters as very or extremely important in promoting a trade show.

Due to the crisis of the coronavirus COVID-19, in March 2020 there was a large drop in hotel reservations in Spain for the Easter holidays that year. In the Balearic Islands, the most affected region, the drop in the first 17 days of March with respect to the entire month of February 2020 exceeded 100 %. Across the country, the decrease in hotel reservations compared to the previous month was of more than 40 %.

The statistic shows the venture capital investment in mobile and telecom subsectors in the United States in the second quarter of 2012. In that time, the venture capital investment in gaming amounted to 3.1 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the percentage of Americans with HIV transmission misconceptions as of 2012. It was found that 30 percent of respondents believed HIV transmission could occur through sharing a drinking glass.

The statistic depicts the retail sales of telemark ski equipment in the U.S. snow sports market from the 2008/09 season to the 2015/16 season. In the 2015/16 season, retail sales of telemark ski equipment amounted to about 2.14 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the number of American single parents who have taken custody of their own children and were receiving any child support between 1993 and 2011. In 2011, approximately 4.6 million single parents in the United States had custody of their own child or children and were receiving any child support.

This statistic shows the number of American single mothers who have taken custody of their own children and were awarded child support between 1993 and 2011. In 2011, approximately 6.3 million single mothers in the United States had custody of their child or children and were awarded child support.
The graph shows the highest rated college sports telecasts in the 2012/13 academic year. The most highly rated game was Alabama vs. Kentucky for the SEC championship with a rating of 15.1.

This statistic shows the top 20 prescription drugs in the United States based on sales in 2019. In that year, the top prescription drug in the United States based on sales was Humira, generating approximately 21.4 billion U.S. dollars in sales.
This graph shows the net leasable area of trade shows in the United States from 2010 to 2013. In August 2013, the net leasable area of trade shows was 2.1 million net square feet.

This statistic depicts the distribution of research and development expenditure of Henkel worldwide in 2020, by business sector. In that year, 57 percent of Henkel's global research and development expenses were used for their adhesive technologies sector. Total global R & D expenditure of Henkel was 487 million euros in 2020.
This statistic shows the share of the leading countries of non-oil merchandise imports to the United States in 2012. In that year, 26.3 percent of non-oil merchandise imports came from China.

Gamification is the use of game elements to motivate and engage employees in performing their tasks and to increase productivity. During a 2019 survey, 89 percent of respondents stated that they probably would increase their productivity if their employer gamified their work.

As of March 2020, around 35 percent of women and 32 percent of men surveyed in the U.S., believed that face masks were somewhat effective at preventing the spread of the coronavirus. The statistic illustrates the percentage of U.S. adults who believed face masks were effective at preventing the spread of the coronavirus as of March 2020, by gender.
This statistic shows the percentage of jobs supported by imports to the United States in 2011, by sector. In 2011, 13.7 percent of jobs in the mining sector were supported by imports.

The statistic shows the share of respondents who have implemented controls to mitigate the risks related to the use of cloud computing. 28 percent of respondents say that they have strengthened contract management to mitigate the risks associated with cloud computing.

This statistic shows the market share held by Ubisoft in the European gaming market from 2011 to 2014, by quarter. In the first quarter of 2014, Ubisoft held 10 percent of the gaming market in Europe.

This statistic presents the share of teenagers in the United States who have posted selected personal information online as of March 2012, sorted by gender. During the survey period, it was found that 93 percent of female respondents had posted their personal address online.

This statistic shows the IT security investments planned by organizations worldwide as of May 2017. During the survey period, 47 percent of respondents stated that they planned to invest in advanced authorization technologies.

This statistic shows the results of a 2012 survey among more than 90,000 respondents who are members of the LGBT community in all 27 European Union member states and Croatia. They were asked if they had ever felt that they were sexually oriented when they were a kid. 80 percent of respondents in the United Kingdom stated they had felt that way.
This graph shows a breakdown of U.S. imports of goods in 2018, by main commodity group. In 2018, about 10.2 percent of all goods imported were agricultural products.

This statistic shows the revenue generated by Future PLC in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2011 and 2012, broken down by business sector. In 2012, the company generated 21.3 million British pounds in revenue through its fashion and apparel sector.

The interest income from cash and equivalents at the SLM Corporation, commonly known as Sallie Mae, increased considerably between 2013 and 2019, before dropping in 2020. This decline could be attributable to the effects of the coronavirus pandemic. At the end of 2020, the interest income from cash and equivalents at this publicly traded U.S. corporation, whose operations are originating, servicing, and collecting on student loans, amounted to approximately 21.1 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic depicts the likelihood of consumers in the United States to purchase Google Glasses. During a survey conducted in May 2013, 29 percent of respondents stated that they were very likely to buy Google Glasses.

As of March 2020, 84 percent of Americans, aged 30 to 44, believed that hand sanitizer was either very or somewhat effective at preventing the spread of the coronavirus. For further information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

This statistic gives information on the amount of money French consumers are willing to pay for monthly YouTube premium content as of March 2013. During a consumer survey, it was found that 15 percent of respondents were willing to pay up to two U.S. dollars per month for a single YouTube channel based on their interests.

This statistic shows the global cotton stocks-to-use ratio from 1990 to 2019. In 2017, the cotton stocks-to-use ratio worldwide stood at some 91.7 percent. The global production of cotton amounted to some 114.73 million 480-pound bales in that year.

This statistic shows the total production of cottonseed and oil worldwide from 2009/2010 to 2017/2018. In 2016/2017, the global production of cottonseed amounted to about 13.5 million metric tons, down from 14.8 million metric tons in 2015/2016.

This statistic shows the share of U.S. YouTube users who regularly watch favorite YouTube channels as of April 2017. During the survey period, it was found that 33 percent of YouTube users had more than two favorite channels they watched regularly. As of April 2017, PewDiePie was the most popular channel on the platform, according to the number of subscribers.
This statistic represents the gross output of the U.S. aircraft manufacturing industry from 2008 through 2019. In 2019, this industry had a gross output of around 135.4 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the average number of security breaches experienced by organizations in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in the last year as of early 2013, by organization size. According to the survey, large organizations experienced an average of 113 security breaches in the last year.

This statistic shows the results of a 2015 survey among adult Americans on whether they think someone who is 18 years old should be allowed to get a tattoo without parental permission. 84 percent of respondents stated they think 18 year olds should be allowed to get tattoos legally without parental permission.

The statistic shows the monthly market share held by the leading smartphone operating systems in Japan from 2014 to 2021. In March 2021, Android had a market share of around 52.3 percent, making it the leading smartphone OS in Japan.
This statistic shows the population growth in Australia from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the population of Australia grew by about 1.27 percent compared to the previous year.
This statistic shows the distribution of ethnic groups in Australia in the state of Victoria in 2011. 25.8 percent of the population of Victoria, Australia were English.

As of March 2020, almost sixty percent of male consumers and more than a third of female consumers in the United States didn't expect that the coronavirus pandemic would change the amount of money that they typically spent on canned goods. However, almost a quarter of male consumers expected that they would spend more on canned goods in the future.

This statistic displays the remaining life years of selected world commodity reserves as of 2012. At this point, it was estimated that global copper reserves will suffice for the upcoming 31 years. It was further estimated, that nickel is one of the commodities with the shortest lifetime of reserves.

In 2021, the most successful Chinese artist alive based on sales at public auctions was the oil painter Hua Guan. His works generated about 781 million yuan at public auctions. The second place belonged to the watercolorist Li Zaiyan, who recorded sales of around 272 million yuan at public auctions.

The statistic shows the results of a survey concerned with the question whether the birth of Martin Luther King Jr. should be celebrated as a national holiday, or not. 74 percent of the respondents felt that Martin Luther King Jr.'s birth should be celebrated as a national holiday.

This statistic depicts the value of the U.S. tableware market in 2012. In 2012, cookware generated about 3.3 billion U.S. dollars for the U.S. tabletop market. The total market value of the U.S. tabletop market was about 12.2 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the distribution of space owned by General Dynamics in 2020. General Dynamics is a market leader in the aerospace and defense industry. In 2020, they owned 24 percent of the total space and 48 percent of the company-owned facilities.

This statistic shows the share of vehicle buyers who reported using various information sources to research vehicles worldwide in 2012. According to Capgemini, 52 percent of respondents from the United Kingdom reported using dealerships as an information source to research vehicles.

This statistic shows the results of a 2013 survey among adult Americans on which institutions in the United States they think are most affected by corruption. In 2013, 51 percent of respondents stated they think that political parties are the most affected by corruption in the United States.

This statistic depicts the results of a survey conducted in 2013 by the International Food Information Council ( IFIC ). U.S. adults were asked at what point of the food expiration date they are likely to throw away uneaten food. Some 55 percent of respondents answered to throw away uneaten food when the product is past its 'best by'date.
The statistic shows the revenue of the ESPRIT brand worldwide from 2005 to 2020. In 2020, the global revenue generated by the ESPRIT brand was about 1.38 billion U.S. dollars.
This statistic illustrates the global area of fresh fruit harvested from 1990 to 2020. In 2020, the area of fresh fruit harvested worldwide amounted to some 74.9 million hectares.

As of March 2020, 62 percent of Americans believed that hand soaps were very effective at preventing the spread of the coronavirus. In comparison, only 3 percent believed that hand soaps were not at all effective.

This statistic displays the number of performed transplants in the U.S. between January and March 2013, by organ. During this period, there were 1,542 liver transplants performed in the country. Organ donation can be given through both a deceased and living donor if blood and oxygen are flowing through the organs until the time of recovery to ensure viability. There are over 120,000 people in the country waiting for an organ transplant.

This graph shows the public opinion of Americans on Edward Snowden's leaks of National Security Agency intelligence reports. In July 2013, about 48 percent of Americans thought that the leaks had weakened U.S. security.

The statistic reflects the opinion of the surveyed U.S. citizens on the root causes of the sexual assault problems in the U.S. military. In 2014, 54 percent of respondents stated that they think individual acts of misconduct are responsible for the military sexual assault problems.

This statistic shows the results of a 2013 survey among Americans aged 16 and older on qualities they are looking for in a close friend. 80 percent of respondents stated a close friend has to be loyal.

This statistic shows the results of a survey, conducted in 2013, regarding the things women do to improve their mood. According to the survey, 37 percent of women say they pray or meditate to improve their mood.
The statistic depicts a breakdown of the telecommunications market in the Asia-Pacific region in 2012, by service type.

This statistic shows the results of a survey, conducted in 2013, asking the respondents which activity they think would extend their life expectancy. 58 percent of respondents believe that more exercise would extend their life expectancy.

The statistic reflects the opinion of the surveyed U.S. citizens concerning the power position of the U.S. military in the world. In 20 years, 56 percent of respondents believe that the U.S. military will hold an absolute dominant position just one of many powers in the world.
The statistic shows the number of deaths due to terrorism in 2011 grouped by perpetrator category. 2.670 people were killed by Sunni Extremist in 2010.

This statistic shows the revenue of the mechanical engineering industry in Russia from 2006 to 2017. In 2017, the Russian market for mechanical engineering was sized at around 26 billion euros ( or about 30 billion U.S. dollars ).

The majority of Russians believed that the level of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) would remain the same or increase slightly in the coming year, according to a survey from September 2020. The share of respondents who expected the disease to spread decreased with age.

The statistic presents the distribution of merger and acquisition ( M & A ) deals value in Europe in 2012, by sector. In that time, the technology sector contributed with four percent of the total value of all M & A deals made in Europe.

This statistic presents the most prevalent spam content categories worldwide in 2019. That year, junk mail accounted for 39 percent of global spam volume. Dating-related junk mail generated eight percent of global spam messages.

This statistic shows the results of a 2013 survey among adult American smokers on how old they were when they first started smoking. 40 percent of surveyed smokers said they were between 16 and 18 years old when they started smoking.

The statistic shows the gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in Canada from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the gross domestic product per capita in Canada was around 44,485.73 U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows the gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in France from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. GDP refers to the total market value of all goods and services that are produced within a country per year. It is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country. In 2020, the GDP per capita in France was around 42,099.06 U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows the gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in Japan from 1986 to 2019, with projections up until 2026. In 2019, the gross domestic product per capita in Japan was around 40,837.45 U.S. dollars. For further information, see Japan's GDP.

The statistic shows the gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in the United States from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. The gross domestic product ( GDP ) refers to the market value of all goods and services produced within a country in a given period. GDP per capita is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country. In 2020, the gross domestic product per capita in the United States was around 63,179.69 U.S. dollars. See the U.S. GDP for further information.

The statistic shows the growth rate of the real gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Japan from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the GDP in Japan fell by about 4.58 percent compared to the previous year. For comparison, the GDP growth rate of China had reached about 6.1 percent that same year.

The statistic shows the growth in real GDP in the Netherlands from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the Netherlands'real gross domestic product decreased by around 3.94 percent compared to the previous year.
The statistic shows the value of imports in China from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, China's imports had amounted to about 2.04 trillion U.S. dollars.

Between January and March 2020, the time spent on all online services in Poland increased due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. In January, the time spent on video on demand services amounted to 49.6 percent, while in March it increased to 68.7 percent. The time spent on information and news services also increased from 38.2 percent to 45.6 percent.

This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Greece from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment rate in Greece was around 16.96 percent. Today, Greece reports the highest unemployment rate of all EU states.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in the Netherlands from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment rate in the Netherlands was at approximately 4.06 percent.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Poland from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment rate in Poland amounted to approximately 3.66 percent.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Turkey from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment rate in Turkey was at approximately 13.94 percent.
The statistic shows the life expectancy in Italy at birth from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy in Italy at birth was about 83.23 years.
The statistic shows the life expectancy in Japan from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy in Japan was about 84.32 years.
In 2020, the United States had the world's largest reserves of hard coal at some 218 billion metric tons. China ranked second, with reserves amounting to nearly 137 billion metric tons.
How many people use Facebook?
This statistic shows the production volume of refined lead worldwide from 2006 to 2020. In 2020, the global production volume of refined lead amounted to approximately 11.7 million metric tons.
The statistic shows the number of undernourished and starving people worldwide from 2000 to 2019. In 2019, about 672.5 million people were undernourished or starving worldwide.
In March 2020, the number of transactions in the foodservice market fell in Poland. The most significant drop was recorded in small restaurants ( -31 percent ).

As of June 2019, the most expensive retail location in the world was Causeway Bay in Hong Kong, with an annual rent of 2,749 U.S. dollars per square foot. The second-most expensive retail location was Times Square in New York, with an annual rent of 2,227 U.S. dollars per square foot.
This statistic shows the global crowdfunding volume in 2012, by continent. In 2012, the global crowdfunding volume in North America amounted to 1.6 billion US dollars.

During the measured period, Instagram saw the highest increase in user engagement with selected social media platforms in the United States. The photo sharing app's user engagement increased by 9.6 percent compared to the preceding period.
The chart shows the average annual income of employees at selected banks in the United States in 2009. The average employee at the Bank of America earned 100,000 U.S. dollars in 2009.

In 2020, South Korea's natural gas consumption amounted to approximately 2.2 trillion British thermal units. According to the source, the data only include fuels that were consumed for the purpose of final consumption and not for manufacturing or industrial use.
This statistic shows the number of GLOBALG.A.P certified farms in Asia and Oceania in 2012, by country. As of December 2012, there were 1,520 GLOBALG.A.P certified farms operating in New Zealand.

The statistic shows the inflation rate in the Euro area from July 2020 to July 2021. In July 2021, the inflation rate in the Euro area was about 2.17 percent compared to the same month of the previous year.

As of 2020, there were around 37.6 million people living with HIV worldwide, and 28.1 million people on antiretroviral therapy ( ART ). In that year, there were around 1.2 million new HIV infections, and 690 thousand AIDS-related deaths.

The statistic shows the seasonally adjusted youth unemployment rate in EU member states as of June 2021. The source defines youth unemployment as unemployment of those younger than 25 years. In June 2021, the seasonally adjusted youth unemployment rate in Spain was at 36.9 percent.

This statistic depicts the retail revenue compound annual growth rate ( CAGR ) of the world's leading retailers between fiscal year 2014 and 2019. During that period, Walmart had a retail revenue CAGR of 17.6 percent.

In April 2020, the international air cargo traffic from and to Mexico amounted to approximately 29.3 thousand metric tons. This represents a decrease of around 57.8 percent in comparison with the air cargo traffic reported during the same month a year earlier.
The statistic displays the number of runners-up at the World Cup by country. Germany has been runners-up four times at the FIFA World Cup.

This statistic shows the expenditure of pharmaceutical company Roche on research and development from 2011 to 2021. Roche is a Swiss-based pharmaceutical company, and one of the leading pharma companies worldwide. In 2021, Roche's expenditure on research and development came to some 14.8 billion Swiss francs.

This statistic shows the operating profit of the Swiss-based pharmaceutical company Roche from 2007 to 2021. Roche is one of the largest global pharmaceutical companies. In 2021, Roche reported an operating profit of approximately 22.1 billion Swiss francs.

As of 2019, South Korea had the highest density of computer tomography ( CT ) scanners in the world, with 111.2 scanners per million population. The country with the second highest density of CT scanners at that time was Israel, with around 70.8 scanners per million population.

This statistic shows AstraZeneca's operating profit from 2006 to 2021. AstraZeneca plc is a leading pharmaceutical company worldwide. The multinational company is headquartered in London, UK. AstraZeneca is focused on products for following major disease areas : cancer, cardiovascular, gastrointestinal, infection, neuroscience, respiratory and inflammation. In 2021, the company reported an operating loss of some 1.3 billion U.S. dollars.
This statistic shows AstraZeneca's revenue from its top product Pulmicort from 2006 to 2021. In 2021, AstraZeneca's revenue from top product Pulmicort amounted to some 956 million U.S. dollars.
The statistic shows the revenue from fixed-line data services in 2010, by selected country.

In 2021, Tatyana and Vladislav Bakalchuk were the richest Russians, with a wealth of 29.3 billion U.S. dollars each. Tatyana Bakalchuk was the only woman among the ten richest Russians that year, while Andrey Melnichenko was the only one of the richest men.

The chart shows the market share of the European Union juice industry from 2003 to 2008, by category. In 2003, chilled juice made up for 3.5 percent of the market share, while in 2008 it had increased to 12.1 percent.

This statistic displays how often U.S. residents think about the number of calories they consume in 2013 and 2014. In 2014, 31 percent of respondents reported to often think about the number of calories they consume.

In June 2021, the international air passenger traffic from and to Argentina amounted to approximately 115.7 thousand passengers. This represented an increase of around 1.7 percent in comparison with the air passenger traffic reported during the same month a year earlier.

The timeline shows the number of viewers of the Grammy Awards from 2000 to 2020. The Grammy Awards ceremony is broadcasted on multiple networks across the United States. According to the source, the ceremony for 2020 was watched by over 6.4 million viewers on ABC, CBS, NBC, and PBS.

This statistic shows the results of a consumer survey conducted by Public Policy Polling in February 2013. Americans were asked about the impact of various factors on their decision to believe new information about food or health. Some 59 percent of survey respondents said that the most influential factor was personal experience.

This statistic shows the results of a 2011 survey among American adults on whether they would have a hard time giving up their cell phone or the internet. 60 percent of the respondents stated they would have a hard time giving up their cell phone.

This statistic represents the capacity and assembly volume of the global automotive industry from 2015 through 2022, by region. In 2022, the North American industry is projected to have capacity of about 23.5 million vehicles and will assemble about 76.2 million vehicles.

This statistic shows the annual growth rate in the global semiconductor industry from 1988 to 2019, and a forecast for 2020 and 2022. In 2019, the semiconductor industry grew by approximately 23.6 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic shows the worldwide semiconductor chain revenue in 2008, by segment. In 2008, semiconductor research and development ( R & D ) accounted for 193.7 billion U.S. dollars of the global semiconductor chain revenue.

The statistic presents the most popular games on Steam as of December 2021, ranked by average monthly playertime. According to the findings, CS : GO ranked first on the platform, with an average of 115.8 hours played per month. Record of the Year was ranked second with an average of 97.7 hours per month.
China is the largest consumer of electricity in the world, using 6.86 terawatt-hours in 2020. The United States was the second largest consumer of electricity, using 3.84 terawatt-hours that year.

As of October 2021, there were 189 operational nuclear reactors worldwide. The United States had the largest number of nuclear reactors in operation, with 92. France had the second largest number of nuclear reactors in operation, with 56.

The statistic shows the distribution of Android app usage for business or personal reasons according to smartphone users. During a survey in June 2013, it was found that 32 percent of respondents used their smartphone for business purposes only.

The production of motor vehicles in Europe in July 2021 was at around 76.7 million units, a year-on-year drop of around five percent compared with July 2020. Germany was the largest producer of cars and commercial vehicles in Europe, having produced roughly 62.5 million units in July 2021.
This statistic shows the number of asylum seekers in industrial countries from 2005 to 2014. In 2014, the number of asylum seekers in industrial countries amounted to 868,000.

This statistic shows the leading app developer motivation trends as of July 2013. According to the survey, 52 percent of respondents were motivated to develop apps because they were passionate about their ideas.

In 2020, the number of organized-crime related homicides in Mexico amounted to 28,942 cases. This represents an increase of around 35 percent in comparison to the previous year, when organized crime related violence took the lives of 23,827 people.

This statistic shows the percentage of top funders in public funding for research and development on neglected diseases in 2019. In that year, the U.S. government was responsible for 73 percent of total R & D funding for neglected diseases.

This statistic shows the private spending for wired internet access via dial-up in EMEA from 2007 to 2013. In 2007, private spending for wired internet access via dial-up in EMEA amounted to 12.3 billion U.S. dollars.

The market capitalization of the leading 100 banks worldwide amounted to approximately 4.1 trillion euros in the second quarter of 2020. Market cap is the number of shares in a company multiplied by the price per share. In this case, the 100 leading banks are the most valuable financial institutions in the world.

This statistic shows the number of e-mail accounts among e-mail users in the United States as of January 2016. During the survey period, 63 percent of respondents stated that they had only one e-mail address.

The statistic shows the budgetary balance in EU countries in 2020 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ). A positive value indicates a budget surplus, while a negative value indicates a budget deficit. In 2020, Germany's budget deficit amounted to 3.6 percent of the gross domestic product.

The statistic shows the value of exchange traded funds assets under management in 2010, by country. In that year, the United States was the largest exchange traded fund provider, with total managed assets worth 681.3 billion U.S. dollars.
This statistic shows the world's largest cities in 2010 and a forecast for 2025. In 2010, Tokyo was the biggest city in the world with 37.2 million inhabitants.

This statistic shows the market access rebates and discounts offered to brand name drugs by generic drugs manufacturers in the United States from 2013 to 2018, by component. In 2013, rebates and discounts offered to brand name drugs in the form of negotiated fair market value by generic manufacturers amounted to some 33 percent.

Due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, the average price for sports packages on streaming services in Norway increased by 333 percent in March 2020 compared to the same month a year earlier. After the coronavirus outbreak, the average price for sports packages on streaming services decreased by 75 percent compared to the same month a year earlier.

This statistic depicts the global production of nickel from 2008 to 2014. In 2008, approximately 1.35 million metric tons of nickel were produced or mined worldwide. Until 2014, this amount increased to nearly two million metric tons.

Indian Oil Corporation Limited had three of the largest oil and gas pipelines in the world in 2019, with a planned length of over 18,000 kilometers. The pipeline was to be built in phases, with the first phase being the construction of the pipeline from the southern state of Gujarat through the northern state of Jharkhand, and finally reaching the northern state of Haryana in 2023.
This line graph shows the net revenue made by AMD from their computing solutions segment each year from 2002 to 2013. In 2004, AMD made 2.6 billion U.S. dollars from computing solutions.
This statistic shows the net sales made by Sony Ericsson Mobile Communications from 2002 to 2011. In 2004, Sony Ericsson Mobile Communications had net sales of 6.3 billion euros.

This statistic shows the gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita of Saudi Arabia from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the GDP per capita of Saudi Arabia amounted to approximately 20,341.46 U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows the 20 countries with the lowest fertility rates in 2021. All figures are estimates. In 2021, the fertility rate in South Korea was estimated to be at 1.07 children per woman, making it the country with the lowest fertility rate worldwide.

The statistic shows the distribution of micro loan borrowers in 2008, by region. In that year, more than half of all micro-borrowers were located in South Asia, with a share of 51.7 percent of the global micro-borrowers.

Since 1967 there have been numerous devastating oil spills around the world. The largest was in 1991, during the Persian Gulf War, in which an estimated 380 to 520 million gallons of oil was deliberately spilled by Iraqi forces into the Persian Gulf. This was done in a bid to stop U.S. and coalition forces landing, with oil slicks in some areas as thick as five inches.

The statistic shows the leading countries in the globalization index 2021 in the field of political globalization. The 2021 edition of the index uses data from the year 2019. The index value for the United States was at 98.28 points.

In 2020, the United States was by far the country with the largest gross domestic product ( GDP ) in the world, with a value of around 21.3 trillion U.S. dollars. The second-largest GDP was that of China, amounting to 14.84 trillion U.S. dollars.

From 2016 to 2019, the rates of online purchase of reading materials such as books, magazines and e-learning materials in Luxembourg have remained relatively stable with the exception of a slight increase in 2017. In 2019, the percentage of individuals to have purchased reading material online was at 38.5 percent.
This statistic shows the 20 countries with the lowest inflation rate in 2020. In 2020, Sudan ranked 1st with a negative inflation rate of about 2.9 percent compared to the previous year.

As of January 2021, the App Store offered 38,857 gaming apps. In contrast, as of that month the store had 3,829 non-gaming apps available. In total, there were 63,894 active apps from the Apple App Store as of January 2021.
This statistic shows the number of NGOs with consultative status with ECOSOC from 1948 to 2010. In 1948, there were 6 NGOs with consultative status with ECOSOC.

This statistic shows the share of public Wi-Fi locations and hotspots worldwide that were free to access as of the fourth quarter of 2013. During the survey period, it was found that 75 percent of public Wi-Fi locations and hotspots worldwide required payment to access.
This timeline shows the adidas Group's gross profit worldwide from 2000 to 2020. In 2020, the company's worldwide gross profit amounted to about 9.9 billion euros.
The timeline shows the adidas Group's financial leverage worldwide from 2000 to 2020. In 2020, the company's worldwide financial leverage amounted to about 49.8 billion euros.

The statistic shows the share of ESPRIT brand sales by product category worldwide in fiscal year 2020. In that year, women's products accounted for 67 percent of all ESPRIT brand sales. The ESPRIT brand is owned by the ESPRIT Holding. The corporation operates in the fashion and retail industry and sells apparel, footwear, accessories, jewelry, and housewares under the brand label.

In 2021, Puma generated around 2.5 billion euros from apparel sales, an increase of around 517 million euros on the previous year. Apparel sales accounted for around 46 percent of Puma  s sales in 2021.

This statistic shows the operating income ( EBIT ) of the Puma Group worldwide from 1993 to 2021. In 2021, Puma's global operating income amounted to about 558.5 million euros. Besides Nike and adidas, Puma is one of the largest sporting goods manufacturers worldwide.
This timeline depicts the number of abercrombie kids stores worldwide from 1998 to 2014. The number of abercrombie kids stores worldwide amounted to 171 in 2010.

In 2020, the majority of respondents in Poland feared food shortages and price increases due to the coronavirus outbreak. Nearly 75 percent of Poles were worried about food shortage and price increases. Nearly 70 percent of respondents were afraid that their relatives would get ill, and almost every second person feared a reduction in wages.
This timeline shows the net sales of Levi Strauss worldwide from 2010 to 2021. In 2021, Levi Strauss'net sales amounted to about 5.77 billion U.S. dollars.

There were 15,000 metric tons of leaked oil from tanker incidents in 2021. This was a significant increase from the previous year, when there were only 2,000 metric tons of leaked oil from tanker incidents.

The timeline shows the profit of VF Corporation's work wear segment worldwide from fiscal year 2017 to 2021. In 2021, VF Corporation's work wear segment had a profit amounting to 27.1 million U.S. dollars worldwide. VF Corporation is an internationally operating company covering the lifestyle and footwear industry. The group owns more than 30 brands. The company's largest ones are `` The North Face '', `` Timberland '', and `` Vans ''.

The total aggregate attendance at games of the English Premier League has fluctuated since the 2009/10 season. In 2019/20, the total aggregate attendance at the games was at 11.3 million, a significant decrease from the previous season due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. The highest total aggregate attendance in the Premier League is recorded in 2018/19, with 14.53 million attendees.
The chart shows the number of internet-ready TV sets worldwide from 2005 to 2012. In 2005, the number was at around 1 million.
This statistic shows the population growth in the Philippines from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the population of the Philippines increased by approximately 1.35 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) at current prices from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. The gross domestic product at current prices in 2020 amounted to around 84.84 trillion U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita worldwide from 2010 to 2020. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2020, the global GDP per capita amounted to about 10,958.53 U.S. dollars.
The ranking shows the general conditions for closing a business by selected countries in 2009. In Great Britain, the general conditions for closing a business were ranked as 9.2.
The graph shows the revenue growth of the largest construction companies in China from 2008 to 2009. The Chinese Construction Bank Corporation's revenue grew by 36 percent during that time period.

As of August 2020, around 67 percent of consumers in China intended to increase their spending on new automobiles. In comparison, the new car purchase intention among consumers in Germany was expected to decrease by around 33 percent. The global auto industry is anticipated to sell about 80 million vehicles in 2020.
The statistic shows the change in the results of Nordstrom from 2002 to 2010. In 2010, the company's results increased by 2.1 percent when compared to the previous year.

Bridgestone's research and development ( R & D ) expenditures came to around 106 billion Japanese yen in the fiscal year of 2018. The Japan-based multinational motor vehicle parts manufacturer incurred about 95 billion yen in research and development costs in the fiscal year of 2016.
This line graph shows Hanook Tire's operating profit from 2005 to 2009. In 2005, Hanook Tire's operating profit came to around 308 million Kwanzas ( approximately 47 million U.S. dollars ).

This statistic shows the expenses for research and development of the Italian oil and gas company Eni from 2009 to 2016. In 2016, the company spent approximately 232 million euros for research and development. In the period of consideration, the amount spent on research and development increased steadily.
The graph depicts the fair play table of the 2010 World Cup by country. South Africa has a fair play table of 5/8.

This statistic presents the share of U.S. internet users who were aware of selected data privacy and security issues as of October 2013. During the survey period, it was found that only five percent of respondents were aware of Edward Snowden's revelations about the NSA.

This statistic presents the share of global internet users who have used selected types of media as of November 2015. During the survey period, it was found that 70 percent of internet users had used online search at least once.

This statistic shows the percentage of internet users in the United States who were using social networks from Fall 2014 to Fall 2019, sorted by age group. As of the most recent survey period, it was found that 97 percent of U.S. online users aged between 25 and 34 years used social networks.
This statistic shows the number of malnourished children worldwide in 2000 and projections for 2050, by region. In 2000, about 75 million malnourished children were registered in South Asia.

The chart shows the production of sheep and goat meat in selected regions of the world, comparing the years 1987 and 2007. In 1987, the production of sheep and goat meat was highest in the Middle East and North Africa with 1,000 units, followed by East Asia and South Asia with 700 and 500 units respectively. The least production was recorded in the African continent with 100 units in 1987 and 2007.
The number of libraries in Romania decreased by approximately two thousand from 2013 to 2020. The number of libraries dropped from 11.3 thousand in 2013 to 8.8 thousand in 2020.
The statistic shows the wind turbine investments in Germany and worldwide from 2004 to 2015. Worldwide, wind turbine investments amounted to around 43.2 billion euros in 2004.

The statistic shows the share of German and non-German manufacturers in the global wind turbine production from 2009 to 2012. In 2012, German manufacturers accounted for around 6.9 percent of the world's wind turbine production.

The world total has the highest potential of solar thermal energy, amounting to 1,400 terawatt hours per year. This is significantly higher than the potential in Africa, which is at 775 terawatt hours per year. Despite having the lowest potential, the Middle East is the region with the largest installed solar thermal capacity worldwide.

In 2020, China suffered from the most natural disasters, with 13 natural disasters. The United States was ranked second, with 23 natural disasters. In that same year, there were no natural disasters in Iceland.

In the fiscal year 2020-21, which ended in March 2021, video game publisher Ubisoft generated over 1.5 billion euros in revenue from its subsidiaries in the United States. The company's U.S. subsidiaries include Ubisoft ( video game publisher ), U.S. Interactive ( publishing label ), and Motion Twin ( video game developer ). In total, Ubisoft's global revenue in the 2020-21 financial year amounted to 4.5 billion euros.
The chart shows the number of United Internet subscribers from 2007 to 2009. In 2007, there were 7.12 million subscribers.

The chart shows a comparison of the number of iPhone and iPad sales from 2009 to 2011. In 2009, 20 iPhones and 1 iPad were sold. In 2010, the sales for iPhones increased to 37, while the sales for iPads decreased to 8. In 2011, the sales for iPhones further increased to 45, and the sales for iPads also increased to 21.
The statistic shows the debt level of selected U.S. automobile manufacturers in 2009. The debt level of Ford amounted to around 27 billion U.S. dollars.
The statistic shows the U.S. expenditure on the Iraq war and on U.S. soldier fatalities from 2003 to 2012. In 2011, U.S. expenditure on the Iraq war amounted to 81.1 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the population growth in the United States from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the population in the USA grew by about 0.36 percent compared to the previous year. See the United States population figures for comparison.

From 2016 to 2019, the rates of online purchase of reading materials such as books, magazines and e-learning materials in Italy have been steadily increasing, from 9 per cent in 2016 to 12 per cent in 2019.

This statistic presents the value of funds raised by crowdfunding platforms worldwide from 2012 to 2014. In 2013, the value of funds raised by crowdfunding platforms worldwide amounted to 6.1 billion U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows the budget balance in the United States from 2016 to 2020 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the state deficit of the United States was at around 14.84 percent of the gross domestic product. See the U.S. GDP growth rate here.

This statistic shows the estimated main import partners for the United States in 2019. In 2019, the most important import partner for the United States was China, accounting for 18 percent of all imports.
The statistic shows the population growth in Japan from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the total population of Japan registered a growth of about minus 0.35 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic shows the budget balance in Ireland from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. A positive value indicates a state surplus ; a negative value, a state deficit. In 2020, the state deficit of Ireland was around 22.62 billion euros.

The statistic shows the national debt of Spain from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the national debt in Spain was around 1,522.62 billion U.S. dollars. For comparison, the Greek debt amounted to approximately 375 billion U.S. dollars that same year.

This statistic shows the national debt of Spain from 2016 to 2020 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2020, the national debt of Spain amounted to approximately 119.89 percent of the GDP.

The timeline provides data on online advertising spending in the United Arab Emirates from 2008 to 2009 and a forecast until 2012. In 2009, the online advertising spending in the UAE was 19 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Italy from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 71.03 percent of Italy's total population lived in urban areas and cities.
The statistic shows the estimated main export partners for Italy in 2019. In 2019, Italy's main export partner was Germany, accounting for 12 percent of all exports.

As of March 2020, almost sixty percent of U.S. consumers aged between 55 and 64 stated that they would be much less likely to go to a supermarket because of the coronavirus pandemic. This figure stood at just over ten percent for consumers aged between 18 and 29.

The chart shows the operating profit share of various countries in the photovoltaic industry from 2004 to 2009. The United States had the highest operating profit share in 2004 with 80 percent, while Germany had the lowest with only 2 percent.
The statistic shows the ranking of the leading ICT countries worldwide in 2011. In 2011, the United States was ranked first with an ICT performance index score of 76.2.
The statistic shows the share of ICT in the GDP of selected countries in 2010.

This statistic shows the results of a survey concerning smartphone users regarding the loyalty of their operating systems. During the survey period it was found that almost 27 percent of German respondents stated that their current operating system was very loyal.

The statistic presents the market share of leading real estate websites in the United States in 2016, based on their share of visits. Realtor.com was ranked first with a market share of 19 percent of total visits.

The graph shows the results of a survey among Afghans to evaluate the work of the President of Afghanistan, Hamid Karzai. In December 2010, 63 percent of respondents rated the work of Hamid Karzai as positive.

The graph shows the results of a survey among Afghans regarding the work of the United States and the International Security Assistance Force ( ISAF ) in Afghanistan. 54 percent of respondents rated the work of the U.S. and ISAF as good or better in terms of establishing security.

As of the 3rd quarter of 2020, there were approximately 145 thousand people employed in the advertising and market research industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ). This is a decrease of ten thousand people since the beginning of 2019.

This statistic shows the most common types of blocked spam messages worldwide as of October 2013. During the survey period, it was found that 43 percent of blocked spam messages were found to be using a generic top-level domain ( gTLD ).
The statistic shows the areas of application for palladium worldwide in 2010. In that year, 6.5 percent of the palladium was used for dentistry.

This statistic presents the annual distance traveled by a heavy vehicle in France from 2004 to 2018, by vehicle type. In 2018, a heavy vehicle traveled a distance of more than 32,000 kilometers by bus or coach.

This statistic shows Merck KGaA's revenue from 2014 to 2020, distributed by segment. In 2020, the company's healthcare segment generated some 6.6 billion euros of revenue. In the United States, Merck KGaA is also known as `` EMD Chemicals '' or `` German Merck ''. The company is headquartered in Darmstadt. Founded in 1668, Merck is the oldest operating chemical and pharmaceutical company worldwide.
The graph shows the number of employees of the world's leading home appliance manufacturers in 2008.

The statistic shows the weighted index of social justice in the OECD countries in 2011. The index is based on the Social Justice and Inequality Index ( SJI ) developed by the International Institute for Social Justice.
