In the fiscal year of 2018, the U.S. Highway Trust Fund collected 63 percent of its revenue through gasoline and diesel taxes. The U.S. Highway Trust Fund is a government agency responsible for the maintenance and improvement of the nation's highway infrastructure.
The number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the United Kingdom from 2010 to 2021 has generally increased year-on-year. In 2021, there were approximately 2.77 million enterprises in the UK.

This statistic depicts the leading investments in prepping a home for sale in the United States in 2013 and 2014. The survey revealed that 69 percent of respondents are planning to make improvements to the exterior features of their home in 2014.
In 2021 there were approximately 594 thousand business sites, or local units for VAT/PAYE based enterprises in London, an increase of around 5 thousand when compared with the previous year.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the crop and animal production industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2019, by employment size band. In this year, within this sector there were 1,320 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

Of the 1.4 thousand local units in the crude petroleum and natural gas extraction sector in the United Kingdom in 2020, the majority were businesses that employed less than five people. Local units that employed between five and nine people numbered 15, while there were just five companies that employed 250 people or more.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the mining of metal ores and other quarrying industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2019, by employment size band. In this year within this sector there were 230 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the manufacture of wearing apparel sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. In this year within this sector there were 310 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the wood manufacturing sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. In this year, there were 810 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

During a 2019 survey, it was found that the average number of pages per buying session across all verticals was 16.7. The e-commerce vertical had the highest average number of pages per buying session with 32.1 pages.

The statistic shows the growth in real GDP in Indonesia from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, Indonesia's real gross domestic product fell by around 2.23 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the furniture manufacturing sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. In this year, there were 810 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the wholesale and retail trade and repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. In this year within this sector there were 5,800 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

This statistic shows the number of local units in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the air transport industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2019, by employment size band. In this year, within this sector there were 90 local units with employment size between 10 and 19 employees in VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises.

This statistic shows the national debt of Indonesia from 2016 to 2020 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2020, the national debt of Indonesia amounted to approximately 37.02 percent of the GDP.

Of the 27.9 thousand sports and recreation local enterprises operating in the United Kingdom in 2020, the majority were businesses that employed less than five people. Sports and recreation enterprises that employed between five and nine people numbered 5.7 thousand, while there were just 140 companies that employed 250 people or more.
In the fiscal year of 2021, the United States Postal Service had a total of 231,476 vehicles in its fleet, up from 230,904 vehicles the previous year.

This statistic displays the number of active physicians per 100,000 population in West African countries that are suffering from the Ebola outbreak in 2014. Sierra Leone has some 2.2 physicians per 100,000 population. In comparison, the U.S. average stands at 245 physicians per every 100,000 of its population. Ebola first emerged in 1976 in Sudan and the Democratic Republic of Congo. The outbreak in West Africa has proven difficult to control, especially in poor countries.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the coke manufacturing industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2012 to 2019, by turnover size band. As of March 2019, there were 20 enterprises with a turnover of more than 5 million GBP in this sector, more than in the previous years.
This statistic shows the average income rating in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2018, by region. The average income rating in London was 6.1 out of 5, compared with 3.7 in Northern Ireland.

As of March 2020, 65 percent of U.S. consumers reported that they expected to spend about the same amount on mobile electronics in the next six months. However, almost a quarter of consumers expected to spend either somewhat less ( 12 percent ) or a lot less ( nine percent ) on mobile electronics.

Of the 27.9 thousand civil engineering enterprises operating in the United Kingdom in 2021, the majority were businesses that employed less than five people. Civil engineering enterprises that employed between five and nine people numbered 2.2 thousand, while there were just 90 companies that employed 250 people or more.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the programming and broadcasting activities sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. As of this year, there were 35 enterprises with between 20 and 49 employees.

In 2021, there were 2,340 security companies operating in London, making it the region with the most enterprises in this sector in the United Kingdom. In total there were 6,890 security companies operating in the UK in 2021.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises in the education sector in the United Kingdom in 2019, by employment size band. During this year, there were 3,560 enterprises with between 20 and 49 employees.

This statistic shows the reported Fairtrade International sales income worldwide in 2018, by product. In that year, the reported Fairtrade International sales income from coffee amounted to 76.1 million euros.

This statistic shows the share of restaurant employees who would like to own a restaurant some day in the United States as of October 2013, by age group. During the survey, 66 percent of restaurant employees aged between 25 and 34 years said they would like to own a restaurant some day.

This statistic illustrates the distribution of home owners in England as of 2021, broken down by age. Home ownership is most common among the elderly over 65 years of age, with 35 percent of homeowners falling into this category.

This statistic shows the percentage change in the distribution of mail segments in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2012. In 2012, the share of transactional mail ( e.g. business mail, catalogs, invitations, letters of recommendation and other types ) increased by 50 percent compared to 2005.

This statistic shows different dealership franchises'ratings of the cost and quality of their manufacturers'used car warranties in the United Kingdom ( UK ) according to a car dealership survey carried out in January 2016. The respondents gave a score out of ten. Peugeot dealers gave their manufacturer's used car warranty terms and conditions the lowest rating while the highest score of 8.6 out of 10 was given by both Suzuki and Lexus dealers.

This statistic shows the best-rated midsize-ship cruise lines by travelers in the United States as of May 2021. With a score of 93, Royal Caribbean was the best midsize-ship cruise line according to Cond Nast Traveler readers.

In 2020, a survey carried out in the United Kingdom ( UK ) found that 58 percent of respondents said they would consider using a digital health service if it was available for free, while a further 21 percent said they would consider it if it was available for a small fee. Only four percent said they would not consider using a free digital health service.

The statistic shows the advantages of buying art online according to international buyers as of April 2015. The most common advantage was the price research, which was reported by 80 percent of respondents as an advantage of buying art online.

This statistic shows the best-rated large-ship cruise lines by travelers in the United States as of May 2021. The Viking Ocean Cruises was the best-rated large-ship cruise line according to Cond Nast Traveler readers with a score of 93.5 out of 100.

This statistic shows different dealership franchises'ratings of the professionalism of their manufacturers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) according to a car dealership survey carried out in January 2016. The respondents gave a score out of ten. Jaguar and Fiat dealers gave their manufacturer's professionalism the lowest rating while the highest score of 9.6 out of 10 was given by Mercedes dealers.

This statistic shows the friendliest cities in the United States as of August 2014. The survey was based on responses from residents of each city. The results were then voted on by the residents themselves. The survey was conducted by YouGov. The results showed that Charlotte was the friendliest city in the United States with an index score of 84.6.

The statistic presents the distribution of actors and actress who have won an Academy Award as of March 2014, broken down by age. As of March 2014, 37 percent of actors who have won an Academy Award have been between 26 and 34 years old.

The statistic presents the box office revenue of `` Best Picture '' nominees at the Academy Awards in 2020. `` The Irishman '', which was nominated for `` Best Picture '' in 2020, generated 1.8 million U.S. dollars in domestic box office revenue.

This statistic shows the main reasons for using the internet to interact with public authorities or services in Great Britain in 2020. During the survey period, it was found that 35 percent of respondents stated that they used the internet to interact with public authorities or services in order to download a formal download.

This statistic shows the reasons for online file sharing and saving in Great Britain in 2014, by age group. Most commonly reported reasons were `` to exchange data with others '' and `` to use files from several devices or local storage ''.

This statistic shows the share of internet users who regularly visited public services or local authority websites in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2012, by age. In 2012, 43 percent of internet users aged between 55 and 64 reported visiting public services or local authority websites regularly.

This statistic shows the number of new Mercedes large heavy goods vehicles which were registered in the United Kingdom between January 2014 and October 2015 on a monthly basis. Large heavy goods vehicles were not particularly popular in the United Kingdom. The number of new registrations for these vehicles was below 20 in both years recorded here.

During a representative survey of the British adult population, undertaken between the 16th and 17th March 2020, respondents were asked about their preferred approach to deciding the winners and losers of any sports leagues, competitions or tournaments that have been suspended or paused as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic. There was a significant difference in the share of respondents that indicated that there should be no winners or losers recognised this year, with 40 percent of those aged 55 and over, compared with just 12 percent of those aged between 18 and 24.

This statistic shows the responses of internet users in the United Kingdom when asked what types of things they currently do on the internet. As of August 2015, the majority of respondents reported using the internet for general surfing or browsing, at 69 percent.

This statistic ranks the number of new bus and coach registrations in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2020, by bus manufacturer. The leading bus manufacturer in 2020 was the bus manufacturer MAN SE, with a total of 478 new bus and coach registrations.

This statistic shows a forecast for the number of new hotel rooms opening in Europe from 2012 to 2016. In 2013, 30,966 new hotel rooms opened in the European hotel market. It was forecasted that 34,248 new hotel rooms would open in 2016.

This statistic shows a forecast for the number of new hotel rooms opening in the Middle East from 2012 to 2016. In 2013, 9,868 new hotel rooms opened in the Middle Eastern hotel market. It was forecasted that 17,568 new hotel rooms would open in 2016.

The statistic depicts the top ten nation brand performers in the people and skills segment in 2014, measured by the Brand Strength Index ( BSI ). In that year, New Zealand received a people and skills segment BSI score of 81.

This statistic ranks the leading light goods vehicle models in Great Britain in 2019, by the number of vehicles registered. That year, the Renault Clio was the most popular LGV model with approximately 956,600 vehicles registered. This was followed by Volkswagen Transporter and Vauxhall Vivaro.

Since 2001 there has been little change in the average number of daily sun hours in the UK. In 2020, there was an average of 0.2 more daily sun hours compared to the 10-year mean from 2001 to 2010. The largest deviation during this period was in 2002. This year there was 0.6 more daily sun hours compared to the 10-year mean.

The average daily temperature in the United Kingdom has remained relatively stable since 2001, with temperatures rarely straying below 9 degrees Celsius. In 2021, the UK had an average daily temperature of 10.4 degrees Celsius. The highest average daily temperature during the period shown was recorded in 2014 at 10.9 degrees Celsius. Temperatures across the UK tend to be warmest in England.

This statistic shows the real and nominal value of the minimum wage in the United States from 1930 to 2013. In July 2009, the minimum wage was 8.15 U.S. dollars per hour, which was not much higher than the minimum wage in 1970.

Monthly average daily temperatures in the United Kingdom have typically been warmest in January and February. Since 2015, the highest average daily temperature recorded in the UK was 18.7 degrees Celsius in July 2018. The summer of 2018 was the joint hottest since institutions began recording temperatures in 1910. By comparison, the summer months of 2019 had a peak average temperature of 19.1 degrees Celsius in July. The UK's highest average monthly temperature in this period occurred in August 2020, at 17.6 degrees Celsius.
The graph shows the estimated population of Europe from 1950 to 2021. The population is steadily increasing from 551 million in 1950 to 740 million in 2021.

This statistic shows the quarterly average number of heating degree days in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2011 to 2019. The highest average number of heating degree days, 12.2, was recorded in the third quarter of 2013. The lowest, zero, was recorded in the first quarter of 2019.

Over the past decade, the United Kingdom has seen its average wind speed increase by approximately 2.5 knots. The highest average wind speed recorded since 2010 was 11.5 knots in the fourth quarter of 2020. One knot equates to one nautical mile per hour. Overall, 2010 had the lowest average wind speed with 7.6 knots, while 2019 had the highest average speed of 9.4 knots.

This statistic shows the leading international fall destinations for United States travelers as of August 2016. During the survey, 31 percent of respondents stated that they were considering visiting New Zealand for their next international trip.

The statistic shows the number of Facebook fans/Twitter followers of the NBA franchise Charlotte Hornets from September 2012 to September 2021. In September 2021, the Facebook page of the Charlotte Hornets basketball team had around 1.72 million fans.

This statistic shows the growth in retail spending in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013, by food and non-food sectors. From 2012 to 2013, total expenditure in the retail sector grew by 1.5 percent. The food and grocery sector showed the highest growth with 4 percent, while spending on non-food products declined by 0.3 percent.

The statistic shows the number of Facebook fans/Twitter followers of the NBA franchise Memphis Grizzlies from September 2012 to September 2021. In September 2021, the Facebook page of the Memphis Grizzlies basketball team had around 1.76 million fans.

This statistic shows the general attractiveness factors of the United Kingdom ( UK ) for tourists in 2014. According to 35 percent of respondents, the UK's cultural and historic attractions are the main reason for visiting, while 14 percent state that the economy and society in the UK are attractive in themselves.

This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in 2014 on the most attractive countries in the world. The survey was conducted in six countries. 60 percent of respondents stated the United States was the most attractive country in the world.

This statistic shows the top reasons for U.S. employees to mutate themselves on a mobile conference call in 2013. During the survey, it was found that 35 percent of employees in the United States use mobile conference calls to eat or make food.

This statistic shows the share of net marine insurance premium income in the total marine insurance gross written premiums in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 1992 to 2014. In 2012, the share of net marine insurance premium income in the total marine insurance gross written premiums in the United Kingdom ( UK ) amounted to 10 percent.

The number of new coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) deaths in Denmark increased significantly by December 17, 2020. On December 16, the country registered eight deaths, which was the lowest number of deaths recorded in a single day since the outbreak began. By contrast, the highest number of new deaths in a single day was recorded on November 29, with 22 deaths.

This statistic shows the share of private label and brand label types of milk British shoppers choose most regularly when shopping, according to a survey conducted in December 2012. Consumers who regularly bought milk were asked to indicate which type they bought most regularly. Of respondents, 38 percent chose standard or premium named brands, while 58 percent tended to buy some form of own label product.

This statistic shows the reasons for which tourists used their mobile devices while traveling in the United States as of July 2014. During the survey, 60 percent of respondents said they used their mobile device while traveling for local restaurants and attractions.

This statistic shows the number of pedestrians killed or seriously injured in road accidents, with engines of 50 cc or over, in Great Britain as of 2019, categorized by gender and age group. In that year, there were 1,749 more male pedestrians killed or seriously injured than female pedestrians. People between 25 and 59 years old were by far the group age with the highest number of casualties, with 1,749 men and 1,073 women.

This statistic shows the most annoying types of tourists in locals'eyes in the United States as of July 2014. During the survey, 22 percent of locals said the most annoying tourists were those who stopped and talked to everyone they passed by.

This statistic shows the preferred customer service methods for travel-related problems in the United States as of June 2014, by income. During the survey, 42 percent of respondents with an income of 75,000 to 99,999 U.S. dollars said they preferred customer service by telephone call.

This statistic presents the preferred mobile messenger apps of moms in the United States. During the July 2014 survey it was found that 35 percent of U.S. digital mothers used the Facebook messenger app on their phone.

This statistic shows the supply levels of logistics space in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in the first half of 2013 and the first half of 2014, by region. 3.94 million square feet of logistics space was available in the first half of 2014 in the Midlands and 3.94 million square feet in 2013 in the West Midlands.

This statistic shows the take-up of logistics space in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between the first half of 2014 and the first half of 2015, by region. 11 percent of all logistics space taken up in the first half of 2015 was in the Midlands.

This statistic shows the leading post-vacation lifestyle changes of travelers worldwide as of July 2014. During the survey, 37 percent of respondents said that they introduced foods and recipes that they first ate on vacation into their diet after they returned home.

This statistic shows the leading lifestyle changes of travelers after city or cultural vacations worldwide as of July 2014. During the survey, 41 percent of respondents said that they introduced foods and recipes that they first ate on vacation into their diet after they returned home.

During a representative survey of the British adult population, undertaken between the 16th and 17th March 2020, respondents were asked their opinion on how the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo should be handled and scheduled to take place during the COVID-19 pandemic.

This statistic shows the leading lifestyle changes of travelers after nature vacations worldwide as of July 2014. During the survey, 31 percent of respondents said that they introduced foods and recipes that they first ate on vacation into their diet after they returned home.

This statistic shows the most used definitions of `` off the beaten path '' in North America as of August 2014. During the survey, 58 percent of respondents stated that `` off the beaten path '' means an experience that is new or hasn 't been done before.

This statistic shows the most popular `` off the beaten path '' destinations for North American travelers as of August 2014. During the survey, 14 percent of respondents said that South America was a popular off the beaten path destination for North American travelers.

This statistic displays the distribution of contractors in Obamacare's Healthcare.gov website as of December 2014. The total cost of Obamacare sign-ups during the 2014 open enrollment period was about 250 million U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the most collectible living artists at auction worldwide from 2011 to 2016, by value of sales. Between 2011 and 2016, Yayoi Kusama was the most collectible living artist worldwide with auction sales at Christie's reaching 1.21 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows opinions of members of the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders ( SMMT ) on the possibility of the use of third parties to fill skills gaps in the industry. The survey was carried out in July 2014. Most respondents were against the idea, with 64 percent stating that the use of third parties to fill skills gaps would have no impact on the quality of work.

This statistic illustrates the sales at auction of post-war and contemporary art in Europe and the United States from 2000 to 2015. In 2013, auction sales of post-war and contemporary art in Europe and the U.S. reached 3.92 billion U.S. dollars.

The statistic illustrates the sales at auction of modern and contemporary art in Latin America from 2013 to 2018. According to the source, auction sales of modern and contemporary art in Latin America had reached 75.4 million U.S. dollars in 2018.

This statistic shows British public opinion from September 18 to 19, 2014, and one week later on September 24 to 25, 2014, on whether the United Kingdom and the United States should send troops back into Iraq to fight the Islamic State/ISIS. On the second date, more people approved of the potential UK and US military operation, whereas fewer people disapproved or were unsure. This could be due to increased media portrayal of ISIS as violently anti-Western.

This statistic shows the different British public approval ratings by political stance on September 24 to 25, 2014 of the RAF-provided air strikes in Syria against Islamic State/ISIS to weaken them. The majority of participants who approved of the air strikes were Conservative supporters, while the majority of those who disapproved were Labour supporters.

Nearly 80 percent of respondents were of the opinion that Romania's neighboring countries were the most reliable in case of a conflict with Russia. Only 28 percent of respondents considered Hungary to be a reliable ally.
During the week of March 15, 2020, the dollar sales of turkey meat in the United States grew by 96.4 percent. Conversely, the dollar sales of deli meat appreciated by 41.6 percent in that period.

This statistic shows the results of a yougov survey conducted in 2014, asking British adults to select types of beer from a list. According to the results, 42 percent of British adults do not like any of the types listed, while 28 percent prefer stout.

This statistic shows the sales value of compounded, unvulcanized rubber based on PRODCOM estimates * * in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2010 and 2014. The UK experienced an increase in sales value over this period. The sales value reached 212.5 million British pounds in 2013.

The statistic shows the distribution of employment in Syria by economic sector from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, 11.2 percent of the employees in Syria were active in the agricultural sector, 22.9 percent in industry and 66.5 percent in the service sector.

This statistic shows the methods consumers prefer to use to contact their local public sector organizations in the United Kingdom in 2013. According to the survey, 47 percent of consumers prefer to use telephone to contact their local public sector organizations, while 39 percent prefer to use e-mail.
This statistic shows the harmonized consumer price index for all items in Germany from October 2017 to September 2018. In September 2018, the consumer price index for all items was 104.05 points.
This statistic shows the harmonized consumer price index for all items in Estonia from October 2017 to September 2018. In September 2018, the consumer price index for all items was 109.02 points.
This statistic shows the harmonized consumer price index for all items in Slovenia from October 2017 to September 2018. In September 2018, the consumer price index for all items was 104.05 points.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, there were 661 enterprises manufacturing pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in the United Kingdom.
This statistics shows the share of countries worldwide where seperatarian or communal violence occurred from 2007 to 2012. In 2012, 43.9 percent of countries worldwide reported incidents of violence.

This statistic shows the economic contribution of tourism in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013. Both domestic and outbound travel for personal purposes contributed 117.1 billion British pounds to the UK economy that year, while business travel contribution amounted to 34.2 billion British pounds.

A survey from April 2020 asked Italian individuals how they would rate the government's communication about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. Data show that the majority of respondents ( 46 percent ) believed the information provided by the government was fairly good. By contrast, 13 percent of interviewees stated the information was very poor.

This statistic shows the results of a survey among U.S. adults by gender on issues facing working women in the United States in September 2014. During the survey, 6 percent of men were of the opinion that balancing work and personal life is the most important issue facing working women and 41 percent of women were of the opinion that eliminating the gender pay gap is the most important issue facing working women in the U.S. today.

This statistic shows the economic contribution of tourism in Scotland in 2013. Both domestic and outbound travel for personal purposes contributed 14.3 billion British pounds to the Scottish economy that year, while business travel contribution amounted to 6.9 billion British pounds.

This statistic illustrates the monthly trend in volume sales of the total retail trade in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from December 2017 to November 2018. Retail trade sales volume in the UK had a steady increase until November 2018.

This statistic displays the annual turnover of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations manufacturing in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2019, by subgroup. In 2019, the total turnover of the manufacture of pharmaceutical products was over 20.4 billion British pounds.

This statistic displays the value of purchases in the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations from 2008 to 2019, in the United Kingdom ( UK ). In 2019, the value of purchases in the manufacture of pharmaceutical products was approximately 12.1 billion British pounds.

This statistic displays the percentage change in volume of food, drink and tobacco retail trade ( compared to the previous month ) in the European Union from September 2016 to August 2018. In August 2018, the volume of food, drink and tobacco retail decreased slightly by 0.1 percent compared to the previous month.

This statistic shows the average monthly savings as a share of monthly income in Great Britain from 2013 to 2015, by gender. The average monthly savings of women in the second quarter of 2014 amounted to 8.1 percent of their monthly income.

This statistic presents the preference of male and female consumers for fork and knife or chopsticks when eating Asian meals in the United States as of May 2014. During the survey, 80 percent of female respondents stated that they preferred to use fork and knife when eating Asian meals.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of vulcanized rubber threads and cord in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. EU exports of vulcanized rubber threads and cord reached a value of 1.3 million British pounds in 2018.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of rubber transmission belts in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. The EU was clearly an important trade partner for the United Kingdom over this period. EU exports of rubber transmission belts reached a value of 22.5 million British pounds in 2018.

In 2018, the most transported good by train in France was crude oil, with more than 8.6 billion ton-kilometers. In second and third place were passenger cars and coke, with 4.2 and 3.7 billion ton-kilometers, respectively.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of vulcanized rubber seals in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. EU exports of vulcanized rubber seals reached a value of 114.6 million British pounds in 2018.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of rubberized textile fabric adhesive tape and similar products in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2013. EU exports of rubberized textile adhesive tape reached a value of 326 thousand British pounds in 2013.

This statistic shows the value from EU and non-EU exports of plastic monofilaments exceeding 1mm diameter in the United Kingdom between 2010 and 2019 *. This statistic shows the house price index in Czechia from the first quarter of 2016 to the second quarter of 2020. In the quarter ending June 2020, the house price index stood at 150.92 index points - the highest level recorded during this period of time.

Edward Jenner's work on smallpox, published in 1797, was the first time that any scientific findings about vaccination were presented to the wider medical community. Within a few short years of this publication, vaccination had been practiced in most European countries, and the impact was beginning to show almost immediately ; particularly in countries such as Sweden and England. As vaccination practices spread, the severity and frequency of smallpox pandemics declined, and the disease ceased to be endemic in some regions.

The smallpox death rate in Britain, for all three countries ( England, Scotland and Wales ), shows a trend of decreasing death rates from 1847 until 1980. The death rate was highest in 1850 for all three nations, with the death rate in England, Scotland and Wales being significantly higher than that of India. The death rate in India was generally lower than that of the other two countries, with the exception of 1857 and 1869, where the Indian death rate was higher than that of Britain. The highest death rate in Great Britain was recorded in 1890, where there were approximately 7,000 deaths due to smallpox per million people.

This statistic shows the share of the population aged 18 to 64 years old who are in poverty in the EU from 2005 to 2013. In 2013, 18.3 percent of the European population aged between 18 and 64 years were living in poverty.

This statistic presents the share of adult internet users in developing and emerging markets who accessed the internet daily as of May 2015. In that time, it was found that 70 percent of Brazilian internet users accessed the internet daily, with 58 percent accessing the internet several times a day.
This statistic shows the production volume of major gold mines in Russia in 2013. The Krasnoyarsk Gold Mine, also known as the Norilsk Nickel mine, produced 22.1 metric tons of gold in 2013.

The majority of respondents stated that they would vaccinate their children against measles, mumps, and rubella ( MMR ). However, over 40 percent of people surveyed for this study answered that they would not have their children vaccinated.

As of March 2020, 78 percent of British people surveyed were washing their hands more frequently as a result of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ), while a further 69 percent were using hand sanitizer more regularly. Only seven percent of respondents said they were not making any changes to their lifestyle as a result of the virus.

This statistic presents the share of adult internet users in developing and emerging markets who used the internet to get information as of June 2014. In that time, it was found that 79 percent of Brazilian internet users accessed political news online.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the furniture manufacturing industry in Denmark from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, furniture manufacturing led to personnel costs of approximately 483.3 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the furniture manufacturing industry in Estonia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, furniture manufacturing led to personnel costs of approximately 117.9 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the furniture manufacturing industry in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, furniture manufacturing led to personnel costs of approximately 2.68 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the basic metals manufacturing industry in France from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, basic metals manufacturing led to a turnover of approximately 25.3 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the basic metals manufacturing industry in Croatia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, basic metals manufacturing led to a turnover of approximately 232.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the basic metals manufacturing industry in Slovakia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, basic metals manufacturing led to a turnover of approximately 3.97 billion euros.

This statistic shows the average amount of child support received by custodial parents from their noncustodial counterpart in the United States from 1993 to 2017. In 2017, the average amount of child support received by custodial parents from their noncustodial counterpart stood at 3,450 U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the average amount of child support paid by custodial parents to noncustodial parents in the United States from 1993 to 2017. In 2017, the average amount of child support paid by custodial parents to noncustodial parents stood at 5,463 U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Ireland from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 80.4 million euros.

Between February 24 and March 25, 2020 search ad metrics related to medical products and search ad conversion rate in the United States have shown significant changes due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. The average number of searches for pharmaceutical ads in the measured period has increased by 34 percent and conversion rates have increased by 47 percent.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Greece from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 787.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Citroen in the Republic of Ireland between 2009 and 2019. In the period of consideration, Irish sales of Citroen cars oscillated. From 2009 to 2015, Citroen sales grew to its peak, at approximately 1.8 thousand units as of 2014. From 2016 onwards, Irish Citroen sales declined and has fluctuated. In 2019, Citroen sales amounted to 945 units, a decrease of roughly 35 percent in comparison with the peak year.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Italy from 2008 to 2018. In 2018, the production value of this industry came to approximately 32.2 billion euros.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Lithuania from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 422.5 million euros.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Slovakia from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 361.4 million euros.

This statistic shows the share of respondents who have experienced safety issues on holiday in the European Union ( EU ) in 2014. 2 percent of respondents said they had been robbed or had their luggage stolen while on holiday.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Sweden from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 235.8 million euros.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in the United Kingdom from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 4.7 billion euros.

This statistic represents the share of people in France who practiced a certain activity during their free time in 2015, by gender. It reveals that more than 80 percent of the men surveyed played video games in their free time, whereas the same was true for less than 60 percent of the women surveyed.
This statistic shows the number of employees of Banco Santander worldwide from 2012 to 2020. As of the end of 2020, Banco Santander employed approximately 190,000 people globally.

The outbreak of coronavirus in the world and the occurrence of the first infected individuals in Poland may affect the economic growth of the country. At the end of March 2020, the Ministry of Finance, when preparing the strategy for the next year, considered different scenarios and their impact on the Polish economy. In the worst case, the GDP index is predicted to fall to nearly -23 percent.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in Denmark from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, this industry produced a turnover of approximately 13.86 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in Hungary from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, this industry produced a turnover of approximately 3.24 billion euros.
This statistic shows the number of custodial parents in the United States as of 2011, by marital status. As of 2011, about 3.5 million custodial parents were divorced.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacture of basic pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical preparations in Ireland from 2008 to 2014. In 2014, this industry had personnel costs of approximately 1.27 billion euros.

This survey displays the percentage of U.S. adults that believe health research is a problem or solution for rising health costs in the U.S., from 2016 to 2020. In 2020, around 54 percent of respondents believed that health research part of the solution for rising costs.

The statistic shows the financial assets of mutual investment funds in Norway as of 2013, broken down by asset type. The total value of equity and other shares owned by mutual funds amounted to approximately 442 billion Norwegian kroner in 2013.

This statistic illustrates the total value of financial assets of investment funds in Poland as of 2013, broken down by asset type. It can be seen that the total value of financial assets of investment funds held in equity amounted to approximately 87.5 billion Polish zloty at that time. The total financial assets of investment funds held in debt reached a value of over 20.1 billion Polish zloty in Poland as of 2013.
This statistic depicts the dental treatment ever received by 15 year olds in Wales in 2013. The majority of respondents, 70.5 percent, have had advice on oral care.
This statistic displays the dental care ever received by 15 year olds in Northern Ireland in 2013. The majority of respondents, 64.2 percent, had received advice on oral care.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Denmark semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 8.97 euro cents per kWh.

The number of confirmed coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) cases in Sweden as of December 8, 2020, showed that the number of women who had been infected was slightly higher than the number of men. There were 163,851 men and 166,539 women who had been confirmed as infected.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Estonia semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 4.04 euro cents per kWh.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Poland semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 4.2 euro cents per kWh.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in Slovakia semi-annually from 2010 to 2018. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 4.27 euro cents per kWh.

Household electricity prices in Denmark averaged 30.35 euro cents per kilowatt-hour ( kWh ) in the second half of 2020. Since 2010, household prices have seen an overall increase, peaking at 33.26 euro cents per kWh in the first half of 2018. Households using between 2.500 and 5.000 kWh paid 31.26 euro cents per kWh in the second half of 2020.

Household electricity prices in Estonia averaged 13.26 euro cents per kilowatt hour ( kWh ) in the second half of 2020. Residents of Estonia using between 1.000 and 2.500 kWh paid 14.26 euro cents per kWh, while those using between 2.500 and 5.000 kWh paid 13.26 euro cents per kWh. Households using between 1.000 and 2.500 kWh tended to pay less for electricity in Estonia than those using between 2.500 and 5.000 kWh.

This statistic shows the electricity prices for household end users in Luxembourg semi-annually from 2010 to 2020. In the second half of 2020, the average electricity price for households using between 1.000 and 2.500 kWh was 23.66 euro cents per kWh.

This statistic illustrates the use of social networks as a communication method among different age groups and by gender in France in 2014. Among respondents aged 18 to 24, 28 percent reported using a social network to contact family or friends.

This statistic shows the electricity prices for household end users in Austria semi-annually from 2010 to 2020. In the second half of 2020, the average electricity price for households was 25.48 euro cents per kWh.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on attitudes towards advertising in Germany in 2012. During the survey period it was found that 63 percent of respondents agreed to some extent that advertising is an integral part of modern life.

This statistic illustrates the use of photo sharing as a communication method among different age groups and by gender in France in 2014. Among respondents aged 18 to 24, 39 percent had used photo sharing to contact family or friends.

In 2020, every second company in Poland expects a reduction in the number of employees due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Every third company plans to reduce office space and every fourth company expects a reduction in the company's activities.

This statistic displays the number of independent contractors of community pharmacies in England from 2006/07 to 2020/21. In 2019/20, there were 4,766 independent contractors of community pharmacies in England.
This statistic shows the purchase reasons for tablet devices in France in 2014. The most common reason was that an existing product had broken, with 26 percent of respondents giving this reason.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information and communication technology manufacturing industry in Finland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the ICT manufacturing industry employed a total number of 15,905 people.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Volvo in Turkey between 2012 and 2019. In the period of consideration, Turkish sales of Volvo cars fluctuated, peaking at 6.9 thousand units sold in 2015. In 2019, Volvo sold approximately 4.2 thousand cars, a decrease of roughly 29 percent in comparison with the previous year.

This statistic displays the results of a survey of individuals in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013, regarding their attitude towards receiving mail and e-mail. Of respondents, 56 percent reported they spend a lot of time reading it.

This statistic displays the response of individuals in Great Britain when asked, why would they not be likely to get information from a pharmacy on some of the issues that they just mentioned? In this period, 36 percent of individuals interviewed said they would not be likely to get information from a pharmacy on issues that they just mentioned due to lack of trust in pharmacies.

In 2020, the most registered car brand in France was by far Peugeot, with more than 311,000 new registrations. The French car brand saw a significant increase in sales since 2016, when its registrations amounted to nearly 205,000. The second most registered car brand in 2020 was Renault, with about 303,000 new registrations.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) manufacturing industry in Bulgaria from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the production value of the ICT manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 265.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the U.S. retailers running the most circular advertisements for analgesics in 2014. In that year, Walgreens ran the most effective circular ads for analgesics with a count of 228.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on the time spent using products or devices in Germany in 2014. During the survey period it was found that respondents spent an average of 2.5 hours watching TV.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most car parts manufacturers in Poland feel uncertain about the future. Thirty-nine percent of manufacturers expect the company's production to fall by about 20 to 40 percent.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Fiat in Austria between 2012 and 2018. Austrian sales of Fiat cars decreased from 12.5 thousand units sold in 2012 to 10 thousand units sold in 2014, before increasing again the following year. The number of Fiat cars sold in Austria peaked at 15.6 thousand units in 2017. In 2018, there were 14.7 thousand units of Fiat cars sold in Austria.

The production value of the ICT services industry in Belgium increased by 2.5 billion euros since the previous year. With 35,539 million euros, the production value thereby reached its highest value in the observed period. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.
This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Kia in Austria between 2010 and 2018. Austrian sales of Kia cars declined from 12.4 thousand units sold in 2012 to 9.3 thousand units sold in 2015.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Citroen in Austria between 2010 and 2018. Austrian sales of Citroen cars decreased from 13.5 thousand units sold in 2010 to 10.3 thousand units sold in 2012, before increasing slightly in the following years. In 2018, 7.6 thousand Citroen cars were sold in Austria.

This statistic illustrates the number of complaints submitted to the Financial Ombudsman regarding customer current accounts in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between the financial years of 2009/2010 to 2020/2021. It can be seen that the number of complaints regarding customer current accounts fluctuated during the period under observation, reaching a total of under 24.1 thousand as of 2020/2021. The largest number of complaints were found in 2015/2016, when a total of approximately 58.5 thousand complaints were recorded.
This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Mitsubishi in Austria between 2010 and 2018. Austrian sales of Mitsubishi cars rose to a peak of 4.9 thousand units sold in 2018.

This statistic illustrates the number of complaints to the Financial Ombudsman regarding credit card services and products in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between the financial years of 2009/2010 to 2019/2020. It can be seen that the number of complaints regarding credit cards fluctuated overall during the period under observation, reaching a total of under ten thousand as of 2019/2020. The largest number of complaints were found in 2012/2013, when a total of over 19.5 thousand complaints were recorded.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology services sector in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the annual production value of the ICT services sector amounted to approximately 62.82 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology services sector in Poland from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the annual production value of the ICT services sector amounted to approximately 23.02 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology services sector in Slovenia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the annual production value of the ICT services sector amounted to approximately 2.47 billion euros.
The number of daily visits on online health portals in Hungary peaked on March 22, 2020, when over 5.2 million visits were recorded. The lowest number of visits was recorded on March 8, 2020.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Opel in Belgium between 2009 and 2020. Belgian sales of Opel cars peaked at 43,000 units sold in 2011, but decreased in the following years, amounting to 19,947 units in 2020.

This statistic shows the share of American adults who remained married after their first marriage in 2013, by age. In 2013, 53 percent of adults aged 55 to 64 remained married after their first marriage.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information and communication technology services sector in Slovenia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the ICT services sector turnover amounted to approximately 3.35 billion euros.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Italy from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 9.1 percent to 16.8 percent.

The number of cars sold by Alfa Romeo in Switzerland fluctuated between 2009 and 2019. The sale of Alfa Romeo cars peaked in 2011 at 4,100 units sold. In 2019, there were 2,900 units of Alfa Romeo cars sold in Switzerland, a decrease of roughly 14 percent in comparison with the previous year.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Hungary from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 3.6 percent to 9.1 percent.

The number of cars sold by Honda in Switzerland decreased between 2009 and 2019, from a peak of 8,300 units sold in 2009 to just over 4,000 units sold in 2019. The sale of Honda cars has been in decline since 2011, with the greatest decrease seen between 2015 and 2016, where sales fell by almost 2,000 units.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Slovakia from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 9.3 percent to 16.4 percent.

The number of cars sold by Hyundai in Switzerland fluctuated between 2009 and 2020. The sale of Hyundai cars rose continuously from 6,200 units sold in 2009 to a peak of 11,300 units sold in 2012. In 2020, there were 6,300 units of Hyundai cars sold in Switzerland, a decrease of roughly 33 percent in comparison with the previous year.

This statistic shows the proportion of energy derived from renewable sources in Finland from 2006 to 2015, as a percentage of gross final consumption. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources climbed from 7.3 percent to 15.2 percent.

As of May 31, some 33 percent of respondents in the United States who had lost income due to the pandemic stated that they are receiving financial support from their government. This statistic is based on the daily COVID-19 / coronavirus pandemic survey conducted by Statista.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Volvo in Norway between 2009 and 2020. Norwegian sales of Volvo cars experienced a net increase over the period, increasing from 7,400 units sold in 2009 to a peak of 12,000 units sold in 2013. In 2020, 9,300 Volvo cars were sold in Norway.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Tesla in Norway between 2009 and 2020. Norwegian sales of Tesla cars experienced net growth over the period, rising from zero sales in 2009 to a peak of almost 18,900 units sold in 2019. In 2020, there were 8,600 units of Tesla cars sold in Norway.

This statistic shows the results of a 2015 survey among adult Cubans living in Cuba regarding their satisfaction with the current economic system that exists in Cuba. 80 percent of respondents stated they are not too satisfied or not at all satisfied with the economic system that exists in Cuba today.

This statistic shows the proportion of electricity derived from renewable sources in Czechia from 2007 to 2018. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources in electricity generation climbed from 3.6 percent to 9.1 percent.

The statistic shows the proportion of electricity derived from renewable sources in Italy from 2007 to 2019. During this period the share of energy from renewable sources in electricity generation climbed from 14.3 percent to 22.2 percent.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Italy from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 22.8 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 1.3 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Poland from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 5.18 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) services industry in Romania from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the personnel costs in the ICT services industry amounted to 2.87 billion euros.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information and communication technology services sector in Ireland from 2009 to 2016. In 2016, the ICT services sector employed a total number of 87,849 people.

In the given time period, Facebook advertising cost-per-click ( CPC ) in North America decreased by over 20 percent, from 0.64 U.S. dollars in January 2020 to 0.48 U.S. dollars in March 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic.

Since 2000, the average weekly working hours in France have remained stable, with French employees working 36.5 hours a week. However, in the period between 2000 and 2005, the weekly working hours in France increased by almost two hours. In 2005, French employees worked on average 36.3 hours a week, compared to 35.9 hours in 2000.

This statistic presents the share of ATM machines that were not working ( broken ) or were out of order ( non-functional ) in selected European countries from 2005 to 2012. In 2012, 99.5 percent of ATMs in Europe were working, up from a share of 99 percent in 2011.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information and communication technology services sector in Poland from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the ICT services sector employed a total number of 234,849 people.
This statistic shows the annual turnover of the telecommunications industry in Spain from 2008 to 2014. In 2008, the telecommunications sector turnover amounted to approximately 40.1 billion euros.
This statistic shows the annual turnover of the telecommunications industry in Latvia from 2008 to 2014. In 2008, the telecommunications sector turnover amounted to approximately 882.3 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the telecommunications industry in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2014. In 2008, the telecommunications sector turnover amounted to approximately 18.9 billion euros.

This statistic displays the gross domestic expenditure on research and development ( GERD ) as a percentage of GDP in Belgium from 2000 to 2019. Over the period, the GERD share rose by a total of 0.61 percentage points. The GERD peaked in 2019, when gross expenditure on research and development made 1.69 percent of Belgium's GDP. In 2015, this ratio was 1.58 percent, much lower than in Austria but nevertheless, higher than in Italy.

This statistic shows the gross domestic expenditure on research and development ( GERD ) as a percentage of GDP in Estonia from 2000 to 2017. Over the period, the GERD share rose by a total of 0.58 percentage points. The peak was in 2009, when gross expenditure on research and development made 1.92 percent of Estonia's GDP. In 2015, this ratio was 1.58 percent, much lower than in Austria but nevertheless, higher than in Italy.

Over the period from 2005 to 2019, the gross domestic expenditure on research and development ( GERD ) share rose by a total of 0.62 percentage points. The GERD peaked in 2019, when gross expenditure on research and development made 1.69 percent of Finland's GDP. In 2015, this ratio was 1.6 percent, which was the highest ratio during the shown period.

This statistic presents the annual loss incurred due to automated teller machines - related physical attacks, with data from 2010 to 2019. According to the source, physical attacks on ATM machines were on the rise during this period, increasing from 33 million euros in 2010 to 49 million euros in 2016. Afterwards, the number of physical attacks on ATM machines decreased, reaching 21 million euros in 2019.

In the period from March 11 to 20, 2020, CEOs, sales managers and marketing managers of Swedish export companies were asked how they assess the business impact of the coronavirus in terms of exports from Sweden. 44 percent stated to see very negative impacts in the current situation, and 43 percent assessed it moderately negative for the next four weeks as well.
This statistic shows the innovation expenditure of the advertising industry in Germany from 2008 to 2021. In 2021, the German advertising industry spent roughly 493.5 million euros on innovation.

This statistic shows the final consumption expenditure of households in Germany on clothing as annual figures from 2005 to 2020. Since 2009, spending on clothing has increased overall, reaching approximately 53.1 billion euros in 2020.

This statistic depicts the share of U.S. home owners who planned home improvement projects in 2014, 2015 and 2016. The survey revealed that some 65 percent of home owners planned home improvement projects in 2016.

This statistic shows the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for the chief financial officers ( CFOs ), working on the permanent basis in the public and charity accounting and finance sector in London ( United Kingdom ) in 2015, listed for the size of the organization. In that time, chief financial officers working in small to medium enterprises earned between 50 thousand and 90 thousand British pounds ( GBP ) per annum on the London public finance & accounting market.

This statistic shows the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for the director in audit and assurance, working on the permanent basis in the public practice in London ( United Kingdom ) from 2014 to 2015. In 2014, directors in audit and assurance earned between 90 thousand and 110 thousand British pounds ( GBP ) per annum on the London public finance market.

This statistic shows the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for partners, working on a permanent basis, in the public practice in London ( United Kingdom ) in 2015, listed for the various branches of the public practice ( audit, assurance, tax, corporate finance ). In that time, partners in the public finance sector earned between 110 thousand and 200 thousand British pounds ( GBP ) per annum on the London public finance market.

This statistic illustrates the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for market risk management specialists, working on a permanent basis, in the banking and financial services sector in London ( United Kingdom ) as of 2018, listed by years of experience. The source states that salary ranges are approximate guides only and relate to base salaries ( excluding superannuation, bonuses, incentive schemes and stock options ). It can be seen that at that time, newly qualified specialists, with up to two years experience earned between 40 thousand and 60 thousand British pounds per annum, whereas highly qualified specialists with over ten years experience earned between 110 thousand and 150 thousand British pounds per year.

This statistic displays the volume of turnover made in the Spanish food, beverages and tobacco wholesale market in 2014, by sub-sector. That year, the total turnover of the food, beverages and tobacco wholesale market reached over 29.5 billion euros, with the greatest share of turnover coming from the sale of vegetables, at almost 29.8 billion euros.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on the product information search activities of distance selling users in Switzerland in 2013. During the survey period it was found that 35 percent of respondents stated that they had looked up a product description on a website.

This statistic illustrates the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for credit risk analysts both in banking and non-banking financial services sector, working on a permanent basis, in London ( United Kingdom ) as of 2018, listed for the level of qualification and years of experience. The source states that salary ranges are approximate guides only and relate to base salaries ( excluding superannuation, bonuses, incentive schemes and stock options ). It can be seen that at that time, newly qualified analysts with up to two years experience earned between 32 thousand and 45 thousand British pounds per annum, whereas highly qualified analysts with over ten year experience earned between 95 thousand and 125 thousand British pounds per year.
This chart represents the favorite fruits in France in 2017. It shows that 30 percent of respondents preferred the banana, followed by 29 percent who liked the cherry.

The monthly volume of issued credit cards by Russian banks reached 535.5 thousand in January 2020, marking a decrease compared to the previous month. The highest volume was recorded in December 2019 at 930.6 thousand.

In the period from March 11 to 20, 2020, CEOs, sales managers and marketing managers of Swedish export companies were asked how they assess the business impact of the coronavirus in terms of exports from Sweden. 45 percent stated to see very negative impacts in the next four weeks.

This statistic illustrates the minimum and maximum annual salary brackets for business change analysts, working on a permanent basis, in the commerce and industry sector in London ( United Kingdom ) as of 2018, listed for the level of qualification and years of experience. The source states that salary ranges are approximate guides only and relate to base salaries ( excluding superannuation, bonuses, incentive schemes and stock options ). It can be seen that at that time, newly qualified analysts with up to three years experience earned between 65 thousand and 80 thousand British pounds per annum, whereas highly qualified analysts with more than six years experience earned between 95 thousand and 115 thousand British pounds per year.

This statistic displays the share of individuals in the United Kingdom with metabolic conditions in 2018, by age and gender. In this year, 26 percent of individuals diagnosed with a metabolic condition were aged between 35 and 44 years old.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the telecommunications sector in Lithuania from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the telecommunications sector had a production value of approximately 675.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the telecommunications sector in Portugal from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the telecommunications sector had a production value of approximately 5.47 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the telecommunications sector in Denmark from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, personnel costs in the telecommunications sector amounted to 996.6 million euros.
This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the telecommunications sector in Spain from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, personnel costs in the telecommunications sector amounted to 4.66 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the telecommunications sector in France from 2009 to 2016. In 2016, personnel costs in the telecommunications sector amounted to approximately 11.36 billion euros.

This statistic illustrates respondents answers to a survey regarding mobile instant messages in Italy in 2014. It shows that 29 percent of respondents used mobile instant messages to inform people about health issues.
This statistic illustrates the frequency of contact with grandparents in Italy in 2014. Among respondents, 23 percent reported keeping in contact every 2 to 3 days.

The number of employees in the telecommunications industry in Belgium decreased by 552 employees since the previous year. As a result, the number of employees in Belgium saw its lowest number in 2019 with 21,852 employees. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018.

According to a survey carried out in Chile among company executives and directors, the main problem faced by businesses due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak in the country was the decrease in demand and sales. Up to 58 percent of the businesspeople surveyed pointed out that this was their companies'main problem in the face of the pandemic. Business activities were the second most mentioned problem, with 33 percent of respondents, while only three percent of the businesspeople interviewed said that workers compensation was the main problem faced by Chilean companies due to COVID-19.

This statistic shows the total volume of wine produced in Portugal from 2006 to 2018. In 2018, the total volume of wine produced in Portugal was expected to reach approximately 6.1 million hectoliters.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Estonia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the telecommunications sector employed 4,149 people.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Cyprus from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the telecommunications sector employed 3,599 people.
