This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Hungary from 2008 to 2018. In 2018, the telecommunications sector employed 19,495 people.
This statistic shows the total number of employees in the telecommunications sector in Sweden from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the telecommunications sector employed 26,564 people.

This statistic presents the results of a survey on how much influence people have over the quality and variety of local sporting facilities in England in 2014/15. People were asked to respond to the statement `` I have over the quality and variety of local sporting facilities ''. The majority of the respondents ( 83 percent ) said that they have no influence on the quality and variety of local sporting facilities.

This statistic shows the results of a survey question asking adults in England how much influence they have over the quality of their local environment. Of respondents, 73 percent said they have no influence, while 24 percent said they have a small amount of influence.

This statistic displays the lifestyle choices of individuals with a musculoskeletal condition in the United Kingdom in 2018. In this year, 79 percent of individuals with a musculoskeletal condition consumed alcohol.

This statistic shows the share of air passengers who bring a Wi-Fi enabled tablet onboard flights worldwide in 2015, by region. During the survey, 37 percent of the respondents from Latin America said that they take a Wi-Fi enabled tablet with them on flights.

The number of fatalities in transport accidents in France has decreased from 2011 to 2017 according to the type of transport. In 2017, more than 3,500 people died on the road, compared to almost 4,000 in 2011.

This statistic displays the share of individuals in the United Kingdom with a respiratory condition in 2018, by age. In this year, 26 percent of individuals diagnosed were aged between 45 and 54 years old.
This statistic shows the value of publishers'book copyright payments in France from 2009 to 2020. In 2020, the value of publishers'book copyright payments amounted to 482 million euros.

The turnover of the information sector in Spain increased by 533.5 million euros since the previous year. Therefore, the total turnover amounted to 17.8 billion euros in 2019. This increase was preceded by a declining turnover in this industry.
This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information sector in France from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the information sector turnover amounted to approximately 41.3 billion euros.
The turnover of the information sector in Austria increased by 171.6 million euros since the previous year. Therefore, the total turnover amounted to 4.7 billion euros in 2019.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2017. In 2017, the information sector turnover amounted to approximately 77.5 billion euros.

According to the survey conducted in 2020, more girls than boys participated in reading and writing activities, and more boys than girls participated in playing sports and games. In contrast, more girls than boys participated in drama and theatre activities.

This statistic shows the proportion of patent applicants in Finland from 1980 to 2013 that were female. Over this three decade period, the share of female Finnish inventors experienced an overall increase of 6.9 percentage points, peaking in 2013, when 10.7 percent of Finnish patent applications were from women.

This statistic illustrates the results of a survey about the reliability of information provided by media and other sources in France in 2015, by age group. The results of this survey show that the share of respondents aged 50 to 64 who considered radio a reliable source of information was ten points lower than among respondents aged 18 to 24.

This statistic represents SEAT's worldwide vehicle sales from the fiscal year of 2013 to the fiscal year of 2020. In the fiscal year of 2020, the Volkswagen Group sold some 476,000 vehicles under its SEAT brand.

The total value of wine production in France has fluctuated significantly from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the value of wine production was measured at 7.6 billion euros. The highest value was reached in 2011 at 9.2 billion euros, while the lowest was in 2017 at 6.9 billion euros. The data includes the production of table wine and juice wine.

This statistic presents the share of children aged 5 to 15 who recently participated in any sport in England, as of annual surveys conducted between 2008/09 and 2017/18. In the period 2013/14, around 90.7 percent of children aged 5 to 15 had participated in sports in the last 4 weeks. In 2017/18, the share had dropped to 85.8 percent.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Citroen in Sweden between 2009 and 2019. Swedish sales of Citroen cars fluctuated over this period, peaking at 6.4 thousand units sold in 2011. In 2019, there were 3.2 thousand units of Citroen cars sold in Sweden.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Mazda in Sweden between 2009 and 2019. Swedish sales of Mazda cars experienced a net increase over the period, increasing from 3,200 units sold in 2009 to a peak of 6,700 units sold in 2016. In 2019, there were 6,300 units of Mazda cars sold in Sweden.

This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Toyota in Sweden between 2009 and 2020. Swedish sales of Toyota cars fluctuated over this period, peaking at 23.1 thousand units sold in 2017. In 2020, there were 22.8 thousand units of Toyota cars sold in Sweden.

This statistic illustrates the distribution of preferences among first-time buyers for the type of property purchase in the United Kingdom ( UK ), listed for the first quarter of 2017 and the second quarter of 2017. The most popular option for first-time buyers in the UK was to purchase a house, as expressed by 49 percent of respondents in the second quarter of 2017. House purchase was followed by flats and maisonette ( 28 percent ), semi-detached ( 20 percent ) and terraced houses ( 18 percent ).

This statistic provides information on the usage frequency of Apple Pay according to consumers in the United States as of June 2017. During the survey period, 18 percent of Apple Pay users stated that they had tried to use the service but were unable to do so.

This statistic shows the value of the Christmas market in selected European countries in 2013 and 2014. In 2014, the Christmas market in Germany was worth an estimated 2.9 billion euros, making it the largest in Europe. The French market was worth nearly half as much, at approximately 1.2 billion euros.

This statistic shows the market share of chilled fruit juice as a proportion of all fruit juice consumed in the European Union ( EU ) from 2007 to 2018. In 2018, the market share of chilled fruit juice was approximately 11.6 percent.

This statistic shows the market share of fresh fruit juice as a proportion of all fruit juice consumed in the European Union ( EU ) from 2007 to 2018. In 2018, the market share of fresh fruit juice was approximately 11.6 percent.

This statistic presents the share of children who recently participated in sports in England, by age and activity. As per the survey conducted between April 2013 and March 2014, around 30 percent of the children aged between 11 and 15 had taken part in a sports activity in the last 4 weeks prior to the survey. Further information about sports in the United Kingdom can also be found in the Dossier : Sport in England - Public funding and participation.

The eSports industry has become an increasingly significant part of the entertainment sector in recent years. Players can compete against each other, individually or in teams, in a multiplayer video game tournaments across the world. In a survey conducted in May 2021, 15 percent of Hispanic respondents were avid fans of eSports in the United States.

The production value of the information sector in Belgium saw an addition of 172.2 million euros in 2019. Therefore, the total production value amounted to 5.0 billion euros in 2019. In general, the production value has been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information sector in the Czech Republic from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the information sector came to approximately two billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information sector in Estonia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the information sector came to approximately 255.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the net revenue from the manufacture of fruit and vegetable juice in Germany from 2009 to 2020. In 2020, the net revenue from fruit and vegetable juice manufacturing amounted to roughly 2.7 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information sector in Lithuania from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the information sector came to approximately 269.5 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information sector in Poland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the information sector came to approximately 6.85 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information sector in Portugal from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the information sector came to approximately 1.99 billion euros.
This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the information sector in France from 2009 to 2015. In 2015, the personnel costs in the information sector approximated 11.38 billion euros.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information sector in Estonia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the number of employees increased compared to the previous year, amounting to a total of 4,792 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information sector in Italy from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the number of employees decreased compared to the previous year, amounting to a total of 75,049 people.

The statistic presents the results of a survey conducted in January and February 2018 to find out about the situation of women and gender ( in ) equality across 27 countries. In Mexico, male respondents guessed that approximately 56 percent of the companies with home office practices were led by women. The source estimated that around six percent of companies in Mexico had female CEOs.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information sector in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the number of employees increased compared to the previous year, amounting to a total of 2,301 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information sector in Poland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the number of employees decreased compared to the previous year, amounting to a total of 52,098 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the information sector in Slovenia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the number of employees decreased compared to the previous year, amounting to a total of 3,749 people.

The statistic shows the number of companies operating on the insurance market in Switzerland from 2011 to 2019. The number of domestic insurance companies decreased steadily from 2011 to 2019, with a total of 39 companies operating on the domestic Swiss insurance market at the end of 2019.

The statistic shows the number of companies operating on the insurance market in Cyprus from 2011 to 2019. Throughout this period, the number of companies fluctuated, the highest values were in 2019, with 596 companies in the total market.

The statistic shows the number of companies operating on the insurance market in Slovenia from 2011 to 2019. The number of companies fluctuated throughout the years. There were 17 companies present on the Slovenian domestic insurance market at the end of 2019, a decrease compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the rating of individual features of royal parks in the United Kingdom ( UK ) by visitors in 2013 and 2014. The most highly rated features were the variety of wildlife and the opportunity to see animals in their natural environment, with 95 percent of respondents giving a high rating to these two aspects.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the crude oil and natural gas extraction industry in Bulgaria from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the extraction of crude oil and natural gas industry produced a turnover of approximately 29.3 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the crude petroleum and natural gas extraction sector in France from 2009 to 2014. In 2014, the crude oil and natural gas extraction sector produced personnel costs of approximately 24.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the crude petroleum and natural gas extraction sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the crude oil and natural gas extraction sector produced personnel costs of approximately 2.6 billion euros.

During the first week of lockdown imposed by the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Italy, the audience of the website of the Italian daily newspaper Il Sole 24 Ore increased by almost 260 percent compared to the first week. The website of the news channel Rai saw its audience grow by eight percent.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the mining of coal and lignite industry in Bulgaria from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the mining of coal and lignite industry employed in total approximately 11,316 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the crude petroleum and natural gas extraction sector in Lithuania from 2008 to 2018. In 2018, the crude petroleum and natural gas extraction sector employed in total approximately 141 people.
The statistic shows the share of global smartwatch unit shipments by vendor in 2016. Apple's share of smartwatch shipments worldwide stood at 49 percent in 2016.

The statistic illustrates the total amount of venture capital private equity investments in Europe from the first quarter of 2008 to the fourth quarter of 2014, broken down by quarter. Private equity is the OTC provision of equity capital through private or institutional investments with the participation of companies in another company for a limited time in order to generate financial benefits. It can be seen that total venture capital investments fluctuated overall during the period under observation, reaching a value of more than 2.2 billion euros as of the fourth quarter of 2014. The largest value of investments was found in the third quarter of 2014, when venture capital investments of almost 3.1 billion euros were recorded.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Nepal from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Nepal amounted to 1.88 children per woman.

This statistic shows the number of guest accommodation and B & Bs (bed and breakfast) sold in Northern Ireland from 2016 to 2017. The number of rooms in B & B accommodation increased from 376 thousand in 2016 to 418 thousand in 2017.
The statistic shows the market size of soft drinks in Vietnam from 2010 to 2014. In 2010, the Vietnamese soft drink market size was estimated at about 16.3 billion VND.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the manufacturing industry in Greece from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 45.4 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the manufacturing industry in Spain from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 441.5 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the manufacturing industry in Slovenia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual production value of the manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 23.19 billion euros.

The weekly revenue of the Norwegian book retailer Hyre was significantly lower in the period from March 11 to March 20, 2020 than it was during the corresponding week of 2019. Indeed, while in week 11 of 2019, the revenue amounted to roughly 473 million Norwegian kroner, in week 12 of 2020, it reached around 565 million Norwegian kroner. The coronavirus outbreak has led to a higher demand of books and reading materials among the Norwegian population, especially since the beginning of a nationwide lockdown in week March 16 of 2020.

This statistic shows the distribution of the pharmaceutical current R & D spending in Canada by region, in 2017 and 2019. In 2019, the current R & D spending in Ontario, Canada, totaled 51 percent of the total pharmaceutical current R & D spending in the country.

As of April 2021, the house price index in the United Kingdom ( UK ) increased in all areas of the country. The UK's largest city, London, saw the biggest year-on-year price growth, with the index increasing by 2.1 percent. The smallest growth was recorded in Aberdeen, with a decrease of 1.2 percent.

This statistic displays the Canadian pharmaceutical industry's trade balance from 2004 to 2020. In 2020, the trade balance for the industry was -10.1 billion Canadian dollars, an increase from the previous year. The pharmaceutical industry in Canada adds value to raw resources such as minerals, plants, and animals, by converting this material into drugs and pharmaceutical products.
This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacturing sector in Ireland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the manufacturing industry had personnel costs of approximately 10.25 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacturing sector in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the manufacturing industry had personnel costs of approximately 36.69 billion euros.

The personnel costs of the manufacturing industry in Austria increased by 1.2 billion euros since the previous year. Therefore, the personnel costs in Austria reached a peak in 2019 with 42.1 billion euros. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the personnel costs in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.
This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacturing sector in Sweden from 2008 to 2014. In 2014, the manufacturing industry had personnel costs of approximately 35.4 billion euros.

This statistic shows the age distribution of Nepal from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 28.9 percent of the Nepalese population fell into the 0-14 year category, 64.5 percent into the 15-64 age group and 5.4 percent were over 65 years of age.

This statistic displays the total volume of Scotch whisky produced per annum from 2000 to 2015. The largest volume of Scotch whisky produced was in 2008 with a total production of 524 million litres of whisky. Since then the total volume of whisky produced has declined.

This statistic illustrates the penetration photo sharing as a communication method among various demographic groups in Italy in 2014. Thirteen percent of males reported using this method to contact family or friends.

This statistic shows the opinion of the French on the need for stricter containment measures to fight against the coronavirus epidemic ( COVID-19 ) in France as of February 9, 2020. According to Ipsos, 53 percent of the respondents supported the introduction of more restrictive measures.

This statistic illustrates the usage of free media content and services in Italy in 2014. During the survey period, it was found that 25 percent of respondents stated they had used free on-demand video content in the past month.

The share of Swedes using the internet on a daily basis was the highest among the 25-to-34-year-olds in 2020, with 100 percent of men and women in this age group reported to be daily internet users. The age group with the smallest share of daily internet users were the 75-to-85-year-olds, with 72 percent of men and 63 percent of women in this age group.

This statistic shows the share of individuals who have never used the internet in Sweden in 2020, by gender and age group. During the survey period, 23 percent of the total population stated that they had never used the internet. The group with highest share of individuals who have never used the internet was the 75 to 85 year olds with 19 percent of them.

The production value of the food product manufacturing industry in Austria saw no significant changes in 2020 in comparison to the previous year 2019. Still, the production value reached its highest value in the observed period in 2020.

This statistic displays the duty applied to table wine in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2009 to 2015. The duty added has gradually increased since 2009. In 2015, the duty applied to table wine was 21.93 British pounds per hectoliter.

The production value of the food product manufacturing industry in Switzerland decreased by 1.1 billion euros since the previous year. Therefore, the production value declined to 29.1 billion euros in 2018. In general, the production value has been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

In 2020, Volvo was the most popular car brand in Sweden. During that year, over 18 thousand passenger cars were sold, which was a decrease of more than 20 percent compared to the previous year. Another car brand, which also experienced a decline in sales demand from 2019 to 2020, was Volkswagen with nearly 12 thousand sold units.

The number of employees in the food product manufacturing industry in Denmark decreased to 53,086 employees since the previous year. This means a decline by 845 employees in 2019. This decrease was preceded by an increasing number of employees in this industry. In general, the number of employees has been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

This statistic shows the percentage change in the number of passenger cars sold in Sweden between 2009 and 2020. The sale of passenger cars in Sweden decreased by 23.2 percent in 2020 compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the food product manufacturing sector of Croatia from the years 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the Croatian food product manufacturing sector employed a total number of 52,477 people.

According to a 2019 survey, the most used IT solutions to work remotely in Mexico were accessing the internet from any device and using cloud storage. Data visualization was also one of the most popular solutions to work outside of the office, with 45 percent of respondents stating to use it.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the food product manufacturing sector of Cyprus from the years 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the Cypriot food product manufacturing sector employed a total number of 10,619 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the food product manufacturing sector of Latvia from the years 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the Latvian food product manufacturing sector employed a total number of 21,076 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the food product manufacturing sector of Lithuania from the years 2008 to 2015. In Lithuania the number of employees in the food product manufacturing sector came to a total of 39,539 people in 2015.

In 2019, the number of employees in the food product manufacturing industry in Poland increased by 4,865 employees since 2018. Therefore, the number of employees in Poland reached a peak in 2019 with 422,906 employees. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2017.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the food product manufacturing sector of Portugal from the years 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the Portuguese food product manufacturing sector employed a total number of 88,076 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the manufacturing industry of chemicals and chemical products in Spain between the years 2008 to 2018. In 2018, the Spanish chemical manufacturing sector employed a total number of 92,834 people.

The Tate Modern was the most visited free attraction in North East England in 2020, welcoming roughly 94 thousand visitors. The number of visitors to this renowned art gallery decreased by roughly 60 percent over the previous year due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Other two London-based free attractions - the Natural History Museum and the British Museum - followed in the ranking that year.

This statistic shows the countries with the most expensive passports worldwide as of April 2015. The most expensive passport in the world was the German passport with an estimated cost of 251 U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the annual production value for the manufacture of chemicals and chemical products in Bulgaria from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the Bulgarian annual production value of the chemical manufacturing industry amounted to approximately 1.35 billion euros.

The Royal Botanic Gardens and Kew Gardens were the most visited paid tourist attractions in London in 2020, welcoming around 1.2 million visitors. The number of visitors to these renowned gardens decreased by roughly 75 percent over the previous year due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Other well-visited paid tourist attractions in London were the London Zoo and the Tower of London.

As of February 28, 2022, the number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in the Americas amounted to over 1.47 million. Meanwhile, the number of confirmed COVID-19 deaths in the region reached more than 473 thousand. In Europe, there were over 176 million confirmed cases and 6.6 thousand deaths.

According to a survey from April 2020, the level of worry about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak varied among the Finnish people according to their age group. The highest share of respondents aged 25 to 34 years ( 44 percent ) were not at all worried, whereas the largest share of people aged 65 to 79 years ( 25 percent ) were very worried. The first COVID-19 case in Finland was confirmed on January 29, 2020. For further information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

This statistic displays the net ingredient cost of prescription items dispensed in England in 2020, by therapeutic classification. In this year the total net ingredient cost of items dispensed for the treatment of hypertension was approximately 1.7 billion British pounds.

The statistic shows the leading paid attractions in South West England in 2019 and 2020. The Abbey Gardens and Abbey Ruins was the most visited paid attraction in the region in 2019, welcoming roughly one million visitors. In 2020, the number of visitors decreased by roughly 20 percent to around 1.5 million.

This statistic displays results of a survey conducted among mobile internet users in France in 2014. It shows that over 80 percent of respondents did not pay any extra fees to access 4G on their mobile internet connection.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises operating in Slovakia's manufacturing sector of rubber and plastic products from 2008 to 2018. In 2017, there were 1,639 enterprises manufacturing rubber and plastic products in Slovakia.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) sector in the Czech Republic from 2009 to 2016. In 2016, the Czech information and communication technology sector had a production value of approximately 21.62 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) sector in Estonia from 2008 to 2017. In 2017, the Estonian information and communication technology sector had a production value of approximately 3.07 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) sector in Greece from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the Greek information and communication technology sector had a production value of approximately 7.34 billion euros.

This statistic displays the change in daily smoking rates in selected European countries between 2000 and 2013. In the United Kingdom ( UK ), the daily smoking rate decreased by 14 percent. In the Netherlands, the daily smoking rate decreased by 31 percent.

This statistic displays the rate of immunization coverage against selected infectious diseases in Europe in 2013. In this year, 98 percent of children in Germany were immunized against diphtheria, tetanus and pertussis.

This statistic displays reasons consumers in Italy purchased new audio or Hi-fi systems as of April 2014. The leading reason for purchase was `` existing product had broken '', at 15 percent of respondents.

American Football is one of the most popular sports in the United States, enjoyed by thousands of people live in the stadiums and millions more back home. A January 2020 survey showed that 24 percent of respondents aged 18 to 29 very much enjoyed watching American Football on TV.

This statistic displays reasons consumers in Italy purchased new games console as of April 2014. The leading reason for purchase was `` wanted better performance, '' at 22 percent of respondents, followed by `` wanted a larger game library, '' at 20 percent.

This statistic illustrates the penetration of entertainment or service usage content among the Italian population as of 2014. During the survey period, it was found that over half of respondents reported using apps for personal use.

The chart shows the annual production value of the information and communication technology ( ICT ) sector in Portugal in 2008. That year, the Portuguese information and communication technology sector had a production value of approximately 14.3 billion euros.

This statistic illustrates the activities which mobile phone, tablet and computer users carried out using their devices in Italy in 2014. Browsing the internet, checking emails and using search engines were activities shared by more than 80 percent of respondents.

This statistic displays the average number of electronic products and devices in working order in households in Italy in 2014. On average, Italian households had two working laptops, two cooking appliances and two TVs.

This statistic shows the percentage of households using every day devices in Spain in 2014. Mobile phones, TVs and laptops were amongst those devices most commonly used with over 90 percent of respondents stating that they used them every day.

This statistic shows the average amount spent on various electronic products and appliances in Spain in the three months prior to the survey ( April, May and June 2014 ). Spanish consumers spent an average of 595 euros on their television in the three months prior to survey.

The statistic shows the value of sustainability themed socially responsible investments ( SRIs ) in Spain biannually from 2011 to 2017. Investments in assets related to sustainability amounted to approximately 1.3 billion euros in 2013 and grew to nearly 12.7 billion euros in 2017.

The statistic shows the value of best-in-class investment strategy on European biannually from 2005 to 2017. Investments in companies, that were leaders in their respective industries, amounted to approximately 159 billion euros in 2010 and grew to nearly 584 billion euros in 2017.

The statistic shows the value of best-in-class investment strategy on German ethical funds market from 2011 to 2017. Investments in companies, that were leaders in meeting environmental, social and governance development criteria, amounted to approximately 13.3 billion euros in 2013, and grew to nearly 22.1 billion euros in 2017.

The production volume of petrochemicals across India at the end of fiscal year 2018 was almost 37 million metric tons. There was a constant increase in the production volume of petrochemicals since fiscal year 2015.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of tobacco products in Denmark from 2010 to 2016. In 2015, the production value of the tobacco manufacturing sector in Denmark came to approximately 1.28 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the tobacco products manufacturing sector in France from 2009 to 2018. In 2018, the personnel costs of the manufacture of tobacco products approximated 198.8 million euros.

The statistic shows the ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Nepal from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, government expenditure in Nepal amounted to about 27.43 percent of the country's gross domestic product.

The number of employees in the tobacco product manufacturing industry in Bulgaria decreased by 171 employees in 2019 in comparison to the previous year. Therefore, the number of employees in Bulgaria saw its lowest number in that year with 1,395 employees. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the tobacco products manufacturing sector in France from 2008 to 2010. In 2010, the tobacco products manufacturing sector employed a total number of 1,837 people.

The statistic shows the development of engagement and voting investment strategy in Europe biannually from 2005 to 2017. The value of assets subject to engagement and voting strategies grew exponentially during this period, from approximately 851 million euros in 2005 to over 4.8 billion euros in 2017.

In 2020, approximately 3.4 billion British pounds worth of sugar confectionery was imported into the United Kingdom from countries within the European Union. The equivalent data on the value of sugar confectionery exports from the United Kingdom split by European Union and non European Union trade is available at the following.

This statistic shows the results of a survey asking customers of the Taiwanese food delivery company, Fyomi, which of the company's new customer-focused policies they believe are the most beneficial. During the survey, 37 percent of the respondents said that the most beneficial policy was the free delivery on orders carried by small children and the elderly.

This statistic shows the school policy on holidays during school term out of school time in the United Kingdom in 2014. Of respondents, 45 percent said that their school policy on holidays during school term out of school time was to be on the same as the school holidays in the calendar year.
This statistic shows the impact of free Wi-Fi access on holiday booking decisions. 42 percent of respondents reported that free Wi-Fi access had an impact on their holiday booking decisions.
More than 50 percent of respondents were of the opinion that the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) originated in the laboratory. Only 14 percent stated that the virus was transmitted from animals to humans.

The production value of the textile manufacturing industry in Bulgaria decreased by 27.2 million euros since the previous year. Therefore, the production value declined to 484.9 million euros in 2020. This decrease was preceded by an increasing production value in this industry. In general, the production value has been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the textile manufacturing sector in Latvia from 2008 to 2016. In 2015, the production value of the Latvian textile manufacturing sector amounted to approximately 99.2 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the textile manufacturing sector in Hungary from 2008 to 2016. In 2015, the production value of the Hungarian textile manufacturing sector amounted to approximately 422.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the value of liquorice imported into the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2004 to 2020, split between European Union and non-European Union trade. Imports of liquorice from the EU peaked in 2016, when they valued at 4.1 million British pounds. For the equivalent data on the value of liquorice exports from the United Kingdom split by EU and non-EU trade, please see the following.

This statistic shows the results of a survey among Americans regarding their personal acceptance of divorce. The survey was conducted in 2014. During this survey, 30 percent of respondents stated that they think divorce is sometimes acceptable, while 15 percent stated it is not at all acceptable.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the textile manufacturing sector in Ireland from the years 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the textile manufacturing sector employed a total number of 1,719 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the textile manufacturing sector in Latvia from the years 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the textile manufacturing sector employed a total number of 2,673 people.

The statistic shows the size of sustainable and responsible investments ( SRI ) market in Sweden in 2013, 2015 and 2017, ranked by investment strategies. In 2017, the exclusions strategy was the dominant responsible investment strategy in Sweden. It amounted to approximately 710.3 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover from the manufacture of rubber products in Slovakia from 2008 to 2016. In 2015, the turnover of the manufacture of rubber products amounted to approximately 1.87 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover from the manufacture of rubber products in Finland from 2008 to 2016. In 2015, the turnover of the manufacture of rubber products amounted to approximately 963.8 million euros.

American Football is one of the most popular sports in the United States, enjoyed by thousands of people live in the stadiums and millions more back home. The highest league in the land is the NFL, which consists of 32 teams divided equally into two conferences. At the end of the season, the two best-performing teams compete for the ultimate prize at the Super Bowl. A January 2020 survey showed that 18 percent of male respondents very much preferred watching college football to NFL on TV.

The statistic shows the deaths & injuries from terrorist attacks worldwide from 2000 to 2013, by organization. During this period of time, the 'Taliban'perpetrated around 8,000 attacks resulting in 9,000 deaths and 9,000 injuries.

In 2020, approximately one million British pounds worth of boiled sweets were imported into the United Kingdom from countries within the European Union. The equivalent data on the value of boiled sweet exports from the United Kingdom split by European Union and non European Union trade is available at the following.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the rubber products manufacturing sector in Ireland from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of the rubber products manufacturing sector in Ireland amounted to approximately 89.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the rubber products manufacturing sector in Hungary from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of the rubber products manufacturing sector in Hungary amounted to approximately 1.87 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the rubber products manufacturing sector in Poland from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of the rubber products manufacturing sector in Poland amounted to approximately 4.24 billion euros.

The chart shows the progression of the global unit sales of virtual reality input systems from 2015 to 2018. In 2015, the total sales amounted to 42,000 units, with Early Majority TT-7 leading the market with 20,000 units. The chart indicates a steady increase in sales for all categories over the years. By 2018, the market reached its peak with a total of 56,000 units across all virtual reality input systems. This significant growth can be attributed to the advancements in technology and increased adoption by industries such as healthcare, entertainment, and education.

This statistic shows the development of assets under management of exchange traded funds ( ETFs ) on the Deutsche Brse in Germany from 2002 to 2013 ( as of May ). In 2012, the total value of assets of ETFs managed on the market-leading stock exchange in Europe reached 205.7 billion euros.

This bar chart depicts the perceived advantages of driverless cars in the United Kingdom in November 2014. The greatest perceived advantage was an increased safety on roads, with 18 percent of respondents believing that driverless cars would be safer than cars driven by humans.

This statistic illustrates the frequency of mobile instant messages being exchanged between household members in Spain in 2014. A majority of 53 percent of respondents stated that mobile instant messages were sent every day within their household.

This statistic illustrates how often people in Spain watched television or a movie as a household in 2014. Almost half of the respondents stated that they did it on a daily basis, whereas five percent never watched television or a movie with their household members.

In March 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic and the closure of many physical shops in Poland, online sales of household goods have increased compared to February. The most significant increase in sales occurred in interior and furniture stores.

This statistic shows the most popular domestic location types for multi-generational travel in the United States as of February 2015. During the survey, 27 percent of respondents said they chose to take their multi-generational trips in the city.

This statistic shows the share of the total votes received by each party in the UK general election of May 7, 2015 in England. The Conservative party had gained the greatest share of the votes in England, with 41.1 percent of all votes for the party under leadership of David Cameron.

This statistic illustrates the growth in the asset value of social and solidarity funds on the European responsible investing ( RI ) market from December 2010 to December 2016. It can be seen that the total value of assets of social and solidarity funds on the European responsible investing ( RI ) market fluctuated overall during the period under observation, reaching a value of 1.9 billion euros as of December 2016.

Levels of concern about energy prices in the United Kingdom have risen since 2012, with approximately 50 percent of consumers being fairly concerned in 2021. In comparison, only 22 percent of consumers were not concerned about energy prices in 2012.

This statistic displays the percentage of daily added sugar that is derived from alcohol in the diet of individuals in England from 2008 to 2012, by age. In this four year period, 19 percent of added sugar in the diet of individuals aged between 19 and 64 years came from alcohol.

A 2021 survey conducted by the UK Department for Business Energy & Industrial Strategy ( BEIS ) found that 73 percent of UK's residents worry about their energy bills over the winter, with 31 percent of respondents reporting to be very worried.

This statistic shows the estimated value of microloans distributed by microfinance institutions ( MFIs ) in Central and Eastern Europe from 2012 to 2017, divided by the countries involved. In 2017, approximately 12.2 million euros worth of microloans were supplied to businesses and individuals in Hungary.

Building societies, unlike banks are not listed on the stock market and thus, don't have external shareholders. Instead, the `` owners '' and decision makers in building societies are mortgage borrowers, savers and current account holders. Building societies offer many traditional banking products and financial services such as mortgage lending, savings and current accounts.

This statistic shows the number of overnight stays from the U.S. to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013, by age group. There were 4.3 million overnight stays made by tourists between 45 and 54 years of age.

Due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, many retail businesses were forced to close their doors to customers for several weeks. This statistic shows the number of active physicians in the United States as of March 2020, based on specialty and gender. There were over 70,000 male physicians specializing in pain medicine and pain management and over 40,000 female physicians specializing in pain medicine and pain management.

Out of 361 COVID-19 patients in Ukraine as of February 10, 2021, nearly 40 percent were aged between 50 and 69 years old. The average age of those infected with COVID-19 in the country was approximately 30 years.
In 2019, there were over 48,000 active physicians with an MD or a PhD in the United States. This statistic shows the number of active physicians in the U.S. in 2019, by specialty.

This statistic shows the consumption of ice cream per capita in Canada from 2004 to 2016. Ice cream consumption in Canada amounted to approximately 4.71 liters per capita in 2016, down from 4.69 liters the previous year.
This statistic shows the age structure in Uruguay from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 20.23 percent of Uruguay's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Uruguay from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups ; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Uruguayan population was 35.7 years.

This line graph displays how many million euros were spent per year on road network maintenance in Bulgaria between 2005 and 2016. The highest road infrastructure maintenance expenditure within the time period shown was observed in 2007. A total of approximately 92 million euros was spent on road maintenance in 2016.

This line graph displays how many million euros were spent annually on road network maintenance in Iceland between 2004 and 2016. The highest road infrastructure maintenance expenditure within this time period was observed in 2008. A total of 36.5 million euros was spent on road maintenance in Iceland in 2016.

This statistic shows the share of consumers who make an effort to buy locally grown food in Canada as of May 2015, by age group. During the survey, 35 percent of the respondents aged between 35 and 54 years said they strongly agreed that they make an effort to buy locally grown and produced food.

This statistic shows the share of consumers who think selected organizations are doing a good job with food quality and safety in Canada as of May 2015. During the survey, 93 percent of the respondents said they thought farmers markets were doing a good job with food quality and safety.

This statistic illustrates the total amount spent annually on maintenance of the road network infrastructure in the Slovak Republic from 2004 to 2017, in million euros. In the period of consideration, maintenance expenditure presented a trend of growth. In 2017, maintenance expenditure reached its peak, amounting to approximately 227 million euros. The lowest expenditure on maintenance was recorded in 2004, at a total of roughly 82 million euros.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Bolivia from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment rate in Bolivia was at approximately 5.61 percent.

The New York State Department of Health has been tracking coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) cases in hospitals since March 1, 2020. As of June 21, there have been 89,296 hospitalizations due to COVID-19 in the state. The first hospitalization occurred at the start of the pandemic in early March.

This statistic depicts the year-on-year percentage change in sales turnover of shops selling footwear in the Netherlands from 2007 to 2017. Turnover from Dutch footwear store sales ( value ) decreased by 2.1 percent in 2017.

This statistic illustrates the total amount spent annually on inland waterway infrastructure maintenance in Lithuania from 2004 to 2017, in million euros. In the period of consideration, inland waterway maintenance expenditure oscillated. In 2017, expenditure amounted to approximately two million euros. The largest amount of money spent on inland waterway maintenance was recorded in 2008, at a total of roughly 2.6 million euros.

The statistic displays the annual turnover of the wholesale trade for beverages in the Netherlands from 2009 to 2013. In 2013, the wholesale of beverages generated revenues of approximately 6.7 billion euros.

This statistic displays the annual turnover of the wholesale trade for medical goods in the Netherlands from 2009 to 2013. In 2013 the wholesale of medical goods generated revenues of approximately 26 billion euros.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Serbia from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment rate in Serbia was at approximately 9.11 percent.
This statistic shows the total population of Angola from 2016 to 2026. In 2018, the total population of Angola amounted to approximately 29.39 million inhabitants.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Angola from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. Gross domestic product ( GDP ) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2020, Angola's gross domestic product amounted to around 62.44 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the national debt of Angola from 2016 to 2020 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2020, the national debt of Angola amounted to approximately 135.21 percent of the GDP.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the administrative and support service activities industry in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the administrative and support service activities industry produced a turnover of approximately 3.3 billion euros.

This statistic depicts alliances formed involving U.S. and/or European biotechnology companies with large-up-front payments in the United States and/or Europe, as of 2020. During this time, U.S. company Genentech and/or its alliance with Swiss company Roche reported large up-front payments totaling some 792 million U.S. dollars.

In 2020, the value of green finance investments by BBBVA bank in Spain reached approximately 10.8 billion euros. This was a decrease in comparison to the previous year and the largest value of investments in the different areas of green finance. Social infrastructures and businesses, and financial inclusion and entrepreneurship represented the other two areas in which BBBVA bank invested in green finance. The value of investments in these areas reached approximately 2.7 and 2.3 billion euros respectively in 2020.

This statistic presents information on the benefits of digital learning according to U.S. middle school students in blended learning environments as of December 2014. During the survey period, it was found that 62 percent of respondents stated that digital learning enabled them to learn at their own pace.

This statistic displays the proportion of the total public drug program expenditures for non-seniors in Canada by broad drug classes as of 2020. During this year, 11.4 percent of total drug program spending for non-seniors was dedicated to antirheumatic and immunosuppressant drugs.
This statistic shows the most important import partners for Algeria in 2019. In 2019, the most important import partner for Algeria was China with a share of 18 percent in all imports.
This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Armenia in 2019. In 2019, the most important export partner of Armenia was Russia, with a share of 22 percent in exports.

This statistic displays the number of people employed in the insurance market in Denmark from 2004 to 2019. The number of people employed fluctuated throughout the time. A total of 14,267 people were employed in Danish insurance companies in 2019.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the information and communication industry in Malta from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the information and communication industry produced a turnover of approximately 1.57 billion euros.
This statistic shows the age structure in Georgia from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 20.23 percent of Georgia's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

This statistic shows the median number of weeks of unemployment for people who became unemployed employed in the U.S. from 2007 to 2014. In 2014, it took 7.6 weeks on average for people to find a new job after they had been unemployed.

This statistic displays the number of people employed in the Dutch insurance market from 2004 to 2019. The number of employees decreased year-on-year throughout the period. In 2019, there were approximately 40,000 employees working in insurance companies in the Netherlands, an increase from the previous year.

This statistic displays the number of people employed in the Turkish insurance market from 2004 to 2019. The number of people employed fluctuated throughout the time. In 2019, there were 19,521 people employed in Turkish insurance companies, a decrease from the previous year.

On February 10, 2022, there were 1,979 new cases of COVID-19 in New York City. The state of New York has been one of the hardest hit U.S. states by the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic shows the number of new COVID-19 cases in New York City from March 8, 2020 to February 10, 2022, by diagnosis date.

In 2019, the production value of the information and communication industry in Bulgaria increased by 833.5 million euros since 2018. With 6.4 billion euros, the production value thereby reached its highest value in the observed period. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.

In 2019, the production value of the information and communication industry in Switzerland increased by 4.1 billion euros since 2018. Therefore, the production value in Switzerland reached a peak in 2019 with 54.2 billion euros. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry has been, with the exception of 2013, continuously increasing over the last years.

This statistic illustrates the market share of life premiums distribution channels in Luxembourg from 2012 to 2017. In 2017, the leading distribution channel was agents, accounting for approximately 32.5 percent of total life insurance sales.

This statistic shows the share of households with children that own pets in Canada in 2013, by age of child. Among the households with children aged between three and five years, 48 percent owned a pet.

This statistic illustrates the market share of life premiums distribution channels in Slovenia from 2012 to 2017. In 2017, the leading distribution channel was agents, accounting for 72.2 percent of total life insurance sales.

This statistic illustrates the market share of non-life premiums distribution channels in Belgium from 2012 to 2016. In 2016, direct writing dominated the market with 60.7 percent of non-life insurance policies being distributed directly by insurance companies.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Guatemala from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Guatemala amounted to 2.85 children per woman.

The number of cashless transactions in Europe increased steadily from 2005 to 2020. By 2020, the number of cashless transactions in Europe reached approximately 177.7 billion, up from 71.6 billion in 2005.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the accommodation and food service activities industry in Malta from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the accommodation and food service industry employed a total number of 17,521 people.

This statistic displays how often adults in the United Kingdom consume an alcoholic beverage containing alcohol. In 2018, 21 percent of respondents said they consume an alcoholic drink containing alcohol 2 to 3 times a week.

On February 10, 2022, there were 17 deaths due to COVID-19 in New York City. The state of New York has been one of the hardest hit U.S. states by the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic shows the number of new COVID-19 deaths in New York City from March 3, 2020 to February 10, 2022, by date.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in Lithuania from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the industry employed 17,098 people. By 2018, the number of employees had remained relatively stable at 18,038 people. In that same year, the total number of employees in the Lithuanian construction industry amounted to approximately 82.7 thousand people.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in the Netherlands from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the industry employed 51,856 people. By 2018, the number of employees had decreased to 50,834 people. In that same year, the total number of employees in the Dutch construction industry amounted to approximately 363.7 thousand people.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in Austria from 2010 to 2019 varied over time. In 2015, the industry employed 31,908 people. By 2019, the number of employees had increased to 35,193 people. In that same year, the total number of employees in the Austrian construction industry amounted to approximately 190.5 thousand people.

The number of employees working in the civil engineering industry in Malta from 2009 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the industry employed 834 people. By 2018, the number of employees had grown to 892 people. In that same year, the total number of employees in the Maltese construction industry amounted to approximately 4.7 thousand people.

This statistic displays the reasons why individuals sometimes drink alcohol in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. Of respondents, 72 percent drink alcohol to celebrate special events such as weddings, birthdays or anniversaries.

In 2019, the personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in Germany increased by 1.1 billion euros since 2018. Therefore, the personnel costs in Germany reached a peak in 2019 with 13.3 billion euros. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the personnel costs in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.

The annual personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in Spain from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the civil engineering industry had personnel costs of approximately 4.68 billion euros. By 2018, the personnel costs had decreased to around 4.39 billion euros. In that same year, the total personnel costs of the Spanish construction industry amounted to approximately 33.9 billion euros.

The annual personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in France from 2010 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the civil engineering industry had personnel costs of approximately 8.8 billion euros. By 2018, the personnel costs had risen to around 10.7 billion euros. In that same year, the total personnel costs of the French construction industry amounted to approximately 161.7 billion euros.
This statistic shows the number of business media titles in Canada from 2001 to 2012. In 2012, there were 785 business media titles in Canada, the same as in the previous year.
This statistic displays how often adults in the United Kingdom get drunk when they consume alcohol. In 2014, almost half of respondents said they never get drunk when they consume alcohol.

The COVID-19 case rate in New York City reached almost 30,000 per 100,000 people as of February 13, 2022. The highest case rate was among those aged 18 to 24 years, which was around 33,000 per 100,000 people.

The annual personnel costs of the civil engineering industry in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2018 varied over time. In 2015, the civil engineering industry had personnel costs of approximately 219.9 million euros. By 2018, the personnel costs had risen to around 233.6 million euros. In that same year, the total personnel costs of the Luxembourg construction industry amounted to approximately 1.1 billion euros.
This statistic displays the number of employees working in the publishing activities industry in Portugal from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the publishing activities industry employed 9,539 people.

This statistic displays the results of a survey of individuals in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015, regarding their agreement with the statement, `` I tend to moderate my drinking so that I am not drinking for your health ''. Eight percent of respondents reported they strongly disagreed with the statement.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the wholesale and retail trade including the repair of motor vehicles and motorcycles industry in Malta from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the wholesale and retail trade industry produced a turnover of approximately 7.6 billion euros.

The total greenhouse gas emissions of the British Barclays Group have decreased considerably from 2015 to 2020. In 2015, the emissions of the group amounted to 467.4 thousand tons, but by 2020, this figure had dropped to 196.4 thousand tons - an impressive reduction of more than three quarters.

The number of enterprises in the publishing activities industry in Germany decreased by 545 enterprises in 2019 in comparison to the previous year. Therefore, the number of enterprises declined to 7,719 enterprises in 2019. This decrease was preceded by an increasing number of enterprises in this industry.
This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the publishing activities industry in Estonia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, there were 401 enterprises in the publishing activities industry.

The production value of the publishing activities industry in Belgium decreased by 593.5 million euros since the previous year. As a result, the production value in Belgium saw its lowest number in 2019 with 2.2 billion euros. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018.

This statistic shows the number of Metro, Inc. properties in Canada in 2021, by type. That year, the Canadian based grocery retailer Metro, Inc. operated 648 drugstores and 232 discount stores in Ontario and Qubec.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the publishing activities industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the publishing activities industry had a production value of approximately 28.25 billion euros.

The online retail trade in Hungary grew significantly compared to March 2019 due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. The highest increase was recorded in the food and grocery category, with a growth of 56 percent. At the same time, the online retail trade in the clothing and footwear category decreased by 33 percent.

This statistic illustrates the share of the gross domestic product ( GDP ) spent on all modes of inland transport infrastructure in Belgium from 2004 to 2017. In the period under consideration, this expenditure oscillated. In 2016 and 2017, share of GDP spent on inland transport infrastructure amounted to 0.7 percent. The highest share was recorded in 2009 at 0.9 percent.

The statistic presents the weekly time spent listening to music from selected sources by consumers in the United States as of July 2018, sorted by age group. According to the source, respondents aged 16 to 19 spent 60 percent of their weekly time listening to music via on-demand streaming.
The statistic shows the leading music genres according to consumers in the United States as of May 2018. During the survey, 55 percent of respondents stated that they preferred rock music.

In 2019, the production value of the transportation and storage industry in Denmark increased by 1.2 billion euros since 2018. Therefore, the production value in Denmark reached a peak in 2019 with 61.8 billion euros. The recent development could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2018. Notably, the production value in this industry has been, with the exception of 2016, continuously increasing over the last years.
This statistic shows the number of feed cattle produced in Canada from 2011 to 2020, by region. In 2020, around 2,097,000 feed cattle were produced in Alberta.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the transportation and storage industry in Latvia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the transportation and storage industry had a production value of approximately 4.18 billion euros.

This statistic shows the travel information sources that residents of Turkey considered to be the most important when making holiday plans in 2015. Based on figures from the European Commission, recommendations of friends, colleagues or relatives were the most considered sources for 52 percent of respondents, while 6 percent contacted travel agencies or tourism offices.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the transportation and storage industry in Norway from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the transportation and storage industry had a production value of approximately 47.1 billion euros.

This survey shows the percentage of Canadians over the age of 65 years that had written down their wishes for end-of-life medical treatment in 2017, by province. Some 81 percent of older citizens living in Saskatchewan had their wishes for medical treatment documented.

This survey shows the percentage of Canadians over the age of 65 years that had been told by a health professional that they had a limited life expectancy of five years or less as of 2011. Some 6.5 percent of those surveyed had been told they had other restrictions that would limit their life expectancy.

As of March 3, 2022, the number of active coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) infections in France was over 22.7 million. Since the start of the pandemic, the number of deaths due to this virus was over 1.6 million.

During a March 2020 survey of media buyers and planners in the United States, gauging the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on short term advertising strategies, 44 percent of respondents said they were planning to increase their emphasis on cause-related marketing efforts, and 36 percent said the same about brand equity. On the other hand 48 percent were going to step away from performance marketing for the time being. All in all, 63 percent of responding marketers said they were going to make changes to their messaging strategies between March and June 2020.

This statistic displays the number of enterprises in the transportation and storage industry in Lithuania from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, there were 12,301 enterprises in the transportation and storage industry.

This statistic shows the holiday type habits of residents of Bulgaria in 2015. 55 percent of respondents traveled on holiday for a duration between 4 and 13 consecutive nights. 57 percent of Bulgarian holidaymakers went on short-stay trips of up to 3 consecutive nights away from home.
This statistic shows the holiday type habits of residents of Turkey in 2015. Over half of respondents ( 61 percent ) took trips of up to 3 consecutive nights away from home.

This statistic displays the number of enterprises in the transportation and storage industry in Norway from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, there were 21,067 enterprises in the transportation and storage industry.

This statistic displays the number of enterprises in the transportation and storage industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, there were 88,907 enterprises in the transportation and storage industry.

This statistic displays the prevalence of individuals treated for problem alcohol use in Ireland from 2009 to 2013. In 2013, there were approximately 235.7 individuals per 100,000 population receiving treatment for problem alcohol use.

This statistic shows the most important import partners for Guatemala in 2019. In 2019, the most important import partner for Guatemala was the United States with a share of 36 percent in all imports.

Gucci is one of the most iconic and well-known luxury personal goods brands in the world. The company operates all over the world. As of 2021, Gucci had a total of 539 stores in operation worldwide. About 220 of these stores were located in the emerging markets of the company.

In a 2019 survey, around 61 percent of informal caregivers in the United States reported having no impacts to their work due to their caregiving responsibilities. This statistic illustrates the impacts experienced by informal caregivers in the United States due to their caregiving responsibilities as of 2019.

This statistic shows the annual turnover for the mining and quarrying industry in Norway from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the mining and quarrying industry produced a turnover of approximately 61.5 billion euros.

How effective do Norwegians think advertising will be in communicating information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 )? According to a survey from March 2020, over 60 percent of the respondents agreed that advertising will be effective in this context. However, more than 40 percent of the respondents stated that advertising will not be effective.

This statistic shows the responses to a survey about online and social media tools used in companies amongst C-suite executives in Canada as of March 2013. During the reported period, 93 percent of executives who were e-mail subscribers stated that they had engaged with brands via e-mail.
This statistic shows the total number of immigrants to Canada from 2000 to 2021. Between July 1, 2020 and June 30, 2021, approximately 227,843 immigrants came to Canada.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Costa Rica from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Costa Rica amounted to 1.74 children per woman.

This statistic shows the total tuition fees for the top ranked U.S. business graduate schools for physician executives based on the 2013-2014 school year. During this year, the top ranked U.S. business graduate school for physician executives was Hofstra University, which cost physician executives a total of 156,879 U.S. dollars in tuition and fees.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the administrative and support service activities industry in Estonia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the administrative and support service activities industry employed a total number of 32,858 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the administrative and support service activities industry in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the administrative and support service activities industry employed a total number of 31,099 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the administrative and support service activities industry in Malta from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the administrative and support service activities industry employed a total number of 14,812 people.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the administrative and support service activities industry in Poland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the administrative and support service activities industry employed a total number of 431,849 people.

The average retail price for potatoes hit an all-time high of 11.26 Canadian dollars per 4.54 kilograms in June 2020. As well as monthly fluctuations, the price has quite dramatically risen over the survey period, with an average annual price of 5.62 Canadian dollars in 2014.

This statistic shows the frequency of flyer usage before hardware shopping in Canada as of October 2014. During the survey, 37 percent of respondents said they never used flyers before shopping for hardware.

During a March 2020 survey of media buyers and planners in the United States, gauging the impact of the coronavirus outbreak on short term advertising expenditures, it was found that 49 percent of respondents said they were going to increase their spend on digital video ads, and 29 percent said the same about mobile video ads. At the same time 57 percent were going to decrease their spend on traditional TV and radio ads, and 46 percent said the same about print ads.

This statistic shows the frequency of flyer usage before home improvement product and services shopping in Canada as of October 2014. During the survey, 38 percent of the respondents said they never used flyers before shopping for home improvement products and services.

This statistic shows the frequency of flyer usage before sports equipment shopping in Canada as of October 2014. During the survey, 44 percent of respondents said they never used flyers before shopping for sports equipment.

This statistic shows the frequency of flyer usage before wireless product shopping in Canada as of October 2014. During the survey, 43 percent of respondents said they never used flyers before shopping for wireless products.
This statistic shows the harvested acreage of sugar beet in Canada from 2010 to 2015. In 2010/2011, 30,300 acres of sugar beet was harvested in Canada, up from 24,900 acres the previous year.
This statistic displays the value added tax on beer in Ireland in 2019, by type of beer. The value added tax on stout amounted to 30 percent, while the value added tax on lager was at 29.6 percent.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of consumer electronics industry in Greece from 2011 to 2017. In 2017, there were 31 enterprises manufacturing consumer electronics in Greece.

This statistic depicts the leading home improvement categories purchased online in the United States in 2014. The survey revealed that 16.8 percent of U.S. consumers purchased lighting and ceiling fans online.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in Albania from 1986 to 2026. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2020, the GDP per capita in Albania amounted to around 5,068.06 U.S. dollars.

This statistic presents the content assets most lacking on B2B vendor websites according to buyers in the United States as of November 2014. During the survey, it was found that 35 percent of responding buyers felt that case studies were lacking on B2B vendor websites.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of optical instruments and photographic equipment industry in Belgium from 2010 to 2012. In 2012, there were 13 enterprises manufacturing optical instruments and photographic equipment in Belgium.

Over 50 percent of polled restaurant owners reported a turnover loss of up to 50 percent during the COVID-19 outbreak in Russia. Every fifth respondent witnessed a sales fall ranging from 51 to 100 percent over the period under consideration.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Vietnam from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Vietnam amounted to 2.05 children per woman.
This statistic shows the life expectancy at birth in Vietnam from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy at birth in Vietnam was 75.4 years.
This statistic shows the age structure in Vietnam from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 22.87 percent of Vietnam's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

This statistic shows the distribution of the gross domestic product ( GDP ) across economic sectors in Vietnam from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, agriculture contributed around 15.01 percent to the GDP of Vietnam, 34.43 percent came from the industry and 41.58 percent from the service sector.

This statistic shows the responses to a survey about tablet usage in Canada as of January 2014. During the reported period, 54 percent of retailers stated they currently offered a dedicated iPad menu on their website.

This statistic displays results of a survey regarding the reading of digital books more than printed books in France in 2014. It shows that 37 percent of respondents fully agreed that they had the feeling that they read more digitally printed books than traditionally printed books.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of furniture industry in North Macedonia from 2011 to 2018. In 2018, there were 682 enterprises manufacturing furniture in North Macedonia.

The recycling rate of household waste in England increased in the past decade, from 41.5 percent in 2010/11 to 45.1 percent in 2019/20. However, this was a minor decrease from the previous year. The recycling rate tended to be slightly higher for the years 2013/14 to 2016/17, but dropped in the following years.

This statistic presents the share of smartphone users who have paid for mobile video content as of May 2015, sorted by gender. During the survey period, it was found that 18 percent of male respondents had paid for a video that they had watched on their smartphone.

This statistic presents the share of smartphone users who have paid for mobile video content as of May 2015, sorted by region. During the survey period, it was found that 23 percent of respondents from the United States and Canada had paid for a video that they had watched on their smartphone.

As of March 7, 2022, the United States had the highest number of reported cases of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) among the most impacted countries worldwide, with over 71 million cases. India had the second highest number of COVID-19 cases among the most impacted countries, with over nine million cases.

This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Vietnam in 2019. In 2019, the most important export partner of Vietnam was the United States, with a share of 23 percent in exports.
This statistic shows the male and female population of Canada in 2021, distinguished by age group. In 2021, about 3.68 million male Canadians were aged between 15 and 24 years.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on the preferred dishes in France in 2016, by age group. It reveals that 14 percent of respondents aged 65 and older stated that their preferred dish was roasted chicken, compared to only two percent of respondents aged 18 to 34 years old.

In 2020, the Kohl's Corporation employed approximately 110,000 associates, a decrease from the previous year's total of 121,000. The company had associates working in about 130 locations throughout the United States that year.

This statistic shows the total number of employees in the real estate activities industry in Norway from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the real estate activities industry employed a total number of 24,946 people.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of domestic appliances industry in Ireland from 2008 to 2012. In 2012, there were 31 enterprises manufacturing domestic appliances in Ireland.

The statistic shows the preferred locations for summer reading according to Goodreads members worldwide as of July 2015. The source found that 63 percent of respondents stated their ideal summer reading location was in a bed.
