During the last reported period, the total community newspaper titles in Canada fell in all provinces and territories except New Brunswick, Newfoundland/Labrador, and Quebec. Ontario's total dropped from just under 400 in 2016 to around 340 in 2019, and the figure for Alberta dropped below 130.

This statistic shows the weekly reach of radio across multiple demographics in Canada in 2013. During the reported period, radio had the most reach among female listeners aged 18 and over, with a 63 percent reach. Radio had the least reach among male listeners aged 18 and over, with a 55 percent reach.

This statistic shows the share of daily newspaper readers across Canada as of June 2015, by age. During the reported period, 26 percent of daily newspaper readers were aged between 18 and 24 years in Quebec.

The chart shows a comparison of viewer count on different platforms for the series 'CSI: GO'in 2020 and 2021. The peak viewer count was on the first episode of the series on the streaming service HBO in 2020, with 1000 viewers. The average viewer count was also highest on the first episode of the series on TV in 2021, with 600 viewers. There was a significant decrease in viewer count on the second episode of the series on HBO in 2021, which only had 200 viewers, despite having the highest average viewer count that year.

During the third quarter of 2020, it was found that 87 percent of Canadian mobile users accessed social networking apps. Communication apps were ranked second with a 85 percent usage reach among mobile audiences in Canada.

This statistic displays the share of American high school students in grades 9 to 12 who have used smokeless tobacco products in the past month as of 2014, by ethnicity. The survey revealed that 1.5 percent of white, non-Hispanic students have used dissolvable tobacco products in the past month.

This statistic depicts the percentage of American middle school students that used select tobacco products as of 2014. According to the data, 12.5 percent of American middle school students currently use dissolvable tobacco products.
This statistic shows the number of total mobile app downloads in Germany from 2009 to 2014. In 2012, the total number of mobile app downloads amounted to approximately 1.7 billion.

According to the most recent data, in the province of British Columbia, the reach of community newspapers was about 57 percent among the population aged 12 years and older on a weekly basis. Weekly reach in Ontario, Canada's most populous province, was around 46 percent.

In 2019, the market for nervous system disorders treatments was valued at over 20 billion U.S. dollars. This statistic displays the value of the U.S. nervous system disorders market from 2014 to 2019. The market is expected to grow over the next several years.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of electrical lighting equipment industry in Ireland from 2008 to 2017. In 2017, there were 73 enterprises manufacturing electrical lighting equipment in Ireland.

This statistic shows the total number of free community newspapers published in Canada in 2013 and 2015, by province and territory. During the most recent reported period, Ontario had 8,460 free community newspapers in circulation.

This statistic presents the share of active savings accounts per person in the United Kingdom ( UK ) as of 2014, by number of accounts. Among the respondents, 40 percent had three or more savings accounts.

This statistic presents the share of savings accounts held with or without withdrawal in the main banking provider in the United Kingdom ( UK ) as of 2014. Approximately 76 percent of current account holders, with easy access accounts, reported that they had no intention to withdraw their savings.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. physicians who used select methods to deal with burnout in 2020. According to the data, 48 percent of physicians in the United States reported using professional therapy or counseling to deal with burnout.

This statistic shows the average annual circulation of popular building publications in Canada as of June 2014. During the reported period, Architectural Digest had a circulation of 32 thousand copies.

This statistic displays the migration figures of Spanish people leaving or returning to Spain from 2010 to 2020. During the analyzed period of time, the number of Spanish people leaving or returning to Spain peaked in 2015, with approximately 94.5 thousand Spanish people doing so. In 2020, the number of people leaving or returning to Spain amounted to approximately 52.5 thousand.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on the share of internet users looking for health-related information on medical review websites in Germany in 2013, broken down by gender. During the survey period it was found that 43 percent of male German internet users looked for medical information on websites such as WebMd.

This statistic shows the net number of non-permanent residents in Canada in 2021, distinguished by province or territory. Between July 1, 2020 and June 30, 2021, Ontario gained 17,946 more non-permanent residents than it lost.

This statistic shows the trend in total sales value of IGP wine in supermarkets in France from 2003 to 2019. The figures show that the sales value of IGP wine increased over the years from 399.5 million euros in 2003 to 927.5 million euros in 2019.
This statistic shows the total number of separated people in Canada from 2000 to 2020, distinguished by gender. In 2020, there were 471,836 men and 523,945 women who were separated in Canada.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the manufacture of leather and related products industry in Latvia from 2009 to 2016. In 2015, the leather manufacturing industry produced a turnover of approximately 4.3 million euros.

The turnover of the leather and related products manufacturing industry in Switzerland saw an addition of 27.6 million euros in 2018. Therefore, the turnover in Switzerland reached a peak in 2018 with 615.7 million euros. The recent development could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2017. Notably, the turnover in this industry has been, with the exception of 2013, continuously increasing over the last years.
This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Belarus in 2019. In 2019, the most important export partner of Belarus was Russia, with a share of 42 percent in exports.

This statistic shows the level of enjoyment in aspects of clothes shopping among male consumers in Canada as of July 2013. During the survey, 60 percent of the male respondents said that they found browsing through a variety of different stores to be very enjoyable.

First released in July 2013, Call of Duty : Warzone is an online battle royale game which pits up to 150 players against each other. As with many online games, players can gain experience points through playing the game and completing certain missions. This ranking system is then used to match players of similar skill levels against each other in online games. Given the competitive nature of the game, it is no surprise that Call of Duty : Warzone has developed a loyal legion of fans. As of April 2021, the game had reached a record high peak number of concurrent players of over 100 million.
This statistic shows the total number of lone parent families in Canada in 2021, distinguished by province and territory. In 2021, about 4.1 million lone parent families were living in Ontario.

This statistic shows the annual expenditure on still wine per household in France from 2010 to 2019, in euros. The figures reveal that the annual expenditure on still wine slightly decreased over the years, going from 130.5 euros in 2010 to 119.5 euros in 2019.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Cameroon from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 57.55 percent of Cameroon's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the volume of milkshake produced in Canada from 2010 to 2020. Approximately 2,670 kiloliters of milkshake were produced in Canada in 2020, a decrease from around 2,900 kiloliters the previous year.
This statistic shows the total number of employer firms in Canada in 2019, distinguished by establishment size. In 2019, 8.8 million Canadian employer businesses had less than five employees.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the total business economy ; repair of computers, personal and household goods ; except financial and insurance activities in Latvia from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, there were 115,851 enterprises in the total business economy.

This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the total business economy ; repair of computers, personal and household goods ; except financial and insurance activities in Luxembourg from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, there were 31,945 enterprises in the total business economy.

This statistic shows the number of advanced metering infrastructure installed in the United States from 2008 to 2020. In 2020, approximately 102.3 million advanced metering infrastructure were installed in the U.S.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the total business economy ; repair of computers, personal and household goods ; except financial and insurance activities in Greece from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the total business economy had personnel costs of approximately 326.2 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the total business economy ; repair of computers, personal and household goods ; except financial and insurance activities in Hungary from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the total business economy had personnel costs of approximately 27.4 billion euros.
In 2019, eight percent of total enterprises in Cyprus sold products via websites or apps to other European countries. This is a one percent increase from 2017.

As of August 2021, Imperial Chemical ranked highest among the leading chemical companies in the United Kingdom ( UK ), with a market capitalization of approximately 12.8 billion British pounds. Johnson Matthey and Vitex ranked second and third with market capitalization of 5.8 and 2.3 billion British pounds, respectively.
This statistic shows the number of employees at head offices in Canada from 2010 to 2018. In 2018, there were 226,872 people employed at head offices in Canada.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the total business economy ; repair of computers, personal and household goods ; except financial and insurance activities in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2009 to 2018. In 2018, the total business economy had personnel costs of approximately 648.2 billion euros.
This statistic shows the total population of Ghana from 2016 to 2026. All figures are estimates. In 2018, the total population of Ghana amounted to approximately 29.56 million inhabitants.
This statistic shows the life expectancy at birth in Ghana from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy at birth in Ghana was 64.05 years.
This statistic shows the age structure in Ghana from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 37.77 percent of Ghana's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.
This statistic shows the net income of the leading mining companies in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2020. In that year, BHP Group had a net income worth approximately 5.1 billion British pounds.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Ghana from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups ; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Ghanaian population was 20.5 years.

The statistic shows Tanzania's share in the global gross domestic product ( GDP ) adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity ( PPP ) from 2016 to 2026. In 2020, Tanzania's share in the global gross domestic product adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity amounted to approximately 0.06 percent.

During the first years of the period under consideration, the net migration balance with countries other than Spain resulted in negative figures. This trend, however, terminated in 2016, year in which Spain received more newcomers than people leaving the country. In 2020, the net migration balance of Spain with other countries amounted to 235 thousand individuals. To see information on the migration flow in Spain click here.
In 2019, eight percent of total enterprises in Denmark sold products via websites or apps to other European countries. This is a one percent increase from 2017.
This statistic depicts the volume of apple production in France from 2005 to 2020. In 2020, the volume of apple production was expected to reach more than 1.4 million tons.
This statistic shows the population change in Uganda from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, Uganda's population increased by approximately 3.26 percent compared to the previous year.
This statistic shows the age structure in Tanzania from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 43.78 percent of Tanzania's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.
This statistic shows the age structure in Uganda from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 46.23 percent of Uganda's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

This statistic shows the leading kitchen appliance finishes among homeowners in Canada as of February 2015. During the survey, 82 percent of the respondents said they chose or would choose stainless steel as the finish for their kitchen appliances.

This statistic shows the distribution of the gross domestic product ( GDP ) across economic sectors in Uganda from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, agriculture contributed around 24.01 percent to the GDP of Uganda, 26.09 percent came from the industry, and 43.65 percent from the services sector.

This statistic shows the share of economic sectors in the gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Tanzania from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the share of agriculture in Tanzania's gross domestic product was 27.23 percent, industry contributed approximately 29.02 percent and the services sector contributed about 36.06 percent.

This statistic shows the outdoor advertising locations that respondents had perceived as out-of-home advertising in Spain in 2020. The study shows that respondents perceived buses and coaches as the most out-of-home advertising format with approximately 19.8 million people having seen it.
This statistic displays the annual excise duty revenue related to beer in Ireland from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the annual excise duty revenue of beer amounted to approximately 422.5 million euro.
This statistic displays the annual excise duty revenue related to beer in Italy from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the annual excise duty revenue of beer amounted to approximately 713 million euros.

A recent survey of U.S. adults showed that the most common change in behaviour in response to the coronavirus outbreak would be to avoid crowded places, with 65 percent of respondents considering this a protective measure. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. respondents who would consider taking the following actions in response to the coronavirus outbreak, as of February 9, 2020.

More than one third of respondents considered that the most important challenge that Romania would have to face in the European Union was related to the country's status as a member of the union. Only five percent of respondents considered that taxation was the most important challenge for Romania.
This statistic displays the annual excise duty revenue related to beer in Sweden from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the annual excise duty revenue of beer amounted to approximately 412 million euros.

This statistic displays the annual excise duty revenue related to beer in Turkey from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the annual excise duty revenue of beer reached its peak at approximately 1.3 billion euros.

This statistic displays the annual excise duty revenue related to beer in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the annual excise duty revenue of beer amounted to approximately 4.16 billion euros.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Lesotho from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment rate in Lesotho was 24.47 percent.

This statistic displays the permitted blood alcohol levels for driving road vehicles in Europe in 2018, in grams of alcohol per liter of blood. Malta and the United Kingdom ( UK ) have the highest limits by a margin of 0.3 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. These two countries have an alcohol limit of 0.8 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. However, the vast majority of countries have set their legal alcohol limits for drivers at 0.5 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. Five countries have more restrictive rules and set their legal limit at 0.0 grams of alcohol per liter of blood. These restrictive rules are applied in the Slovak Republic, Hungary, China, Indonesia and Russia.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the programming and broadcasting activities industry in France from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the programming and broadcasting activities industry produced a turnover of approximately 11.94 billion euros.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the programming and broadcasting activities industry in Finland from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the programming and broadcasting activities industry produced a turnover of approximately 563.8 million euros.

This statistic shows the number of employees of the leading food and beverage companies in Canada in 2016. McCain Foods Inc. employed approximately 200,000 people in Canada in 2016, making it the largest food and beverage company in terms of employee numbers.

The statistic shows Lesotho's budget balance in relation to GDP between 2016 and 2020, with projections up until 2026. A positive value indicates a budget surplus, a negative value indicates a deficit. In 2020, Lesotho's budget surplus amounted to around 0.21 percent of GDP.
This statistic shows the number of stores operated by Canadian Tire Corporation in Canada in 2020, by brand. Canadian Tire operated 672 Canadian Tire stores in 2020.

This statistic shows the percentage of physicians in the U.S. that reported having a burn-out syndrome, according to a survey conducted from March to June 2019, by generation. It was found that 35 percent of the millennial physicians reported having a burn-out syndrome.

This statistic shows data on the total consumption of chocolate and cocoa products by households in Spain from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, a household's consumption of chocolate and cocoa products amounted to approximately 162 million kilograms.

The personnel costs of the real estate industry in Switzerland increased by 183.9 million euros since the previous year. With 3.1 billion euros, the personnel costs thereby reached its highest value in the observed period. This could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2017. Notably, the personnel costs in this industry is continuously increasing over the last years.

This statistic shows the percentage of adults in the U.S. with at least one permanent tooth loss from 2011-2012, by age and ethnicity. During this time, around 11.9 percent of non-Hispanic black adults aged 20-39 had at least one permanent tooth loss.
This statistic shows the population change in Niger from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, Niger's population increased by approximately 3.76 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the system-wide average business class air fares in Canada from the first quarter of 2015 to the second quarter of 2017. The average quarterly discounted business air fare in the second quarter of 2017 amounted to 5,300 Canadian dollars.

This statistic presents the percentage of internet users in the United States who have utilized showrooming and webrooming as of September 2014. During the survey period, it was found that 68 percent of U.S. internet users had browsed products in-store but ended up purchasing them online.

This statistic shows the consumption of frozen fries in Canada from 2000/01 to 2018/19. In the marketing year of 2017/18, the consumption of frozen fries in Canada amounted to approximately 235,000 metric tons.

This statistic displays the number of spinal cord injuries in Scotland in the period 2020/21, split by the mechanism of injury. During this period, the number of spinal cord injuries incurred as a result of a fall amounted to 55, this was the leading cause of spinal cord injury. It was followed by road traffic accidents which came to 20.

This statistic shows the import volume of grapes to Canada from 2010/11 to 2020/21. In the marketing year of 2020/21, the import volume of grapes in Canada amounted to approximately 193,900 metric tons.

This statistic shows the price of 200 cigarettes in Canada as of March 2018, by region. The price of 200 cigarettes in Ontario was 103.46 Canadian dollars, compared to 139.02 dollars in New Brunswick.

The changes in mobility trends after the coronavirus outbreak in Poland in March 2020 were more significant than those in April 2020. The most significant decrease in mobility was recorded in places such as restaurants, cafs, shopping centers, theme parks, museums, libraries, and cinemas. Significant changes also took place in shops, pharmacies, and parks. However, in April, there was an increase in mobility in places such as residential areas, workplaces, and transport stations. The changes in mobility in Poland due to the coronavirus epidemic in 2020 were more pronounced than those in the previous year.

This graph shows the total number of students enrolled in public elementary and secondary schools in Canada from 2000 to 2020. In the 2019/20 school year, about 4.96 million students were enrolled in public elementary and secondary schools in Canada.

This graph shows the total number of students enrolled in public elementary and secondary schools in Canada from 2000 to 2020, distinguished by gender. In the 2020 school year, about 2.55 million male students were enrolled in public elementary and secondary schools in Canada.

In 2019, e-commerce accounted for six percent of total retail sales in Canada, with clothing and clothing accessories stores making up one percent of total retail sales. In the same year, non-store retailers made up 60 percent of total retail sales in Canada.

This statistic represents the share of online sales in the revenue of enterprises selling online in France in 2014, by sector. It shows that online sales accounted for 25 percent of the revenue of enterprises selling cars and motorcycles, compared to only 1.5 percent for wholesale trade.

This statistic shows the farm product price index ( FPPI ) of specialty crops in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the farm product price index for specialty crops in Canada was 111.4, an increase from 110.1 the previous year.

This statistic shows the farm product price index ( FPPI ) of cattle and calves in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the farm product price index for cattle and calves in Canada was 171.4, a decrease from 171.7 the previous year.

This statistic shows the farm product price index ( FPPI ) of hogs in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, the farm product price index of hogs in Canada was 146.4, an increase from 133.2 the previous year.

This statistic shows the farm product price index ( FPPI ) of all farm products in Canada from 2008 to 2020. In 2020, the farm product price index for all farm products in Canada was 129.9, an increase from 129.6 the previous year.
This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of barley in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, farm cash receipts of barley in Canada amounted to approximately 948.52 million Canadian dollars.
This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of rye in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, farm cash receipts of rye in Canada amounted to approximately 53.19 million Canadian dollars.

The coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) has led to deaths in Switzerland. As of February 2022, the age group most affected by the virus was 80 years and older. Indeed, of the 9,017 deaths due to the coronavirus in Switzerland, around 8,700 were in people aged 80 years and older.
This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of flaxseed in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, farm cash receipts of flaxseed in Canada amounted to approximately 213.55 million Canadian dollars.
This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of corn in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, farm cash receipts of corn in Canada amounted to approximately 2.21 billion Canadian dollars.

This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of cranberries in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, farm cash receipts of cranberries sold by farmers in Canada amounted to approximately 145.94 million Canadian dollars.

This statistic presents the results of a consumer survey, showing the consumption of hair colorants in Russia in 2012 and 2013 by product type. In 2013 almost 77 percent of Russian hair colorant consumers used permanent colors.

This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of forage and grass seed in Canada from 2008 to 2020. In 2020, farm cash receipts of forage and grass seed in Canada amounted to approximately 158.65 million Canadian dollars.
This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of ginger in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, farm cash receipts of ginger in Canada amounted to approximately 129.52 million Canadian dollars.

This statistic presents the leading hair colorant brands in Russia ranked by consumption usage as of 2013. According to the survey, L'Oral was the second most used hair colorant brand in Russia in 2013 with a consumption usage of 15.3 percent.

This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of Christmas trees in Canada from 2008 to 2020. In 2020, farm cash receipts of Christmas trees in Canada amounted to approximately 138.52 million Canadian dollars.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the scientific research & development industry in Croatia from 2009 to 2015. In 2009, the scientific research & development industry produced a turnover of approximately 148.8 million euros.

This statistic displays the potential cost savings in healthcare through mobile health in 2014. During this year, it was estimated that mobile health could save 33 percent of the cost of physician visits. There has been a slow adoption of mobile health in the United States market.

As of March 2020, most Hungarians agreed with the government's decision to make changes to public transport regulations connected to the spread of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). According to the survey, over 60 percent of respondents found it possible that public transport vehicles would run on a schedule similar to the current situation.

The statistic shows the number of paid subscribers registered to the Match Group from the first quarter of 2014 to the first quarter of 2021. In the last reported quarter, the Match Group's number of paid subscribers amounted to over 11 million users. The Match Group, formerly owned by IAC, owns and operates online dating platforms such as the eponymous Match.com, OkCupid, Tinder, PlentyofFish and others.

This statistic depicts the frequency of home-related activities among U.S. homeowners in 2014. The survey revealed that 61 percent of homeowners do painting and other wall related projects on their own.

This statistic presents information on in-store shopping technology improvements in the United States in 2014 and 2013. During the survey, 15 percent of respondents stated they would like to have more information about products available in-store.

This statistic depicts the percentage of children in the United States who visited the dentist in the past year as of 2018, by ethnicity. The survey revealed that 47.5 percent of Hispanic children in the U.S. aged 2 to 17 years old visited the dentist in the past year.

This statistic displays the number of births in Spain in 2020, by age of mother. The largest group of women bearing their first child were 34 years old, with almost 24 thousand births that year. The second largest group was that of women between 35 and 39 years old, with more than 20 thousand births.

This statistic displays the mortality rate of lung cancer in 2013, by selected European country and gender. Lung cancer, also known as lung carcinoma, occurs when there is abnormal cell growth in the lungs, this abnormal growth can spread to other parts of the body. In 2013, the mortality rate of lung cancer among males was highest in Lithuania at 138.2 per 100,000 population, whereas the highest mortality rate among females was in Czechia at 54.1 per 100,000 population

This statistic shows the weighted average price of diamonds in the Ekati and Diavik mines in Canada from 2012 to 2014. In 2012, the Diavik mine, which began production in 2003, produced diamonds with a weighted average price of 3.55 million Canadian dollars per carat.

This statistic displays the compound annual growth rate ( CAGR ) of diamond production from mines worldwide between 2005 and 2013, by country. During this period, the CAGR of diamond production in Russia was -0.1 percent.

This statistic shows the total number of students enrolled in regular second language programs offered by public elementary and secondary schools in Canada in the academic year 2018/19, distinguished by province. In the academic year 2018/19, about 758,947 students were enrolled in regular second language programs in Quebec.

This statistic displays the change in the number of hospital visits or admissions due to the use of health technology in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. The number of hospital bed days has decreased by 59 percent since the use of health technology.

As of April 2020, 34 percent of job registrations on the job portal B-Terv were related to the industry of health and social work. Another 19 percent of job registrations concerned the field of other intellectual professions.

This statistic displays the percentage share of digital health applications in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by category. The majority of digital health applications ( 31 percent ) were for consumer use and medical reference use ( 16 percent ).

This statistic shows the national debt of Burkina Faso from 2016 to 2020 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2020, the national debt of Burkina Faso amounted to approximately 46.55 percent of the GDP.

The exchange rate history of the euro against the Czech crown ( EURCZK ) reveals a steady increase since 2015, despite several dips in 2018 and 2020. By the end of 2020, the exchange rate of one euro was equal to approximately 4.1 Czech crowns. This value grew to 4.2 by the end of 2021.
This statistic shows the farm cash receipts of sheep in Canada from 2008 to 2019. In 2019, farm cash receipts of sheep in Canada amounted to approximately 14.36 million Canadian dollars.

This statistic displays the least attractive countries in Europe for mHealth app development as of 2015. In this year, the United Kingdom was the leading country in terms of attractiveness for mobile health app development with 32 percent.

This statistic shows the total number of students graduated from postsecondary institutions in Canada in 2019, distinguished by age group and gender. In 2019, around 166,851 women aged between 20 and 24 years received a certificate, diploma, or degree from a postsecondary institution in Canada.

This statistic displays the cost of a hip resurfacing procedure in selected countries as of 2019. In the United States, a hip resurfacing procedure cost approximately 28,000 U.S. dollars, while in Mexico the price for the same procedure was less than half of that amount.

This statistic shows the off-trade retail volume share of mixed fruit juice drinks in France from 2008 to 2013. The retail volume share slowly increased over this period of time, accounting for 13.6 percent of the total volume of juice drinks sold in off-trade retail in France in 2013.

This statistic shows the off-trade retail volume share of orange juice in France from 2008 to 2013. The retail volume share slowly decreased over this period of time, accounting for 13.6 percent of the total volume of juice drinks sold in off-trade retail in France in 2013.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the food and beverage service activities industry in Norway from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, the production value of the food and beverage service activities industry came to approximately 5.4 billion euros.

As of December 29, 2021, 68.6 percent of Indonesian respondents stated that they were afraid of contracting COVID-19. The share of respondents who were afraid of contracting the virus had been decreasing since it peaked at 87 percent on June 19, 2020.

This statistic displays the share of online customers who experienced problems with purchases in the United Kingdom ( UK ) as of April 2015, by problem. Of respondents, 46 percent of encountered problems with their purchases being delivered to the wrong address.

This statistic shows the off-trade retail volume share of vegetable juice in France from 2008 to 2013. The retail volume share slowly increased over this period of time, accounting for 13.6 percent of the total volume of juice sold in off-trade retail in France in 2013.

This statistic shows the share of economic sectors in the gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Burundi from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the share of agriculture in Burundi's gross domestic product was 28.33 percent, industry contributed approximately 11.03 percent and the services sector contributed about 45.14 percent.

This statistic shows the reasons for publishing e-books in Canada in 2017, broken down by company size. During the reported period, 72 percent of large publishers stated that their main reason for publishing e-books was to increase sales.

This statistic shows the opinion of air travelers on the necessity of airport security screenings in the United States as of June 2015. During the survey, 58 percent of respondents said they believed airport security screenings were a necessary inconvenience to keep air travel safe.

This statistic displays the number of adults with a mood disorder in the United States in the period 2008-2012, by poverty level. Some 4.4 million individuals with a major depressive disorder had a household income below 100,000 U.S. dollars. Mood disorders describe a serious change in mood. Depression can be common among individuals with mental illnesses.

This statistic shows the share of self-serve meat case and full-service meat counter purchases in Canada in 2016. During the survey, 78 percent of the respondents said that they preferred to purchase their meat from self-serve meat cases.

This statistic displays the leading five men's toiletries brands used in Russia, ranked by consumption in 2013. Of the Russian men surveyed, 14.3 percent used Andras, ranking it as the most popular men's toiletry brand.
This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Senegal in 2019. In 2019, the most important export partner of Senegal was Mali, with a share of 22 percent in exports.
This statistic presents the most valuable French food brands from 2015 to 2017, by brand value. The most valuable French food brand in 2015 was Carrefour, with a brand value of 9.6 billion euros.

How has the coronavirus pandemic changed the hand-washing habits of the Danes? According to a survey from March 2020, a higher share of the younger respondents ( 76 percent of those aged 18 to 39 ) had improved their personal hygiene by washing their hands more frequently than before. However, this share dropped to 65 percent among those aged 60 years and older. Furthermore, the frequency of using hand sanitizer increased among all age groups.

This statistic shows the national debt of Rwanda from 2016 to 2019 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2019, the national debt of Rwanda amounted to approximately 50.15 percent of the GDP.

This statistic displays the workforce in the life sciences industry in the Los Angeles and Orange County Metro Area in the United States in 2018, by type. In that year, the Los Angeles and Orange County Metro Area had some 11,788 employees in the industry.

This statistic displays the distribution of employment in the New Jersey/Westchester Metro Area's life sciences industry in 2013, by segment. During this year, employment in the biotechnology manufacturing sector accounted for 15 percent of the total.
This statistic shows the meat-related changes to dietary choices among consumers in Canada as of September 2016. During the survey, 34 percent of the respondents said they try to eat fish regularly.

This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Somalia in 2019. In 2019, the most important export partner of Somalia was the United Arab Emirates, with a share of 47 percent in exports.

This statistic shows the revenue of the 20 leading companies in the digital goods, services and content segment in Germany in 2013. In the period of consideration, online retailer Amazon generated a revenue of roughly 1.9 billion euros through digital goods, services and content.

This statistic shows the leading tobacco companies in Canada from 2007 to 2015, by market share. In 2015, Imperial Tobacco Canada Limited was the leading tobacco company in Canada with a market share of 49.6 percent.

The production value of the motor vehicle, trailer and semi-trailer industry in Switzerland dropped to 408.5 million euros in 2014. The production value thereby reached its lowest value in recent years. The recent development could be explained by the fact that Eurostat reports a break in time series for 2010.

This timeline displays the amount of fresh shellfish purchased annually by households in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased volume fluctuated over this period of time. In 2020, French households'purchases of shellfish amounted to approximately 74.2 thousand tons, a decrease compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the responses to a survey about online retail in Canada as of November 2014. During the reported period, 47 percent of respondents stated that they used social media to talk to friends about holiday shopping.

As of December 29, 2021, 83 percent of Malaysian respondents stated that they were afraid to contract COVID-19, up from 78 percent on Feb 24, 2020. Malaysia is currently experiencing an increase in the number of daily cases.

This statistic displays the number of registered passenger cars in the 28 European Union member states from 1990 to 2017. In the period of consideration, stock of passenger cars presented a trend of continuous growth. In 2017, the number of registered passenger cars in the EU 28 reached its peak, at 264.2 million vehicles.

This statistic displays the distribution of substance abuse treatment facilities in the United States by payment option offered, as of 2020. Programs offered at a majority of the country's substance abuse treatment facilities were cash or self-payment ( 28 percent ), followed by private health insurance ( 19 percent ).

This statistic shows the results of a survey on the share of companies selling products or services via a website, app or electronic data transfer in Germany in 2020, broken down by industry. During the survey period it was found that 25 percent of companies in the insurance and financial services industry stated that their company sold products or services via a website, app or electronic data transfer.
This statistic shows the share of past-day tea consumers in Canada from 2011 to 2013, by age. In 2012, 52 percent of past-day tea consumers were aged between 18 and 24 years.

This statistic shows the number of small mammals owned as pets in Canada from 2006 to 2020. Approximately 1.24 million small mammals were owned as pets in Canada in 2020, up from 1.22 million pet small mammals in 2016.
This statistic shows the sales of bird food in Canada from 2006 to 2025. Bird food sales in Canada amounted to approximately 34.2 million Canadian dollars in 2019.
This statistic shows the sales of small mammal and reptile food in Canada from 2006 to 2025. Sales of small mammals and reptile food amounted to approximately 9.68 million Canadian dollars in 2006.

This statistic shows the sales volume of bird food in Canada from 2006 to 2020. The retail sales volume of bird food amounted to approximately 3.4 million metric tons in 2006 and was forecasted to fall to 2.3 million metric tons by 2012.

As of 2020, Europe reported the highest rate of mental health hospital admissions per 100,000 population. This statistic shows the rate of mental health hospital admissions per 100,000 population worldwide as of 2020, by region.

This statistic displays the distribution of chronic conditions among hospital stays among super-utilizers and payers in the United States in 2012. During this time, 27 percent of hospital stays among Medicare super-utilizers aged between 1 and 64 years were for chronic conditions. A relatively large proportion of the United States'health care resources are consumed by a small percentage of the population, where about a quarter of the country's health expenses are incurred by one percent of the population.

During the time of the coronavirus pandemic, global consumers seem rather positive about brands keeping in touch. In March 2020 they were asked how they feel about brands communicating their response to the outbreak, and the majority said they liked brands offering help and support, such as free health checks or financial assistance. In China, 75 percent of consumers were pleased with brands contributing to the fight against the epidemic by making various donations. However, in France and Germany only 20 percent of consumers thought brands were doing their part to help.

This statistic shows the production value of the manufacture of machinery and equipment industry in Norway from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of the manufacture of machinery and equipment industry came to approximately 5.43 billion euros.

This statistic shows the area of carrots harvested in Canada from 2008 to 2021. In 2021, approximately 21,700 acres of carrots were harvested in Canada, up from approximately 21,300 acres of carrots harvested the previous year.

The consumer price index ( CPI ) for fruit juice and vegetable juice in the Netherlands fluctuated from January 2018 to June 2021. In June 2021, the index value of fruit and vegetable juice prices was measured at 110.79, where the year 2015 equals 100.

This statistic shows the area of radishes harvested in Canada from 2008 to 2021. In 2021, approximately 2,500 acres of radishes were harvested in Canada, a decrease from approximately 2,700 acres the previous year.

This statistic shows the most popular types of digital communication methods among teenagers in the United States as of March 2015. During the survey period, it was found that 79 percent of teen respondents used text messaging the most to communicate online.

The consumer price index ( CPI ) for food in the Netherlands increased gradually from January 2018 to 2021. In January 2018, the index value of food prices was measured at 103.44, where the year 2015 equals 100. The CPI increased to 111.79 by August 2021.

The consumer price index ( CPI ) for prepared meals sold in supermarkets in the Netherlands increased gradually from January 2018 to 2021. In January 2018, the index value of prepared meal prices was measured at 100.5, where the year 2015 equals 100. The CPI increased to 106.1 by August 2021.

This statistic presents the most popular ways in which teens interact and communicate with their friends online as of March 2015, sorted by gender and age group. During the survey period, it was found that 59 percent of male teen respondents aged 15 to 17 years had met online friends via a social networking site.

This timeline displays an overview of the household retail purchases of fresh trout in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased volume rose by more than 1,400 tons over this period of time. In 2020, French households'purchases of fresh trout amounted to 6,049 tons compared to 5,373 tons in 2009.

The timeline displays an overview of the household retail purchases of fresh whiting in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased amount fluctuated over this period of time. In 2020, French households'purchases of fresh whiting amounted to approximately 4,100 tons.
From 2016 to 2019, the rates of online purchase of reading materials such as books, magazines and e-learning materials in Portugal have remained relatively stable, ranging between 10 and 13 per cent.

Rocket League is a sports video game developed by Psyonix and released in July 2015 on Xbox One, Windows and PlayStation 4. The game combines elements from both racing and soccer games - each player controls a vehicle which is used to strike a ball with the aim of scoring in the opposing goal. Rocket League events on the video streaming service Twitch were watched for a combined 14.04 million hours in January 2022.

This statistic shows the results of a survey on online shopping for Christmas presents in Germany in 2013, by mobile device used. During the survey period it was found that roughly 18 percent of smartphone owners stated to use the internet exclusively to shop for Christmas presents.

This timeline gives an overview of the retail purchase volume of fresh ray in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased volume dropped from roughly 4,200 tons in 2009 to about 2,600 tons in 2013. In 2020, the purchase volume amounted to roughly 3,350 tons.

This timeline displays an overview of the household purchase volume of chilled prepared seafood in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased volume gradually increased over this period of time, going from roughly 165,000 tons in 2009 to an estimated 203,000 tons in 2020.

This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Bosnia & Herzegovina in 2019. In 2019, the most important export partner of Bosnia & Herzegovina was Germany, with a share of 14 percent in exports.

This timeline gives an overview of the household purchase volume of chilled dried salted fish in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased volume fluctuated over this period of time. In 2020, French households'purchases of dried salted fish amounted to roughly 2,900 tons compared to an estimated 4,400 tons in 2010.

This statistic shows the number of employees of the wholesale trade industry in Canada from 2008 to 2019. There were approximately 639,000 wholesale trade employees in Canada in 2019, an increase from around 653,000 in the previous year.

This timeline displays an overview of the household purchase volume of canned seafood in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased volume remained somewhat stable over this period of time. In 2020, French households purchased nearly 129,000 tons of canned seafood products.

This timeline displays an overview of the household purchase volume of canned tuna in France from 2009 to 2020. It shows that the purchased volume dropped by more than 15,000 tons over this period of time. In 2020, French households purchased roughly 70,000 tons of canned tuna.

The timeline displays the household average expenditure on fresh bass in France from 2009 to 2018. It shows that the average expenditure rose by almost six euros over this period of time. In 2018, French households spent an average of 14.3 euros per kilogram of fresh bass.

The timeline displays the household average expenditure on fresh haddock in France from 2009 to 2018. It shows that the average expenditure remained stable over this period of time. In 2018, French households spent an average of 15.80 euros per kilogram of fresh haddock.

The period of isolation caused by the coronavirus pandemic in 2020 changed the social and entertainment habits of Poles. Fifty-six percent of those surveyed watched movies more often than before the epidemic, and 53 percent played video games more frequently. However, the most significant number of Poles spent more time browsing the internet, which is a direct result of the lockdown.

The timeline displays the household average expenditure on fresh ray in France from 2009 to 2018. It shows that the average expenditure rose by almost two euros over this period of time. In 2018, French households spent an average of 12 euros per kilogram of fresh ray.

The timeline displays the household average expenditure on fresh whiting in France from 2009 to 2018. It shows that the average expenditure rose by almost two euros over this period of time. In 2018, French households spent an average of 13.5 euros per kilogram of fresh whiting.

This timeline depicts the total volume of fresh milk-based desserts produced in France from 2008 to 2020. It shows that the production volume fluctuated over this period of time. In 2020, the production volume of fresh milk-based desserts was at an estimated 591 thousand tons.
This statistic shows the total assets of Sears Canada from 2010 to 2016. Sears Canada had total assets amounting to approximately 1.25 billion Canadian dollars in 2016.

The timeline displays the household average expenditure on fresh squid in France from 2009 to 2018. It shows that the average expenditure rose by almost two euros over this period of time. In 2018, French households spent 11.10 euros per kilogram of fresh squid on average, compared to 8 euros per kilogram in 2009.

This statistic shows the annual breakdown of sales volume of fresh seafoods in France from 2009 to 2020, by retailer. It reveals that hyper and supermarkets accounted for the majority of the sales volume of fresh seafoods, with a share of 96.7 percent in 2020.
Leon's Furniture Limited had a total of 234 Leon's Furniture Limited stores in Canada in 2020. Meanwhile, Leon's Brick Outlet had 7 stores in the country that year.
Leon's Furniture Limited had a total of 272 stores across Canada as of December 31, 2020. Ontario was home to the most stores, with 128, followed by Alberta with 58.

The production value of the wearing apparel manufacturing industry in Czechia decreased by 24.9 million euros in 2020 in comparison to the previous year. Therefore, the production value declined to 696.8 million euros in 2020. This decrease was preceded by an increasing production value in this industry. In general, the production value has been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

This statistic shows the value of organic and ecological vegetable seed in Canada in 2012, by region. In Ontario, approximately 6.5 million Canadian dollars worth of organic and ecological vegetable seed was produced in 2012.

During the time of the coronavirus pandemic, global consumers seem rather positive about brands keeping in touch. In March 2020 they were asked how brands are responding to the crisis, and more than half of respondents said that brands are communicating well. The survey revealed that in Australia and Brazil consumers felt brands were doing the most they could to respond to the outbreak, whereas consumers in Germany and Japan thought brands were doing the least.

The production value of the wearing apparel manufacturing industry in Switzerland decreased by 51.9 million euros since the previous year. Therefore, the production value declined to 787.5 million euros in 2018. In general, the production value has been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Panama from 1986 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. Gross domestic product ( GDP ) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2020, Panama's gross domestic product amounted to around 30.66 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows annual production value of the manufacture of wearing apparel industry in Malta from 2009 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of this industry came to approximately 7.4 million euros.
This statistic shows the most important import partners for Panama in 2019. In 2019, the most important import partner for Panama was China with a share of 21 percent in all imports.

This timeline displays an overview of the household purchase value of chilled fish and seafood from discounters in France from 2009 to 2018. It shows that the purchase value gradually increased over this period of time, going from roughly 177 million euros in 2009 to over 283 million euros in 2018.

The statistic shows the distribution of employment in Panama by economic sector from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, 15.01 percent of the employees in Panama were active in the agricultural sector, 18.12 percent in industry and 67.09 percent in the service sector.

This statistic shows the distribution of the frozen fish and seafood market value in France from 2009 to 2020, by distribution channel. It reveals that supermarkets and hypermarkets consistently held the highest share of the market value over this period of time.

Between 2008 and 2019, the value of whole milk powder imported to France increased by more than 40 million euros. In 2019, the import value of whole milk powder amounted to 120 million euros, compared to an estimated 45 million euros in 2008.

The statistic shows Ethiopia's share in the global gross domestic product ( GDP ) adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity ( PPP ) from 2016 to 2026. In 2020, Ethiopia's share in the global gross domestic product adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity amounted to approximately 0.06 percent.
This statistic shows the population change in Ethiopia from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, Ethiopia's population increased by approximately 2.54 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic presents the distribution of hours watched on Twitch worldwide in February 2022, broken down by game. According to the source, League of Legends accounted for 14.7 percent of the time spent watching on Twitch in the measured period.
This statistic shows the age structure in Lebanon from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 24.93 percent of Lebanon's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

In 2019, the number of bullfighting events and other bull festivals in Spain amounted to 1,431, down from 1,528 a year earlier. The most common of these activities is Spanish-style bullfights or corridas, which make up about half of these events. Other festivals involving cattle, such as the widely known San Fermin celebrations in Pamplona, account for approximately a quarter of bull events.

This statistic presents the number of inbound foreign tourist arrivals in France in 2018, by continent of residence. That year, there were approximately seven million foreign tourists from Africa in France.

In the first half of 2020, the European Union received a total of 84.9 thousand asylum applications. The European country with the most applications in the first half of 2020 was Germany, with 76.6 thousand applications. Hungary, Italy, and Sweden rounded out the top five countries with the most asylum applications in this time period.
In 2020 there were 652 illegal border crossings detected on the Eastern route to the European Union through the borders of the EU, compared with the lowest number recorded in the last decade in 2009.
In 2020 there were 22,819 illegal border-crossings recorded on the Western African route to the European Union through the Canary Islands, the highest number of crossings since 2009.

The statistic shows the leading U.S. second screen devices used while watching TV and digital video streamed on TV as of January 2017. During the survey period, it was found that 35 percent of respondents who used a smartphone while watching TV also used a computer for the same purpose.

The statistic shows Libya's budget balance in relation to GDP between 2016 and 2019, with projections up until 2026. A positive value indicates a budget surplus, a negative value indicates a deficit. In 2019, Libya's budget surplus amounted to around 20.21 percent of GDP.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Libya from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Libya amounted to 2.21 children per woman.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Belgium from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 98.42 percent of Belgium's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

The coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Switzerland has led to restrictions on daily life for the population. Based on a survey conducted in the country in October 2021, 32 percent of respondents were spending more time with their families and partners, compared to 35 percent in March 2020. The effects on the population's social life, however, are more significant. In October 2021, 41 percent of respondents reported having fewer friends.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Ecuador from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 64.19 percent of Ecuador's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This is a line graph titled Semi-trailers : new registrations in France from 2004 to 2017. On the x-axis, Year is drawn. New trailer registrations is drawn on a linear scale from 0 to 25,000 on the y-axis. Semi-trailers were at their highest registration in 2008. Semi-trailers were at their lowest registration in 2010.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Finland from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 85.51 percent of Finland's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Malaysia from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 77.16 percent of Malaysia's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in New Zealand from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 86.71 percent of New Zealand's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in Romania from 2010 to 2020. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2020, 54.19 percent of Romania's total population lived in urban areas and cities.

The statistic shows the results of a survey concerned with the question whether the survey respondents try to include or avoid organic foods in their diet. 44 percent of the respondents said that they do not try to include or avoid organic foods.

This statistic shows the share of residents who agree or disagree that food trucks compete with restaurants in Toronto as of April 2014, by gender. During the survey, 32 percent of female respondents said they thought food trucks competed with restaurants in Toronto.

This statistic shows the amount of waste sent to different treatment methods by local authority in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2016/17 and 2017/18. Waste sent to incineration or energy recovery increased from 166,000 tonnes in 2016/17 to 374,000 tonnes in 2017/18.

This statistic shows the distribution of the United Kingdom ( UK ) government's energy and climate change spending budget in 2014 and 2016. The majority of spending was directed towards the Department for Business, Innovation and Skills with 3.3 billion British pounds in 2014/15 and 3.3 billion in 2015/16.

The coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Switzerland has led to restrictions on contact between people and larger gatherings being cancelled. Based on a survey conducted among the Swiss population in February 2022, 40 percent responded they felt more friendly towards others, compared to the previous year.

This statistic displays the age-standardised rate of cancer per 100,000 population in 2012. In this year, the highest rate of cancer was in Belgium with approximately 337 people per 100,000 population diagnosed.

This statistic shows the distribution of French tourists'outbound trips in 2014, by travel companion. It reveals that more than 40 percent of French tourists went on an international trip with their partner, without children.

This statistic shows the sales volume of wine in British Columbia ( BC ) from 2012/13 to 2018/19. The sales volume of wine in the Canadian province of British Columbia reached approximately 76.38 million liters in the fiscal year ending March 2019.
This statistic represents Canada's aerospace exports in 2013, with a breakdown by region. In 2013, about 20 percent of Canada's aerospace exports went to Europe.

This statistic shows the retail sales of the beer import market in British Columbia ( BC ) in the fourth quarter of 2019/20, by region. Retail sales of imported beer in the Canadian province of British Columbia amounted to approximately 23.1 million Canadian dollars in the fourth quarter of 2019/20.

This statistic shows the revenues of school boards in Canada in 2018, distinguished by the source of funds. In 2018, school boards received 46.5 billion Canadian dollars from the Canadian government, including the Canada School Board Foundation.

This statistic shows the sales volume of domestic cider in British Columbia ( BC ) from 2011 to 2015, by type. The sales volume of domestic packaged cider in the Canadian province of British Columbia reached approximately 12.68 million liters in 2015.

This statistic shows the leading types of spirits sold in British Columbia ( BC ) in the fiscal year ending March 2021, by sales volume. According to the report, vodka was the leading spirit sold in the Canadian province of British Columbia with approximately 9.7 million liters sold in the fiscal year ended March 2021.

This statistic shows the volume distribution of the wine import market in British Columbia ( BC ) in the first quarter of 2015, by country. According to the report, approximately 24 percent of the wine imported into British Columbia in the first quarter of 2015 was from the United States.

This statistic shows the categories with the largest consumer spending decrease in Canada in the 4th quarter 2015. Gas and convenience stores saw the largest decrease in consumer spending with a decrease of 6.1 percent in the last quarter of 2015.

Due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak in Switzerland, the population is spending more time at home. As a consequence, shopping malls and public transport are getting less footfall. Based on a survey conducted in the country in March 2020, 19 percent of respondents were currently spending more time outside their household than before the outbreak.

The statistic shows the ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Oman from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, government expenditure in Oman amounted to about 53.62 percent of the country's gross domestic product.
This statistic shows the revenue of Pandora A/S worldwide in 2020, by region. In 2020, Pandora A/S generated 4.5 billion Danish kroner in the United States.

This statistic presents the distribution of the total budget of French tourists for holidays in the Euro zone in 2014, by type of payment. It appears that French tourists spent more than 40 percent of their budget for holidays in France.

This statistic shows the sales volume of grapefruit and pomelo in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2018. The sales volume of grapefruit and pomelo decreased between 2009 and 2013, according to historical data. By 2018 the sales volume of grapefruit and pomelo is expected to reach 29.3 thousand tonnes.

This statistic shows the sales volume of cherries in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2018. The sales volume of cherries decreased between 2009 and 2013, according to historical data. In 2018 the sales volume of cherries is expected to reach 16.2 thousand tonnes.

This statistic shows the average inflation rate in Azerbaijan from 1996 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the average inflation rate in Azerbaijan amounted to about 2.83 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic shows the distribution of employment in Azerbaijan by economic sector from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, 35.6 percent of the employees in Azerbaijan were active in the agricultural sector, 15.1 percent in industry and 49.04 percent in the service sector.

This statistic shows the volume of fresh kohlrabi imported in Canada from 2008 to 2017. In 2017, approximately 33,863 metric tons of fresh kohlrabi were imported to Canada, a decrease from around 34,490 metric tons the previous year.
In the period from 2000 to 2019, the share of high-speed rail transport among all rail passenger transport in Italy increased steadily, from 37.2 percent to 39.2 percent.
This statistic shows the most important export partner countries for Azerbaijan in 2017. In 2017, the most important export partner of Azerbaijan was Italy, with a share of 28 percent in exports.

The coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Switzerland has generated a large amount of online interest in the population's daily life and in the media. Based on a selection of online media reports and Google searches, the following statistic shows how interest in the coronavirus has developed in Switzerland from January to March 2020. While media reports were relatively modestly covered, search interest peaked in late February at the height of the outbreak.
This statistic presents data on the volume of cheese consumed per capita in the European Union from 2007 to 2012. In 2011 the volume of cheese consumed amounted to 17.3 kilograms per capita.

This statistic provides data on the value of kidney and white pea beans exported from Canada to the European Union's 28 countries from 2009 to 2013. In 2012, approximately 79.7 million Canadian dollars worth of kidney and white pea beans were exported from Canada to the 28 countries of the EU.

The statistic shows the ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Zambia from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, government expenditure in Zambia amounted to about 31.79 percent of the country's gross domestic product.

The statistic shows Zambia's budget balance in relation to GDP between 2016 and 2020, with projections up until 2026. A positive value indicates a budget surplus, a negative value indicates a deficit. In 2020, Zambia's budget deficit amounted to around 13.06 percent of GDP.
This statistic shows the life expectancy at birth in Zambia from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy at birth in Zambia was 63.95 years.
This statistic shows the population change in Zambia from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, Zambia's population increased by approximately 2.89 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in Nicaragua from 1996 to 2026. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2020, the estimated GDP per capita in Nicaragua amounted to around 1,929.66 U.S. dollars.

In 2019, there were about 24.8 million children in the United States, aged between 0 and 5 years. On the other hand, there were about 25.1 million children in the country, aged between 12 and 17 years.
In 2019, about 13.5 percent of the U.S. population were children. This is a decrease from a peak of about 14.3 percent in 1970.

This statistic provides data on pulses exported from Canada to the European Union's 28 countries, as a share of world exports, from 2009 to 2013. In 2012, approximately 0.5 percent of pulses exported from Canada to the world were exported to the EU-28 countries.

This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in France in March 2020 on the frequency at which people leave their homes during the lockdown period due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). It shows that more than half of the respondents left their homes once a week on average during the lockdown period.
This statistic shows the age structure in Nicaragua from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 29.51 percent of Nicaragua's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

This statistic shows the number of gift cards given annually by consumers in Canada as of July 2015, by age group. During the survey, four percent of respondents aged between 55 and 64 years answered that they gave six to ten gift cards as presents, tokens of appreciation or prizes annually.

This statistic provides data on the value of mung beans imported to the European Union's 28 countries from 2009 to 2013. In 2013, approximately 32 million Canadian dollars worth of mung beans were imported to the 28 countries of the EU.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Nicaragua from 1950 to 2050 *.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups ; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median age of the Nicaragua population was 25.1 years.

This statistic provides data on the value of red adzuki beans imported to the European Union's 28 countries from 2009 to 2013. In 2013, approximately 3.5 million Canadian dollars worth of red adzuki beans were imported to the 28 countries of the EU.

This statistic represents the number of new products with pea ingredients launched in Spain from 2010 to 2014. In 2013 there were a total of 39 new pea ingredient products launched in Spain, the highest in the five year period.

This statistic shows the national debt of Mali from 2016 to 2019 in relation to the gross domestic product ( GDP ), with projections up until 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2019, the national debt of Mali amounted to approximately 40.88 percent of the GDP.

This statistic shows the value of gift cards given annually by consumers in Canada as of July 2015, by gender. During the survey, nine percent of the female respondents answered that they gave gift cards worth 201 to 300 Canadian dollars annually.

This statistic shows the number of footwear manufacturing establishments in Canada as of December 2020, by employment size. As of December 2020, there were 23 micro footwear manufacturing establishments in Canada, each employing between one and four employees.

This statistic shows the main reasons for returning back to the same holiday place on the same holiday for residents of Latvia in 2015. 49 percent of Latvian holidaymakers said that they chose to go to the same holiday destination they had previously visited.
In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most of the Polish respondents are worried about their families'health and the general economic situation.

This statistic shows the travel information sources that residents of Latvia considered to be the most important when making holiday plans in 2015. Based on figures from the European Commission, recommendations of friends, colleagues or relatives were the most considered sources for 63 percent of respondents, while 6 percent contacted travel agencies or tourism offices.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the manufacture of leather and related products industry in Poland from 2008 to 2016. In 2016, this industry had personnel costs of approximately 183.3 million euros.

This statistic shows the holiday type habits of residents of Hungary in 2015. 63 percent of Hungarian holidaymakers stayed on holiday for up to 3 consecutive nights. 61 percent of Hungarian holidaymakers went on short-stay trips of up to 3 consecutive nights away from home.
The statistic depicts the world's largest sailing yachts as of 2019, by length. 'Viking'was the largest sailing yacht in the world with a length of 142 meters.

This statistic presents data on the retail sales value of drinking milk in Germany from 2009 to 2018. In 2013, the retail sales value of milk amounted to approximately four billion U.S. dollars, according to historic retail figures. This is expected to increase further by 2018.

This statistic shows the holiday package travel preferences of residents of Luxembourg in 2015. 33 percent of respondents went on an all-inclusive holiday, while 25 percent went on a holiday with transport and accommodation.

This statistic shows the number of personal goods merchant wholesalers in Canada as of December 2016, by region. There were 1,746 personal goods merchant wholesalers in the province of Ontario as of December 2016.

This statistic shows the number of jewelry and watch merchant wholesalers in Canada as of December 2020, by region. There were 217 jewelry and watch merchant wholesalers in the province of Ontario as of December 2020.
This statistic shows the total population of Peru from 2016 to 2026. In 2019, the total population of Peru was estimated at approximately 33.23 million inhabitants.
This statistic shows the life expectancy at birth in Peru from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy at birth in Peru was 76.75 years.

A recent survey from IPSOS found that an increasing share of people worldwide feel it will be unlikely that they will personally travel to China in the next year due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. This statistic shows the percentage of respondents worldwide who felt it likely or unlikely they will personally travel to China in the next year as of February 9, 2020, by country.

As of March 2020, toilet paper and disinfectant wipes were completely out of stock in 91.2 percent of selected retail stores. The out-of-stock rate was calculated by dividing the number of `` completely out-of-stock '' shelves by the total number of shelves audited.

This statistic displays the distribution of leather goods imports to Portugal in 2017, by country of origin. In 2017, Spain was the leading import partner in terms of leather goods with a share of 27.8 percent in all imports.

This statistic shows the number of students enrolled in dramatic art schools in Spain from the school year 2005/2006 to 2016/2017. During the last school year under review, the number of students enrolled in drama and art schools in Spain amounted to over 2.5 thousand.

This statistic shows the number of students enrolled in language schools in Spain from the school year 2005/2006 to 2016/2017. As of the last year, the number of individuals enrolled in language schools in Spain amounted to approximately 434 thousand students.

This statistic shows the number of students who completed their training in the field of arts and design in Spain from 2005 to 2018, according to the type of training and the level of education. In 2017-2018, a total number of 6,857 students graduated from an arts and design higher education program in Spain.

This statistic displays the manufacture of opium alkaloids and their derivatives in the United States from 2014 to 2019, by type. In 2014, there were almost 1,600 kilograms of morphine manufactured in the country. That number has decreased to around 1,300 kilograms in 2019.

This statistic displays the stroke mortality in U.S. adults aged 45 years and over in the period 2010-2013, by ethnicity and gender. During this time, there were around 101 stroke deaths per 100,000 population among non-Hispanic white men aged 45 years and over.
This statistic shows the value-added per employee of Canada's railroad rolling stock manufacturing industry in 2004 and 2012. In 2004, this industry added about 106,000 Canadian dollars per employee.

This statistic shows the stroke death rate among adults aged 45 and over in the U.S. between 2010 and 2013, by level of urbanization. The death rate for stroke in the most urbanized part of the United States was 112 per 100,000 population.

This statistic shows the number of optical goods stores in Canada as of June 2021, by region. There were 413 optical goods stores in the province of Ontario as of June 2021, compared to just one in Prince Edward Island.
As of December 2021, there were 880 micro food health supplement stores in Canada, each employing between one and four employees. Moreover, there were 390 stores with five to nine employees.

The most mentioned topic on Russian social media on March 9 and March 10, 2020, was the depreciation of the Russian ruble, as per 24 percent of respondents. The second most popular theme was the discussion of the government measures to prevent the further devaluation of the currency, named by 23 percent of participants.

This statistic shows the leading tour operators in Europe ranked by group revenue figures in 2012 and 2014. TUI and Thomas Cook topped the list, with TUI showing 18.5 billion euros in revenue and Thomas Cook following with 10.9 billion euros in 2014.
The value of alcoholic beverages imported into Sweden increased from 2010 to 2020. The value of alcoholic beverages imported into Sweden was measured at around 11.6 billion Swedish kronor in 2020.
The value of alcoholic beverage exports from Sweden fluctuated from 2010 to 2020. The value of alcoholic beverages exported from Sweden was measured at 5.3 billion Swedish kronor in 2020.

This statistic presents data on the retail sales value of drinking milk in France from 2009 to 2018. In 2013, the retail sales value of milk amounted to approximately 3.29 billion U.S. dollars, according to historic retail figures. This is expected to increase to over 3.55 billion U.S. dollars in 2018.

This statistic shows the natural gas prices for household end users in the 28 European Union member countries from 2010 to the first half of 2018, in euro cents per kilowatt-hour. In the first half of 2018, the average natural gas price for households was 5.92 euro cents per kWh.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in Madagascar from 1986 to 2026. All figures are estimates. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2020, the estimated GDP per capita in Madagascar amounted to around 464.29 U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows Madagascar's share in the global gross domestic product ( GDP ) adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity ( PPP ) from 2016 to 2026. In 2020, Madagascar's share in the global gross domestic product adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity was estimated to amount to approximately 0.03 percent.

The statistic shows Madagascar's budget balance in relation to GDP between 2016 and 2020, with projections up until 2026. A positive value indicates a budget surplus, a negative value indicates a deficit. In 2020, Madagascar's budget deficit amounted to around 5.66 percent of GDP.
