This statistic shows the shopping locations used by female shoppers in the past three months in Canada as of May 2012. During the survey, 87 percent of the female respondents said they had shopped at a supermarket in the past three months.
This statistic shows the age structure in Madagascar from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, about 39.65 percent of Madagascar's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.

The first death caused by the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Poland was reported on 4 March. Since then, the number of deaths has been increasing, reaching its peak on January 11, 2022. The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in the country reached over 4.7 million on January 11, 2022.

This statistic shows the share of economic sectors in the gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Madagascar from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the share of agriculture in Madagascar's gross domestic product was 23.59 percent, industry contributed approximately 19.58 percent and the services sector contributed about 49.6 percent.

This statistic displays the revenue distribution of the pharmacy market in Germany in 2020. Prescription drugs garnered the largest part amounting to approximately 25.3 billion euros. The second largest revenue generating area were biopharmaceuticals at 9.5 billion euros.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) per capita in El Salvador from 1986 to 2019, with projections up until 2026. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the GDP per capita in El Salvador amounted to around 4,091.55 U.S. dollars.

The number of patents in the biotechnology sector in Denmark fluctuated during the period from 2011 to 2018. The highest number of patents was obtained in 2014, with a total of 195 patents. The number of patents in the biotechnology sector in Denmark decreased to a total of 173 patents in 2018.

This statistic illustrates the trend in sale value turnover of shops selling beverages in the Netherlands annually from 2007 to 2017. The turnover value of Dutch beverage stores showed a gradual decline between 2011 and 2016. In 2017, the turnover value increased again.

The statistic shows the ratio of government expenditure to gross domestic product ( GDP ) in El Salvador from 2016 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, government expenditure in El Salvador amounted to about 32.75 percent of the country's gross domestic product.

The statistic shows the distribution of employment in El Salvador by economic sector from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, 17.51 percent of the employees in El Salvador were active in the agricultural sector, 21.62 percent in industry and 61.19 percent in the service sector.

Since 2005, the gross minimum hourly wage in France has been gradually increasing. In December 2005, the gross minimum hourly wage in France amounted to 8.02 euros. Fourteen years later the hourly minimum wage increased by two euros, reaching 10.5 euros. In 2020, France had an average annual wage higher than countries like Spain and Italy, but lower than those in Germany or in the United Kingdom.

This statistic shows the retail sales of filled biscuits in Canada from 2006 to 2016. Retail sales of filled biscuits amounted to approximately 27.9 million Canadian dollars in 2006 and were forecasted to fall to 22.1 million Canadian dollars in 2012.

This statistic shows the sales volume of packaged or industrial cakes in Canada from 2006 to 2016. The retail sales volume of packaged/industrial cakes amounted to approximately 32 thousand metric tons in 2006.

How much advertising revenue do you expect to lose in April 2020 due to the coronavirus situation in Norway? A survey from March 2020 found that nearly one third of the local newspaper companies in Norway expected to lose between 75 and 90 percent of their advertising revenue. 11 percent of the respondents even said to expect to lose more than 90 percent of their advertising revenue.

The statistic presents the distribution of gamers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) as of May 2021, broken down by gender. According to the findings, women accounted for just under 40 percent of all gamers in the UK.
This statistic displays the number of practicing nurses employed in the health sector in Austria from 2000 to 2019. The number of nurses employed in Austria increased to over 92 thousand in 2019.

The income of Empire Company Limited in Canada fluctuated significantly from 2013 to 2020. In 2013, the company had an income of 500 million Canadian dollars, which increased to 700 million in 2014. However, the income dropped to 300 million in 2016 and further decreased to 600 million in 2017. In 2018 and 2019, the income increased again to 700 and 800 million Canadian dollars respectively. However, in 2020, the income took a negative turn and reached 1.5 billion Canadian dollars, which was a decrease from the previous year.

This statistic shows the annual volume of turbip produced in Spain from 2014 to 2019, in thousand tonnes. 2016 ranked as the year with the highest production of this type of products with around 82 thousand tonnes produced.

This statistic illustrates how many Ford Fiesta passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2001 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Ford Fiesta was observed in 2015, when over 130,000 units were newly registered. In 2019, this figure had declined to some 76,423 units registered for the first time.

This statistic presents the distribution of active Pinterest users who have children in the United States as of April 2015, sorted by age group. During the survey period, it was found that 39 percent of active Pinterest users with children were aged between 3 and 7 years.

This statistic presents the share of active Pinterest users who use Pinterest instead of doing other activities in the United States as of April 2015, sorted by gender. During the survey period, it was found that 40 percent of active female pinners used Pinterest instead of watching television.

This statistic presents the categories active males pinners and acitve females pinners make promoted pin purchases in the United States as of April 2015. During the survey period, it was found that 49 percent of active male pinners made promoted pin purchases from the fashion and clothing category.

This statistic displays the consumption of alimentary tract and metabolism pharmaceuticals in Hungary from 2000 to 2020. The defined daily dosage of alimentary tract and metabolism pharmaceuticals has increased over this period and amounted to 376.2 per 1,000 inhabitants per day in 2020.

This statistic displays the consumption of alimentary tract and metabolism pharmaceuticals in Italy from 2011 to 2020. In 2020, the defined daily dosage of alimentary tract and metabolism pharmaceuticals amounted to 175.8 per 1,000 inhabitants per day.

This statistic presents an estimate of the economic impact of the coronavirus crisis in the Spanish region of Andalusia, broken down by province in 2020. According to the forecasts, the economic impact of the coronavirus crisis in Andalusia will amount to approximately 902 million euros, of which almost 360 million will be generated in the province of Sevilla.

This statistic shows the catalog, mail order and telephone sales of independent retailers in Canada from 2010 to 2012. In 2010, catalog, mail order and telephone sales of independent retailers amounted to 3.57 billion Canadian dollars, growing to 4.06 billion Canadian dollars the following year.

This statistic displays the number of individuals employed in the health and social care sector in Czechia from 2000 to 2019. In 2019 there were approximately 363 thousand employees in the health and social care sector, an increase from previous years.

This statistic displays the number of individuals employed in the health and social care sector in Greece from 2000 to 2019. In 2019 there were approximately 269 thousand employees in the health and social care sector, an increase from previous years.

This statistic shows the accommodation choices of French residents for the summer 2015, by region. It reveals that the majority of respondents from the South-East region of France planned to stay in a hotel, while more than half of those from the North-East region of France intended to stay with friends.

This statistic displays the number of individuals employed in the health and social care sector in Russia from 2000 to 2014. In 2014 there were approximately 5.6 million employees in the health and social care sector, an increase from previous years.

The number of individuals employed in the health and social care sector in Iceland increased over the period from 2009 to 2020. The number peaked in 2020, when around 25.8 thousand individuals were employed in the health and social care sector.

This statistic displays the number of general practitioners ( GPs ) employed in the health sector in Poland from 2000 to 2017. In 2017 there were approximately 8.3 thousand general practitioners employed in the healthcare sector in Poland, the highest amount in the provided time interval.

This statistic displays the number of general practitioners ( GPs ) employed in the health sector in Spain from 2005 to 2018. In 2018 there were over 35.8 thousand general practitioners employed in the healthcare sector in Spain, the highest number in the provided time interval.

This statistic displays the number of general practitioners ( GPs ) employed in the health sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2000 to 2020. In 2020, there were over 52 thousand general practitioners employed in the healthcare sector in the UK.
The number of psychiatrists employed in Denmark generally increased since 2008. The number grew from 944 psychiatrists in 2008, up to 1,099 in 2018.

In the week ending March 14, 2020, toilet paper sales in Canada increased by 732 percent compared to the same week in 2019. Other personal care and cleaning products which experienced a surge in sales due to the coronavirus outbreak included masks and gloves, bathroom tissue and personal wipes.

This statistic shows the number of feed cattle marketings in Canada from 2000 to 2016, by type. In 2015, there were approximately 2,200 slaughtered feed cattle in Canada, down from 2,300 the previous year.

This statistic displays the number of practicing midwives employed in the health sector in Luxembourg from 2000 to 2017. Luxembourg has seen an increase in the number of practicing midwives employed in the health sector, with 205 midwives employed in 2017.

This statistic shows the criminal use of explosives in Canada in 2014, by incident. In 2014, there were 63 incidents of criminal use of explosives in Canada, of which 27 were related to criminal activity and 8 were incidents of accidental bombing.

As of March 2020, there was a total of 1,859 thousand barrels worth of oil and gas that were no longer in use and had to be disposed of. The source states that the oil and gas company, Occidental Petroleum, had to dispose of this amount of crude oil and natural gas liquids in order to comply with the oil spill containment cap.

This statistic provides information on the number of internet users in Saudi Arabia from 2015 to 2019 and a forecast up to 2025. In 2019, Saudi Arabia had 28.5 million internet users. This figure is projected to grow to 36.8 million internet users in 2025.

This statistic shows the share of educational institutions with internet connection in Spain from 2009/10 to 2016/17. In 2016/17, 95.9 percent of educational institutions in Spain had internet connection.
This statistic shows the total number of jobs in Canada in 2020, distinguished by industry. In 2020, there were 1.55 million construction workers employed or self-employed in Canada.

This statistic illustrates how many Nissan Qashqai passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2007 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Nissan Qashqai was observed in 2016, when over 63 thousand units were newly registered. In 2019, sales figures amounted to 52,371 units.

This statistic illustrates how many Audi A3 passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2001 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Audi A3 was observed in 2015, when over 42 thousand units were newly registered. In 2019, sales figures amounted to 17,448 units.

This statistic illustrates how many Range Rover Evoque passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2001 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Range Rover Evoque was observed in 2019, when over 51,000 units were newly registered.

In 2021, the majority of respondents in Central and Eastern Europe ( CEE ) were of the opinion that their companies'revenue would grow in the next three years. This was a significant increase compared to the previous year, when only 26 percent of respondents were confident about the future growth of their companies.

This statistic illustrates how many Peugeot 208 passenger cars were registered for the first time annually in Great Britain, between 2012 and 2019. A peak in sales of the Peugeot 208 was observed in 2013, when over 37 thousand units were newly registered. In 2019, sales figures amounted to 20,371 units.

This statistic shows the wireless access worldwide as of June 2015, by device. During the survey period, it was found that 82 percent of the Wi-Fi access points worldwide were able to connect smartphones.

This statistic displays the greenhouse gas emissions in metric kilotons of carbon dioxide equivalent from the land-use, land-use change forestry ( LULUCF ) sector in Northern Ireland ( United Kingdom ) in 2014. In 2014, the greenhouse gas emissions from the LULUCF sector in Northern Ireland was 687 metric kilotons of carbon dioxide equivalent.

This statistic displays the number of dentists employed in the health sector in Germany from 2000 to 2019. In 2019 there were over 71 thousand dentists employed in the healthcare sector in Germany, an increase from previous years.

The number of dentists employed in Iceland fluctuated during the period from 2000 to 2020. The number peaked in 2008 with 301 dentists and dropped to its lowest point in 2011 with 270 dentists. In 2020, there were 290 dentists employed in Iceland.

This statistic displays the number of dentists employed in the health sector in Luxembourg from 2000 to 2017. In 2017 there were 581 dentists employed in the healthcare sector in Luxembourg, the highest number in the provided time interval.
The number of pharmacists employed in Denmark generally increased since 2000. The number grew from around 2,200 pharmacists in 2000, up to around 3,200 pharmacists in 2018.

This statistic shows the biggest online threats to older relatives according to internet users worldwide as of June 2015. During the survey period, 52 percent of respondents stated that they were afraid of getting infected with a virus or malware when using the internet.

The statistic presents information on the expected duration of time of social media usage and implementation according to global professionals in 2014. During the survey period, 31 percent of respondents stated that their social media usage and implementation would last for up to two years.

This statistic shows the volume of radioactive waste produced by the non-nuclear industry in France in 2016, by type of waste in cubic meters. That year, the French non-nuclear industry produced more than 20,000 cubic meters of radioactive waste.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, almost 40 percent of Polish respondents had to set up their office in the living room or another room in the house. Every third respondent needed a separate office, and every fourth needed a combined office and a private space.

This statistic shows the annual value of residential property purchase transactions carried in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2014. There was a sharp reduction in transaction values at the beginning of housing market and credit crisis in 2008, when the value of transactions fell from 334.7 billion in 2007 to 182.6 billion British pounds following year. By 2014, the transactions value recovered and reached 282.6 billion British pounds.

This statistic shows the value of property purchase transactions carried in the public sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2014. The value of transactions fell in 2008 to approximately 1.6 billion British pounds, but recovered in the following years, reaching nearly 3.3 billion in 2014.

This statistic shows the annual value of property purchase transactions carried out by financial institutions in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2005 to 2014. There was a sharp reduction in transaction values at the beginning of housing market and credit crisis in 2008, when the value of property purchase transactions fell from 12.6 billion in 2006 to 5.6 billion British pounds in 2008. By 2014, the transactions value recovered and reached a total of 7.7 billion British pounds.

This statistic presents the most commonly experienced financial threats by internet users worldwide as of June 2015. During the survey period, it was found that 20 percent of respondents had received anonymous or unsolicited e-mails or messages claiming to be from a bank or other financial institution.

In 2020, the trade balance of services of Canada with the United States amounted to a trade deficit of 3.5 billion Canadian dollars. This means that Canada imports more from the United States than it exports to the United States.

This bar chart shows the number of powered road goods vehicles registered in Slovenia that travelled by ferry from United Kingdom ( UK ) ports to mainland Europe between 2009 and 2017. A total of nine thousand Slovenian goods vehicles travelled to mainland Europe in 2012, which accounted for 1.08 percent of all goods vehicles that travelled by ferry to the continent that year. In 2016, the number decreased to eight thousand.

This bar chart shows the number of powered road goods vehicles registered in Bulgaria that travelled by ferry from United Kingdom ( UK ) ports to mainland Europe between 2009 and 2017. A total of 28 thousand Bulgarian goods vehicles travelled to mainland Europe in 2012, which accounted for 1.21 percent of all goods vehicles that travelled by ferry to the continent that year. In 2016 this had increased to 80 thousand.

This statistic presents the sentiments of adults in the United Kingdom ( UK ) towards the government's proposal to force developers to build more homes, as of 2014. The majority of respondents - 36 percent - tended to disagree that the government should force developers to build more homes.
This statistic shows the gross domestic product ( GDP ) of Canada in 2018, distinguished by major industry. In 2018, the GDP of the construction industry in Canada was 173.2 billion Canadian dollars.
This statistic shows the real Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of Canada in 2020, distinguished by province. In 2020, Ontario's real GDP was 710.4 billion chained 2012 Canadian dollars.

The number of specialist doctors in the field of sanitary and epidemiological group in Russia reached approximately 13.7 thousand in 2020, marking a slight increase from the previous year. In the period under consideration, the highest number of specialists in epidemiology and hygiene was recorded in 1995, at over 34.3 thousand.

This statistic presents the expectations of the British adult population with regards to the actions that they believe the government should take in response to empty homes in the United Kingdom ( UK ) as of 2014. A total of 66 percent of respondents believed that the government should make it compulsory for owners to let their empty homes be occupied, and a further 50 percent wanted the government to impose a tax on empty homes.

The statistic shows a breakdown of the Rugby Football Union ( RFU ) income in England from 2014/15 to 2020/21. The income from ticket sales accounted for 55.1 million British pounds in the 2019/20 season.

This statistic depicts foreign affiliate sales of goods and services in Canada in 2017, distinguished by country or region. In 2017, Canadian-owned foreign affiliates generated sales of about 393.5 billion Canadian dollars in the United States.

This bar chart shows the total number of registered cars in Great Britain ( UK ) with carbon dioxide emission levels between 201 and 225 grams per kilometer from 2001 to 2017. In terms of emissions-based vehicle tax, these cars fall under band K, although this category also includes older vehicles with higher emissions figures. The number of cars in this emission band grew steadily over the observed time period, until 2012 when the number of cars with these emission levels began to decline. In 2017, there were still over one million vehicles with carbon dioxide emissions between 201 and 225 grams per kilometer registered in Great Britain.

This statistic displays the share of individuals who visit a dentist regularly in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. According to the data, 69 percent of individuals in Scotland and Wales regularly visit the dentist.
This statistic shows the number of full-time workers in Canada in 2019, distinguished by province. In 2019, around 4.76 million people were employed on a full-time basis in Ontario.

This statistic illustrates the percentage of the total licensed cars in Great Britain that fell into the 131 to 140 grams per kilometer carbon dioxide emission band between 2001 and 2017. For the purposes of vehicle taxation, this category is known as Band E. In 2017, cars in this emission band accounted for 9.9 percent of the total licensed car stock in Great Britain.

This statistic depicts the percentage distribution of after-tax income in Canada in 2019, based on the income level. In 2019, income earners in the top 20 percent earned 12.5 percent of all after-tax income in Canada.

This statistic shows the leading home system upgrades among homeowners who renovated in Canada in 2017. During the survey, some 31 percent of the respondents said that they had upgraded their plumbing system during their last renovation.

This statistic shows the likelihood of consumers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) to be influenced by the energy efficiency of a product when shopping around, as of 2014. The survey showed that 43 percent of respondents agreed strongly that they were more likely to look at a product's energy efficiency if it was the best deal, while a further 35 percent agreed to some extent that they were more likely to consider a product's energy efficiency if it was on offer for a particular deal.

The number of requests for driving routes on the Apple Maps application in Russia increased by nearly 60 percent on March 19, 2021 compared to the previous day. The service resumed working on March 20, 2020 after a two-day shutdown.
This statistic depicts the median annual family income in Canada from 2000 to 2018. In 2018, the median annual family income in Canada was 87,930 Canadian dollars.

This statistic displays the distribution of long term empty dwellings in England as of 2014, by region. Long term empty dwellings are defined as dwelling which were empty for longer than six months. The majority of long term empty dwellings were found in the North East of England, at 14 percent.

This statistic displays the total sales value of small retail businesses ( excluding automotive fuel sales ) in Great Britain monthly from January 2017 to December 2021. The amount spent in small retailers reached approximately 11.6 billion British pounds in December 2021.

This statistic displays the results of a survey question asking UK consumers which hot beverage types they drink most often in 2015. Of respondents, 44 percent drink tea most often, followed by 21 percent who drink instant coffee. Hot drinks have always played an important role in British culture, particularly in the case of tea, as seen in the high and rising market value of hot drinks. Recently, however, the increasing popularity of coffee has dented sales of tea, turning Brits into a nation of coffee drinkers. This has been furthered exaggerated by cheaper and easier access to premium coffee via the likes of coffee pod machines. Tea is also making a new name for itself, however, with loose leaf tea, as well as fruit and herbal teas, appealing to the many that are improving their eating habits and following current health and wellness trends.

This statistic shows the monthly export value of farm and fishing products in Canada from January 2015 to March 2021. In March 2021, exports of farm and fishing products from Canada amounted to approximately 3.47 billion Canadian dollars.

This statistic shows the monthly export value of wheat in Canada from January 2014 to August 2021. In August 2021, exports of wheat from Canada amounted to approximately 793.4 million Canadian dollars.

The expectation for men in France was 79.2 years in 2020. Variations are relatively small by region, except for the island of Mayotte. Indeed, the gap is three years ( except Mayotte ) between the expectation for men in Haut-de-France and that in le-de-France ( 75.2 years ).

This statistic shows the monthly export value of dairy products in Canada from January 2015 to March 2021. In March 2021, exports of dairy products from Canada amounted to approximately 1.1 billion Canadian dollars.
This statistic displays the awareness of e-cigarettes in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. The majority of respondents, 62 percent, were aware of e-cigarettes.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of Cox's Orange-group dessert apples in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from January 2015 to November 2019. The wholesale price of Cox's Orange-group apples was valued at 0.88 British pounds per kilogram in November 2019.

This statistic illustrates the value of illicit liquor seized in India during the general assembly elections in 2019, by state and union territory. The largest amount of illicit liquor was seized in the state of Uttar Pradesh, valued at over 461 million Indian rupees.

Between January and March 2021, the Italian e-commerce industry was largely impacted by the outbreak of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). In fact, in February 2021, online sales of consumer packaged goods increased by around 110 percent compared to the same month of the previous year. This figure grew to 142 percent as of March 2021.

The highest number of news articles about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in the Nordic countries from January 1 to March 23, 2020, was published in Sweden. The number of articles in Sweden amounted to 196 thousand. Denmark followed with 163 thousand articles, while Norway and Finland published 112 and 76 thousand articles respectively.

This statistic compares the average number of journeys made per person annually for all purposes in England in 2018, by mode of transport. Travel by car or van as a driver was the most common mode of transport with an average of 397 trips made per person per year.

This statistic shows the average age in years of the East Midlands Trains rolling stock between 2007/08 and 2018/19. The average age of the East Midlands Trains rolling stock increased by one year each year as of the fourth quarter of the financial year 2007/08 until the fourth quarter of the year 2018/19. The average age of the East Midlands Trains rolling stock reached its peak in the fourth quarter of the year 2018/19, at 26.1 years.

This statistic shows the average age in years of the London North Eastern Railway rolling stock between 2007/08 and 2018/19. The average age of the London North Eastern Railway's rolling stock increased by one year each year between 2007/08 and 2016/17, reaching 31.5 years in the fourth quarter of 2016/17. In the first quarter of the following year, the average age of the London North Eastern Railway's rolling stock decreased to 25.8 years.

This statistic displays the revenue generated by business transactions during consumers'trade shows in France as of 2015, by participant origin. It appears that foreign exhibitors generated a revenue of 9.8 billion euros during business transactions at trade shows in France.

This statistic displays the average weekly sales value of large retail businesses in Great Britain monthly from January 2016 to May 2021. An average of 6.9 billion British pounds were spent per week in large retailers in Great Britain in May 2021.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of beetroot in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2015 to 2019. The wholesale price of beetroot was valued at 0.49 British pounds per kilogram in November 2019, a decrease of five pence compared to a year before.

This statistic shows the average age in years of the London Overground rolling stock between 2007/08 and 2018/19. The average age of the London Overground trains decreased from 30.6 years in 2007/08 to 15.9 years in 2016/17. In 2017/18, the average age increased to 16.5 years.

This statistic displays the average weekly sales value of small non-store retail businesses in Great Britain monthly from January 2015 to November 2021. The amount spent in small non-store retail businesses, such as mail order houses, reached approximately 583.5 million British pounds in November 2021.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of kent cauliflower in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2015 to 2019. The wholesale price of kent cauliflower was valued at 0.89 British pounds per head in November 2019, an increase compared to a year before.

This statistic displays the wholesale price of celery in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from June 2014 to November 2019. The wholesale price of celery was valued at 0.77 British pounds per kilogram in November 2019, a decrease of 21 pence compared to the price a year before.

In the third quarter of 2020, 16.5 percent of playback on OTT services in the United States occurred within the drama category, down from 15.1 percent in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Drama was the most viewed genre in early 2019 and 2020, followed by action and adventure. Meanwhile, science fiction and horror content became less popular.

This statistic shows the number of VAT and/or PAYE based enterprises manufacturing musical instruments in the United Kingdom for 2021, by turnover size band. As of March 2021, there were 5 enterprises with a turnover of more than 5 million British pounds.

This statistic shows the share of consumers who are likely to buy Canadian brands in Canada as of May 2015, by age group. During the survey, 68 percent of the respondents aged between 18 and 34 years said that they were likely to buy Canadian brands.
This statistic depicts the median annual family income in Canada in 2019, distinguished by province. In 2019, the median annual family income in Alberta was 102,430 Canadian dollars.

The number of smartphone users in Russia has been increasing steadily over the years, from 50.1 million in 2015 to an estimated 115.8 million in 2025. This growth is driven by the widespread adoption of smartphones and the increase in the overall population over the years.
This statistic shows the number of smartphone users in Germany from 2018 to 2024. For 2020, the number of smartphone users in Germany is estimated to reach 74.1 million.

This statistic shows the reasons consumers in the United Kingdom gave for shopping around for a new energy supplier in 2014. Almost half of those surveyed, 47 percent, said they were motivated to look for a new supplier because their current one was not providing good value for money.

This statistic illustrates the number of aircraft landings and take-offs at Edinburgh Airport in the UK from 2005 to 2020. In 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic, there were only 43,100 aircraft movements at Edinburgh Airport.

In 2019, there were about 1.68 million single people living in Canada with an income of less than low income. This is an increase from 2000, when there were about 1.03 million single people living in Canada with an income of less than low income.

This statistic displays the age distribution of consumers who complained about `` no hang-up fraud '' reviewed by the Financial Ombudsman Service in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2012 and 2014. It shows that the majority of people who complained about financial fraud over the telephone were over 65 years of age.

This statistic shows the distribution of time spent by consumers in the United Kingdom on researching and using renewable energy, according to a survey conducted in 2014. Of respondents, 25 percent said they spent between one and two hours researching renewable energy, while 22 percent said they spent between two and three hours.

In December 2020, the movie `` Call Me by Your Name '' from the higher quality ( 4K ) was the most available movie on subscription video-on-demand ( SVoD ) services in the United States, with over 1.2 million titles available. The movie `` Call Me by Your Name '' was also the most available movie on SVoD services in the United States in January 2020, with over 1.2 million titles available.

This statistic displays the results of the Catalan election held on September 27, 2015 showing the share of votes won by each party in the different regions. The pro-independence alliance Junts pel S ( Together for Yes ) won the majority of the votes in the region of Catalonia with 1.12 million votes, followed by Ciutadans ( Citizens ) with 588,543 votes and Pro Dcide ( For Decision ) with 454,943 votes in the region of Catalonia.

This statistic shows the time consumers in the United Kingdom spend on comparing energy suppliers, in 2014, by the number of suppliers they are comparing with. The majority of respondents, 87 percent, spend between one and two hours comparing energy suppliers.

This statistic shows the type of technology used by travel managers to manage business trips in France in 2014. It reveals that 60 percent of respondents used online travel tools, while 47 percent used a travel management company.

This statistic shows how satisfied consumers are with their new energy supplier after switching in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. The vast majority of consumers were either very or quite satisfied, with only seven percent reporting being less than very satisfied.

This statistic displays the results of a survey of individuals in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, regarding their attitudes towards mobile commerce. Fifteen percent of respondents reported they strongly disagreed with the statement, that being able to shop by mobile allows them to use their time more efficiently.

This statistic displays the main barriers to mobile commerce according to the consumers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014. The leading reason for consumers not buying or ordering items online via mobile device was that they did not find the products they were looking for.

The graph shows the movies with the largest TV advertising budgets in the United States in the first half of 2015. The movie Furious 7 had a TV ad budget of 32 million U.S. dollars in the presented period.

This statistic shows the amount of money non-owners are able to save weekly towards a mortgage deposit in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015, listed by region. The average amount that can be saved per week for the purposes of a mortgage deposit was highest in London at 52 British pounds.

This bar chart illustrates the average haul length for articulated heavy goods vehicles with a weight over 33 tons in the United Kingdom from 1990 to 2016, in kilometers. In 2012, the average haul length for over 33 ton HGVs was 126 kilometers. Despite a peak in 1995, the average haul length for over 33 ton HGVs decreased to 126 kilometres in 2012.

This bar chart shows the number of vehicles in the United Kingdom ( UK ) that were fitted with software that manipulates emissions data as of September 2015, by sub-brand. The Volkswagen group had the highest number of vehicles with software manipulations, with 511,942 vehicles.

This statistic presents the state of mind of the Spanish population regarding the coronavirus lockdown as of April 2020. According to a survey carried out between March 23 and 27, 2020, approximately 15 percent of those surveyed considered the lockdown period bad or very bad. A week earlier, this share stood at 12 percent.

This statistic shows the share of pet owners who have purchased a gift for their pet in Canada as of April 2013, by gender. During the survey, 57 percent of the female respondents said they had purchased a gift for their pet.

This bar chart shows the total number of passenger-kilometers travelled annually on Virgin Trains West Coast rail services from 2008/09 to 2018/19, in millions. An increase in West Coast rail passenger transport volume was observed between the financial years 2008/09 and 2018/19. In 2018/19, the transport volume reached 7.7 billion passenger-kilometers.

This statistic shows the turnover development of the onshore wind energy industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2010 to 2013. It shows a compound annual growth rate from 2010 to 2013 of 3.3 percent, with a large growth from 2010 to 2011.

As of April 2020, there were 812 very large crude oil tankers ( VLCCs ) worldwide. Oil tankers, also known as petroleum tankers, are paramount for transporting oil from their extraction site to refineries or further onwards to distribution centers. Vessels vary in size depending on the area or canal they need to traverse, with VLCCs having a storage capacity of around two million barrels of crude oil.

With the Coronavirus 2019 ( Covid-19 ) now officially categorized as a pandemic, many countries have stepped up cautionary measures, including restricting public gatherings and travel bans. For the first quarter of 2020, forecasts suggest a global decline of 9.6 million barrels per day in oil demand, with the rate of decline expected to slow in the second quarter.
This statistic shows the development of employment in the solar thermal industry in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2010 to 2013. It shows a steady growth, rising from 4,600 in 2010 to 5,200 in 2013.

As of April 2020, it was found that 31 percent of female internet users in Canada used photo sharing app Snapchat. Among male internet users, the usage reach was 23 percent. Overall, 74 percent of Snapchat users in Canada stated that they used Snapchat to keep in contact with friends and family.

This statistic presents the value of mobile peer to peer payments in the United States from 2013 to 2015 and a forecast thereof until 2018. In 2015, the value of mobile P2P payments amounted to 16 billion U.S. dollars and it was predicted to increase to 86 billion U.S. dollars in 2018.

In 2020, 94.62 percent of the population in the United Kingdom ( UK ) used the internet. This was an increase of two percent on the previous year and 19 percent on 10 years ago. The UK is one of the biggest online markets worldwide.

This statistic displays the annual turnover of the data processing ; hosting and related services industry in Denmark from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, this industry had a turnover of 290.9 million euros in Denmark.

This statistic shows the shopping frequency during the coronavirus lockdown in Spain in March 2020. The results of a survey conducted between March 16 and 20 showed that 15 percent of respondents purchased online everyday during the lockdown period.

This statistic shows the pet foot food sales volume in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2018, by animal type. Dog food had the highest sales volume at 825 thousand tonnes, followed by cat food at 376 thousand tonnes.

This statistic shows the results of a survey in which respondents were asked whether they are aware of the 5 pence charge on single-use carrier bags, that came into force in supermarkets and other stores in England on October 5th 2015. Of respondents, 25 percent under the age of 35 were aware of the charge.

This statistic shows the number of units sold of toy animals and non-human creatures by manufacturers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2012 to 2020. In 2020, around 810 thousand units were sold in the UK.

This statistic displays the annual turnover of the data processing ; hosting and related services industry in Hungary from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, this industry had a turnover of 66.1 million euros in Hungary.
This statistic shows the number of importing companies in France from 2011 to 2013. The number of importing companies decreased from 120,865 in 2011 to 105,865 in 2012.

This statistic shows the average monthly data volume per mobile internet subscription in Germany from 2009 to 2021. In 2021, the average data volume per mobile internet subscription amounted to 3,244 megabytes per month.

This statistic shows the gross added value by the energy generation from waste and biomass sectors in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2010 to 2013. It shows a compound annual growth rate of 1.2 percent, with a large drop in 2013, down to 1.2 billion British pounds.

This statistic presents the business trip preparations in France in 2014 and 2015. It displays that almost half of the respondents used Google to prepare their business trip, whereas nearly 40 percent of them used the company's travel agency.

This statistic shows the national distribution of employment in the biomass equipment industry across the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013. The total number of jobs was 14,900. England provides the bulk of work in this sector, providing 9,800 of the 14,900 positions.

The statistic shows the trade balance in France from 2010 to 2020, in billion euros. The trade balance is the value of exports minus the value of imports. In 2020, the trade balance deficit of France was around 46.3 billion euros.

According to a survey conducted in March 2020, some 17 percent of U.S. consumers stated that they were buying more pet food and supplies online due to the coronavirus outbreak. Some 75 percent of respondents said that their online spending on pet products was the same as it was in the previous month.

This statistic shows leading car rental companies in the United States ranked by average index ranking in 2018. YouGov's brand Index 2018 index results show that Enterprise ranked highest with a score of 20.8, followed by Hertz at 14.6.

This statistic displays the results of a survey on the share of individuals who agree that they only see a chiropractor for back or neck issues in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. Of respondents, 26 percent agree that they only see a chiropractor for back or neck issues.
This bar chart illustrates the annual export volume of barytes in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in tonnes. In 2012, 19,049 tonnes of barytes were exported from the United Kingdom.
This bar chart illustrates the annual import volume of barytes in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in tonnes. In 2012, 88,000 tonnes of barytes were imported to the United Kingdom.

This statistic illustrates the annual import value of cadmium metal, pigments and oxides in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in thousand British pounds. In 2012, 395 thousand British pounds worth of cadmium metal was imported to the United Kingdom.

This statistic illustrates the annual export volume of cadmium metal and pigments in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in tonnes. In 2012, 293 tonnes of cadmium metal was exported from the United Kingdom.
This statistic displays the consumption of coke and breeze in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014. In 2013, consumption of coke and breeze was at its highest at 3.4 million metric tons.

This statistic shows the reasons the age of children can be a challenge when traveling in the United States as of May 2015. During the survey, seven percent of respondents said that the age gap between the children was too large.

This bar chart illustrates the annual import volume of crushed rock in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in tonnes. In 2012, 1.29 million tonnes of crushed rock were imported to the United Kingdom.

This statistic illustrates the annual export volume of diamonds, including unsorted, rough gem, cut gem, industrial, and dust, in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in tonnes. In 2012, 40 thousand tonnes of unsorted diamond was exported from the United Kingdom.

As of December 29, 2021, 73 percent of Indonesian respondents stated that they were wearing face masks when in public places during the COVID-19 outbreak, a decrease from 86 percent on March 24, 2020. Indonesia has achieved its target of vaccinating 90 percent of its adult population, and therefore, the country has lifted travel restrictions for residents who have been fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

The statistic shows the inflation rate in France from 2004 to 2021. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials ( e.g. gas, oil ), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2021, the average inflation rate in France was at 1.6 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic illustrates the annual export value of fireclay, fireclay bricks, and refractory hollow-ware in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in thousand British pounds. In 2012, 1.2 million British pounds worth of fireclay was exported from the United Kingdom.

This statistic illustrates the annual import volume of fireclay, fireclay bricks, and refractory hollow-ware in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2009 and 2014, in tonnes. In 2012, 2,834 tonnes of fireclay was imported to the United Kingdom.

Hertz Global Holdings Inc. reported approximately 13,000 car rental days in the second quarter of 2020. This represents a significant decrease from the 30,000 car rental days reported in the same quarter of 2019. The decrease in car rental days can be attributed to the coronavirus pandemic, which led to a drop in the number of vehicles rented.

This statistic displays the number of drug-related deaths due to MDMA/ecstasy use in England and Wales from 1993 to 2020. The number of drug-related deaths due to MDMA/ecstasy use has generally increased over this period, with 83 deaths reported in 2020.

This statistic displays the number of drug-related deaths due to benzodiazepine use in England and Wales from 1993 to 2020. The number of drug-related deaths due to benzodiazepine use has generally increased over this period, with 476 deaths reported in 2020, highest number of deaths in the period observed.

This statistic shows the distribution of respondents to a survey question, asking which potential stakeholders takes primary responsibility for the review and management of cyber risks in organizations in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. The majority of respondents, 56 percent, believed that the responsibility for cyber risk management lies with the IT department.

This statistic displays the number of deaths from drug poisoning by fenfluracetam in England and Wales from 1999 to 2020. The largest number of deaths caused by fenfluracetam was recorded in 2017, with 74 deaths recorded, while 57 deaths were recorded in 2020.

This statistic represents the annual installations of onshore wind power in Canada from 2007 to 2014 with a forecast for 2015 to 2020. In 2017, onshore wind power installations are expected to total 1,520 megawatts in Canada. Onshore wind energy is currently one of the most affordable renewable energy sources.

The statistic shows the median household income in the United States from 1970 to 2014, by income tier. In 2014, the median household income for the middle class stood at 71,000 U.S. dollars. This study defined middle class income households as those with an income between 67 and 200 percent of the U.S. median household income, after adjustment for household size. In 2014, the middle class income ranged from about 42,000 U.S. dollars to about 126,000 U.S. dollars per year for a three-person household.

This statistic presents the number of monetary financial credit institutions ( MFIs ) in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from December 2008 to December 2019. Over this period of time the number of institutions decreased from over 393 in 2008 to 355 in 2014. As of December 2019 the number of monetary financial credit institutions in the United Kingdom reached 400.

This statistic presents the distribution of must-have amenities in travel accommodation for tourists from the United Kingdom ( UK ) as of 2015. According to the survey, air conditioning was considered a must-have amenity by 46 percent of the respondents.

This statistic shows the share of subscription video on demand ( SVoD ) subscribers who share their accounts with someone outside their household in the United States as of December 2015, by service. During the survey, it was found that 45 percent of Hulu Plus subscribers also subscribed to Amazon Prime, and 29 percent of Amazon Prime subscribers also subscribed to Hulu Plus.

This statistic shows the value of crowdfunding raised through donation initiatives globally from 2011 to 2014. In 2013, the value of crowdfunding fudds raised through donations amounted to 1.3 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the IT vulnerabilities among organizations worldwide as of May 2014. During the survey period, it was found that 32 percent of organizations had experienced a successful cyber attack.

This statistic displays the distribution of carbon dioxide emissions worldwide in 2014, based on fuel type. Coal accounted for 44 percent of carbon dioxide emissions that year, while natural gas accounted for 20 percent. Carbon dioxide can be removed from the atmosphere through reforestation, soil improvements, and other carbon sinks.

This statistic displays the total revenue of the French drug market from 2010 to 2018, in million pre-tax euros. The total revenue increased over this period of time, going from 52 billion euros in 2010 to 56.2 billion euros in 2018.
The statistic shows the distribution of jobs in the global hydropower sector in 2020, by country. According to the data, 37.4 percent of the workforce in the hydropower sector was employed in China.

This statistic presents the most common cyber risk countermeasures taken by organizations worldwide as of February 2019. During the survey period, it was found that 32 percent of the respondents stated that their organization had implemented security intelligence solutions.

This statistic shows the market value of single greeting cards in the United Kingdom from 2011 to 2020. The UK greeting card market was worth around 1.4 billion British pounds in 2020, down from 1.5 billion in the previous year.

This statistic displays the share of individuals who have used and not used hearing aids in the last 12 months in England in 2014. The majority of individuals surveyed, 92 percent of men and 93 percent of women, have never used a hearing aid.

More than 70 percent of companies surveyed for this study stated that their most important action to drive revenue growth in the next 12 months was to invest in marketing activities. Other popular measures included the pursuit of new customers and the use of new products or services.

This statistic shows the annual turnover from the manufacture of dairy products industry in Hungary from 2008 to 2018. In 2018, the manufacturing of dairy products produced a turnover of approximately 924.1 million euros.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the manufacturing of dairy products in Slovakia from 2008 to 2017. In 2016, the production value of dairy product manufacturing amounted to approximately 516.1 million euros.

This statistic shows the production value of the manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery industry in Slovakia from 2008 to 2017. In 2017, the production value of the manufacture of cocoa, chocolate and sugar confectionery industry amounted to approximately 115.9 million euros.

This statistic shows the percentage of respondents who were satisfied with the quality of air in the lowest satisfaction states in the U.S. in 2013. The survey was conducted between May and June 2013. 68 percent of respondents in Utah were satisfied with the air quality in their state.

The statistic presents information on the number of TV ads bought by selected gaming companies in the United States in 2014 and 2015. According to the source's estimates, Nintendo paid 44 ad buys in 2014, up from 42 in the previous year. In 2015, Nintendo made 46 TV ad buys.

This bar chart depicts the number of individuals employed in the maritime services sector in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2013, by channel of impact. The total number of people employed in the maritime services sector amounted to 495,000 in 2013.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Paraguay from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Paraguay amounted to 2.41 children per woman.

This statistic shows the total number of enterprises in the non-financial business economy in Austria in 2016, by size class of employment. In 2016, there were 1,859 enterprises with 250 employees or more in Austria.

This statistic shows the total number of enterprises in the non-financial business economy in Romania in 2016, by size class of employment. In 2016, there were 3,865 enterprises with 250 employees or more in Romania.

This statistic shows the willingness of U.S. consumers to pay for prescription drug costs as of 2015. During the survey, 54 percent of respondents said they would be willing to pay for their prescription drug costs.

As of June 15, 2021, over one thousand deaths due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) had occurred in Belgium. The coronavirus pandemic has led to deaths in Belgium in 2020 and 2021. According to the number of deaths per region, Flanders faced the highest death rate with over half of its coronavirus deaths.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. consumers who reported being open to receiving mental health services via telehealth in 2015, by age group. It was found that 72 percent of those aged 18 to 44 were open to receiving mental health services via telehealth.

This statistic illustrates the share of adult cancer patients and caregivers who felt their diagnosis and treatment information was clear and easy to understand in the United States as of 2015. Some 71 percent of patients and caregivers stated that their information and instructions for treatment were clear and easy to understand.

This statistic presents the number of branches of CIC Bank in France and abroad from 2014 to 2020, by type. The number of domestic branches of CIC Bank decreased from over two thousand in 2014 to 1,837 in 2020. The number of foreign representative offices remained stable over this period, with a total of eight offices in 2020.

This statistic presents the results of a survey conducted with people aged 65 and over in England in 2015, regarding the importance of arts and culture in helping them to meet others. Over half of the respondents stated that arts and culture is important in helping them to meet others, while 15 percent consider it not at all important.

This statistic presents the results of a survey conducted with people aged 65 and over in England in 2015, regarding the importance of arts and culture in helping older generations get out and about. The majority of respondents considered arts and culture to be important in this respect, with 30 percent saying it was fairly important and 29 percent saying it was very important.

The chart represents the projected electric power sector capacity in the United States from 2020 to 2050. It shows an increase in capacity from 1,100 gigawatts in 2020 to 1,700 gigawatts in 2050, with a compound annual growth rate of 8.5 percent.

The personnel costs of the paper and paper product manufacturing industry in Switzerland dropped to 631.8 million euros in 2017. This means a decline by 16.2 million euros in comparison to the previous year. In general, the personnel costs have been subject to fluctuation over the observed period.

The statistic shows the leading markets in Europe based on share of mobile game session as of January 2015. It was found that Russia was the top country for mobile game session share in the measured period, accounting for 30.1 percent of all mobile game sessions in Europe.

This statistic displays the distribution of features that were likely to be used by consumers of retailers on the Poq platform in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. In 2015, it was found that 32 percent of likely users of retailers on the Poq platform were likely to use the full screen zoom.

The chart presents the comparison of the percentage of mobile operating systems ( OS ) based on game session share in the Americas from January 2014 to January 2015. It was found that the iOS OS had a five percent increase in game session share between 2014 and 2015, reaching 49.9 percent in the last measured period.

As of March 2020, the majority of Dutch consumers declared that they did not make any changes to their lifestyle because of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). However, 30 percent of the consumers in the Netherlands made small changes to their lifestyle and another ten percent declared that they made large changes.

More than 80 percent of respondents were of the opinion that the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) represents a threat for the entire world. Only 42 percent considered that the virus only represents a threat for Romania.

This statistic shows the annual personnel costs of the water transport industry in Cyprus from 2011 to 2017. In 2011, the water transport industry had personnel costs of approximately 41 million euros.

This statistic depicts the percentage of total U.S. livestock drug sales in 2020, by drug class. According to the report, antimicrobial drugs accounted for some 36.5 percent of total livestock drug sales in the United States that year.

This statistic shows the nationalities who were the most likely to take an extra suitcase on vacation as of October 2015. During the survey, 43 percent of respondents from Indonesia said they were most likely to take an extra suitcase on vacation.

This statistic depicts the sales of antimicrobial drugs for usage in livestock in the United States in 2020, by drug class and route of administration. Domestic sales of tetracyclines amounted to some 3.2 million kilograms of active ingredient that year.

This statistic depicts the sales growth of antimicrobial drugs for usage in livestock in the United States in 2020, by drug class. During that year, sales of sulfas decreased by 23.9 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic displays the share of respondents who perceived a benefit from wearable technology in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015. Of respondents, 66 percent perceived a benefit from a heart rate monitor.

The statistic shows the number of internet users in the Oceania region as of January 2017, by country. As of that month, Australia had 21.22 million internet users. Second-ranked New Zealand accounted for 4.12 million internet users.

This graph depicts the share of physically active high school students in the U.S. in 2019, by state. According to the source, around 59.5 percent of high school students in Oregon were physically active in 2019.
This statistic depicts the obesity rate among Hispanics in the United States in 2020, sorted by state. In that year, the obesity rate among Hispanic population in Alabama amounted to 47 percent.

This bar chart depicts the average number of sites available with public transport or by walking in rural areas, by journey times in England as of 2017. In this year, there was an average of 0.7 hospitals available within 60 minutes journey time by public transport or walking in rural areas, compared to 8.7 general practitioners. Within 15 minutes time, there was on average 0.1 secondary schools available compared to 5.7 primary schools.

The most significant drop in car registration in the first four months of 2020 compared to the same period in 2019 was recorded by Volkswagen, with a decrease of over 68 percent. koda recorded the second highest drop in car registration in the first four months of 2020 compared to the same period in 2019, with a decrease of nearly 57 percent. The most popular car models in Poland, as of the first quarter of 2020, were koda Octavia, koda Fabia, and Volkswagen Golf.

The United Kingdom ( UK ) based Nationwide Building Society is the largest building society in the world with approximately 15.9 million members, of which over half were active members in 2019. As well as being a building society, Nationwide is one of the United Kingdom's leading and most widespread financial institutes, specializing in household savings and mortgages.

This statistic shows the retained profit of the United Kingdom ( UK ) based Nationwide Building Society in their financial years from 2011 to 2015. It can be seen that the retained profit increased overall during the period under observation, reaching a value of 833 million British pounds as of 2015. The smallest value of profit was found in 2012, when a profit of 175 million British pounds was recorded.

As of June 2021, the United Kingdom ( UK ) based Nationwide Building Society is one of the largest building societies in Europe with approximately 15.9 million members, of which over half were active members in 2019. Nationwide's board of directors has seen a steady increase in the number of women directors, growing from one in 2015 to 37 in 2021. In comparison, the number of women managing directors at Nationwide Building Society saw a slight decrease between 2015 and 2021, from 27 to 35.

This statistic illustrates the development of the operating profit of Secure Trust Bank Plc, headquartered in the United Kingdom ( UK ), from 2011 to 2019. Within the time period observed, the operating profit fluctuated. In 2019, Secure Trust Bank Plc reported an operating profit of approximately 39.1 million British pounds.
This statistic shows the number of permanent employees in tourist attractions in Wales in 2014. In total, there were 1,749 permanent employees, of which 744 were full-time employees.
This statistic shows the number of seasonal employees at tourist attractions in Wales in 2014. Part-time employees worked 340 jobs in 2014, more than those employed full-time.

This statistic shows the share of child visits to tourist attractions in Wales in 2014. The share of child visits was relatively high to country parks and gardens, at 34 percent, and to wildlife attractions, at 31 percent.

This statistic shows the responses to a survey about Canadian professional sport teams in Canada as of May 2014. During the reported period, 23.4 percent of respondents stated that the Montreal Canadiens were the most popular Canadian sports teams across the country.
This statistic shows the life expectancy at birth in Faroe Islands from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the average life expectancy at birth in Faroe Islands was 82.75 years.
The statistic shows the growth in real GDP in Eritrea from 2016 to 2026. In 2018, Eritrea's real gross domestic product increased by around 13.44 percent compared to the previous year.

In the week starting on 4 March 2020, footfall in retail stores in Poland fell by 16 percent compared to the same period a year earlier. After the first week of March, when the government in Poland announced the decision to close all schools and universities due to the coronavirus outbreak, the situation in retail changed dramatically. After the first week of March, when the government in Poland announced the decision to close all schools and universities due to the coronavirus outbreak, the situation in retail changed dramatically.

This statistic shows the national debt of Eritrea in relation to gross domestic product ( GDP ) from 2016 to 2026. The figures refer to the whole country and include the debts of the state, the communities, the municipalities and the social insurances. In 2018, the national debt of Eritrea amounted to approximately 185.1 percent of the GDP.

This statistic shows the fertility rate in Eritrea from 2009 to 2019. The fertility rate is the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age. In 2019, the fertility rate in Eritrea amounted to 4.01 children per woman.
This statistic depicts the number of mobile cellular subscriptions per 100 inhabitants in Rwanda between 2000 and 2020. There were 82.17 mobile subscriptions registered for every 100 people in 2020.
This statistic depicts the number of mobile cellular subscriptions per 100 inhabitants in Somalia between 2000 and 2016. There were 57.59 mobile subscriptions registered for every 100 people in 2016.

This statistic illustrates the findings of a survey on the distribution of daily online usage via mobile phones in Ireland in 2014, by hours per day. During the survey period, it was found that approximately 42 percent of respondents reported spending between 2 and 4 hours online per day on their mobile phones.

This statistic shows the volume of tuna exported from the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by country of destination. The Irish Republic was the leading destination country for the export of tuna from the UK with over 3.9 thousand tonnes exported.

In the first quarter of 2021, movie theater chain Cineplex generated a total revenue of 41.71 million Canadian dollars. This marks a significant decrease compared to the first quarter of 2020, when the company's revenue amounted to 442.82 million dollars.

In the second quarter of 2021, Cineplex generated a box office revenue of 12.5 million Canadian dollars, up from 11.2 million in the corresponding quarter of the previous year. Meanwhile, its food service, media, amusement, and other revenues all decreased from the previous year.

This statistic depicts the findings of a survey on the usage of mobile phones during everyday activities in Ireland in 2014, by age group. During the survey period, it was found that 17.2 percent of respondents aged between 25 and 29 years reported that they used their mobile phones while driving.

The statistic shows the number of hotels and restaurants selected for the Michelin Guide in Great Britain and Ireland in 2015, by type of establishment. Michelin Guide selected 270 guesthouses and hotels in 2015.

For the calendar year-to-date ended April 4, 2020, the sales value of frozen fruit grew by 24.1 percent compared to the same period of the previous year. In that time, the sales of frozen vegetables grew by 19.6 percent compared to the previous year.

In 2019, mobile gaming app revenues amounted to 69.5 billion U.S. dollars worldwide. In 2024, mobile gaming app revenues are projected to reach 113.9 billion U.S. dollars. The compound annual growth rate ( CAGR ) of the mobile gaming app market is expected to reach 15.8 percent between 2019 and 2024.

In 2020, imports of birds'eggs in shell to the United Kingdom ( UK ) were valued at approximately 67 million British pounds. This constitutes to an increase of almost 17 million British pounds in comparison to 2019.

The statistic shows gross domestic product ( GDP ) in Moldova from 1996 to 2019, with projections up until 2026. Gross domestic product ( GDP ) denotes the aggregate value of all services and goods produced within a country in any given year. GDP is an important indicator of a country's economic power. In 2019, Moldova's gross domestic product amounted to around 11.63 billion U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows Moldova's share in the global gross domestic product ( GDP ) adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity ( PPP ) from 2016 to 2026. In 2019, Moldova's share in the global gross domestic product adjusted for Purchasing Power Parity amounted to approximately 0.04 percent.

This statistic shows the average inflation rate in Moldova from 1996 to 2020, with projections up until 2026. In 2020, the average inflation rate in Moldova amounted to about 4.44 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the share of motorists who said the price of petrol or diesel was one of their greatest concerns in the United Kingdom between 2013 and 2018. The share of concerned motorists showed a net decrease over this period, declining from 63 percent in 2013 to 29 percent in 2018.

This bar chart shows the distribution of responses from a survey question asking `` drivers'opinions on how the government should cut fuel duty and replace any loss of taxation by different options in the United Kingdom in 2015 ''. The x-axis shows By increasing other non-motoring taxes while the y-axis shows By other motorising taxes. The most popular option was to keep fuel duty as it is with 18 percent of the responses.

This statistic shows the reasons that motorists gave for not using public transport in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2018. The most common reasons were that a personal vehicle was more reliable than public transport, and that travelling by car was more convenient than travelling by bus.

This bar chart depicts the distribution of motorists'concerns regarding parking tickets in the United Kingdom in 2015. Of respondents, 39 percent were concerned about the cost of parking and the impact this had on other areas of their expenditure.

This statistic shows the number of visits from Italy to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. 940 thousand Italian visitors stayed at hotels or guest houses. Relatives or friends hosted 521 thousand Italian visitors freely. Another 127 thousand Italian tourists went to universities or schools.

In 2019, approximately 79 percent of the tax filers in the Central and Eastern European countries submitted their tax returns on time. One third of the respondents had problems with filling in the forms, while 22 percent requested tax refunds.

This statistic displays the number of overnight stays on visits from France to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. French visitors spent most of their nights as free guests with relatives or friends. Overnight stays at hotels and guest houses amounted to over 5.5 million nights. In contrast, Bed & Breakfast accommodations hosted French visitors for 326 thousand nights.

This statistic displays the number of overnight stays on visits from Russia to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. Russian visitors spent most of their nights as free guests with relatives or friends. Overnight stays at hotels and guest houses amounted to over 790 thousand nights.

This statistic displays the number of overnight stays on visits from the USA to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. US visitors spent most of their nights as free guests with relatives or friends. Overnight stays at hotels and guest houses amounted to over 9.5 million nights.

This statistic presents the accommodation spending on visits from Finland to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. This statistic presents the accommodation spending on visits from France to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. This statistic presents the accommodation spending on visits from Germany to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. German visitors spent 832 million British pounds at hotels and guest houses. They spent 210 million British pounds while staying freely with relatives or friends.

This statistic presents the accommodation spending on visits from Sweden to the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2014, by type of accommodation. Swedish visitors spent the most in hotels and guest houses - 399 million British pounds, compared to 40 million British pounds while staying freely with relatives or friends.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of specialized stores for the retail sale of sporting equipment in Latvia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, around 45.6 million euros were generated through sports equipment retailing in specialized stores.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of specialized stores for the retail sale of sporting equipment in the Netherlands from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, around 2.6 billion euros were generated through sports equipment retailing in specialized stores.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of specialized stores for the retail sale of sporting equipment in Slovenia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, around 165.8 million euros were generated through sports equipment retailing in specialized stores.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of specialized stores for the retail sale of sporting equipment in Slovakia from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, around 122.4 million euros were generated through sports equipment retailing in specialized stores.

This statistic presents the frequency of giving and receiving pocket money in Great Britain as of January 2016, depending on the child's gender. Boys and girls had a similar pattern of behavior. In January 2016, 59 percent of boys and 58 percent of girls received their pocket money on a weekly basis.

This statistic shows the sales volume of iron and steel scrapolding, shuttering, potting and polishing based on PRODCOM estimates * * in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2009 to 2018. The UK experienced an increase in sales volume over this period. In 2018, the sales volume reached 22.4 million kilograms.

This statistic shows the sales volume of central heating boilers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2008 to 2018. The sales volume of central heating boilers increased over this period, according to the most recent data.

This statistic displays the election results for the Parliament of the German-speaking Community in the Belgian regional elections of May 26, 2019. The German-speaking Christian democrats, CSP, won the majority of the votes with 23.01 percent. The second largest share of the votes was won by the German-speaking socialist party, PS, with 22.88 percent.

This statistic displays the share of consumers who have used the internet to check products in-store before purchasing in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015 and 2016. Of respondents, 74 percent have never used the internet to check products in-store before purchasing.

This statistic displays the reasons for returns of retail purchases in the United Kingdom ( UK ) between November 2015 and January 2016. Of returns made during this time, 37 percent were due to the consumer liking the product or the product not working as well as it should have been.

This statistic presents the share of shoppers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) who have an online account with a high street retailer as of January 2015. The survey showed that 84 percent of the shoppers have an online account with a high street retailer.

This statistic shows the revenue percentage growth from digital sources in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2015, by region and nation. Wales had the highest increase of 17.5 percent, while Northern Ireland had the lowest increase of 1.2 percent.

This statistic presents the share of British parents that reward their children for good behavior with pocket money as of January 2016, depending on the child's gender. The majority of both groups gave pocket money as a reward, with 67 percent of parents of boys and 69 percent of parents of girls reporting that they do so.

This statistic presents the children's savings behavior as reported by parents in Great Britain as of January 2016, depending on the child's gender. Parents of boys and girls reported a similar pattern. Over half of the children saved sometimes ( 66 percent of boys and 65 percent of girls ).

This statistic displays the total population of Belgium in 2021, by place of origin. As of January 1, 2021, approximately 10.1 million people living in Belgium had their origins in another European country than Belgium.

This statistic presents the children's ability to manage money as rated by their parents in Great Britain as of January 2016, depending on the child's age. Over all age groups, the majority of children were rated fairly good or very good at managing money. In the age group from 5 to 9, 25 percent were rated as fairly good and only one percent as very poor. In the age group from 10 to 14, 20 percent were rated as fairly good and five percent as very poor.

This statistic presents the value of fresh or chilled roots and tubers of manioc, arrowroot, salep ( yams ), sweet potatoes and similar exported by the United Kingdom ( UK ) annually from 2001 to 2019, in thousand British pounds. This statistic shows the annual turnover from the manufacture of food products in the Netherlands from 2009 to 2017. In 2017, the manufacturing of food products produced a turnover of approximately 70.48 billion euros.

It is important to note that these reductions were temporary, as the global economy gradually resumed its activities.

This statistic shows the monthly trend in the volume of cosmetic and toilet articles sales ( quantity bought ) in Great Britain from January 2016 to November 2021. The figures are seasonally adjusted estimates, measured using the Retail Sales Index ( RSI ) and published in index form with a reference year of 2019 equal to 100. In November 2021, sales reached to an index level of 98.7.

This statistic shows the monthly trend in the volume of footwear and leather goods sales ( quantity bought ) in Great Britain from January 2016 to November 2021. The figures are seasonally adjusted estimates, measured using the Retail Sales Index ( RSI ) and published in index form with a reference year of 2019 equal to 100. In November 2021, sales reached to an index level of 105.4.

This statistic shows the quarterly trend in the retail sales volume of textiles, clothing, footwear and leather ( quantity bought ) in Great Britain from 1st quarter 2015 to 2nd quarter 2021. The figures are seasonally adjusted estimates, measured using the Retail Sales Index ( RSI ) and published in index form with a reference year of 2018 equal to 100. Over the time period observed, sales within this sector have fluctuated, peaking during the second quarter of 2018, at an index level of 103.2. Sales volume had a decreasing trend in the second quarter of 2020 and registered at an index level of 52.6. As of the second quarter of 2021, sales volume stood at an index level of 98.9.
