This statistic shows the gross disposable income of households in the Netherlands from the first quarter of 1999 to the third quarter of 2021. Disposable income or disposable personal income ( DPI ) is the amount of money households have available for spending and saving after income taxes have accounted for. It is seen as one of many key economic indicators to show the overall health of an economy. As a concept, disposable income is deemed closer to the idea of income been as generally understood in economics, than is either national income or gross domestic product ( GDP ). In the third quarter of 2021, the gross disposable income of households in the Netherlands was approximately 107 billion euros.

This statistic presents the total volume of diesel consumption of foreign heavy vehicles in France from 2004 to 2018. In 2018, the diesel consumption of foreign heavy vehicles was around 3.4 million cubic meters.

The least affected were tourists from the Wielkopolskie Voivodeship, where the number of tourists decreased by 2.5 percent.

This statistic shows the value of imports of plastic apparel and clothing accessories into the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2011 to 2020. In 2020, the import value of these goods was approximately 1.44 billion U.S. dollars.

The lowest priority was to allow people to travel internationally, with a total of 31 percent of respondents choosing this option.

This statistic displays the level of knowledge of respondents regarding antibiotics in Estonia, in 2018. Antibiotics are medications that can kill or hinder the growth of bacteria which cause infections in people and animals. Antibiotics are not used to treat viruses. In 2018, 83 percent of respondents incorrectly answered when asked if antibiotics could kill viruses. 34 percent of respondents answered incorrectly when asked if antibiotics are effective against cold or flu, while 82 percent of respondents answered correctly when asked if unnecessary use of antibiotics could make them ineffective.

In fiscal year 2021, India imported electronic products worth over 3.9 trillion Indian rupees. This was a slight increase in import value of electronic products compared to the previous fiscal year in the country.

This statistic displays how respondents first got the information about not taking any antibiotics unnecessarily in Greece, in 2018. Antibiotics are medications that can kill or hinder the growth of bacteria which cause infections in people and animals. Antibiotic resistance occurs when there is a mutation in the bacteria's genes, however excessive use of antibiotics can also lead to the spread of antibiotic resistant bacteria. In 2018, 49 percent of respondents in Greece reported that they first got the information about not taking antibiotics unnecessarily from a doctor, while 32 percent of respondents first heard the information from a TV advertisement.

This statistic displays the response of individuals when asked at what level they believe it is most effective to tackle resistance to antibiotics in Greece, in 2018. Antibiotics are medications that can kill or hinder the growth of bacteria which cause infections in people and animals. Antibiotic resistance occurs when there is a mutation in the bacteria's genes, however excessive use of antibiotics can also lead to the spread of antibiotic resistant bacteria. In 2018, 29 percent of respondents believed that antibiotic resistance should be tackled at national level whereas only five percent of respondents believed that antibiotic resistance should be tackled at the individual level or within the family.

This statistic displays the share of individuals who received information not to take antibiotics unnecessarily in Spain, in 2016, by European Union and country. Antibiotics are medications that can kill or hinder the growth of bacteria which cause infections in people and animals. Antibiotic resistance occurs when there is a mutation in the bacteria's genes, however excessive use of antibiotics can also lead to the spread of antibiotic resistant bacteria. In 2016, 76 percent of respondents in Spain reported that they did not remember receiving any information not to take antibiotics unnecessarily, this was above the European Union average at 65 percent. Only 23 percent of respondents in Spain received information not to take antibiotics unnecessarily, this was below the European Union average of 33 percent.

Capital ratios express a bank's capital as a percentage of its risk-weighted assets ( RWAs ). Capital requirements for European banks were raised after the Basel III accord and phased in on the 1st of January 2015, with a new minimum requirement of CET1 ratio of 4.5 percent. The United Kingdom's largest banks have all continued to meet the minimum requirement up to the 4th quarter of 2020.

This statistic displays how respondents obtained their last course of antibiotics in Finland, in 2018. Antibiotics are medications that can kill or hinder the growth of bacteria which cause infections in people and animals. In 2018, 82 percent of respondents in Finland reported that they had obtained their last course of antibiotics from a medical practitioner.

The chart presents a geographical analysis of Brazil from 2010 to 2018, categorizing the land area into different types such as forests, countires, plains, deserts, rivers, lakes, arable land, and wetlands. The x-axis represents the years while the y-axis represents the land area in square kilometers. The data is visually represented by a line graph with markers indicating the changes in land area for each year. 

Forests show a gradual decrease over the years, dropping from 4,000,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 1,800,000 square kilometers in 2018. Countires exhibit an increase, growing from 1,200,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 1,300,000 square kilometers in 2018. The area of plains fluctuates slightly over the years, ranging from 1,500,000 to 1,900,000 square kilometers.

Deserts show a slight increase from 250,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 300,000 square kilometers in 2018. Rivers and lakes show a constant increase over the years, with river areas increasing from 2,000,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 2,300,000 square kilometers in 2018, and lake areas increasing from 1,000,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 1,100,000 square kilometers in 2018.

Arable land shows a slight decrease from 1,000,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 900,000 square kilometers in 2018. Terraced wetlands show a significant increase from 300,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 500,000 square kilometers in 2018. 

Out of the different categories, wetlands have the smallest area in 2010 but show a significant increase over the years, making it the category with the largest change in area by 2018. Forests, rivers, lakes, and arable land show a steady increase over the years, with forests increasing the most from 1,800,000 square kilometers in 2010 to 1,900,000 square kilometers in 2018.

The chart contains some outliers, such as the sudden increase in the area of arable land in 2018 and the sudden drop in the area of forests in the same year. These sudden changes suggest significant events that year that impacted the area of each category of land. 

The chart is set against a light gray background with a grid to help visually align the data points. Each data point is annotated with the corresponding area of land for easy reference. The chart is saved as a PNG image named "myplot.png".

It was followed by Chile, with a COVID-19 mortality rate of 301.2 per 100,000 population. In that same year, the total number of COVID-19 deaths in Latin America and the Caribbean amounted to more than 2.7 million.
This statistic shows the size of the helicopter fleet worldwide in 2016 and 2036. In 2036, it is estimated that the global fleet will have around 37,000 helicopters.

This statistic depicts the percentage of U.S. adults aged 18 and older that currently use a tobacco product as of 2014-2015, by state. As of that time, 27.4 percent of adults in Alabama used a tobacco product.

In 2020, around 66 percent of respondents in Chile strongly or somewhat agreed that unless more women held leadership positions in business and government gender equality would not improve. Additionally, 29 percent of respondents disagreed with the statement.
In 2019, there were approximately 265.5 thousand university graduates located in Vietnam. In that year, the number of university students in the country reached 1.71 million.

The statistic presents the results of a survey conducted in January and February 2018 to find out about the situation of women and gender ( in ) equality across 27 countries. In Brazil, 74 percent of respondents strongly or somewhat agreed that a zero-tolerance policy for sexual harassment is essential to bringing about social change.

This statistic presents the frequency of Tinder usage in the United States as of January 2018. During an online survey conducted by We Are Flint, it was found that three percent of internet users in the United States accessed the dating app once every few days.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. Americans who had herpes simplex virus type one, commonly known as oral herpes, in 2015-2016, by gender. As of that time, almost 60 percent of all Americans had oral herpes.

This statistic shows the production value of shampoo, conditioners and shaving products in Taiwan between 2009 and 2019. In 2019, the production value of shampoo, conditioners and shaving products in Taiwan had amounted to approximately three billion New Taiwan dollars.

Among U.S. LGB adults aged 18 to 25, 35 percent had used marijuana in the past month in 2019. The statistic illustrates the percentage of U.S. lesbian, gay or bisexual adults who had used marijuana in the past month, from 2016-2019, by age group.

The number of cruise tourists in Costa Rica has decreased in the past five years. In 2019/2020, just over 120 thousand cruise passengers were reported in the Central American country, down from more than 135 thousand recorded a year earlier. Meanwhile, the number of cruise ships in the country has also been decreasing in the past years.

In 2020, the population of the Charlotte-Concord-Gastonia metropolitan area in the United States was about 2.68 million people. This was a slight increase from the previous year, when the population was about 2.66 million people.

In 2020, the population of the Sacramento-Roseville-Folsom metropolitan area in the United States was about 2.38 million people. This was a slight increase from the previous year, when the population was about 2.37 million people.
The statistic shows Dallas Cowboys players with the most touchdowns scored in franchise history. Emmitt Smith is the career touchdown leader of the Dallas Cowboys with 164 touchdowns.
The statistic shows San Francisco 49ers players with the most touchdowns scored in franchise history. Joe Montana is the career touchdown leader of the San Francisco 49ers with 185 touchdowns.

In 2021, Crown Castle reached a revenue share of 24 percent with AT & T as its main customer. The statistic illustrates the distribution of Crown Castle's revenue worldwide from 2019 to 2021, by customer.

This statistic depicts the number of employees at Dia in Brazil from 2014 to 2016. In 2016, Dia had 10,519 employees, up from 9,098 employees a year earlier. Dia is a supermarket chain headquartered in Rio de Janeiro.

This statistic depicts the net sales of DowDuPont in the Packaging & Specialty Plastics segment from 2015 to 2018. In 2018, the company generated some 24.1 billion U.S. dollars of revenue in this segment. DowDuPont was formed in September 2017 when companies Dow Chemical and DuPont completed a merger of equals. In April 2019, the DowDuPont conglomerate separated into three companies : Dow, dedicated to commodity chemicals, DuPont, dedicated to specialty chemicals, and Corteva, dedicated to agricultural chemicals and seeds. DowDuPont was headquartered in Midland, Michigan.
This statistic shows the sales volume of laundry soap in Taiwan between 2010 and 2020. In 2020, the sales volume of laundry soap in Taiwan had amounted to approximately 4,400 metric tons.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. adults aged 20 years and older with hypertension who were currently using antihypertensive medication in 2017, by state. In that year, around 71.9 percent of adults in Alabama with hypertension were taking medication to control their blood pressure.
This statistic depicts the net sales share of Levi Strauss worldwide in 2021, by brand. In 2021, sales of Levi brand products made up 87 percent of Levi Strauss'total net sales.

This statistic displays the consumer behavior when finding discounted products in the supermarket in Italy in 2016. According to survey results, only nine percent of respondents looked for products with a special offer only if they were looking at the supermarket's weekly or monthly sales.

The statistic shows the consumer behavior in throwing away food in Italy in 2016. During the survey period, it was found that 49 percent of the respondents didn't throw away food but tried to consume it all the time while 37 percent of the interviewees declared that they throw away food frequently.

This statistic shows the total number of Levi Strauss company-operated retail stores worldwide as of 2021, by geographical region. As of November 24, 2021, Levi Strauss operated approximately 905 retail stores worldwide.

This statistic displays the average carer's allowance per retired household in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2017/18, by decile group. Retired households in the bottom decile received, on average, one British pound in carer's allowance ; this was the lowest carer's allowance received of any decile group. Retired households in the top decile received, on average, 599 British pounds in carer's allowance, which was the highest income received from carer's allowance of any decile group.

This statistic displays the average disability living allowance per retired household in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2017/18, by decile. Retired households in the sixth decile received, on average, 748 British pounds in disability living allowance, this was the highest of any decile group, whilst retired households in the second decile received, on average, 78 British pounds in disability living allowance, which was the lowest of any decile group.
This statistic shows the domestic sales volume of paints in Taiwan between 2009 and 2019. In 2019, the domestic consumption of paints in Taiwan had amounted to approximately 257 thousand metric tons.

This statistic shows the domestic sales value of dyes in Taiwan between 2009 and 2019. In 2019, the domestic sales value of dyes in Taiwan had amounted to approximately two billion New Taiwan dollars.

In 2020, the average consumption of beer per capita in Poland amounted to 5.1 liters of pure alcohol. This was a decrease of over one liter compared to the previous year.

This statistic shows the share of the corporate purpose ad campaign of Cannes Lions winners from 2013 to 2017. In 2017, 24 percent of the corporate purpose ad campaign of Cannes Lions winners was spent on TV, radio and out of home.

This statistic presents the percentage of breast reconstructions that were simultaneous to mastectomy among adult females in the U.S. in 2014, by expected primary payer. It was found that in 2014, around 74 percent of breast reconstructions paid by Medicare were simultaneous to mastectomy.

The prospects of investment and development in the house building real estate market in Europe from 2018 to 2022 are shown in this statistic. The sectors with highest prospect scores in 2022 were new energy infrastructure, life sciences, and logistic facilities.

In December 2019, Negin Mirsalehi ( @ neginmirsalehi ) was the most-followed of all Instagram influencers coming from the Netherlands. This according to data provided by InfluencerDB. The Iranian-Dutch fashion blogger fits in a larger trend : Dutch influencers either have a background in music ( such as rappers Lil'Kleine and Boef ), or they were involved in beauty or fashion. Examples of the latter category were bodybuilder and DJ Tavi Castro, Moroccan Dutch `` Mimi '' or Meryem van Os-Karin, Monica Geuze ( @ monicageuze ), `` Nikkietutorials '' or Nikkietutorials, and makeup artist Nikki de Jager ( @ nikkijander ). FC Barcelona footballer Lieke Martens ( @ liekemartens ) was ranked seventh. This list excludes Dutch influencers who are active on other social media platforms.

The artist's Instagram page registered roughly 17 million followers. The second-ranked artist, born in Amsterdam in 1994, is the Dutch born street artist Bansky. The artist's work is characterized by its use of color and his exploration of urban landscapes.

As of April 2020, almost 72 percent of Hungarians stated that their relationships with family members stayed the same during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. However, one-quarter of respondents reported that their relationships with family members got better during the quarantine.

This statistic displays the net rate of return of private non-financial corporations ( PNFCs ) in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2000 to 2018. During this 19 year period the net rate of return of PNFCs fluctuated. Amounting to 11.5 percent in 2000, it peaked at 13 percent in 2015. Afterwards, it decreased to 12.4 percent in 2018.

This statistic displays the gross rate of return of private non-financial corporations ( PNFCs ) in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2000 to 2018. During this 19 year period the gross rate of return of PNFCs fluctuated. Amounting to 11.7 percent in 2000, the gross rate of return of PNFCs increased in the following years, peaking at 12.2 percent in 2015. However, in 2018 the gross rate of return of PNFCs decreased to 11.7 percent.

This statistic displays the capital consumption of manufacturing private non-financial corporations ( PNFCs ) in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2000 to 2018. During this 19 year period the capital consumption of manufacturing PNFCs generally increased year on year. In 2000 the capital consumption of manufacturing PNFCs in the UK amounted to over 20 billion British pounds, by 2018 this had increased to approximately 25.4 billion British pounds.

This statistic displays the gross rate of return of private non-financial corporations ( PNFCs ) in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2000 to 2018. During this 19 year period the gross rate of return of manufacturing PNFCs fluctuated. Amounting to 10.3 percent in 2000, it decreased in the following years, before reaching a value of 12 percent in 2018.

This statistic displays the net operating surplus of service sector private non-financial corporations ( PNFCs ) in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2000 to 2018. During this 19 year period the net operating surplus of service sector PNFCs generally increased year on year. In 2000 the net operating surplus of service sector PNFCs in the UK amounted to approximately 72.1 billion British pounds, by 2018 this had increased to approximately 185.8 billion British pounds.

This statistic displays the capital consumption of private non-financial corporations ( PNFCs ) total assets in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from the first quarter of 2013 to the first quarter of 2019. During this period the capital consumption of PNFCs total assets generally increased. In the first quarter of 2013 the capital consumption of PNFCs total assets in the UK amounted to approximately 16.1 billion British pounds, by the first quarter of 2019 this had increased to roughly 33.7 billion British pounds.

This statistic depicts the merchandise sales of Kmart in 2017, by merchandise category. In 2017, Kmart generated about 2.09 billion U.S. dollars from their apparel and soft home segment.

From March to December 2020, new patients infected by the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) have been hospitalized daily in Belgium. Since April 8, the number of hospitalized patients peaked at 1,007 on November 13. On December 20, 993 patients were hospitalized due to the coronavirus in Belgium.

Between August 2017 and March 2019, the average maximum temperature in Italy experienced several fluctuations. The average maximum temperature registered in the period under consideration was 29.6  C., which was recorded in August 2017. However, the most remarkable peak was registered in July 2017, at 29.8  C. On the contrary, the lowest maximum temperature was observed in February 2018, at 8.3  C.

This statistic displays the number of knife possession offences resulting in absolute or conditional discharge in England and Wales from 2010 to 2017. From 2010 to 2012 the number of knife possession offences resulting in absolute or conditional discharge decreased from 895 discharges to 635 discharges. Thereafter the number of discharges fluctuated, reaching a low of 333 discharges in the latest period.

The statistic shows the sales increase of VF Corporation's Vans brand worldwide from fiscal year 2019 to 2021, by country. In fiscal year 2021, VF Corporation's Vans brand's sales increased by approximately 1.9 percent in the United States, when compared to the previous year.

Amounting to 943 in 2013, the number of suspended sentences grew year on year, reaching 1,291 suspended sentences in the latest period.
