This statistic shows the annual turnover of the manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations industry in Denmark from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the soap and detergents manufacturing industry produced a turnover of approximately 256.3 million euros.
This statistic shows the distribution of law firm staff worldwide from 2005 to 2016, by type. In 2016, law firms reported that 92 percent of their professional staff were permanent employees.

This statistic shows the share of consumers to a chilled food survey, who claimed to eat a range of different types of food from the category 'brunch'in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2017. Of respondents, 76 percent claimed to eat lunch/brunch at least once a month.

This statistic shows the annual production value of the manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations industry in Denmark from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the soap and detergents manufacturing industry had a production value of approximately 245.3 million euros.

This statistic shows the number of employees in the manufacture of soap and detergents, cleaning and polishing preparations industry in Norway from 2008 to 2015. In 2015, the soap and detergents manufacturing industry employed a total number of 925 people.

This statistic shows the most visited home decoration websites during the coronavirus lockdown in Spain between January and March 2020. It showed that the website berlin.es had by far the most online visits during this time period with each month receiving over 20 million visitors.

This statistic displays the number of knife possession offences by adults, resulting in immediate custody in England and Wales from 2010 to 2017. Whilst the incidences of immediate custody fluctuated during the period observed, the trend was generally one of increase. In 2010 the incidences of immediate custody amounted to 4,723, by 2017 the incidences of immediate custody came to a high of 6,719.

This statistic shows the top 10 countries based on share of clinical trial participants worldwide from 2015 to 2019. The United States had the largest proportion of clinical trial participants with 43.8 percent, while the United Kingdom had the smallest share with 2.5 percent.

This statistic shows the distribution of clinical trial participants worldwide in 2015-2019, by gender and geographic location. In this period, 51 percent of clinical trial participants in the United States were female.
The statistic shows Orlando Magic players with the most assists in franchise history. Dwight Howard is the career assists leader of the Orlando Magic with 3,504 assists.
The statistic shows San Antonio Spurs players with the most assists in franchise history. Tim Duncan is the career assists leader of the San Antonio Spurs with 6,851 assists.
The statistic shows Memphis Grizzlies players with the most steals in franchise history. Marc Gasol is the career steals leader of the Memphis Grizzlies with 1,167 steals.
The statistic shows New York Knicks players with the most steals in franchise history. Patrick Ewing is the career steals leader of the New York Knicks with 1,061 steals.

This statistic displays the number of knife possession offences by children, resulting in reprimands or warnings and youth cautions in England and Wales from the first quarter of 2015 to the third quarter of 2017. Whilst the number of knife possession offences by children, resulting in a caution fluctuated during the period observed, the trend was generally one of increase. In the first quarter of 2015 the number of cautions amounted to 110, by the third quarter of 2017 the number of cautions came to a high of 441.

This statistic shows the percentage of Canadian First Nations adults that indicated they had received dental care within the last amount of time as of 2015-2016. According to the data, 30 percent of respondents had received dental care within the last 6 months.

This statistic shows the percentage of Canadian First Nations adults that had experienced select barriers to accessing dental care from 2002 to 2016. According to the data, in 2016, around 9.8 percent of respondents had not been able to visit a dentist due to financial reasons, compared to 22.5 percent of First Nations adults in the year 2000-2003.

As of December 20, 2020, Belgium performed over 648 thousand coronavirus tests. The country accelerated its COVID-19 testing rate in the early weeks of May 2020. From the first of October, Belgium has tested at least 33,000 people every day. Since September, the number of positive cases was escalating daily in the country.

The statistic depicts the share of virtual reality and augmented reality users in the United States as of 2018, by type of device. Smartphone-based VR/AR devices were used by 77 percent of the respondents in the United States, according to the survey.

This statistic shows the number of countries implementing renewable energy feed-in-tariff ( FIT ) and premium schemes worldwide from 2004 to 2016. By 2016, 83 countries had implemented feed-in-tariff schemes, up from 72 countries in the previous year.

This statistic shows the monthly export price of acrylic butter in the United States from January 2017 to October 2017. In October 2017, the U.S. export price of acrylic butter was 2,621 U.S. dollars per ton.

This statistic displays the sales of potted plants in Canada from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, approximately 892.44 million Canadian dollars worth of potted plants were sold in Canada, an increase from around 856.55 million in 2019.
The timeline shows the revenue of the PVH Corporation worldwide from 2015 to 2020, by region. In 2020, PVH Corporation's revenue in the United States amounted to about 2.4 billion U.S. dollars.

This statistic shows the number of air pollution days in rural and urban sites in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2020, by pollutant. There were 21.4 days with nitrogen dioxide pollution in rural sites, compared to 17.4 days in urban sites.

This statistic depicts the key figures on the Brazilian government's investment in the national electronic health record ( EHR ) system as of November 2017. As of that point in time, the Brazilian government had invested more than 20 million Brazilian reals in the development of the national electronic health record system.
This statistic shows the number of reported cases of Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome ( AIDS ) in Canada from 1986 to 2019. In 2019, there were around 90 cases of AIDS reported in Canada.

This statistic shows the asthma hospitalization rate among children and adolescents in Canada from 2006/2007 to 2013/2014, by province. During the given period, the rate of asthma hospitalization in children aged 0 to 19 years in Ontario, Canada, stood at 199.8 per 100,000 population.

This statistic shows the seeded area of canola in Canada from 2008 to 2021. In 2021, approximately 9.07 million hectares of canola were seeded in Canada, an increase from around 8.42 million hectares the previous year.

As of April 2020, 18.6 percent of the content on Quibi was dedicated to news. The platform is mobile-only and launched on April 6, 2020, and according to an analysis of its content available at the time of launch, focused mainly on news, entertainment, and lifestyle.

The statistic shows the number of hotel establishments run by Wyndham in Brazil from 2015 to 2018. Wyndham had a total of 32 outlets in operation in Brazil in 2018, down from 33 hotels a year earlier. This hotel chain was among the leading hotel chains in Brazil in 2018, based on number of establishments.

The statistic shows the number of hotel establishments run by Windermoor in Brazil from 2015 to 2018. Windermoor had a total of 16 outlets in operation in Brazil in 2018, up from 15 hotels a year earlier. This hotel chain was among the leading hotel chains in Brazil in 2018, based on number of establishments.

The statistic shows the number of hotel establishments run by InterContinental Hotels Group ( IHG ) in Brazil from 2015 to 2018. IHG had a total of 14 outlets in operation in Brazil in 2018, up from 13 hotels a year earlier. This hotel group was among the leading hotel groups in Brazil in 2018, based on number of establishments.

The statistic shows the number of hotel establishments run by Master Hotels in Brazil from 2015 to 2018. Master Hotels had a total of 10 outlets in operation in Brazil in 2018, down from 11 hotels a year earlier. This hotel chain was among the leading hotel chains in Brazil in 2018, based on number of establishments.

The statistic shows the growth of average daily rate at city hotels in Brazil from 2010 to 2017. In 2017, the average daily rate at city hotels in Brazil decreased by 6.1 percent, compared to the previous year.

The statistic illustrates the total revenue of pay-TV in the Netherlands in 2017, by type. It shows that the total revenue was the highest in 2017 with over 1.5 billion euros, of which the majority ( nearly 1.1 billion euros ) was generated by cable television.

This survey shows the share of adults in the U.S. who stated they shared certain responsibilities with other persons in their lives as of 2017. Some 44 percent of respondents stated they shared a responsibility to take care of a parent or grandparent.

According to data published by the Chinese Academy of Social Science Research on 2020, there were about 4.7 million high net worth individuals ( HNWI ) in China with a wealth value of over 500 million U.S. dollars. The majority of HNWI's in China had wealth of less than 50 million U.S. dollars.

The direct contribution of tourism to employment in Southeast Asia has been steadily increasing over the past decade. In 2019, the tourism industry in Southeast Asia contributed to employment in a total of 15,973,200 jobs, up from 14,851,400 in the previous year.
As of the first quarter of 2020, 45.7 percent of semiconductor startups had received external funding via grants or other sources, with 32.6 percent having received Series A funding.

From April 2 to 12, 2020, nitrogen dioxide air pollution levels in Santiago, Chile have decreased by approximately 51 percent when compared to the first ten days of the previous month. In Lima, Peru, a reduction of around 60 percent was observed. These results are at least partially related to a reduction in industrial activity and traffic circulation in urban areas, a consequence of partial and total lockdown measures enforced around the world in an attempt to limit the spread of the coronavirus pandemic. In Santiago, Chile, a total lockdown was enforced on March 16, 2020.

The number of suspended and resumed businesses due to the coronavirus epidemic in Poland in 2020 amounted to nearly 30 thousand suspended businesses and 7.5 thousand resumed businesses as of April 2020. Suspended businesses increased from 11 thousand in January to nearly 30 thousand in March, while resumed businesses grew from 3.3 thousand in January to 7.5 thousand in April.

In June 2021, over 20 thousand motor vehicles were sold in Colombia, up from approximately 15.5 thousand sales registered a month earlier. During the period analyzed, December 2020 presented the highest sales volume, with over 30 thousand units sold.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ) in Poland, more frequently used medicines and dietary supplements are expected. Antibacterial gel was the most popular hygiene product to buy, while dietary supplements and multivitamin preparations were the most popular medicines.

Over 98 percent of the audiences at BTS ( Bangtan Boys ) concerts held in Seoul in October 2019 were female. Also, most of the audiences at BTS concerts were aged 20 to 39 years, followed by the age group of 40 to 59 years.
In 2020, the vast majority of Poles ( 78 percent ) were in favor of the opportunity to purchase medicines online.

In January 2022, there were almost 341 thousand unemployed persons in Austria. This was a decrease compared to the previous month. The figures refer to the total number of unemployed people in Austria.

In 2020, the main reason for using telemedicine services in Poland was due to the COVID-19 epidemic and the need to limit visits to medical facilities. Almost every second patient used telemedicine services to avoid restrictions on medical prescriptions or examinations.

The majority of respondents stated that their home office during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic in Romania was very efficient. However, one third of respondents had difficulties achieving a work-life balance.

From January to December 2021, a total of 1,836 femicides were recorded in Argentina. March and April were the months with the highest number of femicide victims with over 40 women murdered on account of their gender per month. The latest figures show that November and December 2021 registered the highest number of femicides in Argentina since 2019, with more than 30 victims per month.

In June 2021, around 16.3 thousand heavy vehicles were produced in Brazil, up from about 14.8 thousand units produced in the same month a year earlier. The severe fall in the production volume in 2020 is linked to the health emergency declared by the Brazilian government at the end of March 2020 due to the COVID-19 outbreak in the country.

According to a survey carried out in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in May 2020, respondents were most comfortable with the ease of wearing a face mask in public places, and the ability to socially distance, as the lockdown rules begin to ease. On the other hand, there was a higher level of discomfort with more people going to restaurants and pubs, and with the ease of working in an office. The latest number of cases in the UK can be found here. For further information about the coronavirus pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

In 2019, the hospital acute care bed occupancy rate in Mexico stood at around 75 percent. In comparison, the bed occupancy rate in acute care hospitals was around 91 percent in 2000 in Mexico. This statistic shows the hospital acute care bed occupancy rates in select countries worldwide in 2000 and 2019.

The majority of professors held online classes during the emergency regime and the coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ) in Romania in 2020. Less than ten percent of respondents stated that they did not hold any online classes.
This statistic shows the breakdown of Disneyland Paris tourist attendance in 2016, by country of origin. That year, 49 percent of visitors to Disneyland Paris were French.
This statistic shows the favorite holiday activities of the French in 2017. It appears that for more than 70 percent of respondents, the best way to spend their holidays was to relax on a beach.

As of March 2020, 48 percent of new chemical projects worldwide were located in the Asia-Pacific region. This was followed by North America with 21 percent of new projects. The Asia-Pacific region is home to many of the world's leading chemical companies.

As of April 2020, 75 percent of healthcare workers in the United Kingdom have not been offered testing for coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) despite showing symptoms. While 16 percent have been offered testing, eight percent have been tested but it is not clear if the results are still pending.

This statistic shows how often people in Spain left their homes due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis in March 2020, broken down by age. In March 2020, 52 percent of the respondents aged between 18 and 24 years old claimed to have left their homes once a day to go shopping or to exercise.

Between March 9 and April 12, 2020, amidst the COVID-19 outbreak, the mobile traffic to Walmart.com in Mexico increased by 63 percent in comparison to the period from February 10 to March 8, 2020. In general, the top five most visited mobile e-commerce sites in the Latin American country saw a growth of at least 30 percent in terms of smartphone traffic.

Daily increase of COVID-19 cases in Russia was recorded at nearly 200 thousand on February 28, 2022. The total number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in the country was approximately 9.5 million as of that date.

Temporary layoffs ( ERTE ) was the most popular measure taken by businesses in the catering industry in Spain during the coronavirus crisis in 2020. Some 75 percent of restaurants, bars, cafeterias and pubs that experienced the coronavirus outbreak in the country considered ERTE as their most viable option.

A 2020 survey of global IT leaders revealed that 44 percent of respondents plan to reduce their spending on software as they look towards 2021. The most popular reason for reducing software spending was the economic uncertainty of the COVID-19 pandemic, as stated by 43 percent of respondents.

There were over 6.5 million registered vehicles across the Indian state of Chhattisgarh at the end of fiscal year 2019. The south Asian country's transport sector accounted for a 4.85 percent share of the GVA with road transport accounting for over three percent of it. The GVA from railways was about 0.7 percent and air transport accounted for about 0.16 percent during the same time period.

Approximately one half of Russians planned to attend cultural events and concerts as soon as the venues would be reopened after the COVID-19 lockdown in August 2020. The rest of respondents was not ready to visit crowded places for the time being.

The statistic shows the share of newspapers used by the Austrian population to inform themselves about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in April 2020. The most popular newspapers in Austria for coronavirus-related information were the Wiener Zeitung and the Standard, with respectively 35 and 21 percent of the Austrian population using them.

The statistic displays the number of medals won by athletes at the Olympic Games from 1984 to 2016, by gender. In these 32 Olympic Games, South Africa's female athletes have won a total of eight medals, including two golds.

The average time spent on watching TV news by Russians aged 65 years and older increased by 30 percent between March 16 and April 5, 2020 compared to the pre-pandemic level. The highest growth rate was recorded among the audience aged from 4 to 11 years.

As of April 2020, 45 percent of landlords offering relief to their tenants in response to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak stated they were providing a reduction in rent. A further 31 percent of landlords were offering their tenants deferred rent agreement.
The price level of organic products in the Netherlands decreased between 2014 and 2019. In 2019, the price level of non-organic products was still higher than the price level of organic products.

In April 2020, a survey of healthcare workers in the United Kingdom ( UK ) found that 31 percent of respondents who had not received a COVID-19 test did not believe the tests were needed. A further eight percent of healthcare workers believed they were only required to receive a test in specific circumstances.

Women's skincare products were the most sold on the online marketplace Wildberries in Russia between February 1 and March 4, 2020. The sales volume of facial masks amounted to nearly 230 thousand units, while approximately 426 thousand units of shampoo were sold on the website over the given period.
In total, more than 22,000 bed and breakfast establishments were registered in France as of January 1st 2017. In Auvergne-Rhne-Alpes, there were 3,000 establishments.

In 2017, the Louvre Museum in Paris was the most visited cultural and recreational site in France, recording more than 14.8 million admissions. The Muse d'Orsay was the second most visited cultural site in France, with more than eight million visitors.

In France in 2018, the number of 4-star hotels was greater in the Auvergne-Rhne-Alpes region than in the rest of the country. This region had nearly 1,800 4-star hotels, compared to less than 100 in the overseas regions.

In June 2021, the volume of container cargo handled in the ports of Panama amounted to approximately 696,000 TEUs. This represented a decrease of around 3.5 percent in comparison with the throughput reported during the same month a year earlier.

This statistic shows the visitor spending at outdoor events in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in 2018, by type of event. Visitor spending at music events amounted to over 17.5 million British pounds in 2018.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, almost one in two employees in Poland worked remotely. This situation was more significant in the services sector, where as many as 51 percent of employees worked from home. In manufacturing, remote work was less popular - only four percent of employees worked remotely.

This statistic presents the average price per night for the rental of an apartment containing a bedroom on a selection of cities in France on Airbnb as of January 1st 2017. According to the source, the average price for an apartment with a bedroom in Boulogne amounted to 85 euros per night.

In 2017, the prevalence of atrial fibrillation and flutter in men was 19.8 million, while in women the prevalence was 17.7 million. Atrial fibrillation and flutter is a known risk factor for stroke. This statistic shows the prevalence of atrial fibrillation and flutter worldwide in 2017, by gender.

In 2019, the United States had around 216 hospitals per million population. In comparison, Korea had around 52 hospitals per million population. This statistic shows the number of hospitals in select countries worldwide in 2019, per million population.

Over the past months, the most significant traffic growth on remote working platforms in Russia was recorded on Google.us, at approximately 23.5 million users, which was higher than on any other platform under consideration. Skype.com saw a nearly fourfold increase in traffic, while Trello.com's user numbers increased by over three times over the period under consideration.

As of June 2018, the average sales price of premium wine in Argentina amounted to 141 Argentine pesos per liter, whereas standard wine recorded an average price of 85 pesos per liter. In comparison, low-alcoholic wine had an average price of 53 pesos per liter. Overall, the sales price of wine in the South American country showed a large variation between the different wine category.

The Women's 800 meter event was first introduced to the Summer Olympics in the 1928 games in Los Angeles. Since then, Soviet athletes saw the most success in this event, winning three golds and eight total medals ( including one bronze ). The Soviet Union's Tatyana Kazankina, and 2020 champion Faith Kipyegon of Kenya are the only athletes to have won two golds in this event. The United States has won two golds and seven total medals in this event, with the last coming in the 2008 games in Beijing.

The hotel occupancy rate on the Reunion Island has been fluctuating between 2013 and 2018. It was at its lowest in 2014 with 59 percent, then peaked at 66.7 percent in 2018. The most noticeable increase was between 2014 and 2015, with a jump from 59 to 61 percent. Conversely, there was a significant drop from 66.7 percent in 2018 to 60 percent in 2019.

The Women's 10,000 meter race was introduced to the Summer Olympics in 1988, and Ethiopian athletes have been the most successful in this event since then. Ethiopian athletes have won five golds and nine overall medals, which is more than double the tally of any other nation. The only athlete to have won two golds in this event was Ethiopia's Abebe Bikila, who also won the gold in the 1980 Olympics, where the event was held in Moscow due to the Soviet Union's invasion of Afghanistan.

This statistic shows the results of a survey asking respondents for the first time in 2015, whether they think that a lack of funding is a major problem for the national health service ( NHS ) in the United Kingdom, between 2014 and 2019. The majority of respondents, over half in 2014 and 2019, think that a lack of funding is a major problem for the NHS.

The Men's Long Jump has been included in all Summer Olympics since the inaugural games in 1896. Since then, athletes from the United States have won the most medals, with 23 golds and 55 total medals. The U.S.'Bob Beamon is the most successful athlete in this event, winning two golds and one bronze medal between 1968 and 1972. The only athlete to have been stripped of a medal in this event was 2008's Felix Sanchez, who lost his appeal in 2013 ; the 2008 gold went to Jamaica's Andre-Jalonsdorf instead.

From March 16 to 22, 2020, amidst the COVID-19 outbreak, sales of cleaning products on online marketplace Mercado Livre increased by more than 60 percent in Brazil comapred to the week from February 24 to March 1, 2020. Moreover, sales of toiletries increased by over 15 percent. In Brazil, Mercado Livre is known as Mercado Livre Livre, its name in Portuguese. It is an online marketplace that operates in the country since 2003.

The Men's Triple Jump was first introduced as an Olympic event in the summer of 1896. Since then, athletes from the United States have been the most successful in this event, winning eight golds and 18 total medals. The U.S.'Michael Johnson is the event's most successful athlete, with his two golds and one bronze medal from the 1980 and 1992 games, respectively. The Soviet Union's Sergey Litvinov is the only athlete to have won two golds in this event, during the 1976 and 1980 games. The only athlete to have been stripped of a medal in this event was 2008's bronze medallist, LaShawn Merritt, as he failed to provide a test sample ; her gold medal from 2004 remains unaffected.

According to a survey from May 2020, the share of Danes worrying that hospitals in Denmark would run out of oxygen due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) increased. In April 2020, nearly one third of the respondents were concerned that hospitals would run out of oxygen, while in May, this number had increased to nearly 40 percent. The first case of COVID-19 in Denmark was confirmed on February 27, 2020. For further information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

From March 9 to March 15, 2020, amidst the COVID-19 outbreak, sales of puzzles on online marketplace Mercado Libre increased by almost 286 percent in Argentina comapred to the week from February 24 to March 1, 2020. Moreover, sales of dumbbells, discs, and bars increased by over 154 percent.

As of 2020, the majority of Germans ( 56 percent ) thought that the easing of preventive measures due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) epidemic was not enough. According to a survey conducted in Germany, 32 percent of respondents considered that the restrictions applied were too much.

A study from May 2019 found that 44 percent of online consumers in the United States had purchased music in the last month. Results varied by country, with just 15 percent of Swedish respondents having bought music recently at the time of survey.

The forecasted pharmaceutical market volume in Russia in 2030 according to the `` targeted '' scenario was estimated at nearly 3.3 billion U.S. dollars. The value of the pharmaceutical market in Russia in the same scenario was forecasted to grow at an annual rate of 7.2 percent from 2019 to 2030.

According to a survey, the Danish museum sector is expected to lose around 314 million Danish kroner due to the coronavirus pandemic. The majority of the loss is expected to be through closures of museums and cultural institutions. The total loss is estimated to be around 293 million Danish kroner.

In 2019, around 47 percent of African Americans with serious mental illness had used illicit drugs in the past year, compared to 19 percent of those with no mental illness. The statistic illustrates past year substance use among African Americans in 2019, by mental health status.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 93.57 percent of female and 95.01 percent of male Vietnamese respondents felt safe after stockpiling on items. In the same survey, the majority of respondents who engaged in panic buying stocked up on dry food items, personal hygiene products and medical supplies.

In 2020, the most significant number of passengers traveling by air in the European Union ( EU-71 ) were citizens of Germany, with over 57.5 million travelers. The second and third most popular origins were the United Kingdom ( UK ) and France, with 50.8 and 47.7 million travelers, respectively.

Frankfurt am Main Airport is the busiest airport in the European Union ( EU-27 ), transporting approximately 22.3 million passengers in 2020. In that same year, London Heathrow was the second leading airport in terms of passenger traffic in the EU, with 21.2 million passengers.

The average bank interest rate in the United Kingdom is expected to reach 0.25 percent in 2022, up from 0.1 percent in 2020. Between 2008 and 2020, the bank interest rate in the UK saw a decrease, reaching a low of 0.1 percent in 2020.

In France in 2018, the number of 5-star campsites varied according to the region. In total, there were more than 220 5-star campsites in the region of Provence-Alpes-Ctes-d'Azur. In Brittany, there were more than 30.
This statistic shows the revenues from out-of-home catering in France between 2010 and 2016. The value of the revenues decreased from 2010 to 2014, when they reached 54.1 billion euros.

Between 2007 and 2019, the number of annual trips made by metro and tram in Paris and le-de-France progressively increased. In 2007, this figure was around 1.4 billion trips, compared to more than 1.5 billions ten years later. However, the number of trips made by public transport in the region decreased in 2019, when it reached around 1.5 billions.

This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in Mexico City in 2018 to find out about the consumption habits during the Lent and Easter periods. In 2018, 70 percent of respondents said they did not replace red meat during Lent and Easter, while 23 percent said they did replace it with other types of meat.

This statistic shows the preferred destinations for French business travelers since the start of 2015. It reveals that 41 percent of respondents traveled only in France, while 30 percent traveled in Europe.

In August 2020, the majority of Russians negatively assessed their national health system, as per 41 percent of survey respondents. Only 12 percent of participants expressed a positive opinion on the health care system in their country.

According to a survey carried out in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in May 2020, it was found that the majority of British respondents ( 55 percent ) were confident that their workplace was secure enough to prevent the spread of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). On the other hand, eight percent of respondents were not confident at all that their workplace was secure enough to prevent the spread of the virus.

As of 2019, 72.4 percent of rural population in Ghana had access to electricity. Between 2008 and 2019, the share of population with access to electricity increased by 10.6 percentage points. Access to electricity was higher in urban areas compared to rural areas.

Since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, the highest number of visits to online grocery stores in Mexico was registered during the celebration of Buen Fin 2020, held between June 26 and July 2. During the remainder of the year, visits to these types of stores remained relatively stable.

A recent survey found that the majority of White adults in the United States had a cable TV subscription as of May 2021, with 45 percent of those surveyed having a current subscription and 34 percent having one in the past. The data shows that Hispanic and African American adults were more likely to have a cable TV subscription than White adults, with 40 percent and 38 percent of respondents having a current and previous subscription respectively.

The chart illustrates the price trends in the art market for three famous paintings - The Mona Lisa, Starry Night, and The Scream - over a period of five years from 2015 to 2019. 

The Mona Lisa, painted by Leonardo da Vinci, shows a consistent decline in its value from 2014 to 2017, with the price dropping from $2.5 million to $1.2 million. However, in 2018, there's a sudden jump in the price to $2.7 million, and it further increases to $3.0 million in 2019.

Starry Night, executed by Vincent van Gogh, demonstrates a volatile situation in the art market. The price fluctuates erratically between 2015 and 2017, starting at $100,000, peaking at $130,000 in 2017, and dropping to $90,000 in 2018. In 2019, there's another substantial increase, with the price reaching $115,000.

The Scream, painted by Edvard Munch, shows a dramatic price increase from 2017 to 2018. The price surged from $90,000 to $120,000, before slightly dropping to $115,000 in 2019. 

These trends are clearly visible in the graph, with the prices of the paintings plotted on the y-axis and the years on the x-axis. Each painting is represented by a marker on a light gray background, and the exact price and year for each painting are annotated above it. A grid enhances the readability of the chart by providing a reference frame for the annotations. 

Despite the fluctuations, the Mona Lisa remains the most expensive painting over the period, followed by Starry Night and then The Scream. However, the price of the Mona Lisa has dropped significantly from its peak in 2018, suggesting a one-time adverse event or change that caused a sudden decline in its value. 

The data shows a diverse range of values, with the highest price of $120,000 for Starry Night in 2017 and the lowest $85,000 for The Mona Lisa in 2015. There's also a noticeable outlier in the price of The Mona Lisa in 2018, which deviates significantly from its previous price, suggesting a one-time event or sudden change that caused a substantial increase in its value. 

In conclusion, the chart provides a clear visual representation of the price trends in the art market for these three famous paintings over a five-year period. It highlights the volatility of the

This statistic shows the distribution of biologic medicines sales by treatment cost in Canada in 2018. In that year, 33.5 percent of biologics sold in Canada had a treatment cost between 10 and 20 thousand Canadian dollars.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 78 percent of female and 76 percent of male Indian respondents stated that they stocked up on dry food items such as rice, noodles, pasta and flour. In the same survey, 61 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 39 percent of respondents did.

A survey held in the United States in May 2020 found that White adults were the most likely to watch or stream movies every day, with 32 percent saying that this was the case for them. Hispanic and African American adults were less likely to do so, with 24 and 31 percent respectively saying that they did so every day.

In March 2020, the vast majority of Poles ( 92 percent ) were of the opinion that it is their responsibility to help fight the coronavirus pandemic. However, 17 percent of respondents admitted that they did not know how to deal with the virus.

During a 2020 survey of publishers, platforms, and programmatic companies worldwide, gauging the state of the audio advertising market, 72 percent of respondents said that having other spoken word ( e.g. serials, e-books ) was important for their business. Additionally, 50 percent of respondents indicated that having podcasts was important for their company.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 49 percent of female and 43 percent of male Indian respondents stated that they stocked up on items because they thought that they or their household might be quarantined and would therefore not be able to buy groceries. In the same survey, 61 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 39 percent of respondents did.

According to a survey conducted in April 2020, 82 percent of independent brewers in the United Kingdom had experienced a decrease in sales due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. In addition, 80 percent of respondents had not been able to do enough to support their staff during the crisis, and 57 percent had to close their businesses down temporarily.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 43 percent of Indian respondents aged 55 years and above stated that they purchased items in bulk in supermarkets and hypermarkets. In the same survey, 61 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 39 percent of respondents did.

The second largest share of the non-financial corporate income tax ( NID ) in Russia was recorded in the mining and quarrying industry at over 9.6 percent of the country's GDP in 2018. The manufacturing sector accounted for nearly 6.2 percent of the NID's total effect on the GDP.

The largest share of the non-financial corporate sector output in Russia was recorded in the mining and quarrying industry at over 25 percent in 2018. The manufacturing sector accounted for nearly four percent of the country's total output.

This ranking represents the most visited tourist sites in Hrault in France between 2015 and 2016. It appears that Notre-Dame de Hrault was the most visited place during this period, with around 23,000 visitors.
In 2020, over 168 cases of other sexually transmitted chlamydia were diagnosed in Poland. The highest number of cases occurred in 2019.

This statistic shows the percentage of foods that were considered self-efficient in the United Kingdom from 1988 to 2019. The food efficiency measure looks at the amount of food wasted per person per week, relative to a standard reference diet. In 2019, 75 percent of all food and 80 percent of indigenous food types were considered self-efficient.

As of February 1, 2021, there were a total of 11,196 Casper Sleep Inc. stores in the United States, the majority of which were located in California. Following California, New York and Florida accounted for seven and six stores respectively.

In 2020, the travel and tourism industry contributed approximately 188 billion U.S. dollars to the gross domestic product ( GDP ) of Southeast Asia. In comparison, the GDP contribution of the travel and tourism industry in Southeast Asia was approximately 205 billion U.S. dollars in 2011.

The statistic illustrates the share of gym members willing to return as soon as the lockdown due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) ends in Spain in 2020. Some 54 percent of respondents claimed they would return to their gym as soon as the lockdown is over.

According to a 2020 global survey of artificial intelligence ( AI ) leaders, the leading reason for their organization to use AI was to assist workers. Other top reasons included over-saturation of data, replacing workers, and to improve customer experience.

The reduction in the level of nitrogen dioxide ( NO2 ) emissions in selected cities around the world is a direct result of the lockdown measures enforced to halt the spread of the novel coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). In London, UK, the reduction in NO2 emissions between March and April 2020 was 17 percent compared to the same period in 2019.

The labor market indicators recorded their lowest values in April 2020 because of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) impact on the Romanian economy. The unemployment rate increased from 3.9 percent in February to 6.2 percent in April 2020, while the net wages index dropped from 8.7 percent in February to -1.7 percent in April. By May 2021, all the indicators recorded their highest values since January 2020.
As of May 2020, leading app publishers generated an average of 1.24 million downloads per app. In contrast, the average number of downloads for all apps was 164,000 per app.

In May 2020, a survey carried out in the UK found that 38 percent of respondents who said they wear a face mask outside during the coronavirus pandemic experience issues with the mask fogging, making it difficult to see. Additionally, almost 40 percent of respondents said that the mask makes it feel too hot, uncomfortable or causes a general discomfort.

An in depth study on patients admitted to hospital and later deceased from the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) infection revealed that the majority of cases showed one or more comorbidities. As the chart shows, hypertension was the most common pre-existing health condition, detected in 67.6 percent of male and 68.2 percent of female patients who died after contracting the virus. Type 2-diabetes, ischemic hearth disease, and atrial fibrillation were also among the most common comorbidities in COVID-19 patients who lost their lives.

A comparison of the engagement rate in free time activities before and during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) lockdown in France in March 2020 showed that the use of the Internet and smartphones increased, while reading books and using messaging apps decreased. The most popular activities during the lockdown were watching TV and consuming news on social media.

The NFL is composed of 32 teams and each team plays eight home games during the regular season for a total of 256 games per season. Over the past years, professional sports leagues have gained significant popularity offering great entertainment to people and fans while generating significant earnings from their broadcasting rights. In 2019, the NFL generated around 200 million U.S. dollars from domestic rights and 15 million U.S. dollars from overseas rights.

The Major League Soccer ( MLS ) is a men's professional soccer league which comprises 26 teams from the United States and Canada. Over the past years, professional soccer has gained significant popularity, offering great entertainment to fans while generating significant earnings from broadcasting rights. In 2019, the MLS generated around 88.5 million U.S. dollars from domestic rights and 16.5 million U.S. dollars from overseas rights.

Data on the median average annual gross salary for full-time employees in the United Kingdom from 1999 to 2021 in British pounds ( GBP ) showed that over this 21-year period, the average annual gross salary for full-time employees increased by over 6.5 thousand pounds, reaching 31.5 thousand pounds in 2021.
The gross minimum wage in Romania increased by 3.7 percent in 2021 compared to the previous year. The minimum monthly wage increased from 2,230 Romanian lei in 2020 to 2,430 Romanian lei in 2021.

In 2020, the United Kingdom ( UK ) exported services worth 42.2 billion British pounds to other European Union ( EU ) countries. The total value of UK exports of services was higher than the value of imports. The main service exported by the UK to the EU was financial services, accounting for over 20 billion British pounds of total exports.

In May 2021, the average spend for grocery delivery and pickup in the United States amounted to 77 U.S. dollars, down from 90 U.S. dollars in August 2020. The average spend for grocery delivery and pickup in the U.S. has increased from 73 U.S. dollars in February 2019 to 90 U.S. dollars in August 2020 and dropped in May 2021.

Naomi Osaka is the highest-paid female athlete worldwide. Between July 2019 and June 2020, she earned approximately 56.5 million U.S. dollars in prize money and around 38.5 million U.S. dollars from endorsements. Her total earnings amounted to around 71.5 million U.S. dollars for the year.
In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, almost half of the parents in Poland had difficulties when it came to combining work and child education at home.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, around 54 percent of female and 49 percent of male South Korean respondents stated that they stocked up on dry food items such as rice, noodles, pasta and flour. In the same survey, 15.4 percent of South Korean respondents said they had engaged in panic buying.

As of March 2020, 38 percent of respondents in the United States reported that they were highly concerned about the coronavirus outbreak and as a result, they had increased their online grocery spending.

As of April 2020, during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, 75 percent of Hungarians used the internet to stay in touch with family and friends. Another 70 percent of respondents used it for entertainment and relaxation.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, around 49 percent of female and 37 percent of male South Korean respondents stated that they purchased items in bulk in supermarkets and hypermarkets. In the same survey, around 15.4 percent of South Korean respondents said they had engaged in panic buying.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, the top three channels for buying goods in bulk across all age groups were supermarket chains, online on an e-commerce platform, and in small grocery stores or hypermarkets. Of the almost ten thousand South Koreans surveyed, only 15.4 percent of respondents said they had engaged in panic buying and the main reason people bought goods in bulk was they were afraid supermarkets or shops would run out of certain items soon.

The Major League Baseball ( MLB ) is a North American sports organization comprising two leagues with a total of 30 teams : the National League and the American League. Over the past years, MLB has gained significant popularity, which has increased its fan base and number of followers worldwide. In 2019, the Los Angeles Dodgers had around 14.5 million followers across its social media channels.

Russia was the major exporter of major arms between 2014 and 2020. The country accounted for nearly 40 percent of the global total over the observed period. India was the second major supplier of major weapons between 2014 and 2020, with a share of 23 percent in the total exports.

This statistic shows the perception of Spaniards of the 2020 holiday flexibility due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis. In April 2020, half of the respondents claimed they would probably have to pay more for their holidays due to the travel restrictions or cancellations.

The number of positive influenza cases per week is highest during the first week of January, 2021 with over 7,800 cases of Influenza Type 1 and 2 combined. This statistic shows the number of positive influenza cases per week worldwide in 2021, by type.
The chart shows the digital TV penetration rate in Russia from 2010 to 2019. The penetration rate increased from 13.3 percent in 2010 to nearly 100 percent in 2019.

Most of the respondents stated that they have been eating more meat since the coronavirus outbreak in the United States in 2020. This is closely followed by other animal products such as eggs and plant-based sources.

The graph shows changes in consumers'eating habits during the coronavirus outbreak in the United States in 2020. Twenty-six percent of respondents stated that they were eating more fruits and vegetables than usual during the pandemic.

The timeline shows the year-on-year growth of the Consumer Packaged Goods ( CPG ) food at home category in the United States in 2020 and 2021, by product type. According to the data, the CPG food at home category overall grew by 2.9 percent in 2020 and 2021 compared to the previous year.

In May 2020, a survey carried out in the United Kingdom found that 30 percent of respondents said they were feeling panicked by the lockdown and the coronavirus pandemic, while a further 11 percent said they were feeling suicidal.

This statistic shows the number of shareholders of the Swedish clothing company Eltel at the end of the financial years 2019 and 2020, by country. The number of shareholders in Sweden was around 15.3 million in 2020. The corresponding figure for the previous year was around 14.6 million.

During the coronavirus outbreak in the United States in 2020, Millennials and Gen Zers were more likely to increase their purchases of dry food, non-alcoholic beverages, and ready-made or microwave meals compared to Gen Xers and Boomers. This statistic shows the percentage of respondents who reported purchasing selected food and beverage categories more during the COVID-19 outbreak in the U.S. in 2020, by age group.
Between November 2018 and March 2019, the average price of a standard double room in Lille remained stable at around 77 euros.
This statistic shows the distribution of doctors newly registered in France in 2014, by specialty. It reveals that over 40 percent of newly registered doctors were specialized in general medicine.

The chart shows the total expenses of international tourists, on a trip to France between 2011 and 2020, in billion euros. In 2019, the total expenses amounted to around 60 billion euros. In 2020, these expenses dropped sharply, to around 28 billion euros.

In 2020, the South African government added an amount of approximately 495 billion rand ( roughly 32.5 billion U.S. dollars ) to the country's gross domestic product ( GDP ) through general government services. This represents an increase of roughly 5.5 percent in comparison to the previous year.

From March 16 to 22, 2020, during the COVID-19 outbreak, the sales value of air conditioners online in Brazil increased by nearly 264 percent compared to the week before. Meanwhile, sales of toasters increased by more than 181 percent. In general, the most sought-after electronic products during the pandemic were home appliances, cooking equipment, and cleaning products.

In 2020, the crude birth rate in Angola was the highest in Africa, at 48.2 births per 1,000 inhabitants. The crude birth rate expresses the number of live births in a given geographical area in a given time period, per thousand mid-year population. Among the African countries with the highest crude birth rate, Angola was the only country in Sub-Saharan Africa, with the exception of Egypt, to have a rate above 40 births per 1,000 inhabitants. As of 2020, the majority of the countries with the highest crude birth rate were in Africa, and the majority of the countries with the lowest birth rate were in Europe.

The majority of respondents believed that the Romanian authorities were taking the necessary measures to tackle the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Only nine percent of respondents stated that the authorities were taking too many measures.
More than 70 percent of respondents were planning to spend their summer holidays in Romania in 2020. Only 12 percent of respondents were willing to travel abroad for their summer vacation.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 116 points regarding vegetables. This is symbolizing an increase of 4.7 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 125 points regarding wine. This is symbolizing an increase of 6.9 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 111.1 points regarding property maintenance and repair. This is symbolizing an increase of 4.9 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 127.8 points regarding water and other services. This is symbolizing an increase of 2.9 points from the previous year.

Before the coronavirus epidemic in Poland, 21 percent of the respondents assessed the government's actions as good. After the outbreak of the coronavirus, the percentage of people who assessed the government's actions positively decreased to 13 percent.

As of the first quarter of 2020, the fastest-growing footwear item worldwide was running shoes, with a year-on-year search growth of 39 percent. During the same period, slipcovers experienced the second-fastest growth with a search increase of 25 percent.

This statistic shows the regional market share of the global pharmaceutical market in 2018, and a forecast for 2023. In 2018, the total global market was valued at around 1.22 trillion U.S. dollars, of which almost a quarter was generated in the Asia-Pacific region.

This statistic presents the value of product shipments of frozen foods in the United States from 2007 to 2019. In 2019, the U.S. product shipment value of frozen foods amounted to approximately 32.39 billion U.S. dollars.

Of the U.S.'first eighteen presidents, twelve owned slaves throughout their lifetime, and eight of these were slave owners while occupying the office of president. Of the U.S.'first twelve presidents, the only two never to own slaves were John Adams, and his son John Quincy Adams ; the first of which famously said that the American Revolution would not be complete until all slaves were freed. George Washington, leader of the revolution and the first President of the United States, owned many slaves throughout his lifetime, with almost 600 recorded in official U.S. sources. Historians believe that Washington's treatment of his slaves was typical of slaveowners in Virginia at the time, however he did develop moral issues with the institution of slavery following the revolution. Washington never publicly expressed his growing opposition to slavery, although he did stipulate in his will that all his slaves were to be freed following the death of his wife, and he made financial provisions for their care that lasted until the 1830s.

The cumulative installed capacity of municipal waste energy in Europe increased by approximately 1.5 gigawatts (GW) from 2010 to 2020. In 2010, the capacity amounted to 3.4 gigawatts, and by 2020 the capacity had increased to 5.01 gigawatts.

This statistic presents the share of domestic tourism consumption in France's Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) from 2010 to 2018. In 2013, the share of domestic tourism consumption in France's GDP was 7.5 percent. Nine years later, this figure reached 7.36 percent.

This statistic presents the share of French and foreign tourists who participated in different leisure activities in Paris in 2014. It appears that more than 70 percent of French tourists visited a museum or a permanent exhibition while more than 80 percent of foreign tourists went to the city center.

This statistic displays the hotel occupancy rate in Brittany in France in 2017, by hotel category. It can be seen that the most occupied hotel category in Brittany was 4 and 5 stars hotels with an occupancy rate of 68.2 percent.

This statistic shows the number of visits from France to the United Kingdom ( UK ) between 2004 and 2019. The number of trips by French residents to the UK increased from 3.25 million in 2013 to 3.6 million in 2014. In 2019 the number of similar trips amounted to around 3.57 million.
The cost of raising a child in Poland from 2014 to 2020 has increased. In 2014, it was approximately 210.5 thousand zloty. In 2020, it was nearly 257.5 thousand zloty.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak, 20.4 percent of Vietnamese respondents stated that they had increased their spending on dry food items such as rice, noodles, pasta and flour. In the same survey, 61.57 percent of respondents indicated that they had not engaged in panic buying because of the coronavirus pandemic, while 38.43 percent of respondents did.
Nearly half of the respondents in Poland would definitely or rather not decide on raising children in the costs of child care.

As of April 2020, during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak, live streaming was the most popular new social media function in Hungary, with 27 percent of respondents using it. The second most popular function was messenger chat or voice call with 25 percent of respondents.

This statistic shows the Chinese share of selected imports of the United States regarding medical supplies and equipment as of 2019. As of that year, Chinese imports of disposable paper household sanitary napkins accounted for some 33 percent of U.S. imports of that kind.

A survey held in the United States in 2020 exploring awards show viewership found that adults aged between 18 and 34 years old were the least interested in watching the Golden Globe Awards, with just seven percent of respondents aged 18 to 34 years old always tuning in to the ceremony. Those aged between 45 and 64 years old were the most interested in watching the show, with over half of respondents within this age group saying that they always watch the awards show.

The graph shows the change in the export and import of selected medical products in China from January 2019 to January 2020. According to the data, the export of oxygen concentrators increased by almost nine percent while the import of the same products increased by around 15.6 percent in the Chinese medical market during the time period under consideration.

In April 2020, the majority of micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises in Poland recorded declines in the number of employees due to the coronavirus outbreak. However, the situation in large enterprises was more favorable. In this period, a significant number of large companies recorded increases in the number of employees.

As of mid-June 2020, the level of support for the protesters participating in the ongoing protests in response to the killing of George Floyd was higher than the level of opposition, with 35 percent of respondents either strongly or somewhat supporting the protesters, compared to 15 percent who either strongly or somewhat opposed them.

A survey held in the United States in May 2020 exploring awards show viewership found that only five percent of Americans always watch the Daytime Emmy Awards. The majority of respondents do not follow the show, with 60 percent of those surveyed never watching the Daytime Emmy Awards.

As of mid-June 2020, the level of support for the police in addressing the protests in response to the killing of George Floyd was higher than the level of opposition, with 50 percent of respondents either strongly or somewhat supporting the police. This compares to 29 percent of respondents who either strongly or somewhat opposed the police.

As of July 2020, the majority of Russians believed that the environmental disaster in the Chernobyl region was caused by human activity. One fifth of respondents stated that the accident was a result of natural processes.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, also commonly known as coronavirus, Vietnamese businesses were predicted to increase their revenue by 5 to 15 percent in 2020. In the same year, the majority of businesses were expected to experience a decrease in their revenue by one to five percent.

As of June 23, 2020, around 81 percent of deaths due to COVID-19 in the state of New York were among White Americans, where they make up 78 percent of the total population. This statistic shows the percentage of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) deaths compared to population among White Americans in select U.S. states as of June 23, 2020.

As of March 2020, 29 percent of respondents stated that their company had more available employees than usual due to coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). In comparison, 19 percent of respondents stated that their companies had less available employees than usual.

According to a survey conducted in the United States in 2020, around 40 percent of workers would prefer to work remotely, while 39 percent would prefer to work in an office. However, around 21 percent of workers stated that they would not have a preference between working remotely or in an office.

According to a 2020 survey, the most used collaboration tool for remote work in the United States was Zoom, with 36 percent of respondents reporting to have used it. Microsoft Teams was the second-most popular collaboration tool for remote work, with 19 percent of respondents reporting to have used it.

This statistic shows the electricity prices for household end users in Germany and Denmark as of 2019, by tax type. With an excise tax of 120 percent, Germany had the highest electricity prices for households in the considered countries.

Following the May 25th death of George Floyd while in police custody, wide-ranging protests and demonstrations against the use of excessive force by police officers and lack of police accountability were held in multiple U.S. cities and abroad. During a June 2020 survey it was found that 31 percent of African American respondents in the United States had a more favorable view of brands who posted their support of the police on social media. In comparison, only 20 percent of white respondents felt the same. Some of the consequences of Floyd's death include demonstrations, public outcry, and increased discourse regarding racial inequality and the impact of the currents state of policing in the United States on social media.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 121 points regarding private transport operations. This is symbolizing an increase of 4.7 points from the previous year.

As of March 2020, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in South Africa, an economic indicator providing information on the change of prices over time, was measured at 91.5 points regarding package holidays. This is symbolizing a decrease of 5.9 points from the previous year.

This statistic displays the share of individuals who said vaccines are comparable with their religious beliefs in the European Union ( EU ) in 2018, by country. In this year, the highest proportion of individuals who hold this belief were found in Poland and Sweden with 93 percent of respondents.

This statistic presents the perception of the economic and labor consequences of the coronavirus in Spain as of April 2020. The majority of respondents, 80 percent, thought that the economic and labor consequences of the coronavirus would be very serious.

The statistic shows the share of the leading leisure activities by tourists in Antwerp in 2017 and 2018. Shopping, visiting shopping streets and gastronomy were the most popular activities with over 30 percent of the tourists, whereas roughly 25 percent visited the city's monuments, churches, museums.

In 2020, the export volume of chicken meat from Japan amounted to approximately 9,857 tons, up from around 9,316 tons in the previous year. The export volume of chicken meat from Japan peaked at around 10,857 tons in 2014.

How many Norwegian primary school pupils have been bullied in the last two years? In the school year 2020/21, 12 percent of all pupils in primary school in Norway stated to have been bullied two to three times a month or more in the last 12 months. That was one percent more compared to the previous year.

As of April 2020, the most annoying thing for Hungarians working from home during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak was the lack of socialization. Another 23 percent of respondents found it difficult to concentrate when working from home.
The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the U.S. museum industry in 2020. Museums reported a median income loss of 10,000 U.S. dollars due to lost revenue and increased operating expenses.

This statistic shows a ranking of U.S. presidents, by their perceived effectiveness in handling selected aspects of their job, according to a survey conducted in 2017. An average of 58 percent of respondents stated that U.S. President Donald Trump was effective in handling foreign affairs.

In 2019, nearly 95 percent of Russian youth living in urban areas had ICT skills, which was three percent higher than the share of young people with such abilities in rural areas. The share of young people with ICT skills in the country's rural regions saw a decline by three percent between 2017 and 2019.

In 2022, Russia planned to import nearly 1.5 million doses of Sputnik V, the vaccine against the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) developed by the Gamaleya Research Institute in Moscow. The vaccine was expected to be produced in the country by the end of August or the beginning of September of that year.

In 2020, the number of first-diagnosed hepatitis B cases per 100,000 population in Russia was measured at 5.2, marking a decrease compared to the previous year. The morbidity rate saw a significant decline since 2010 when it was measured at over 15 cases per 100,000 population.

Approximately one third of offline retail businesses in Russia were estimated to close down after the COVID-19-driven quarantine measures were lifted, according to a survey from April 2020. In Norway, more females than males are undertaking upper secondary education. In 2020, there were 101,564 female and 97,152 male students registered in upper secondary education. That was the highest number of both male and female students during the time under consideration.

As per recent data, the shipment of personal computing devices ( PCDs ) is expected to decline by around seven percent in 2020. The market was valued at around 1.3 trillion U.S. dollars in 2019, accounting for roughly 20 percent of the global personal computer market. The personal computer market is expected to recover in 2021, with shipments growing by around six percent.

In 2021, a total of 1,049 people were killed by police in the United States. The highest number of people killed by police in a single year since 2013 was in 2021, and the number of Black people killed in 2021 amounted to 1,049 as well - the highest number of Black people killed in a single year since 2013.

As of 2019, the United States had the highest rate of civilians killed by police annually, at 33.5 deaths per 10 million residents. This compares to 9.8 deaths per 10 million residents in Canada, and 2.4 deaths per 10 million residents in Australia.

Of the ten U.S. presidents who served between 1789 and 1923, seven had a military background, with ranks ranging from a militia private to five star generals. The most senior of these was George Washington, who was not only the first President of the United States, but also the Commander in Chief of the Continental Army during the War of Independence. Washington's successor, John Adams, had also served in the Continental Army, and was the only president to have ever held the position of Commander in Chief of the Navy and the Army ( concurrently with being the President ). The only other president who had a military background, and who did not serve in the Continental Army, was James A. Garfield, who served in the U.S. Navy during the American Civil War.

The highest number of COVID-19 cases was recorded in the Silesian Voivodeship. The total number of infected people amounted to 13,934 ( as of January 6, 2021 ). The Silesian Voivodeship was followed by the Dolnolskie Voivodeship, where the number of infected people reached 1,934. According to the Minister of Health, over 625 thousand tests were preformed in Poland. For further information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

Take-Two Interactive is a video game distribution company headquartered in the United States. Take-Two Interactive's global revenue has shown a continuous increase since 2015. The main destination of exports of Northern Ireland as of 2020 was the United Kingdom with a value of over three billion British pounds. The United States was the second main destination of exports from Northern Ireland with a total value of 993 million British pounds.

The employment rate in the European Union declined in the first quarter of 2021 compared to the previous quarter. The lowest rate was recorded in Romania, where the employment rate in the first quarter of 2021 decreased by 10.2 percent compared to the first quarter of 2020.

The number of Swedish citizenship acquisitions increased overall during the past decade. In 2020, the number of men who acquired Swedish citizenship amounted to 42,837, and the number of women amounted to 38,081.

Following the May 25th death of George Floyd while in police custody, wide-ranging protests and demonstrations against the use of excessive force by police officers and lack of police accountability were held in multiple U.S. cities and abroad. The most frequent visitors to the United States from the presidential perspective are Lyndon B. Johnson and Richard M. Nixon, who visited the U.S. six times each. The least frequent visitors are the current and former presidents, who have visited the U.S. a total of 30 times.

In 2018, the highest percentage of driving a car or another vehicle under the influence of mind-attending substances in Poland was recorded for alcohol ( 1.7 percent ). The lowest percentage was recorded for cannabis ( 1.1 percent ).

A 2019 survey found that 44 percent of U.S. adults aged 18 to 29 years believed that climate change had a great deal of negative impacts on global agriculture. In comparison, only 28 percent of U.S. adults aged 65 years and older believed the same.

This statistic shows the opinion of French customers regarding the trade of animal fur in February 2022. In 2022, more than 80 percent of the respondents declared that they were against the trade of animal fur.

Belarus was the major importer of Russian condensed milk in 2019, purchasing nearly 4.6 billion Russian rubles worth of the product. The second leading importer of condensed milk was an unknown country, accounting for over 700 million Russian rubles worth of imports.

The coronavirus epidemic has contributed to an increased demand for fast-moving products in Poland. The highest number of customers was recorded on Saturday ( March 15 ), when the government suspended classes in schools and allowed people to move freely. On Sunday ( March 27 ), when the borders were closed, the number of customers decreased, and the number of visits to shopping centers decreased by 40 percent compared to the previous week.

The statistic shows the forecast growth of the global cloud telephony market from 2019 to 2021. The global cloud telephony market is forecast to grow by 8.1 percent in 2020 compared to the previous year.

According to a survey, during the 2020 Hot Sale in Mexico, 62 percent of participants said they bought items online during the event because they were able to get special offers and discounts. In addition, 59 percent of respondents stated they participated in the sales to take advantage of free shipping and delivery options.

The average retail price of whey products in Russia has been fluctuant over the observed period. As of December 2019, the mean price per kilogram was measured at 74.5 Russian rubles, marking an increase by 1.5 percent from the price level in the previous month.

In a survey conducted in January and February of 2019, around 54 percent of respondents in Peru believed that the most important factor needed in order to achieve gender equality was more women being represented in government and politics. Additionally, 45 percent of respondents in the South American country believed that women holding senior positions in business or CEO/board positions is also an essential factor for gender equality.

This statistic shows the gross margin of the LEGO Group from 2015 to 2020. In 2020, the LEGO Group's gross margin amounted to 69.8 percent.

American football is a commonly watched sport both in the United States and worldwide. Some of the biggest stars in the game are household names and often divide opinion based on their public persona and fans'loyalties. During a June 2020 survey in the United States, 19 percent of respondents stated that they were aware a lot about NFL players'reactions to the killing of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer.

However, the level of impact varied from one industry to another. For instance, the hospitality industry was the most affected by the coronavirus crisis. At the same time, the least affected industry was the one of education.

The highest growth of small and medium-sized enterprises ( SMEs ) in Russia was recorded in the food and grocery sector, which accounted for a 23 percent turnover growth from June 14 to June 8, 2020. The second most popular industry with a 17 percent turnover growth over the given period was the sex shops.

The average number of COVID-19 cases per 100 thousand population in Russia was measured at approximately 513.3 on November 30, 2020. The Yamalo-Nenets Autonomous Okrug had the highest incidence rate in the country at over 5.1 thousand per 100 thousand population.

This statistic shows the health expenditure as percentage of Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) in Nigeria from 2006 to 2018. In 2018, the health expenditure as percentage of GDP in Nigeria amounted to 9.6 percent.

In 2019, the average annual expenditure on health care in Nigeria was higher in the South-East zone, reaching 10.3 thousand Nigerian Naira. The average amount of money spent on health in the North-West zone was 5.9 thousand Nigerian Naira.
The highest number of requests for the ECHR to be solved in Romania was recorded in 2018, totaling 979 requests. In 2020, the number of requests dropped to 155.

In 2019, private healthcare expenditure in Nigeria amounted to 3.7 trillion Nigerian Naira. This figure is projected to increase to 4.4 trillion Naira by 2021. The private sector in Nigeria consists of both public and private insurance companies, as well as self-employed individuals and private households.

Between 2018 and 2020, the prevalence of wasting among children under five was the highest in Western Africa, at 6.9 percent. It was followed by Southern Africa, with a rate of 3.2 percent. In Eastern and Middle Africa, the prevalence was 5.2 and 6.2 percent, respectively.

As of May 2020, the average price of oranges in Colombia amounted to 0.89 U.S. dollars per kilogram, whereas in Mexico it stood at 0.77 dollars per kilogram. Among the group of Latin American countries displayed, Peru was the only one to sell oranges at a price higher than 1.5 U.S. dollars per kilogram.

This statistic shows the proportion of people who were concerned about the spread of different infectious diseases in France from 2005 to 2020. It shows that in 2020, people were most concerned about the coronavirus spreading, with a total of 76 percent of respondents declaring being very concerned.
In 2021, the majority of transfers involving men's professional soccer players came from contracts being expunged ( 66.8 percent ). A further 13.1 percent came from players being released on loan.

In 2021, domestic soccer clubs worldwide spent an estimated 4.9 billion U.S. dollars on international transfers of male professional players, a decrease of around 1.5 billion U.S. dollars on the previous year. These transfers involved players representing 185 different nationalities, highlighting the global nature of soccer.
In 2019, the average transfer fee for men's professional soccer players worldwide was 2.68 million U.S. dollars. This figure has increased from 2.25 million U.S. dollars in 2015.

This statistic shows the value of venture capital private equity investments in femtech companies worldwide from 2012 to 2020. In 2020, the value of investments amounted to 516 million U.S. dollars, a decrease from the 548 million U.S. dollars seen in the previous year.

In 2021, the majority of soccer players who moved abroad to play in the men's professional leagues came from Portugal. More than 270 players left the country to play in other European leagues, while more than 200 went to play in the Brazilian professional league.

In 2019, after earning over 250 million Indian rupees, Khana Khazana star and chef, Ajeev Kapoor was listed as the best-paid chef in India. Ranveer Brar and Vikas Khanna were some other names on the list.

In 2021, domestic soccer clubs worldwide made 686 transfers involving female professional players aged between 19 and 23. These players represented the largest share of transfers in 2021. Meanwhile, there were 124 transfers involving players aged between 30 and 35, and nine transfers involving players aged over 35.

As of June 2021, it was calculated that among employers of state and local government workers, the education and health services industry had the highest share of compensation costs for government workers. This was due to the fact that employers of state and local government workers in this industry had to pay an average of 64.2 percent of their workers'wages and salaries.

As of June 2021, it was calculated that the highest share of compensation cost for private industry workers was for those employed in management, professional, and related occupations. This group accounted for 70.7 percent of total compensation costs for the industry.

In June 2020, the most important topic in the presidential election campaign in Poland was the economy. Every second respondent considered this topic to be of particular importance. The second most important topic was health care, followed by the labor market and unemployment.

As of March 11, 2020, 20 out of the 34 cluster infections in South Korea were related to religious facilities, followed by social welfare facilities with 8 cases each. In total, there were 82 cluster infections in South Korea as of March 11.
In 2020, 36 percent of oncology and specialist hospitals in Poland had to part with it due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic.
The number of arrivals in tourist accommodation in Iceland increased steadily from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the number of arrivals amounted to approximately 5.3 million.
In 2020, 40 percent of oncology centers in Poland had restrictions on the statements about the operation of such centers due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ).

During the 2019-2020 flu season in the United States, there were around 20,300 deaths reported among people aged 65 years and older. This statistic shows the number of deaths due to influenza in the U.S. during the 2019-2020 influenza season, by age group.

According to recent economic data, the per capita personal consumption expenditures ( PCE ) of Kansas in 2020 reached 38,764 U.S. dollars. This is a large increase from the PCE of 2000 which stood at 22,938 U.S. dollars. The personal consumption expenditure measures the spending of a household on goods and services.

This statistic shows the volume of gas venting from offshore oil production in the United Kingdom ( UK ) from 2006 to 2019, in metric tons. It shows that gas venting increased significantly over this period from 24,000 metric tons in 2006 to 96,000 metric tons in 2019.

Approximately one half of Russians planned to take part in the upcoming plebiscite on constitutional amendments from June 25 to July 1, 2020, according to a survey from June-July 2020. The share of respondents who would vote in favor of the changes increased from 40 percent in March 2020 to 54 percent in June 2020.

The revenue of the recorded music industry in Denmark increased overall from 2015 to 2019. In 2015, the revenue was at around 456 million Danish kroner, and it reached a peak of over 600 million Danish kroner in 2019.
