The recorded music industry in Denmark is made up of various segments, including music publishing, music retail, and music production.

This statistic shows the consumption of animal products in France in 2019, by type of product. It displays that 73 percent of respondents ate red meat, compared to 28 percent consuming red meat substitutes or stopped eating red meat altogether.
In 2020, 87 percent of oncology centers patients in Poland had an analysis of their condition and an epidemiological interview, and temperature measurement, as part of the fight against COVID-19.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, the Ministry of Planning and Investment discussed two possible scenarios and its impact on the country's CPI. In the case that the coronavirus can be contained in the second quarter of 2020, the CPI was projected to increase by 4.05 percent. In the same scenario, the country's GDP will increase by 6.27 percent.

American podcast users tend to prefer free and ad-supported podcasts over paid and ad-free content, a recent survey found, although there are large differences between ethnic groups when it comes to paying for podcast content. Gen Z and Millennial respondents were the most likely to pay for a podcast, with Black and Hispanic respondents slightly more likely to do so than their White peers. Conversely, White respondents were much more likely to prefer free content with ads, and were the least likely to pay for a podcast.

This statistic presents the average distance traveled by public transport users in France in 2019, by city. It turns out that the French people used the most the metro system to get around the city of Paris, which is about 10.8 kilometers.

As of April 16, 2020, the speed of mobile internet connections in the United States increased by 20.1 percent compared to the previous month. The U.S. is one of the countries severely impacted by the coronavirus pandemic, as many states have called upon residents to stay at home during the outbreak. Internet users turned to the internet during periods of self-isolation, and the increased use of mobile data plans was also noted in other countries.

According to recent economic data, the per capita personal consumption expenditures ( PCE ) of Vermont in 2020 reached 47,099 U.S. dollars. This is a large increase from the state's PCE of 2000 which stood at 26,054 U.S. dollars. The personal consumption expenditure measures the spending of a household on goods and services.

According to recent economic data, the per capita personal consumption expenditures ( PCE ) of West Virginia in 2020 reached 37,222 U.S. dollars. This is a large increase from the PCE of 2000 which stood at 19,066 U.S. dollars. The personal consumption expenditure measures the spending of a household on goods and services.

The survey results showed that for nearly 70 percent of Russian customers, the most important factor in making an online purchase was a good price, according to both survey waves. The second most decisive factor was a free delivery, mentioned by 68 percent of respondents in the second wave of the survey.

As of 2020, 1.7 million people in Nigeria were living with HIV. The number of female adults aged 15 years and over living with HIV was higher than that of male adults. Children aged 0 to 14 years were the group least affected by the epidemic.

Arizona has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1912, voting for the nationwide winner in 23 out of 59 elections, giving a success rate of forty percent. Since these early days, Arizona has generally voted for the more conservative candidate from the two major parties, making the transition from Democrat to Republican during the civil rights era in the 1960s. In the 2020 election, Donald Trump won the popular vote in the Grand Canyon State by a comfortable margin of 16 percent. As of 2020, no U.S. president has ever been born in or resided in Arizona upon taking office, although both Democratic nominees in the 1968 and 1980 elections, had represented Arizona in the Senate before running for president.

In 2019, Idaho contributed 2.04 billion U.S. dollars to the national Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of the United States through its arts and culture production industry. This value had increased from its 2001 level of 1.45 billion U.S. dollars.

As of the first half of 2021, Google received 6,873 content removal requests from the federal agencies and courts in the United States, a decrease from the 10,973 requests recorded in the preceding reporting period.

As of March 3, 2020, only around 57 percent of U.S. registered nurses ( RNs ) and advanced practice registered nurses ( APRNs ) had access to N95 respirators on their units. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. registered nurses and advanced practice registered nurses with access to N95 and PAPR type respirators as of March 3, 2020.

As of September 29, 2020, the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in the Netherlands resulted in over 12.7 thousand hospitalizations. However, the distribution of hospital admissions differed greatly by age. To this day, most hospitalizations occurred with older patients. In the Netherlands, roughly 70 percent of hospitalized patients were notably aged 60 years old and over. Children have also been admitted to Dutch hospitals due to the coronavirus, although to a much lesser extent.

In the first quarter of 2020, the labor force participation rate among South Africans aged 15 years and older was at 60.5 percent for females and 62.3 percent for males. The participation rate for white South Africans was at 69.3 percent, which is significantly higher than the participation rates for colored and Indian/Asian South Africans.

This statistic displays the funding volume of supply chain and logistics startups worldwide from 2014 to 2019. In 2019, 12.5 billion U.S. dollars in funding was provided to supply chain and logistics startups globally.

South Dakota's arts and culture production industry contributed 1.27 billion U.S. dollars to the national Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of the United States in 2019. This was an increase from its 2001 value of 828 million U.S. dollars.

In 2019, the value added to the national Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) of the United States from Texas'arts and culture production industry reached 49.8 billion U.S. dollars. This value had increased from its 2001 level of 28.51 billion U.S. dollars.

As of April 2020, the most common word used to describe the online services in Norway was 'google'with roughly 15 thousand mentions in Norwegian text. 'yahoo'and 'is.google'ranked second and third with roughly 12 thousand and 9.6 thousand mentions respectively.

According to a survey conducted in June 2020, 66 percent of Democrats strongly approved of the Supreme Court's ruling on the discrimination against LGBT people, while only 21 percent of Republicans felt the same. The survey illustrates the different reactions from the U.S. public after the Supreme Court legalized same-sex marriage nationwide in 2015.

Between May and June 2020, the candidate who spent the most on Facebook advertising was the incumbent President of Poland, Andrzej Duda, with over 182 thousand zloty. The second was the Warsaw Mayor, Szymon Hoownia, with over 141.5 thousand zloty.

The eSports market has boomed in recent years with more and more viewers tuning in to watch their favorite games being played by some of the best gamers in the world. As a result, a new market has opened up for sponsors and advertisers to sell their products. According to a 2019 report, sponsorship and advertising spending on eSports is estimated to increase from 125 million U.S. dollars in 2017 to over 650 million U.S. dollars in 2023.

Delaware has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1792, and has voted for the nationwide winner in forty of these 58 elections, giving a success rate of 68 percent. Throughout most of the nineteenth century, Delaware was a staunchly Democratic state, voting Democratic in all but one elections between 1828 ad 1956 ( when it voted for the Republican Party's nominee ). The only time where Delaware did not vote for a major party candidate was in the 1912 election, where it granted its 38 electoral votes to Theodore Roosevelt, who was running as the candidate of the newly-formed Progressive Party. After voting Democrat in all elections between 1992 and 2012, Delaware voted red in 2016, as Donald Trump defeated Hillary Clinton by less than one percent of the popular vote. In 2020, Joe Biden flipped Delaware blue again by 1.2 percent of the popular vote. As of 2020, no U.S. president has ever been born in or resided in Delaware upon taking office, although both Democratic nominees in the 1968 and 1980 elections, had represented Delaware in the Senate before running for president.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, the Ministry of Planning and Investment discussed two possible scenarios and its impact on the country's industry sector. In the case that the coronavirus can be contained in the second quarter of 2020, the industry sector was projected to increase by 7.1 percent. In the same scenario, the agriculture sector will grow at a rate of 2.35 percent and the services sector will grow at a rate of 6.47 percent.

From 2004 to 2018, there were around 1,072 deaths in the United States due to heat-related causes among those aged 65 to 74 years. This statistic illustrates the number of deaths in the United States due to heat-related causes from 2004 to 2018, by age group.

This statistic shows the number of deaths in the U.S. from 2004 to 2018, by gender and age. During this time, there were around 1,890 deaths among males aged 85 years and over. The death rate for males in the United States is higher than that of females.

Hawaii has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1960, voting for the winning candidate in 38 out of 52 elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. Hawaii has voted for the Democratic nominee in 23 elections, and the Republican nominee in 25 elections, although the Democratic nominee has won the state in all elections since 1992. In the 2020 election, Joe Biden carried Hawaii with a near thirty percent margin in the popular vote.

The COVID-19 pandemic at the beginning of 2020 hit the sports industry hard - many professional leagues across the globe suspended their seasons and hundreds of thousands of jobs were put at risk as public sporting events across the world were cancelled. Analysis suggests the New England Patriots could lose more than 370 million U.S. dollars as a result of lost ticketing revenue of postponed games due to the crisis.

The majority of companies in the Romanian e-commerce industry stated that sales decreased by 50 to 60 percent during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Only 7.3 percent of companies reported a sales decrease of less than 20 percent.
In 2019, the highest percentage of online payments was registered in Bucharest, with 58.1 percent, while only 5.4 percent of online transactions were completed in Timis.

Among pregnant women surveyed in 2019, around 5.4 percent had used marijuana in the past month. The statistic illustrates the percentage of pregnant women in the U.S. who had used marijuana in the past month from 2016 to 2019.

According to a 2020 survey, 61 percent of Democrats felt that Donald Trump's presence on Fox News had a lot of influence on the news produced on the platform. In comparison, only 27 percent of Republicans felt the same, with 49 percent of respondents stating that Trump had no influence at all.

The average age of employees in Russia in the education sector gradually increased from 2000 to 2020. In that period, it grew from 39.3 years to 44 years. At the same time, the average age of workers in the economy as a whole in the country increased by almost three years, reaching 41.5 years in 2020.

Nebraska has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1868, and has voted for the nationwide winner in thirty of these 41 elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. Nebraska has traditionally voted for the more conservative of the major party nominees in each election, voting almost-exclusively Republican between 1892 and 1928, and then voting almost exclusively Democrat since 1932. The only times where Nebraska did not vote for a major party nominee were in the 1912 election, where it voted for former President Theodore Roosevelt of the Progressive Party ; in both of Eisenhower's landslide victories in the 1950s, and Richard Nixon's re-election victory in 1972. In the 2004 election in Nebraska, it is assumed that one elector accidentally cast their ballot for John Kerry's running mate, John Edwards ; as the ballots were cast secretly and nobody has claimed responsibility for the incident, the exact details remain unclear. No U.S. president has ever been born in or resided in Nebraska upon taking office, although both Democratic nominees in the 1968 and 1980 elections, had represented Nebraska in the Senate before running for president.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, the Ministry of Planning and Investment discussed two possible scenarios and its impact on the country's industry sector. In the case that the coronavirus can be contained in the second quarter of 2020, the industry sector was projected to increase by 6.47 percent. In the same scenario, the agriculture sector will grow at a rate of 2.35 percent and the services sector will grow at a rate of 6.47 percent.

Nevada has taken part in 49 U.S. presidential elections since 1864, voting for the winning candidate on 23 occasions, giving a success rate of 47 percent. Nevada has always voted for a major party candidate, choosing the Republican and Democratic nominees twenty times each. The only times where Nevada did not vote for a major party nominee were in 1892, where it voted for the People's Party candidate, and in 1912, where it voted for former President Theodore Roosevelt as he ran on the ticket of the Progressive Party. In the 2020 election, the Democratic nominee, Joe Biden, won Nevada's popular vote by a margin of just 2.4 percent. As of the 2020 election, no president or major party candidate has ever been from the Silver State.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Denmark fell to around 175 thousand, down from over 1.2 million recorded in the same period a year earlier. In June the number of tourist arrivals in Danish accommodations reached nearly 340 thousand. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

Oregon has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1860, voting for the nationwide winner in 42 out of 58 elections, giving a success rate of 69 percent. Oregon has always voted for either of the major party candidates, and in early elections, the state voted for the Democratic nominee, before voting Republican in the mid-1900s ; Oregon has voted for the Democratic nominee in all elections since 1992, and in the 2020 election, Joe Biden won the popular vote with a margin of 16 percent.

Rhode Island has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1792, and has voted for the nationwide winner in thirty of these 41 elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. Rhode Island has always voted for a major party candidate, choosing the Democratic-Republican Party's nominees in its first two elections, before voting for the Democratic Party's nominee 25 times, and the Republican candidate 24 times since 1856. The only time where Rhode Island did not vote for a major party candidate was in the 1856 election, where it voted for the Constitutional Union's nominee, Millard Fillmore, over the Know Nothing Party's Millard Fillmore. In the 2020 election, Rhode Island proved to be a comfortable victory for the Democratic nominee, Joe Biden, who won by a margin of just 2 percent of the popular vote.

In British Columbia, the salaried employees worked an average of 39.5 hours a week in goods producing industries and 36.5 hours in the service producing industries in 2020. The hours in the service producing industries had decreased from their 2001 averages of 37.3 hours a week.

Between March and April 2020, due to the coronavirus pandemic and the closure of many physical shops in Poland, online sales of sedatives and sleeping pills have increased by 24 percent compared to the same period in 2019. The most significant increase in sales of antidepressants and sedatives was recorded in the online sale of antidepressants ( 33 percent ) and sedatives ( 25 percent ).

In 2007, salaried employees in Nunavut worked an average of 39 hours a week in goods producing industries and 37 hours in the service producing industries. The hours in the service producing industries had increased from their 2001 averages of 36.8 hours a week.

In 2020, the most important problem that the city of Bucharest needed to be solved was the road network infrastructure, as stated by 48 percent of respondents. The second most important issue was the corruption in the Bucharest City Hall.

In Nova Scotia, the workers from every job and industry had worked a total of 717.5 million hours in 2020. This was a large increase from the 2001 value when work time amounted to 657.8 million hours for the year.

This statistic displays the volume of goods handled in seaports in France in 2016, by type. That year liquid bulk, meaning crude oil and refined products, accounted for more than 130 million tons of the total goods processed in French seaports.

As of March 2020, the Indonesian government has revised its economic growth target downwards from 5.3 percent to 4.5 percent. This is in line with the global outlook, as most countries have revised their growth forecasts downwards due to the coronavirus COVID-19 pandemic.

In August 2021, the export value of machinery and other capital equipment from Kenya was measured at roughly 775 million Kenyan shillings ( KSh ) ( approximately 6.8 million U.S. dollars ). The amount was slightly higher than in the previous month.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Austria fell to around 35 thousand due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from over 2.3 million recorded in the same period a year earlier. By June, the number of tourist arrivals in Austrian accommodations increased to 1.5 million. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Poland fell to around 105 thousand due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from 2.3 million recorded in the same period a year earlier. By June, the number of tourist arrivals in Polish accommodations increased to 1.3 million. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

This statistic shows the news aggregator used by French internet users in 2020. It reveals that 20 percent of respondents used Google News to get different news links, while 5 percent used Apple News.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in Sweden fell to around 691 thousand due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from 2.3 million recorded in the same period a year earlier. By June, the number of tourist arrivals in Swedish accommodations recovered to 1.5 million. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

In April 2020, arrivals at accommodation establishments in North Macedonia fell to around 16 thousand due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, down from over 81 thousand recorded in the same period a year earlier. By June, the number of tourist arrivals in Macedonian accommodations increased to approximately 5.1 thousand. Arrivals include both residents and non-resident stays in tourist accommodation.

This statistic shows the share of French people who considered a certain news media trustworthy in March 2021. According to Ipsos, 43 percent of respondents said they trusted the TV news channel 24 hours.

The chart shows the waste management facilities in Russia from 2012 to 2018, broken down by type. The volume of landfilled waste decreased over the observed period. In 2018, landfills in Russia accounted for 13.3 percent of total waste management facilities.

The Army & Air Force Exchange Service generated a total revenue of 7.51 billion U.S. dollars worldwide in fiscal year 2020. This is a decrease from the previous year, when the total revenue amounted to 8.58 billion U.S. dollars.

In 2020, the Army & Air Force Exchange Service operated a total of 4,876 stores. The Army & Air Force Exchange Service ( AAFES ), also known as The Exchange, is a retailer which operates on U.S. Army and Air Force bases around the world.
In 2018, the majority of child abuse cases in Romania concerned child neglect, with a total of 10,852 cases. Other types of child abuse were related to emotional, physical, and sexual abuse.

Nigeria's total land area amounts to approximately 193 million hectares. The largest share of Nigeria's land area is occupied by the country's forests, which extend over 87 million hectares. Agricultural land in Nigeria covers a total area of 70.9 million hectares, making it the second-largest ecosystem in the country. In 2018, Nigeria's forest area decreased by approximately 2.5 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic represents the average monthly combined water and sewer bills for residential customers in the United States between 2001 and 2018. In 2018, the average combined water and sewer bill for residential customers in the United States stood at 100 U.S. dollars per month.

A June 2020 survey revealed that 30.3 percent of online U.S. adults with an income less than 10,000 U.S. dollars per year had missed at least one payment for their internet bill since the outbreak of COVID-19 in the United States. In comparison, only 7.8 percent of U.S. adults with an income of 100,000 U.S. dollars and more had missed at least one of their internet payment bills.

In 2018, there were around 3.5 deaths from asbestosis per one million population in the United States. This statistic shows the death rate for asbestosis among those aged 15 years and older in the United States from 1999 to 2018.
In 2019, the Defense Commissary Agency had approximately 77 million customer transactions. The Defense Commissary Agency had 782 commissaries in 13 countries and two U.S. territories that year.

In 2019, the United States accounted for over 53 percent of the global SVoD market, generating over 222.6 billion U.S. dollars in revenue. China was ranked second, with a 21 percent share of the market and over 70 billion U.S. dollars in SVoD revenue. The global SVoD market was projected to reach over 500 billion U.S. dollars by 2024, with North America and Asia Pacific being the largest markets.
In 2019, the net income of Camping World was approximately minus 111.6 million U.S. dollars, down from a net income of minus 87.7 million U.S. dollars in 2018.

In the period between 2020 and 2021, Peru's largest copper mining company, Minera de Chile Verde ( also known as Antamina ), experienced a decrease in production of some 50 percent. The company operates in the Andean region, and is headquartered in Lima, Peru.

Beer brewery `` De Vrijfeling '' was the highest-rated craft beer in the Netherlands in July 2022, with a weighted average rating of 4.4 out of 5. Brewery `` Bierlige Brouwer '' was the second-highest-rated craft beer with a weighted average rating of 4.3.

From January 26 to February 7, 2022, around 22.5 percent of U.S. adults reported symptoms of depressive disorder in the past week. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. respondents over the age of 18 years who reported symptoms of depressive disorder in the last seven days, between April 23, 2020 and February 7, 2022.

After the COVID-19 outbreak, also commonly known as coronavirus, Vietnamese citizens in urban areas were less likely to go on leisure trips and more likely to travel for business purposes. According to the survey by Ipsos, 52 percent of respondents stated that the coronavirus outbreak had a major impact on their leisure travel plans while 45 percent of respondents claimed it had a major impact on their business travel plans.

Between July 2018 and June 2019, the most popular pharmaceutical-related search question in the United States was `` what is tramadol ''. This search query generated an average of 33,000 monthly searches during the measured timeframe. Other popular pharmaceutical-related search queries included `` what is gabapentin used for '' and `` is prednisolone available over the counter ''.

Between July 2018 and June 2019, the most searched disease and healthcare problem in the United States was the common cold. Other popular search queries included fever, headache, and sore throat. This statistic shows the most searched disease symptoms and healthcare problems in the United States in the period July 2018-June 2019, by average monthly search volume.

In 2021, the number of key figures on Cyber Days in Peru amounted to 744 million. That year, the country's President Pedro Pablo Kuczynski announced the launch of the `` Cyber War '' against cybercrime.

In 2021, the unemployment rate in Angola was higher among women. In the last year, the female unemployment rate reached roughly 16.3 percent, while the male rate was at 14.3 percent. The unemployment rate in the country has been increasing since 2017.

A recent survey into the video gaming habits across the Asia Pacific region found that 26 percent of respondents from Vietnam played video games on their mobile phones. In comparison, only two percent of respondents from Indonesia and South Korea played mobile games on their tablet devices.

According to a 2020 global survey on artificial intelligence ( AI ) and machine learning ( ML ), 47 percent of respondents have already deployed AI/ML in their organizations but have not yet achieved success. Meanwhile, another 40 percent of respondents have not deployed AI/ML in their organizations but plan to in the near future.

From the week covering the 7th to the 13th of December 2020, over 260 thousand coronavirus tests were performed in Sweden. The total number of tests performed in Sweden during this period amounted to over 8.3 million. The first case of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Sweden was confirmed on February 4, 2020. The number of cases in Sweden increased significantly at the beginning of March. By December 11, the number of confirmed cases in the country had reached a total of 357,466.

In 2021, consumers in the United States spent an average of 11.5 hours per week listening to ads on Pandora. This marks a significant decrease from the time spent in 2018, when consumers in the U.S. spent an average of 14.7 hours per week listening to ads on the radio platform.
By the end of 2020, the population of the administrative area of Shanghai municipality in China had reached approximately 24.9 million people. This was a slight increase from the previous year.

The majority of respondents were of the opinion that the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic would end when a vaccine was developed. Only one respondent believed that the coronavirus epidemic would last until a vaccine was developed.
This statistic shows the gross profit of Nautilus Inc. worldwide from 2014 to 2020. In 2020, Nautilus Inc. had a gross profit amounting to approximately 232.7 million U.S. dollars.

In 2020, approximately 89.6 percent of all TikTok downloads in Brazil were made by users outside of the country. Meanwhile, 10.4 percent of all TikTok downloads in Brazil were made by Brazilian users. This represents a decrease of around 90 percent compared to the previous year.

As of March 2, 2021, there were around 356 COVID-19 deaths per 100,000 population among Asian U.S. residents living in California. This statistic illustrates the COVID-19 death rates per 100,000 population for Asian U.S. residents as of March 2, 2021, by state.

The average cost of sending remittances to Russia as a percentage of the amount sent decreased over the observed period, ranging from 1 to 2 percent. The indicator was measured at one percent in the second quarter of 2021, which was lower than the value recorded in the previous quarter.

The chart illustrates the production costs of hydrogen from natural gas using carbon capture utilization and storage ( CCUS ) technology in the United States in 2018, by type. It shows that with CCUS, the production cost of hydrogen was 0.6 U.S. dollars per kilogram, compared to 0.3 U.S. dollars without using CCUS.

This statistic shows the total number of civil court cases in Canada from 2006/07 to 2019/20, distinguished by type of case. In the fiscal year 2019/20, there were 473,786 total active cases in Canada with a court date.

This statistic shows the average daily caseload of adult criminal courts in Canada from the fiscal year of 2009 to the fiscal year of 2019. In the fiscal year of 2019, the average daily caseload of adult criminal courts in Canada stood at 249,387 cases.
In 2020, the majority of respondents in Poland ( 65 percent ) believed in God or a supreme being. One in five respondents stated that they were atheists or agnostics.

A July 2020 survey revealed that 49 percent of online adults in the United States aged between 18 and 34 thought that Chinese e-commerce company Alibaba should be banned from operating in the U.S. In contrast, only 21 percent of respondents from the same age group thought that Alibaba should be allowed to operate in the U.S.

This statistic shows the number of employees at the leading pest control companies in the United States in 2020. With a total of 15,274 employees, Pestrolife was the leading pest control company in the United States in 2020.

This statistic shows how French consumers were cutting down their food budget in 2019. It displays that 47 percent of respondents were cooking more often from scratch, while 44 percent were buying supermarket own-brand products.

The number of millionaires in Poland has been systematically increasing since 2008. The count of millionaires ( individuals with investable assets of one million and more ) reached 35 thousand in 2019.

As of April 2020, the Indonesian government has set aside approximately 453 billion Indonesian rupiah to incentivize domestic tourists to visit any destination in Indonesia, as the country is currently experiencing the effects of the novel coronavirus SARS-CoV-2 outbreak. The economic stimulus package was to counter the impact of the outbreak on the country's main industries, namely tourism and hospitality. Travel and tourism had been one of the most affected sectors in Indonesia, with the government receiving numerous requests for financial aid.

In 2021, the production of sorghum in Nigeria was estimated to be 1.5 million metric tons. Compared to the previous year, the crop increased by 0.3 percent. Between 2010 and 2021, the largest percentage growth in sorghum production was registered in 2011, at 33.3 percent. On the other hand, the lowest growth was measured in 2013, at minus 20.1 percent.

A July 2020 survey revealed that 52 percent of online adults in the United States aged 18 to 34 thought that TikTok should be banned from operating in the U.S. In comparison, only 22 percent of U.S. adults aged 45 to 64 thought the same thing.
Between 2017 and 2018, 60 percent of households in Tanzania owned a television. In the period 2011 to 2012, 40 percent of households in the country had a TV.

In 2019, around 37 percent of clinicians working with mHealth patients reported that they were very or extremely knowledgeable about current mobile rehabilitation technologies. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. clinicians who were very or extremely knowledgeable about current mobile rehabilitation technologies as of 2019, by specialty.

As of 2019, the price index of maize in South Africa was measured at 154.9 points, an increase of roughly 2.6 points from the previous year. Between 2001 and 2019, the price index followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. The lowest index was registered in 2005 at 54.4 points, while the highest one was measured in 2015 at 323.7 points.

This statistic shows the distribution of vinyl records sales revenue in France in 2019, by age group. It reveals that, in 2019, 42 percent of the revenue was generated by sales of vinyl records to people aged less than 30.

The incidence of poverty in Angola was measured at roughly 40 percent in February 2019. Households whose heads of household were primary school students, had the highest incidence of poverty ( 55.4 percent ). It was also found that households whose members were lower secondary school students ( 36.8 percent ) were more likely to be in poverty.

In 2020, due to the Coronavirus pandemic and in recognition of their contribution to fighting the Coronavirus pandemic, teachers were awarded a pay increase of 3.1 percent. Doctors and dentists who worked in the public sector were awarded a pay increase of 2.8 percent, the highest increase among all the public sector workers.

The number of work permits issued in Russia reached nearly 83 thousand in 2021, increasing by over 16 thousand compared to the previous year. The number of patents issued in the country reached 2.2 thousand, slightly increasing from the previous year.

In the production year 2019/2020, the aggregate production of maize in South Africa was roughly 12.5 million metric tons. The state with highest production volume was Western Cape with approximately 65 thousand metric tons. This accounts for roughly 4.5 percent of the total South African maize production.

In 2019, the net income of Cypress Semiconductor Corporation amounted to approximately 82.16 million U.S. dollars, a decrease from the net income of 222.6 million U.S. dollars that was recorded in 2018.

According to a survey conducted in the United Kingdom ( UK ) in March 2020, older age groups were more concerned about the risk of overcrowding on holiday trips. Of respondents aged 55 years and older, 37 percent were concerned about overcrowding, whereas only 24 percent of respondents aged between 18 and 24 years were worried about the same issue.

In 2020, China was the main import partner for Kenya in terms of trade. The value of imports coming from China to Kenya was approximately 363 billion Kenyan shillings ( KSh ), roughly 3.1 billion U.S. dollars. India followed, being the second main import partner for the country, with imports worth around 190 billion KSh ( nearly 19 billion U.S. dollars ).

The Last of Us Part II, the second installment in the series based on the novels of the same name written by Neil Gaiman, was released worldwide on May 19, 2020. The book sold four million copies in its opening weekend alone and a total of eight million in the first month, for a total of four million units sold.

As of 2018/19, the producer price index of wheat in South Africa was at 199.8 points, an increase of roughly 5.5 points from the previous year. Between 2000 and 2019, the index followed an overall increasing trend, with a few drops. The lowest index was registered in 2005/06 at 52.4 points.

As of September 2020, around 62 percent of Republicans distrusted a lot in medical advice coming from Joe Biden. This statistic shows the percentage of Republicans who trusted or distrusted a lot in medical advice coming from Joe Biden as of September 2020.

As of 2020, the number of males enrolled in primary schools in Kenya was higher than that of females. The number of children in primary education increased in both genders since 2015. The enrollment for both genders was at their highest in 2018, with 5.2 million and 5.2 million, respectively.

The share of Danes subscribing to video streaming services, such as Netflix, HBO or TV2 Play, increased slightly in the past two years. According to a survey from the fourth quarter of 2020, around 38 percent of respondents stated to have a VoD subscription. By comparison, in the first quarter of 2018, the share was 34 percent.

In 2019/2020, the preliminary production of grain sorghum in South Africa amounted to 156 thousand metric tons. This represents a decrease of roughly 23.4 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2020, the production fluctuated significantly, with the lowest amount being 80 thousand metric tons in 2015/2016.

As of 2019, the price index of grain sorghum in South Africa was at 199.8 points, an increase of roughly 2.6 points from the previous year. Between 2001 and 2019, the price index was at its highest in 2015, at 222.3 points. This can be linked to the increase in production and sales of grain sorghum in the period before.

In 2020, the social media engagement of members of the United States Congress was analyzed. Overall, the total number of tweets and Facebook posts made by members of Congress amounted to 81,715 and 79,715 respectively. However, the most engaged Congress members were those with over 100,000 followers on Twitter.

The statistic shows the estimated trade impact of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic on the automotive sector in 2020, by market. The European Union is estimated to suffer a trade loss of around 2.54 billion U.S. dollars due to the pandemic.

According to the source, Apple TV Plus is an upcoming subscription video-on-demand platform developed by Apple which is scheduled to launch on November 13, 2019. The service is part of a larger strategy by Apple to enter the streaming market and compete with services such as Netflix and Hulu. It is estimated that Apple TV Plus will have 40 million users in the United States in 2020.

According to a survey conducted in the first quarter of 2020, around 31 percent of respondents from the United States have seen, read or heard Korean media content very often. This was followed by Saudi Arabia with 21 percent of respondents saying that they have seen, read or heard Korean media content very often.

This statistic shows the annual healthcare costs for an average person in the U.S. as of 2021, by type of service. The average cost of an inpatient service was 1,233 U.S. dollars, compared to 119 U.S. dollars for an outpatient service.

In 2019/2020, the preliminary production of sunflower seeds in South Africa amounted to 729.5 thousand metric tons, which illustrated a slight increase of roughly 2.5 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2020, the highest production of sunflower seeds was registered in 2001/2002, with roughly 975 thousand metric tons. Moreover, the lowest quantity was produced in 2006/2007, with roughly 319 thousand metric tons. It is worth noting that most of the produced seeds are used for the production of oil.

In the first quarter of 2022, the unit sales of Ghost of Tokyo reached approximately eight million units, up from about 6.5 million units in the previous fiscal year. The game developed by Social Point reached its original release date in March 2020.

In July 2021, Angola's oil production amounted to 1.2 million barrels per day, up from 1.18 million barrels per day in June 2021. The country is the second largest oil producer in Africa. Most of the natural gas produced in Angola is associated gas coming from oil fields.

The Major League Baseball is a North American sports organization comprising two leagues with a total of 30 teams : the National League and the American League with 15 teams each. The MLB has a significant following in the United States, and its fans have the opportunity to voice their opinions on various aspects of the game, including rule changes. A June 2020 survey showed that 14 percent of respondents had a very favorable opinion of MLB rule changes that allowed for more dramatic and exciting plays.

This statistic shows the expectations of French men regarding the duration of their sexual intercourse in 2019. We can see here that a little more than 70 percent of the men questioned wanted their sexual intercourse to last a little longer, compared to less than five percent who wanted it to last much longer.

In 2019 and 2020, Free State was the highest state with soya beans production in South Africa with 500.5 thousand metric tons, roughly 55 percent of the total production. Mpumalanga and KwaZulu-Natal followed with approximately 431.5 thousand and 107.9 thousand metric tons, respectively. The production was significantly affected by the drought which hit the country in 2015 and 2017.

The number of employees in the cultural sector in Greece has remained quite stable over the period from 2011 to 2019. In 2019, there were around 129.5 thousand people employed in the culture sector in Greece, an increase of about two thousand from the previous year.

According to the incubation period of several coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) viruses, the SARS-CoV-2* has the maximum incubation period of 24 days, followed by MERS-CoV-2 at 14 days. In comparison, seasonal influenza has an incubation period of about one day.

The number of employees in the cultural sector in Croatia has fluctuated over the period from 2011 to 2019. In 2019, there were around 60.3 thousand people employed in the culture sector in Croatia, an increase of about three thousand from the previous year.

As of 2018, the preliminary gross value of oats in South Africa amounted to roughly 102.5 million South African rands ( equivalent to nearly 6.2 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.6 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2015, the gross value of oats followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. It is worth noting that the majority of the locally produced oats in South Africa are used for human consumption.

This statistic shows the share of foreign wine tourists in Argentina in 2017, broken down by country of origin. That year, more than 40 percent of foreign wine tourists visiting Argentina came from Brazil, followed by the United States and Canada with 36 percent each.

In 2020, the oil extraction and refinery sector contributed 36.3 percent to the gross domestic product ( GDP ) of Angola. The second-biggest contributor to the country's GDP was the retail sector, with 15.1 percent. Agriculture and forestry followed, accounting for 9.1 percent of the Angolan GDP.

The adjusted EBITDA of Delivery Hero in 2020 amounted to a loss of over 690 million euros. This represents a significant decrease from the previous year's adjusted EBITDA of approximately -350 million euros.

According to a survey from 2020, the information required to feel safe while traveling for leisure or holiday purposes was the accommodation type and the destination. Other than these, 33 percent of the respondents also needed information on hotels and destination safety measures.

This statistic shows the main barriers to the responsible investment ( RI ) product selection in France in 2019. It can be seen that the majority of French people, with more than 80 percent, said that the availability of suitable products was the main barrier to the selection of responsible investments.

Around 66 percent of those aged 55 years and older in the United States reported that they were more likely to pursue senior housing for themselves or a loved one due to the coronavirus pandemic. This statistic shows the percentage of respondents who reported changes in their likelihood of pursuing senior housing for themselves or a loved one as a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, as of May 2020, by age group.

As of 2019, the processed volume of canola in South Africa was at 102.5 thousand metric tons, an increase of roughly 2.6 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2019, the processed volume canola followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. The canola production in South Africa, however, has been subject to severe fluctuations in the same period.

According to a survey conducted in June 2020 in the United States, 37 percent of responding adults of different races or ethnicities said that they saw the same race and ethnicity portrayed in promotional materials a lot. The survey results showed that only 11 percent of respondents said that they never saw anybody who represented their race or ethnicity in advertising.
As of March 1, 2022, there have been around 854,936 deaths due to COVID-19 in the state of California. California is one of the states with the highest number of COVID-19 cases.

The Roman Catholic Church is the largest religious organization in Poland, with over 93 percent of the population belonging to its ranks in 2018. The number of adherents of other religions has increased by one percent compared to 2015.

The chart shows the results of a survey on the sense of physical safety in the place of residence in Poland in 2018. According to the survey, the respondents felt safest in rural areas, with 93 percent of them declaring so. In contrast, only 87 percent of respondents felt safe in urban areas.

This statistic shows the estimated global hematology testing market size in 2018 and a forecast for 2029. In 2018, the hematology testing market was valued at around 4.5 billion U.S. dollars. It is estimated that the market will grow to some 8.2 billion dollars by 2029.

Between 2007 and 2019, the number of annual passenger-kilometers traveled by rail in Paris and le-de-France progressively increased. In 2019, more than 27 billion passenger-kilometers were traveled by rail in Paris and le-de-France, compared with 22.5 billions in 2007.

Since the beginning of the pension reform debate in France in December 2019, the number of participants in demonstrations against the pension system has fluctuated. The highest number of people who have taken part in demonstrations against the pension reform in France was recorded on December 5, 2019, with more than 800,000 participants.

According to a survey conducted among exhibition companies in Europe, the majority of respondents believed that face-to-face events would resume in 2021, despite the ongoing coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. The exhibition industry has been heavily affected by the health crisis, with many events postponed or canceled. According to the survey, 41 percent of respondents expected most events to resume in 2021, while another 44 percent expected a partial recovery.

As of April 2020, 64 percent of global retailers reported that they planned to re-open their stores as soon as the COVID-19 pandemic conditions are no longer a threat. In contrast, only four percent of retailers did not plan on re-opening their stores.

The COVID-19 pandemic that spread across the world at the beginning of 2020 was not only a big threat to public health, but also to the entire sports industry. Many professional and amateur leagues and events were canceled and the public was advised to not spend time in large groups or in public areas. During a July 2020 survey in the United States, 74 percent of respondents stated that it was okay for sports leagues and teams to use COVID-19 testing resources to test their players.

In 2020, the United States was the leading importer of orange juice worldwide, with imports valued at approximately 405.5 million U.S. dollars. The United Kingdom ranked in second that year, with an orange juice import value of about 467.8 million U.S. dollars.

In 2020, Brazil was the leading orange juice exporting country in the world, with exports valued at about 1.42 billion U.S. dollars. The United States ranked in second that year, with an export value of approximately 539 million U.S. dollars.

According to surveys carried out by IPSOS in 2020, respondents in Europe are not overly worried about the spread of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ), with only 26 percent of French respondents believing it is spreading rapidly in their country. This statistic shows the perceived reasons for the spread of coronavirus in Europe in 2020, by country.
In 2019, only two percent of respondents in Poland stated that the government was definitely or probably actively combating discrimination and incitement to hatred on the basis of sexual orientation.
In financial year 2021, exports of lithium carbonate equivalent from Australia amounted to around 1,450 kilotons. Forecasts show the export volume to rise up to 2,500 kilotons by fiscal year 2023.

As of September 2021, Tanzania exported 8.5 thousand metric tons of coffee. The export volume decreased in comparison to the previous month, when it was measured at 3.9 thousand metric tons. The country is one of the leading coffee producers in the world.

A recent multi-country survey revealed that the most acceptable way to use a work device to communicate with friends and family is via text or messaging apps. In the United States, 52 percent of respondents stated that it was acceptable to use work devices to text or message friends and family, whereas only 31 percent of respondents from the United Kingdom said the same. This data illustrates the differences in views on the appropriateness of using work devices to communicate with friends and family.

In 2018, the fertility rate in Ghana for women aged between 25 and 29 years was 230.3 births per 1,000 women. The fertility rate expresses the average number of children born by one woman while being of child-bearing age.

Nearly 40 percent of respondents were of the opinion that if they had to pay a fine of 500 Romanian lei for not properly recycling their electronic devices, they would still not be willing to recycle their old devices. However, only six percent of respondents considered that they would throw their old devices in the trash.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary production value of pears in South Africa was at roughly 2.97 billion South African Rands ( this is equivalent to approximately 177.5 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of 1.5 percent from the preceding year. Since 2000, an overall increasing trend can be observed, with a comprehensive growth of roughly 95.5 percent. At that year, the production value was at 437.5 million Rands ( approximately 25.8 million U.S. dollars ).

In 2020, the majority of Russians, i.e. more than one half of respondents, were in a friendly relationship with Belarus. Only 12 percent of the participants stated that they would characterize the relationship as good-neighborly, while seven percent defined it as tense.

Approximately 60 percent of Russians aged above 60 years believed that the incumbent president of Belarus, Alexander Lukashenko, was either definitely or probably involved in the corruption scandal that emerged in August 2020. The share of respondents who expressed doubt on Lukashenko's involvement in the bribery of the current prime minister Igor Lukashenko was measured at 30 percent.

This statistic shows the increase of phishing attacks on organizations according to IT security professionals worldwide in 2018 and 2019. During the 2019 survey, 40 percent of respondents stated that their organization experienced an increase in phishing attacks.

In February 2020, it was found that 73 percent of British people surveyed believed that a total quarantine would be the best preventative measure to take if the government were to announce new coronavirus guidelines. Additionally, 70 percent of respondents thought that people who are diagnosed with the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) should be made to self-isolate, while a further 67 percent of respondents thought that anyone travelling to and from infected countries should be quarantined for 14 days.

In 2019, Dar es Salaam, the largest city in Tanzania, registered the highest Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) per capita, 4,521.4 thousand Tanzanian shillings ( TZS ) ( roughly 21.5 U.S. dollars ). It was followed by Mombasa, at 3,766 TZS ( approximately 19.1 U.S. dollars ). Dar es Salaam is the economic and cultural heart of Tanzania. The city is also the largest in the whole East African region.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most companies in Poland felt the need to reorganize their business. Sixty percent of companies decided to implement changes in the form of layoffs, reducing working time, or unpaid leave.

In the fourth quarter of 2020, the share of Danes aged between 25 and 34 years who made a transaction on demand video increased from 16 percent to 16.5 percent. The age group with the smallest share of transactions on demand videos in this period was the 75 years and older group with only 1.1 percent.

In August 2021, the number of trees financed by the search engine Ecosia amounted to 1.7 million. The company stated that the number of trees that have been planted or financed in 2021 amounted to 6.5 million.
In 2021, the number of shareholders at So Paulo-based company So Paulo Limited amounted to 155,868. This represented a decrease of around 2.6 percent compared to the previous year.

In 2018/2019, the sales average price of peaches on markets in South Africa was measured at 15,867 South African Rands ( 907 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton, which represented an increase of roughly 21.5 percent from 2017/2018. Between 2000 and 2019, the price followed a comprehensive increasing trend, with some fluctuations. At that year, the price was measured at 2,856 Rands ( 151 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton, which illustrated a growth of around 75.5 percent.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary production of plums in South Africa amounted to 58.5 thousand metric tons, a slight decrease of roughly 2.5 percent from the preceding year. Since 2000, an overall increasing trend can be observed, with a peak of 86.5 thousand metric tons in 2016/2017. The fluctuations may be related to variations in rainfall.

In the first quarter of 2021, China was the main import partner of Angola, with a share of 49 percent in the total imports. South Africa followed, accounting for 33.6 percent of all imports. The country is the main destination for Angolan exports.

This statistic presents the share of population with potential symptoms of anemia due to coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Spain as of May 2020, by number of symptoms. Almost 44 percent of those surveyed showed at least one of the symptoms listed and more than 14 percent showed more than five of these symptoms.

This statistic shows the prevalence against the coronavirus of the Spanish population as of May 2020, broken down by age. In that month, the prevalence was the highest among those between the ages of 75 and 79 years, with almost seven percent.

From February 4 to March 5, 2020, the proportion of adult Canadians who believed that they were at risk of personally becoming sick due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) increased from 36 to 53 percent. This statistic depicts changes in perceived coronavirus infection risk among Canadians from February to March 2020.

This statistic shows the share of French users of electric scooters in 2019, by destination. It appears that the majority of French people using electric scooters for their daily commute were using them to go to work or to study, with a share of 36 percent of respondents.

This statistic shows the federal contract obligations for top 5 services in response to COVID-19 in the United States as of June 30, 2020. At this time, the top service with the highest contract obligations was the acquisition of pharmaceutical products and pharmaceutical development with some 1.25 billion U.S. dollars.

As of September 2020, a survey on parenting in the United States revealed that 74 percent of responding parents whose children had access to social media reported that they did not share their children's social media accounts due to privacy reasons. Additionally, only 13 percent of U.S. parents whose children had access to social media reported that they did so because their children wanted to have access to it.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary export volume of plums from South Africa was roughly 42.5 thousand metric tons, a decrease of roughly 16.5 percent from the previous year. Between 2000 and 2019, an overall increasing trend can be observed, with a few drops in the volume of exports. The highest volume of plums exported from South Africa was registered in 2016/2017, at roughly 65 thousand metric tons.

In 2019, Brazil was the Latin American country with the largest capital investment in the travel and tourism sector, with nearly 18 billion U.S. dollars. It was followed by Mexico with over 9.3 billion dollars. That same year, the total capital investment in the tourism sector of Latin America amounted to over 75 billion dollars.

In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, almost half of the Polish respondents worked from home, and the remaining one worked in the traditional way, with the same working hours as before.

The number of transportation-related injuries in Russia reached nearly 42.5 thousand in the first quarter of 2021. The most significant increase in the number of injuries was recorded in the air transport category.

As of March 2020, online searches for hand sanitizers increased by 19,166 percent compared to the previous year. In the same time period, online searches for hand wipes increased by 3,092 percent compared to the previous year. Some of these increases were likely triggered by the coronavirus pandemic.

This statistic presents the frequency at which French people used the highway in 2019. Less than 30 percent of respondents claimed to use the motorway at least once a month, while eight percent of them stated that they never used it.

As of 2017/2018, the preliminary sales volume on markets of figs in South Africa amounted to 215.9 metric tons, which represented a growth of roughly 24.4 percent from 2016/2017. Between 2000 and 2018, the sales fluctuated significantly, with the lowest volume of 21.9 metric tons in 2000/2001 and the highest one in 2017/2018.

This statistic shows the results of a survey regarding the capacity of various institutions to deal with the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) crisis in France in 2020. Results show that the French population had the highest level of confidence in medical professionals to confront the coronavirus outbreak with 78 percent.

As of 2018/19, the preliminary gross production value of strawberries and other berries in South Africa amounted to roughly 232.5 million South African Rands ( this is equivalent to approximately 15.2 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.5 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2019, the gross production value followed a comprehensive increasing trend, with some fluctuations. The major drops during this period can be linked to bad weather conditions, which are common in South Africa.
This statistic shows the number of specialized fashion retailers in France in 2018, by core business. In 2018, there were more than 300 clothing accessories retailers in France.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary sales volume of musk melons on markets in South Africa amounted to roughly 6.4 thousand metric tons, a decrease of roughly 15 percent from the previous year. Between 2000 and 2019, the sales volume fluctuated significantly, peaking at 13.2 thousand metric tons in 2000/2001.

The Costa Rican national park, known as `` El ngel del Siglo '', located in the city of San Juan, was the most expensive place to spend the holidays among the selected Costa Rican destinations in 2019, with an average price per person of more than 4,100 euros. In comparison, the average price per person for a holiday in the Costa Rican capital, Santiago, amounted to approximately 135 euros.

As of 2018, the production of good wine in South Africa amounted to approximately 8.3 million gross liters. This represented a decrease of roughly 14.5 percent from the previous year. From 2000 to 2018, the production increased overall, with a few drops along the way. The largest drop was in 2001, when the production fell to 5.5 million gross liters.

In 2021, the Brazilian city of So Paulo was the Latin American and Caribbean city with the highest purchasing power, with an index score of 73.4. It was followed by the Colombian city of Bogot, with an index score of 48.9. The purchasing power index measures the ability of a country's currency to buy goods and services.

As of 2018/2019, the preliminary gross production value of avocados in South Africa was roughly 1.4 billion South African Rands ( this is equivalent to nearly 104.5 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.2 percent from 2017/2018. Since 2000, the gross production value of avocados followed an overall increasing trend, with several fluctuations. The increases were associated with higher production volumes, which were also registered in the last years.

This statistic shows the annual expenditure on domestic tourism trips in Portugal from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the annual expenditure on domestic tourism trips amounted to approximately 2.44 billion euros.

This statistic shows the largest behavioral health hospitals in the United States in 2018, by number of acute-care beds. In that year, the McLean Hospital in Massachusetts was ranked first in the country, with a total of 561 acute-care beds.
This statistic shows the most common types of insider threats in the United States in 2020. That year, privilege misuse accounted for 19 percent of all insider threat incidents.

This statistic displays the results of a survey on the share of young adults and children who understand why exercise and sports are good for them in 2017/2018, by age and school year. Of respondents, 75 percent of children in year 5 to 6 strongly agreed that they understand why exercise and sports are good for them.

In the wake of the First World War, the League of Nations was established at the Paris Peace Conference of June 28, 1919, and one of its primary aims was to prevent further global conflicts, by maintaining international peace and security through diplomacy and negotiation rather than military action. One of the key principles of the League of Nations was the idea of 'policing the world's oceans', in order to prevent the further spread of armed conflict, and to protect the merchant ships that were often used as supply routes by both sides in the First World War. In the summer of 1927, a number of allied countries increased the number of naval forces on the Mediterranean Sea in a bid to prevent German and Italian expansion, and in the summer of 1931, a number of countries including Britain, France, Italy and the United States also increased their naval presence in the region.

In the year 2020, there were approximately 155 million children aged 5 to 19 years worldwide who were considered obese. This number is expected to increase to 250 million by the year 2030. The data suggests a growing problem with obesity around the world.

In 2019, the most popular product category on Russian online marketplace Bulyu, which was not surprisingly electronics, was clothing and footwear, with over 150 thousand orders. Baby goods were the next most demanded category, followed by auto parts.

As of December 2020, the average download speed of fixed internet connections in Moldova was at approximately 94.5 Megabits per second ( Mbps ). Mobile internet connections were much slower, at around 37.5 Mpbs.

This statistic shows the number of overweight children aged 5 to 19 years in countries worldwide in 2030. In that year, it is projected that around 21.5 million overweight children aged 5 to 19 years will be living in China.
This statistic shows the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) in Finland as an annual average from 2005 to 2020. In 2020, the average CPI was measured at 122.02, where the base year 2015 equals 100.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), almost every second Pole feared that he or someone in his immediate family would lose their job or employment. Only 26.8 percent of respondents were not afraid of such a loss.

As of 2018/19, the preliminary gross production value of pineapples in South Africa amounted to roughly 250.5 million South African Rands ( this is equivalent to approximately 16.5 million U.S. dollars ), which represented a slight increase of roughly 2.3 percent from the preceding year. Between 2000 and 2019, the gross production value of pineapples followed an overall increasing trend, with some fluctuations. In 2000/01, the preliminary gross production value was at roughly 105.4 million Rands ( approximately 6.8 million U.S. dollars ). On the other hand, in 2015/16, the value reached a peak of roughly 363.9 million Rands ( approximately 19.3 million U.S. dollars ).
This statistic shows the number of mechanically propelled boating vessels in the United States in 2020, by size. In 2020, there were 6,542 16 to less than 26 feet in size.

In 2020, there were over 567 thousand registered craft fairs and markets in the United States, up from 553 thousand in the previous year. In 2020, the U.S. craft fair and market industry generated a total revenue of over 21.1 billion U.S. dollars.

As of 2018, around 25 percent of Hispanic adults in the United States were current e-cigarette users. The statistic illustrates the percentage of U.S. adults who were current e-cigarette users as of 2018, by ethnicity.
Since 4 March, when the first coronavirus case ( COVID-19 ) was confirmed in Poland, the number of people quarantined has been growing.

An August 2020 survey revealed that 23 percent of parents in the United States were very concerned about the amount of time their child ( ren ) spent on digital devices during the COVID-19 pandemic. Additionally, 33 percent of U.S. parents were somewhat concerned about the amount of screen time their children had.
In Estonia, the output value of forestry and connected secondary activities was 735.9 million euros in 2017. This was the highest value since 2012, when it was 546.7 million euros.

As of 2018/19, the sales average price of oranges on markets in South Africa was at 3,342 South African rands ( 208 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton. Since 2000, the price has been following an overall increasing trend. At that year, the average price was measured at 725 Rands ( 47.5 U.S. dollars ) per metric ton.

This statistic shows the impact of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic on the mood of farmers in France in March 2020. It reveals that more than half of the respondents were rather pessimistic about their situation.

In Austria, the output value of forestry and connected secondary activities was 2.42 billion euros in 2018. This was the second highest value since 2012, when it was 2.58 billion euros. The biggest decrease occurred between 2015 and 2016, when the output dropped by 250 million euros.

In Poland, the output value of forestry and connected secondary activities was 5.54 billion euros in 2017. This was the highest value since 2011, and an increase of 1.5 billion euros compared to the previous year.

In the U.S., around 81 percent of pregnant females reported alcohol use in the past 12 months. This statistic shows the percentage of pregnant females in the U.S. who reported alcohol use or binge drinking in the past month from 2015 to 2018.

As of April 2020, 34 percent of Hungarian homeowners who had started planning to renovate their homes decided to postpone the project due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. Another 23 percent of respondents had already cancelled their home renovations.

The average monthly salary in Denmark in 2019 was highest among employees in the mining and quarrying industry, at around 61 thousand Danish kroner. The lowest average monthly salary was found in the trade and transport industry, amounting to 38.9 thousand Danish kroner on average.

As of 2019, 70.4 percent of the U.S. population under 18 years old lived in a household with a broadband internet subscription. The statistic illustrates the percentage of the U.S. population under 18 years old living in a household with a computer as of 2019, by internet subscription type.

This statistic shows the popular opinion on government action to contain the novel coronavirus COVID-19 outbreak in France in 2020. According to Ipsos, 75 percent of respondents considered that the government had hidden information concerning the coronavirus from the public. For further information about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

Rakhim Abramov from Uzbekistan was the most successful Instagram blogger in the country from May 2019 to April 2020, by earnings. He earned over 1.5 million U.S. dollars on the platform over the observed period. Dina Saeva ranked second with nearly 900 thousand U.S. dollars in income.

The majority of respondents stated that their professors did not provide any support or information related to the online education during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in Romania. Only 12 percent answered that their professors were very involved in their online education.
As of October 31, 2020, the Brazilian soccer player Lionel Messi scored 32 goals in the 2019/2020 season, the lowest number of goals scored in a season by the player since 2011/2012.

In Hungary, the forest and logging industry generated a gross value added of 245.9 million euros in 2017. This marked the highest value in the observed time period since 2009. The GVA generated by this industry in 2016 was 224.3 million euros.

In 2019, around 71 percent of U.S. healthcare organizations reported to use the electronic health record ( EMR ) as one of their three most used sources for their disease registry. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. healthcare organizations using select sources for their disease registrar in 2019.

In Sweden, the forest and logging industry generated a gross value added of 3.53 billion euros in 2017. The GVA generated by this industry peaked in 2011 at 4.24 billion euros. After a decrease of almost 400 million euros between 2011 and 2015, the GVA remained relatively stable.

According to a survey conducted in 2019, 60.7 percent of patients used telehealth services 1 to 9 percent of patients received telehealth services over 25 percent of patients received telehealth services 10 to 24 percent of patients received telehealth services over 25 percent of patients received telehealth services 0 percent of patients received telehealth services.

In the first half of 2021, the value added by the transportation and storage sector to Kenya's Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) was measured at 437 billion Kenyan shillings ( KSh ) ( approximately 4.1 billion U.S. dollars ). The added value in the first half of 2021 represented a decline in comparison to the previous year.

This statistic presents the forecasted percentage of job losses that could potentially be experienced in Spain from 2020 to 2023, as a result of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. The mid-term scenario, which predicts a decrease of 16 percent in the employment rate in Spain, has been estimated as the most likely outcome for the Spanish job market by a group of experts in November 2020.

Kenya's Gross Domestic Product ( GDP ) from the manufacturing sector grew by nearly nine percent in the third quarter of 2021, compared to the same quarter of 2020. The indicator was measured at 9.6 percent in the quarter before ( Q2 ) 2021. Manufacturing activities are key for the Kenyan economy. The sector employed roughly 1.3 million people in 2020.

The top non-profit funder for the global coronavirus response as of March 5, 2020, was the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation. The foundation has pledged to donate around 750 million U.S. dollars to support efforts to combat the coronavirus pandemic.

This statistic shows the number of pipeline incidents with liquid release in Alberta, Canada in 2018, by volume. There were 205 incidents with liquid release in Alberta, Canada in 2018, of which 21 incidents had a release volume between one and five cubic meters.

According to a survey carried out in the UK in March 2020, around a third of respondents said they will dine out less often than before the coronavirus outbreak, while a further 11 percent said they will not go out at all. On the other hand, 46 percent of respondents said they will dine out the same amount as before, and three percent said they will go out more often than they did before.

In 2020, there were 16,049 merchant vessels in South Korea. According to the source, a merchant ship is defined as a ship that is used to transport goods. In that year, there were 1,859 fishing vessels in South Korea.

In fiscal year 2020, the total assets of the Shinkin Central Bank amounted to approximately 43.7 trillion Japanese yen. The Shinkin Central Bank is the central bank for Shinkin banks and engages in financial activities to support the Shinkin banking system. Shinkin banks are regional commercial banks that are considered to be the heart of the local banking system.

In fiscal year 2020, the total liabilities of the Shinkin Central Bank amounted to approximately 42 trillion Japanese yen. The Shinkin Central Bank is the central bank for Shinkin banks and engages in financial activities to support the Shinkin bank system. Shinkin banks are regional commercial banks that are considered to be the heart of the local banking system.

This statistic shows the average annual number of alcohol-related deaths in the U.S. from 2011 to 2015, by condition and gender. During this time, there were an average of 6,664 alcohol-related deaths among males per year with hypertension as a condition.

As of August 2020, the vast majority of Hungarians preferred that their children attended school in person during the upcoming schoolyear. Only five percent of respondents wanted their children to take classes online.

In 2017, the rate of potentially preventable inpatient hospital stays among U.S. adults aged 65 years and older for chronic conditions was around 3,030 per 100,000 population, compared to 1,098 per 100,000 population among adults aged 18 to 44 years for acute conditions. This statistic illustrates the rate of potentially preventable adult inpatient hospital stays per 100,000 population in the United States in 2017, by condition type and age.

The employment rate in Norway was slightly higher for men than for women from 2010 to 2020. In 2020, the employment rate for men was 69.8 percent, and for women it was 64.8 percent. The employment rate for both genders was higher in 2010, 2011, and 2012, but dropped annually from 2013 onwards.

In the second quarter of 2021, the share of Danes aged between 16 and 24 years who listened to music amounted to nearly 60 percent. The age group with the second highest share of music listeners was 25 to 34-year-olds, reaching roughly 35 percent.
As of March 3, 2022, Indonesia has registered a total of 147,854 deaths from the coronavirus. The virus has a major impact on the economy, particularly the tourism sector.

The number of unemployed people in Norway fluctuated from 2010 to 2020. The highest number was reached in 2016 with over 130 thousand unemployed people, and the lowest was in 2012 with around 88 thousand people. In 2020, there were over 129 thousand unemployed people in Norway.

More than 50 percent of parents surveyed for this study were mainly concerned that their child would not be able to catch up with the school work they missed during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. At the same time, 40 percent of respondents were also worried that their child would not be socially integrated when they go back to school in the fall.

This statistic shows the main concerns of the French regarding the choice of their holiday destination in 2015. That year, 37 percent of French respondents were worried about the political instability in a country, while 36 percent were more concerned about the risk of an attack.

According to a survey by Rakuten Insight on panic buying after the coronavirus outbreak in April 2020, around 17 percent of South Korean respondents stated that they stocked up on items because they thought that they or their household might be quarantined and would therefore not be able to buy groceries. In the same survey, 15.4 percent of South Korean respondents said they had engaged in panic buying.

This statistic shows the objects of fantasy of French men and women on a summer vacation in 2017. For both genders, the top object of fantasy was the hotel room with 58 and 19 percent of respondents stating it as the object they would like to have on their vacation.

In 2021, the value of new business jet transactions globally amounted to 48.7 billion U.S. dollars, down from 59.6 billion U.S. dollars in 2019. The value of pre-owned business jets in 2021 amounted to 51.8 billion U.S. dollars, also down from 59.6 billion U.S. dollars in 2019.
As of March 2020, over half of all business jets in the global fleet were 13 years old and over. Only 21 percent of business jets in the global fleet were less than six years old.

The chart shows the market share of various smart TV streaming devices in 2020. Tizen held the highest market share at 25.4 percent, followed by WebOS and Sony PlayStation with 14.3 percent and 10.2 percent respectively. Apple TVOS and Amazon's Fire TV had the lowest market shares, with 3.8 and 3.7 percent respectively.

As of 2018, around 42 percent of the total population in Burundi were living in urban areas. The country is one of the fastest urbanizing in the whole continent. In the last decade, Burundi's urbanization increased by roughly six percentage points.

From January to June 2019, the most popular direct-to-consumer brand on social media in the United States was Kylie Cosmetics. The cosmetics brand received an average of 1.3 million social media actions per post. The second-most popular brand was KW Beauty, with an average of 1.8 million social media actions per post.

The SARS epidemic between 2002 and 2003 in China did not result in a long-term economic loss. During the outbreak in the first half of 2003, the quarterly GDP fell by two percent in China. Transportation was the most-hit sector with a drop by 5.4 percentage points.

This statistic represents the share of global solar photovoltaic ( PV ) capacity additions from 2015 to 2022, as a percentage of the world's total PV capacity. In 2022, solar PV capacity additions are expected to account for around 15 percent of the world's total PV capacity.

The majority of respondents were concerned about food safety during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic in Romania. More than 50 percent of respondents were worried that food from outside would be contaminated with the virus. Moreover, nearly 40 percent of respondents were afraid that food from Romania or Italy would be contaminated with COVID-19.

This statistic shows the annual turnover of the postal and courier business in France from 2010 to 2020. In 2019, the postal and courier activities sector produced a turnover of approximately 15.3 billion euros.

The global renewables output in 2020 has been impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic. The electricity sector has felt the most significant change with a decline of 9.6 percent in output. The heat sector has also felt the effects with a decline of 0.2 percent in output.

The statistic shows the level of concern about the security of public clouds according to a survey of IT security professionals in 2020. As of May 2020, 42 percent of respondents reported that they were very concerned about the security of public clouds.

This statistic presents the total amount of freight transported annually in France by train between 2008 and 2018, in million tonne-kilometers.
