An overall decrease in the amount of goods transported can be observed over the time period shown. In 2018, around 32 billion tonne-kilometers of freight were transported by train in France.

Following a series of high profile instances of police brutality and racial inequality in the United States in 2020, several professional athletes and teams spoke out on social media to bring awareness to the situation. During an August 2020 survey in the United States, 28 percent of respondents said that this protest was very effective in bringing attention to police brutality and racial inequality.

This statistic shows the leading female biotech CEOs in the United States as of 2019, by annual compensation. During this year, Nancy Jackson was the chief executive officer of Genentech, a Swiss-based biotech company, and she earned some 45.3 million U.S. dollars.
As of March 31, 2020, small jets accounted for 25 percent of the business jets fleet in Europe.

In a survey conducted in Italy in 2020, 51 percent of respondents declared that, if the elections would take place in September 2020, they would vote for the candidate from the leftmost party ( PD ), whereas 18 percent of interviewees would vote for the candidate from the center-right party ( PD ). Moreover, nine percent of respondents would vote for the candidate from the rightmost party ( PM ), while seven percent of the asked voters would not decide yet.

As of March 2020, half of Hungarians stated that they would not use public transport during the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) outbreak. Another 19 percent of respondents said that they would use public transportation only when it was absolutely necessary.

As of September 2020, the Brazilian startup N26 led by Andr Neves had the highest total funding amount for Latin America with 1.4 billion U.S. dollars, followed by Food, with nearly 585 million dollars.

As of May 2021, the most viewed YouTube celebrity channel in Taiwan was that of the Taiwanese-Canadian singer Hua Chengyu, with around 618 million views. The second place belonged to the Taiwanese-Canadian singer and actor Sodagreen, and the third spot was taken by the Taiwanese-Canadian actor and singer John Tang.

As of August 2020, around 81 percent of food and drink trading sites in the United Kingdom ( UK ) were trading following the coronavirus lockdown restrictions. Food and drink trading sites in London were the least likely to trade following the lockdown, with 71.5 percent of sites trading.

As of 2018, the share of households with access to sufficient drinking water in urban areas in Ghana was around 87 percent, while in rural areas, it was around 89 percent. The highest share of households with access to sufficient drinking water in Ghana was in rural areas, while the lowest share was in urban areas.

In July 2020, the monthly average price for an egg in Egypt was 6.7 Egyptian pounds ( 0.43 U.S. dollars ), which illustrated a decrease of roughly 2.5 percent from the preceding month. From January 2019 onwards, the mean price per egg fluctuated between five Egyptian pounds ( 0.32 U.S. dollars ) and 11.6 Egyptian pounds ( 0.81 U.S. dollars ). Moreover, the price per egg was at its highest in April 2019 at 11.7 Egyptian pounds ( 0.81 U.S. dollars ), while it was at its lowest in September 2019 at five Egyptian pounds ( 0.32 U.S. dollars ). The increase in price in April and May 2019 can be linked to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, which caused a surge in demand for eggs due to increased consumption at home. Furthermore, the drop in September 2019 can be associated with the government's response to the increase in the price of eggs by increasing the supply of eggs through state-owned farms.

The global carbon emissions reduction target as set by the Paris Agreement requires the world to achieve net-zero carbon emissions by 2050. The current trajectory indicates that the world is not on track to reaching this target. Based on the current rate of emissions, the renewable energy scenario requires the world to achieve zero emissions by 2040.

As of end-February 2020, 35 percent of Alzheimer  s disease-modifying therapies in clinical trial phase III of development worldwide were targeting synaptic plasticity/neuroprotection pathways. This statistic illustrates Alzheimer  s disease-modifying therapies in phase III of development worldwide as of 2020, by type.

This statistic presents the share of companies that were led to layoffs due to the coronavirus crisis as of June 2020, by type. Companies in the tourism sector were the most affected by the layoffs, with a rate of 25 percent. In contrast, only 5 percent of companies in the ICT sector experienced layoffs.

This statistic presents the perception of Spanish professionals on how their company is adapting to the coronavirus crisis as of June 2020. In that time, 66.3 percent of the professionals surveyed considered their company's response to the COVID-19 pandemic good.
The graph depicts the average number of NFL games attended per season in the United States as of September 2020. The average number of games attended per season was at 8.4 in 2020.

The majority of respondents were of the opinion that the measures taken by the Romanian authorities against the spread of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Romania were appropriate. However, one third of respondents stated that these measures were not necessary.

Monday Night Football on ESPN presents the final games and highlights of the NFL weekend to households across the United States. Monday Night Football on ESPN presents the final games and highlights of the NFL weekend to households across the United States. In a September 2020 survey in the United States, 20 percent of respondents aged 35 to 44 stated that they watched Monday Night Football every week, while 13 percent only tuned in when their favorite team was playing.
This statistic shows the average inflation rate of the consumer price index in the largest European economies from 1980 to 2021. In 2018, the average inflation rate in Germany was about 0.38 percent.
The statistic shows the unemployment rate of the five largest European economies from 1980 to 2021. The unemployment rate of the United Kingdom in 2021 was estimated to be 5.4 percent.

The number of people employed in the U.S. intermodal container leasing market fluctuated between 2018 and 2021. In 2021, there were an estimated 351,000 people employed in the intermodal container leasing market in the United States.

As of April 2020, around 24 percent of U.S. adults aged 18 to 29 years reported having psychological distress in the past seven days due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic illustrates the percentage of U.S. adults who reported having psychological distress in the past seven days due to the COVID-19 pandemic in select groups as of April 2020.

This statistic shows the revenue of Zalando from the first quarter of 2018 to the fourth quarter of 2020. In the fourth quarter of 2020, Zalando generated approximately 2.3 billion euros in revenue, an increase compared to the previous quarter.

In 2020, the most frequent type of motor insurance claim made in Ireland was third party injury. There were approximately 4.5 thousand such claims made per 1,000 policies. Windscreen and accidental damage claims were ranked second and third, with incidence rates of 29.3 and 22.7 respectively.

In the past 10 years, the share of children from cultural minorities in primary school in Norway increased. In 2010, the share was around seven percent, while in 2020, it was nearly 15 percent. That was over two percent more than ten years before.

In 2021, it was estimated that nearly 70 percent of the urban poor population in Argentina lived in households that were below the poverty line. In total, almost 60 percent of the Argentine population was living in poverty as of that year.

In 2020, approximately 0.3 thousand international conferences were held in Japan. According to the source, international conferences are defined as events which are open to the participation of foreign speakers and/or foreign delegates.

In 2018, Algeria's trade deficit amounted to approximately -19.5 billion U.S. dollars. The deficit is defined as the value of imports minus the value of exports. In the period under review, the highest deficit occurred in 2018, while the lowest occurred in 2016.

This statistic presents the distribution of the leading ten food contributors to potassium intake in the United States between 2015 and 2016, by age and food category. This statistic illustrates the distribution of the leading ten food contributors to sodium intake in the United States from 2015 to 2016, by weight and food category.

The number of new passenger cars registered in Denmark fluctuated between 2017 and 2020. The highest number of new registrations was recorded in 2019 at 228,000 cars. As of March 6, 2022, the total number of death caused by coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Libya was over 6.3 thousand. According to a 2018/2019 study, approximately 54 percent of children and teenage students in urban areas of Costa Rica used the internet to listen to music, against nearly 46 percent of those surveyed in rural areas of the Central American country.
This statistic shows the percentage of adults in the U.S. with arthritis in 2020, by state and gender. As of that year, around 42.9 percent of women aged 18 years and older in Alabama had arthritis.

The number of installed automated teller machines ( ATMs ) in the United States has been experiencing a steady decline over the past decade. In 2008, there were approximately 46.5 million ATMs installed across the country, but by 2020 that number had fallen to around 33.5 million.

This statistic shows the purchasing channels for detox beverages among French consumers in 2019. It reveals that almost two-thirds of the respondents purchased their detox drinks in supermarkets or hypermarkets.

In 2020, every second Pole declared that the most significant measure to prevent coronavirus infection was to quarantine people coming from abroad. Every third respondent believed that the most effective way to prevent the epidemic was to prohibit visits to hospitals and to travel abroad.

How many crimes were reported and who were the victims in Denmark in 2020? That year, the number of overall crimes in Denmark amounted to 442 thousand. Furthermore, there were 179 thousand crimes reported against women, while the number of crimes against men amounted to 441 thousand.

In 2019, the medicare inpatient per-user costs were at 21,726 U.S. dollars, compared to 17,064 U.S. dollars in 2009. This statistic illustrates the medicare inpatient per-user costs from 2009 to 2019.

In a survey conducted in Mexico in 2020, approximately 73 percent of respondents stated that they would gift their loved one books, making it the most popular type of present for Christmas that year. Meanwhile, 45 percent of the people interviewed said they would give their presents toys.

As of August 2020, around 73 percent of countries reported that they had allocated funding specifically for mental health as part of their response to the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic shows the percentage of countries who had allocated funding for mental health as part of their COVID-19 response, as of August 2020.

As of January 19, 2022, India had the highest number of confirmed cases of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in the Asia-Pacific region, with over 37.7 million people having been infected. Indonesia had the second highest number of confirmed cases in the Asia-Pacific region with approximately 3.5 million people having been infected with the virus.

From the years 1768 to 1772, it is estimated that almost 1,800 slaves were exported from the Thirteen Colonies to the West Indies. The majority of the remaining slaves were exported to other European colonies in the Caribbean, particularly in the 1770s ; at this time the transatlantic slave trade was at its peak.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. adults that take dietary supplements, distributed by income. The statistic is based on a survey conducted in August 2020. In 2020, the website bounce rate of the L'Oral Paris cosmetics website was 61 percent, making it the most popular cosmetics website in France. The website of the LVMH Group was ranked second with a bounce rate of 60 percent.

In February 2020 - just prior to the global coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, the S & P 500 was at a little over 3,700 points.

In 2019, the number of female students enrolled in tertiary education in Tunisia reached approximately 167.2 thousand, while the number of male students was around 98.5 thousand. From 2014 onwards, the number of female students in tertiary education in the country decreased by over 30 thousand, while the number of male students declined by approximately 25.5 thousand.

The most common type of crime in Norway was theft, with over 65 thousand victims in 2019. Furthermore, almost 32 thousand people were victims of violence and maltreatment, while nearly 16 thousand people were victims of property crime.

The statistic shows the impact of COVID-19 on the revenue and expenses of tech companies worldwide as of May 2020. As per the data, 33 percent of respondents reported a revenue reduction due to COVID-19, while 16 percent reported an increase in expenses.

The number of medical apps downloaded worldwide increased by 66 percent in March 2020 compared to the same month in the previous year. In comparison, the download volume of medical apps in South Korea increased by 134 percent during the same period. This statistic shows the growth in the number of medical apps downloaded worldwide and in selected countries during the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020.

In 2019, there were 1,477 complaints of police violence recorded in Brazil, down from 1,631 cases of police brutality reported a year earlier. In the past five years, the highest number of police violence complaints was registered in 2018, while the lowest was in 2011.

As of May 2020, more than half of the surveyed IT-management professionals in Finland said that their employees are more productive when working from home during the COVID-19 pandemic. Only 17 percent of the respondents reported that their employees are less productive when working remotely.

In 2020, the state of So Paulo had the highest number of police officers murdered in Brazil, with 49 cases. It was followed by Rio de Janeiro with 44 cases. In that same year, Bahia was the Brazilian state with the highest number of homicides of police officers.

This statistic shows the compound annual growth rate ( CAGR ) of vertical farming between 2020 and 2027, by select country. The vertical farming market in the United States is expected to grow by 24.8 percent annually over the course of the next seven years.

In August 2020, the average monthly price for round rebar iron in Egypt was measured at 10,202 Egyptian pounds per metric ton ( this is comparable to 673 U.S. dollars per metric ton ), which represented a decline of around 2.9 percent from the preceding month. From January 2019 onwards, the mean price per metric ton fluctuated between 10,202 Egyptian pounds ( 673 U.S. dollars ) in August 2019 and 12,979 Egyptian pounds ( 797 U.S. dollars ) in September 2019. The largest price drop was between September 2019 and January 2020, as the mean price for one metric ton of round rebar iron dropped by approximately 23.2 percent.

The COVID-19 pandemic that spread across the world at the beginning of 2020 was not only a big threat to public health, but also to the entire sports industry. Many professional and amateur leagues and events were canceled and the public was advised to not spend time in large groups or in public areas. During a March 2020 survey in the United States, 14 percent of respondents strongly agreed that the lack of live sports had a significant impact on their daily life.

The chart displays the comparative data on the sugar output of three countries - Canada, Mexico, and the USA - from the years 1885 to 1988. The x-axis represents the years while the y-axis signifies the sugar output. The graph is marked with grid lines and each data point is annotated with the corresponding country name. 

The graph shows a general upward trend in sugar output over the years for all three countries, with a few exceptions. For instance, there is a noticeable drop in sugar output in Mexico in the year 1920, which could be attributed to various factors such as economic downturns or changes in agricultural practices. Similarly, there is a sudden spike in sugar output in Canada in the year 1940, possibly due to an increase in available land or more favorable growing conditions. 

The USA's sugar output shows a bimodal trend with two distinct peaks in the years 1905 and 1985, indicating two periods of significant increases. Canada and Mexico also exhibit a bimodal trend with their sugar output peaking in the years 1915 and 1970 respectively. 

In terms of comparison, the USA consistently produces the highest amount of sugar among the three countries throughout the period, despite a general decline in recent years. Canada and Mexico follow closely behind, with their sugar output fluctuating but generally staying higher than those of the USA. 

The chart also contains several outliers that could indicate the occurrence of unexpected events or anomalies in the data. For example, the sudden drop in sugar output in Mexico in 1920 and the abrupt increase in Canada in 1940 are considered as outliers in the data. 

The title of the chart could be 'Northern American sugar output by country 1885-1988'. The x-axis and y-axis are labeled as 'Year' and 'Sugar output' respectively. The chart also contains a legend in the upper right corner that specifies which color corresponds to which country (Canada, Mexico, or the USA). 

The background of the chart is light gray with a grid that helps in estimating the value of each data point. The background color of the chart does not affect the visibility of the data points. 

The chart is saved as a PNG image file named'myplot.png'. The file size of the image is determined by the dimensions of the plot and the padding that is added for the legend and title. The image file is saved in the same directory where the plot is generated. 

The plot generates a stable and clear line

In 2022, it was estimated that the unit cost of recycling paper packaging in Japan would reach around 16.5 Japanese yen per kilogram. The average costs of recycling different types of packaging varied widely, with plastic packaging being the most expensive.

1,095 people were imprisoned in Norway in 2018. The most common crime that year was theft, with 1,095 prisoners. Furthermore, 1,049 prisoners were convicted of drug-related offences, and 753 were convicted of sexual offences.

As of August 2020, the monthly average price for wood in Egypt was at 5,872 Egyptian pounds per cubic meter ( this is comparable to 352.87 U.S. dollars ), which illustrated a slight increase of 0.5 percent from July 2020. Throughout the period under investigation, the mean price per cubic meter fluctuated between 4,967 Egyptian pounds ( 290.97 U.S. dollars ) in November 2019 and 9,000 Egyptian pounds ( 541.98 U.S. dollars ) in March 2020. The largest price increase was from November 2019 to March 2020, with a growth of nearly 36 percent.

In 2020, the vast majority of Poles ( 62 percent ) believed that abortion should be legal in certain cases. According to the survey, only 14 percent of respondents considered abortion to be prohibited in all cases.

The Culture Recovery Fund ( CRF ) was set up to support organizations in the arts and cultural sector in England, which had suffered as a result of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic. The fund was set up in three rounds, with a total of 1.7 billion British pounds available to organizations in England. As of November 7, 2020, over 255 million British pounds had been awarded in the first round of grants.
This statistic shows the seafood department unit sales in the United States in 2019, by variety. That year, U.S. seafood department sales of salmon amounted to about 323.4 million units.

In July 2020, the monthly value of exports from Egypt stood at approximately two billion U.S. dollars, which illustrated an increase of around 5.5 percent from the preceding month. Moreover, between January 2019 and July 2020, the value of exports from Egypt ranged between roughly 4.8 billion U.S. dollars ( in April 2020 ) and approximately 26.5 billion U.S. dollars ( in July 2019 ). Furthermore, non-petroleum exports accounted for the largest share in the total exports, with a percentage of around 65.1 percent, while crude oil contributed with roughly 3.5 percent. Moreover, the export value from Egypt to the European Union declined in the last months, as the EU countries started imposing tariffs on Egyptian goods, especially petroleum products.

This graph shows the number of packaged units of medical cannabis extracts sold in Canada from October 2019 to March 2021. In March 2021, approximately 263,890 units of medical cannabis extracts were sold in Canada.

This statistic shows the percentage of adult medical cannabis patients in Canada who reported using cannabis to manage select health conditions as of April 2020. According to the survey, 45 percent of respondents reported using medical cannabis to manage anxiety disorders.

The highest number of new COVID-19 cases per day was reported for women aged 70 years and older in Czechia. For this age group, the number of women infected with the coronavirus was nearly ten times higher than the number of men. The first cases of coronavirus infection in the Czech Republic were reported on 1 March. On March 24, 2022, the Czech Republic reported more than 2.5 million confirmed cases of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ).

This statistic shows the percentage of medical cannabis patients in Canada that were using other medications with medical cannabis prescriptions in 2020, by condition. As of that year, around 31.8 percent of opioid pain patients were also taking other medications with medical cannabis prescriptions.

Among Canadian adult patients that were surveyed between April 1st and 30th, 2020, around 27 percent stated that the COVID-19 pandemic made it harder for them to access medical cannabis without a prescription. This statistic illustrates the impact of COVID-19 on medical cannabis purchasing among Canadian patients, by impact on access and cost, as of April 2020.

Over the observed period, the use of nitrogen fertilizers in Algeria slightly decreased, dropping from 9.1 tonnes in 2015 to 8.2 tonnes in 2019. On the other hand, the use of phosphate fertilizers slightly increased in the country, going from 7.5 tonnes in 2015 to 7.1 tonnes in 2019. The amount of potash used in Algeria significantly decreased over the period, going from 4.3 tonnes in 2015 to 3.2 tonnes in 2019.

In July 2020, the monthly value of exports from Suez port in Egypt amounted to close to 2.2 billion U.S. dollars, which illustrated an increase of close to 2.5 percent from the preceding month. Moreover, between January 2019 and July 2020, the value ranged between approximately 469 million U.S. dollars ( in April 2020 ) and 569 million U.S. dollars ( in February 2020 ). Furthermore, the export value from Suez port ranged between close to 1.8 billion U.S. dollars in March 2020 and 1.5 billion U.S. dollars in May 2020. The drop in the value in March 2020 can be related to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, which interrupted trade activities worldwide.

In July 2020, the monthly value of exports from the port of Deheila in Egypt stood at close to 2.2 billion U.S. dollars, which illustrated an increase of close to 2.5 percent from the preceding month. Moreover, between January 2019 and July 2020, the value of exports from Deheila port ranged between approximately 106.5 million U.S. dollars ( in April 2020 ) and 558.5 million U.S. dollars ( in January 2019 ). Furthermore, the value of exports in January 2019 was around 4.5 percent higher than that in February 2019, while the drop in April 2020 was close to 20 percent.

In 2020, the main concern of Poles was the health of family members. More than 80 percent of respondents were worried about their relatives'health due to the coronavirus pandemic. Nearly 75 percent of Poles were afraid to become infected with COVID-19.

The majority of respondents were of the opinion that people who receive a guaranteed income from the state should not have to work. However, more than one third of respondents strongly believed that people who receive a guaranteed income from the state should have to work.

This statistic displays the production of glass fiber reinforced plastics ( GRP ) in Spain and Portugal from 2012 to 2020. GRP is a composite material made from a polymer matrix that is reinforced with glass fibers. Spain and Portugal were among the leading European producers of GRP in 2019, with production amounting to approximately 167 thousand metric tons and 168 thousand metric tons respectively.
In 2020, the main concern of Poles related to material goods was the risk of breaking the bank account.

This statistic presents the results of a survey regarding the second-hand goods purchased in France in 2018. It appears that clothing for women was the most sought after category of second-hand goods, with 62 percent of the respondents stating that they had bought clothing for women in the past year.
The CDA's stock exchange index in Poland saw a significant increase on March 13, 2020, due to the outbreak of coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). The index was the first to close the day at over 40 points.

The market capitalization of Barrick Gold increased significantly from April 2019 to October 2020. In April 2019, the market capitalization of Barrick Gold was 24.56 billion Canadian dollars. By October 2020, the market capitalization had grown to 62.1 billion Canadian dollars. Barrick Gold is a Canada-based company and is one of the top gold producers worldwide.

In the Americas, it was not uncommon for slaves to be transported on ships from Europe in the 16 th and 17 th centuries. Portuguese and Dutch ships were the most common means of transport for slaves during this time, as they were the most numerous and had the largest capacity. The most common routes included the Canary Islands, which was a popular transit route for slaves destined for the Spanish colonies in the 16 th century, and the Bight of Biafra ( present-day Atlantic Ocean ) in the 17 th century, where Portuguese and Dutch ships would bring slaves to the New World.
In 2020, due to the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic, most of the respondents in Poland did not change their religious involvement. However, 21 percent of respondents started to pray more often.
In 2020, Singapore exported approximately 92 million U.S. dollars worth of natural rubber. The export value decreased compared to the previous year, when it stood at around 96 million U.S. dollars.

The majority of respondents stated that they would prefer to work from home for up to two days a week. Only three percent of Romanians would like to work from home for more than four days per week, while four percent would prefer to work from home for zero days per week.

This statistic presents the opinion of the French on the question of having a daughter and buying toys in 2019. That year, more than 70 percent of the respondents said that they already had a daughter, while 40 percent of them intended to buy toys for their children.

In 2018, around 37.4 percent of females in the United States with a disability reported having a mental distress disorder. The statistic illustrates the percentage of adults in the U.S. with a disability who reported having a mental distress disorder in 2018, by gender.

This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. physicians who were upset for select reasons during the COVID-19 pandemic, as of August 2020. It was found that around 56 percent of surveyed physicians reported that the lack of PPE was a great deal of upset during the pandemic.

In June 2021, around 48 percent of surveyed physicians in the U.S. reported having reduced their hours in primary care due to COVID-19, compared to around 38 percent in July 2020. This statistic illustrates the percentage of surveyed physicians in the U.S. who experienced select changes in practice due to COVID-19 in July 2020 and June 2021.

As of May 2021, around 66 percent of people surveyed in Brazil planned to get vaccinated against COVID-19, while 25 percent had already received at least one dose. Meanwhile, nine percent of respondents said they did not intend to be immunized.

The COVID-19 pandemic in Ukraine was centered in the city of Kyiv, which accounted for the highest number of cases, measuring at approximately 449.5 thousand as of March 7, 2022. The Kharkiv Oblast had the second highest number of infections at approximately 328.6 thousand. The first cases of COVID-19 in Ukraine were reported on February 29, 2020.
In 2020, Peru's imports and exports of goods amounted to approximately 36 billion and 39 billion U.S. dollars, respectively. That year, the value of imports surpassed the value of exports.
In 2020, 35 percent of respondents in Poland believed that the government had a chance to limit the growth of the coronavirus pandemic.

In 2020, the total number of marriages in Algeria amounted to 281 thousand, showing a decrease compared to the previous years. From 2010 onwards, the number of marriages in the country declined steadily, after peaking at 385 thousand in 2013.

As of March 2021, around 65 percent of Canadian adults said they would get vaccinated for the COVID-19 vaccine when it becomes available, while a further 15 percent said they would get vaccinated but would wait a while. This statistic shows the proportion of Canadian adults who would get vaccinated for the COVID-19 vaccine if it became available, as of July 2020.

In October 2020, it was found that 87 percent of British people surveyed strongly believed that having a test, trace and quarantine ( TTQ ) program would be effective in reducing the spread of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Great Britain. Additionally, 84 percent of respondents strongly believed that people who have the coronavirus symptoms should self-isolate, while 78 percent of respondents strongly believed that people should not travel abroad.

In 2019, the export value of agriculture, hunting, and fishery products from Algeria amounted to approximately 11.9 billion Algerian dinars ( around 125 million U.S. dollars ). In the period under review, the export value of the sector increased from 4.7 billion Algerian dinars ( around 25 million U.S. dollars ) in 2014.

In 2018, the leading agricultural product in Algeria based on production value was dates, with a value of 3.7 billion U.S. dollars. In the same year, dates accounted for more than 20 percent of the total value of agricultural production in the country.

As of March 2020, 58 percent of Hungarians stated that they were following news about the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) related to the same extent as other types of news. Another 18 percent of respondents stated that they were following the development of coronavirus-related news to the same extent as other types of news.

The statistic displays the rate of population with insufficient physical activity in selected Latin American countries between 2001 and 2016. According to the data, among the presented countries, Brazil had the highest rate of population with insufficient physical activity with 46.8 percent.

In 2019, 32.4 people in South Korea died within six months after working experience in the shipbuilding industry. According to the source, the number of deaths was higher in the first three years of working experience.
One-third of the respondents who tested positive for coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) in Romania were still able to travel within the country, while seven percent were transferred to other countries.

The impact of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) pandemic on the Romanian economy will have a significant effect. In a double-hit scenario, GDP growth is expected to fall to 4.1 percent in 2021. In this scenario, the second wave of the pandemic would cause a deeper recession, with a drop in GDP growth to as low as -8.5 percent. According to the Ministry of Health, more than 6.8 million people were cured from the coronavirus in Romania.

The number of direct jobs created by the app economy in the European Union ( EU ) from January 2016 to July 2019 has increased steadily. In January 2016, the number of direct jobs was estimated at 520 thousand and by July 2019, it had risen to 671 thousand.

As of April 2021, the Consumer Price Index ( CPI ) for food and non-alcoholic beverages in Ghana increased in comparison to the previous month. The index was measured at 102.9 points, with the base year of 2019 ( =100 ). Food and non-alcoholic beverages are the categories with the highest CPI in the country.

In 2019, the unemployment rate in Algeria was higher among the female population, reaching 20.5 percent, compared to 9.1 percent among men. From 2010 onwards, the gender gap in the unemployment rate remained significant. The highest unemployment rate in Algeria was recorded in 2016 and 2017, at around 11.3 percent for women and 8.3 percent for men.

In 2020, most Hungarians who were planning to buy Christmas gifts for their loved ones stated that they would buy them close family members. Another 22 percent of respondents said that they would buy Christmas presents for their friends.

As of August 2020, around 56 percent of U.S. adults aged 18 years and older strongly disagreed with the statement that e-cigarettes are less harmful than traditional cigarettes. This statistic shows the percentage of U.S. adults who strongly or somewhat disagreed or agreed with select statements regarding e-cigarettes as less harmful than traditional cigarettes, as of August 2020.

According to a global survey conducted in 2019, the majority of respondents in both manufacturing and other industries felt fairly confident in their organizations'ability to understand and mitigate cyber threats. However, manufacturing respondents were slightly more confident with 59 percent of them feeling fairly confident, while only 58 percent of respondents from other industries stated the same.

As of November 2020, 22 percent of content evaluated for delisting from search results in Denmark was due to insufficient information while 18 percent of content requested for delisting regarded professional information.

This statistic shows the volume of French imports and exports of used textile articles and rags from 2015 to 2019. In 2019, the exports of used textile articles and rags amounted to more than 1.7 million tons, compared to imports that year, which were less than 250,000 tons.

This statistic shows the number of clinical trial starts for novel heart failure drugs in the United States from 2009 to 2018, by clinical trial phase. In 2018, there were 4 phase I clinical trial starts for heart failure drugs in the United States.

In the first week of March 2020, sales of antibacterial gel in Argentina increased by almost 300 percent compared to the same period in 2019. Antibacterial gel was the hygiene product with the highest growth during the first week of March 2020. During the second week of March 2020, sales of household insecticides increased by approximately 260 percent in the South American country, when compared to the second week of March 2019.
As of January 2021, the number of mobile money customers in Uganda was at 30.8 million. The population of mobile money users increased by roughly two million in comparison to the previous year.

In Mexico, online searches regarding the U.S. American miniseries The Queen's Gambit have surged since its release on October 23, 2020. Approximately two weeks later, online interest in the Netflix series has grown among viewers with the term `` Gambito de Dama ''  as it was called in the Latin American country  peaking on November 15.

In 2020, the proved natural gas reserves in Angola amounted to 300 billion cubic meters. The volume decreased compared to the previous year, when it was measured at 352 billion cubic meters. Angola is among the countries with the largest natural gas reserves in Africa. Most of the natural gas produced in Angola is associated gas coming from oil fields.

In 2020, the natural gas demand in Angola amounted to 820 million cubic meters. This was the highest demand recorded in the period, increasing by roughly 15 percent compared to the previous year. Angola is one of the largest oil producers in Africa. Most of the natural gas produced in the country is associated gas coming from oil fields.

The number of foreign students enrolled in a university degree program in Spain amounted to approximately 33.5 thousand in the academic year 2019/2020. Of these, approximately 15.5 thousand were from Latin America and the Caribbean, followed by 8.5 thousand from Asia and Oceania.

In fiscal year 2020, the Japanese chemical company Shin-Etsu Chemical Co., Ltd. employed approximately 24 thousand people. Figures have been increasing since fiscal year 2011 when the company reported around 16 thousand employees. Headquartered in Tokyo, Shin-Etsu Chemical is a Japanese chemical company operating in several business sectors such as the health and crop science, pharmaceutical and energy industries.

As of 2020, the most popular online activities among Norwegian youths were instant messaging, social networking, and watching videos. Over nine out of ten Norwegian youths used instant messaging, while nearly as many used social networking. Nearly all of the respondents stated to have used the internet for these activities.
This statistic shows the number of foreigners in selected German federal states in 1960, 1976 and 1990. In 1990, there were roughly 5.2 million foreigners living in Germany.

As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, many people turned to video gaming as a form of entertainment during long periods of being locked down at home. During a survey in the United States in June 2020, respondents stated that their time spent playing fighting games had increased by 27.5 percent.

In 2020, due to the situation caused by the global coronavirus pandemic ( COVID-19 ), most cosmetics companies in Poland feel uncertain about the future, and therefore, they are trying to reduce their expenses. Almost every second company has decided to reduce its exports, and 15 percent of companies have stopped exporting at all.

The highest number of confirmed coronavirus ( COVID-19 ) cases in Estonia as of January 7, 2022, was in the capital region of Tallinn with 4,521 cases. The second highest number of cases was reported in the region of Vrmland with 4,124 cases.

In 2020, the private consumption expenditure in Vietnam accounted for approximately 68.4 percent of the country's total GDP. The figure was relatively stable over the observed period, with a slight increase in 2019 and 2020.

In April 2020, the majority of Russians supported the idea of introducing a mandatory wearing of face masks in public places in the country in order to prevent the further expansion of the coronavirus ( COVID-19 ). The second most popular measure was a restriction on the movement of people between regions, with 87 percent of respondents in favor of that rule.

The average retail price of wheat flour increased by nearly four Russian rubles per kilogram between 2017 and 2020. As of the latest year observed, the mean price of the product was measured at 41.5 Russian rubles per kilogram, marking an increase by nearly nine percent compared to the price levels of the previous year.

In September 2020, 48 percent of Russians agreed with the statement that the country's economy would recover in the upcoming year, down from 51 percent recorded in March of the same year. The share of respondents who believed that the economy would not improve over the upcoming year reached 13 percent in September 2020.

In the United States, around 70 percent of white adults aged 65 years and older received a flu vaccination in 2018. This statistic shows the percentage of white and black adults aged 65 years and older in the U.S. who received a flu vaccination from 2009 to 2018.

In September 2020, around 38 percent of caregivers in the United States reported an increase in the financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic illustrates the percentage of caregivers in the United States who reported an increase or decrease in financial hardship, increased financial burden, and no financial hardship due to the COVID-19 pandemic in September 2020.

A December 2019 survey revealed that 38 percent of adults in the United States have either already experienced or know someone who has experienced cyber stalking. Additionally, 44 percent of responding U.S. adults said that they did not trust their current or ex-partner.

The statistic illustrates the products reporting the highest clicks growth during Black Friday in the Netherlands in 2019, compared to an average day. It shows that web consoles were the fastest growing product category, with a 1,549 percent growth in clicks. This is significantly higher than the average growth of online traffic, which was only 0.57 percent.

This statistic shows the reasons why French people are more ahead in the preparation and purchase of Christmas gifts compared to the same period of the previous year in 2020. That year, 45 percent of respondents said they were more prepared because they had already made a shopping list, while 33 percent were more prepared because they had already bought some gifts.

This statistic shows the forecasted amount of electricity generated in France in 2050, by energy source. It appears that nuclear power will be the main source of electricity generation in the country, with an estimated 180 terawatt hours, compared to 150 terawatt hours for offshore wind.
